Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!”
Reviews.Author: 71eliprada
Reviews.Content: This place is a fairy tale! never before have I seen so much history and beauty combined. I recommend this piece of heaven hands down! Definitely coming back. It's not cheap, but trust me it's worth it. instead of the regular complimentary breakfast you get high quality wine & cheese! . Also the food is delicious in all 3 restaurants and the best part is the staff!! thank you guys for making this the best experience for me and my husband.. We wrote down a few names, special thanks to: Sandra (Picuteo) Chamil and Talana (front desk) Melissa (Patio restaurant) Jose R. (bartender) Fernando (house keeping) great job!!! : )

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: BellaLosGatos
Reviews.Content: We got off to a very rocky start with many challenges along the way...but once Karen was involved the situation turned around.... Romantic and delightful surroundings...courtyard filled with magnificent trees and birds...the room had a small terrace in which to enjoy the evening air.... Wine and cheese reception every evening filled with abundant choices and the pool and jacuzzi small but on the roof top and a magnificent view of the old walled city and water. The convenience is superb you can walk for hours and have everything you need from shopping to dining to sight seeing.... The restaurants have great choices on site...a tad expensive,but extremely handy The best part was having someone respond and handle our problems immediately..Our hats go off to Karen she makes a difference ...we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreToronto
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this excellent hotel in the heart of old San Juan. It is beautiful inside, the first 2 floors are renovated from an old convent. It is right over the road from the island's main Catholic cathedral, and a couple of blocks from the Plaza de Armas, so the location is great. Dozens of shops and restaurants around, plus one attached to the hotel itself. Friendly, helpful staff. It is clean, the bed is great, fridge in the room, coffee maker, hairdryer, etc. Complimentary coffee/tea/fruit in the mornings, complimentary internet access and bottled water. Pool on the roof. We had no issues with this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: bam98
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night in the "bridal suite." Very spacious room with excellent views, but no reason to spend much time in the room since you're in the heart of Old San Juan. Highly recommend breakfast in the hotel's groundfloor interior patio, complementary wine and cheese party, the pools, lunch or light dinner at the adjoining Pizza e Birra cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and comfort in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: marleft
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with the ambiance of a luxurious Spanish style hacienda. El Convento had a feast for the eyes: lovely furnishings, an herb garden, a beautiful inner courtyard, a small intimate pool area and a trendy bar that served delicious food.. All this in the heart of old San Juan, across from a church where we saw a wedding and near the parks, restaurants and shops of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: Lynntt
Reviews.Content: I had only a short stay in Puerto Rico, so I decided to spend the entire 4 days in Old San Juan, which I had toured a couple of years ago. I decided to book a luxury property, something I don't usually do on my teacher's salary, and am so glad that I did! El Convento is an amazing property, kind of a cross between a museum filled with beautiful artifacts and a modern hotel with all of the required amenities. I requested a room on the top floor, with a view of the water, and they assigned me to room 512, which was perfect. It was in a great location for walking all over Old San Juan, which I did each day of my stay. The staff is professional and personable, the food of a very high quality, the accommodations comfortable and beautiful. I feel like I've said "beautiful" too many times, but it is really the only word that I can think of to describe the property. There was a wedding while I was there, and I would have been worried about noise had it not been for the soundproof door of my room. Once closed I didn't hear a thing! El Convento was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSterling
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel El Convento for two nights in February. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, with a lovely open courtyard in the middle of it. The rooms themselves are beautiful and well decorated. The bed was very comfortable. I loved that they put a sound proof door between the "foyer" area of your room and the bedroom, it works wonderfully. The hotel is very well located in Old San Juan and in distance of many restaurants and shops. The staff was very helpful and kind as well. We took advantage of the free wine/cheese (you can show up 5 minutes before its "over" and still enjoy it as well) and was very good and nice for pre-dinner drinks. Had tapas at the bar on the second floor and they were very good. The view our room had (Ocean View) overlooked a lot of rooftops of buildings and was obstructed, which from where the hotel is located- I am guessing all the rooms would be like that. Also, if you are scared of bats- the tree in the courtyard has fruit on it and attracts MANY bats that fly all over around it. Overall, loved the hotel, would recommend for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: AMHunton
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, clean rooms, great service , worth every penny. The roof top pool was the surprise icing on the cake of this lovely old hotel that has everything going for it. They even have a sister hotel at the beach which we spent a day at for free

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: 2vets
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Exuded charm with beamed ceiling, open terraces, terracotta tile. Comfortable beds, good restaurant options within and nearby, nice staff. Definitely 'old world' feel but still modern enough to feel special. Too bad they don't have a spa. Location excellent for exploring Old San Juan for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 504michaela
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice . The staff is vert helpful .the rooms are a little small, but over all I will come back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: rdloewen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days before leaving on a cruise at this hotel and I am so glad we did. Perfect location to walk every where in Old San Juan. People were friendly, our room was clean and we would not hesitate to book a stay here again. Highly reccomend to spend the extra money and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: bgwsnc
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the staff is friendly and attentive, the property is gorgeous, the food is wonderful, and they even serve complimentary wine and cheese every day from 6 to 7 pm. I can't think of a thing I would want to change. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: padilladora
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience. The environment that this property is so unique. We held a meeting at the property and although the meeting space was not ideal; our customer really enjoyed their stay. The staff was wonderful and the rooms are so unique/inviting! The hotel is at an ideal location to be able to walk to any part of Old San Juan! Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm...you won't be disappointed (once you can swallow the expense)”
Reviews.Author: NJCARES
Reviews.Content: We booked a Historical tour package for El Convento that included a walking historical tour of OSJ, 3 nights in a Queen Vista room (room 514) with a bay view. Our room was on the smaller side, and I swear the bed was not a queen size! It seemed tiny! But the room was well-appointed with nice linens, outfitted with a large flat screen, and included a nice seating area. I enjoyed opening the large windows and watching outside. The entire property was open and airy, but what was remarkable was the service. The front desk acted as a concierge for us, and booked us a Biobay tour when there was none available. They emailed me confirmations, left me voicemails, and made sure I had directions on where to go for the tour. Annette was particularly helpful with this! All of the staff was really helpful with restaurant recommendations, walking maps, etc. The walking tour with David was packed full of information. The history was cool, but the hubs and I got a little tired in the heat and with all of the details. David was pretty enthusiastic, so we hung in there. I might skip this next time as we are not big history buffs. We enjoyed the wine & cheese hour, the views from the balconies, and the onsite bar. We did breakfast one morning and while it was good, it was overpriced and there was some construction going on at the time so it was pretty noisy. The price was a little more than we would have liked, but we didn't need a car during that time, we had wonderful accommodations, and loved the walking proximity to most of the things we wanted to do locally (i.e. forts, shopping, restaurants, and nightlife). Overall, we felt it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: cyasukot
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous open air property in the heart of Old San Juan. The staff is wonderful, and the rooms are clean, well decorated and functional. New TV's and very modern tiled bathrooms. There is a wine and cheese reception on the balcony every night - a perfect place to watch the sun set - and this is no cursory wine and chese reception. It's a huge selection of cheese, and very nice wines, and ripe fruit. It's perfect - we changed our evening plans so we could take full advantage of this relaxing event. There is a small roof top pool with a great view of the city and ocean. The restaurant is fantastic - amazing breakfast (try the manchego and serano ham french toast) and outstanding Tapas. The vibe is casual and friendly - you can sit and enjoy the sun and breeze for hours without feeling pressured to leave. You feel like a regular the minute you get here - they treat you very well from every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yazoo_10
Reviews.Content: Beatiful historic landmark in the heart of Old San Juan. Lots of Old World charm.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing history & architecture in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: mare0
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 2nd floor in queen vista. Nice room. First & second floors have 20 ft ceilings! There is a lush courtyard in middle so view seems good from all the floors. There is a rooftop plunge pool & hot tub with amazing views! Staff was friendly & accommodating. Service can be a bit slow at restaurant in morning but be prepared to relax & you won't be bothered! Everyone is so nice & helpful! Great location! & def eat at tapas restaurant across the plaza from hotel (near the huge banyan tree)! It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Full of Character in Heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ACF22
Reviews.Content: We went to El Convento after 3 days at Hilton Caribe. While the Hilton property was beautiful, we definitely prefer the vibe, service and location of El Convento. Hotel is charming, historic with excellent service - loved the library / terrace. Charms of Old SJ right outside steps, best part of trip was walking around town and historic sites just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, the best part of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Honk B
Reviews.Content: First of all, i would like to state that i AM NOT affiliated with this hotel or any travel company in any way, shape, or form. My reviews are honest and forthright. So lets get to the hotel. If anyone tells you there is a better hotel that is better at capturing the essence of Old San Juan, they are dead wrong. We stayed here for 5 days and traveled ALL of old san juan....and to be honest, this is absolutely the best thing there. By saying that, i'm not putting down OSJ, it's just a testament to how enjoyable Hotel El Convento is. Where to start? Every single room walks out to a beautiful courtyard containing a beautiful tree with plenty of conquis that serenade you every night. You never walk down a hallway to your room, your room opens to a 10 foot wide walkway that travels along the entire inner part of the hotel. The restaurant on the bottom floor in the courtyard (Patio del Nispero) is just awesome. Pumpkin fritters, crusted salmon, Flan Brulee.........completely original and awesome. The food is cutting edge. Altho, i will say, El Picoteo (the tapas restaurant on the 2nd floor, rents the hotel space) has better Pina Coladas. After our meal, we asked to see the restaurant manager so we could tell him how much we enjoyed our meal; he was unavailable at the time, however, the next morning, slipped under our door was a hand written card from the restaurant manager (i forget his name) thanking us for how much we enjoyed our dining experience (try getting that in the states) and 2 coupons for free sangrias (which were awesome). Every one at the hotel was incredibly hospitable. My wife and I were enjoying a bottle of wine at the table outside of our room when a hotel employee walked by........without even making eye contact, he offers us an ice bucket for our wine (which is not his job btw), we accept, then he goes and brings us an ice bucket and stashes our bottle of wine in it immediately. The rooms: the terracotta tile was very authentic. The room was very comfortable and not cramped at all, the fridge was fully stocked with bottled water which you could replenish for free at the honor bar at any time (oh btw, there's an HONOR BAR). What's more is that there is a privacy door between your room and the door to the hallway....so any noise from the courtyard at night was basically blocked and reduced to white noise akin to your A/C running or a ceiling fan, if anything at all. The first night, i woke up 3 times but went back to sleep b/c i didn't see any light AT ALL and thought it was the middle of the night. Turns out, the shutters and the curtains don't let in ANY light....so my body was right....it was telling me to get up b/c it was 10 am.....but pitch black in our room (which i found very pleasant). El Picoteo is a very nice place to eat, and is equal to and in many cases much better than the restaurants around town. It's a bit pricey, but u get what u pay for. Garlic shrimp were truly jumbo shrimp and worth $14 for 5 of them. BTW, a lot of the restaurants in OSJ are a bit pricey, so whatever, if u stay at el convento, don't be afraid to enjoy their dinning. There is a pizza joint w/craft brews on the 2nd floor too. Didn't go there, but they have a nice little selection of craft brews.....surprisingly, a lot from North Coast Brewery.... Oh, how about this....the staff knows who you are. Several times, my wife and I were sitting somewhere on the premises and a member of the staff whom we'd never even seen before would come by and address us by our names....i don't care how they know who we are, to me, it says that they care about their guests. Beautiful rooftop with a nice view of the sunset over the harbor. The pool is small, but i'm not going on vacay to do laps, so who cares. Finally, one of the best parts (which really got our evening started) was the free happy hour from 6-7 every night. We fully took advantage of this. I'm not gonna say the wine was awesome, but it was ok and it was free. 7 diff varieties. 4 Reds from Spain. A white from cali, a white from spain and a sparkling rose......plus plenty of cheese and fruit to satiate your appetite. meunster, bleu cheese, brie, reggiano, cream cheese w/chives, it was nice. Drink a bottle of wine and listen to the coquis while sitting on the patio watching the sun go down, compliments of the hotel, that was great. To sum up my very long review (sorry), i wouldn't ever stay anywhere else in old san juan (just b/c of how amazing this place is) and i would almost go back JUST to stay there again, b/c it's worth the trip alone. Not to mention, it's located right in the heart of old san juan. Oh also (i can't shutup) there's a guy singing and playing guitar in the plaza in front of the hotel, its very pleasant and he's very good. You can have your beach front mega resort, i'll take the 500 yr old piece of history with the best of everything all in one place. If you stay here, you will not regret it, unless you're a horrible person, i guarantee it. Bottom Line: i'm going here again, and i don't think i'm leaving the premises. Thank you Hotel El Convento, you are a diamond in the rough

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else in San Jaun”
Reviews.Author: MattMcDonald
Reviews.Content: Ugh! Flight delay! The night we supposed to arrive in San Jaun, we instead, were put up by the airline (AA) at the Miami Internation Airport Hotel(never stay there! gross!) and phoned El Convento at about 10pm to tell them we would be a day late. To our great relief we were assured that we would not be charged for the missed night. We also called the car rental agency that night and even though we would have the car for one less day, they charged us $100.00 more for changing the reservation so late. Our long awaited and well planned vacation was falling apart. We decided things couldn't get any worse so had high hopes for the hotel. We arrived at Hotel El Convento in the rain, a day late after flight delays, parked our rental car along the street, handed the keys to the valet and went to check in. The desk clerk was quick to check us in and answer a few questions and by the time we turned around, our bags were waiting for us. Our room was ready even though we were early and we went right up. Our room was a good size with a nice bathroom, great view and noise was not an issue. That night we had supper at El Picoteo in the hotel. The atmosphere was wonderful and the wait staff excellent. I had the Grouper Civiche which had just right texture and terrific flavour. I also had the Paella which was way too salty, or at least the rice was, so I picked out all the seafood and meat and ate that as it was still pretty good. When the waiter came to clear the plate, he saw what was left and inquired, I explained about the saltiness and he offered anything else on the menu in a hurry but I was fairly full so we just shared a dessert. The Paella did not appear on the bill even though I ate all the good stuff. Again I was quite happy. When we asked for our car it always appeared in a very reasonable time and all the staff were very happy and courteous when ever we needed them While almost all the reviews I have read here are glowing, a couple were not and can only chalk it up to people who are unwilling to accept that a building contructed in 1646 might have some flaws. We would stay here and only here during our next trip to San Jaun.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: JodiDH503
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, locally owned and operated hotel. The 60 employees of this hotel clearly have been trained on service quality. It wasn't perfect my any means, but anything that wasn't perfect was overshadowed by the friendly helpful staff. They have a lovely terrace area where there is an honor bar and the pool area on the roof was very nice too. The location was wonderful, we could walk to all the major sites in San Juan. It was also very expensive, I'm not sure that I would stay again for that reason, but I'm glad I stayed at the hotel at least once. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have chosen a better hotel in San Juan; we'll be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Isles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for a week and we absolutely loved it! Last year we'd spent a week at the Caribe Hilton and were disappointed. The El Convento is a world apart from the Hilton -- so much better in every way and just what we were looking for. Our room was comfortable and quiet, with enough chairs, good lighting, and plenty of storage space. The public spaces were delightful; our favorite spots were the patio where the wine reception took place every evening at 6 pm, as it was a perfect place for relaxing with our books; the ground floor patio where we enjoyed a leisurely breakfast every morning; and the pizza restaurant where we ate when we felt like an easy outdoor lunch of salad and pizza. (We tried the tapas restaurant in the hotel, but Rosa de Triana across the square is much better!) The hotel's service was friendly and efficient. The valet parking was very convenient. And the hotel's location is perfect for exploring Old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely historic, superb location”
Reviews.Author: photomomHouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been lovingly restored/adapted from its origin as one of the oldest buildings on the island. Very romantic! Location in the absolute heart of Old San Juan overlooking the cathedral. Nightly wine and cheese reception not to be missed - a great enhancement to the value of your stay. I recommend making reservations ahead at their very good tapas restaurant (in the courtyard) - even though there are scads of great restaurants within walking distance you may choose to take it easy and just go down the stairs from wine and cheese to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “What does World Class mean?”
Reviews.Author: Jack D
Reviews.Content: I suppose I could say that God has blessed by permitting me to stay at a few truly "World Class" hotels. To me a world class hotel means that they have everything you need and anticipate that need. When you arrive at a hotel and there is no one to greet you, no bell captain or bell hop to handle your luggage and you have to lug it up to your room, then that need is not anticipated. If a hotel does not have a visible concierge desk ,or concierge then they have not anticipated that need. When you go to have tapas at the restaurant and they advertise duck and lamb and the waitress comes back and says then don't have any, especially when they print the menu on a daily basis, well you know what I mean. The staff is, as many have indicated, very nice, somewhat bi-lingual and wants to please you. So three stars for an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience to explore Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: k-cadventures
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Puerto Rico, we didn't know what to expect. We absolutely LOVED our experience and our stay at Hotel El Convento! First, the service. It was impeccable. They are very attentive to every detail, very welcoming (remembered my name every time even though they had only seen me once), very accomodating. Second,the housekeeping and cleanliness was excellent. Everything was in great shape, very clean, and the decor was amazing with an old world charm and feel. Third, the location was perfect for us. We could go out in many directions from this hotel and explore all of San Juan, the forts, have great shopping, great places to eat (would recommend Pirilo for excellent tapas and Marmalade for excellent upscale food and experience, and St. Germain bistro for great fresh, delicious food). Fourth, the grouds and atmosphere were so romantic and beautiful. The courtyard, verandahs, eating areas, lobby, hallways, everything was so intimate, romantic, and welcoming. Beautiful. Fifth, the food. Well, it was great to set and drink sangria, but I do have to admit we had better food elsewhere. But, if you are tired it is right there and great for a close option. The reception they do with wines and cheeses was such a great touch. It was nice after a day of walking to relax with some wine and small food while experiencing the beautiful scenes and sounds of old San Juan. I read complaints about the construction. It was ongoing while we were there too, but hey, improvement is an important thing! However, I did notice they never started before 10 am and finished in late afternoon - the times people are usually away. I thought that was very considerate. I also read about not sleeping due to noise? I'm not sure where that room was. Ours was on the third floor and we slept so soundly and the room was so dark, we found ourselves not even waking up until 10 in the morning and we never do that! Every where we went we met friendly people and had a wonderful time. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Reflects the character of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: strategy543
Reviews.Content: With a lovely courtyard for dining and viewing terrace for cocktails, we embraced the ambience of old world comfort. We recommend this hotel highly and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed in Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Steven A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I often visit the British Virgin Islands, and we live in an area that makes it impossible to get to and from the BVI's in one day. So, we have made a habit of staying at El Convento several times for the night necessary between flights, and will for sure be back again. Ate lunch at the Tapas restaurant, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The gazpacho was killer, as we're the garlic shrimps. Our waitress was excellent and the bar man knows his way around a Mojito. No complaints whatsoever (OK, there was a little construction noise...boo hoo. If you were as old as this building, you'd need work too!). The folks at the front desk are helpful, courteous and attentive (to the point where they prioritize a guest standing in front of them, rather than pick up a ringing phone...amazing!). The El Convento is our go-to hotel in the San Juan area, and most people would find it entirely enjoyable and a memorable experience. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. It was lovely. The room was comfortable and romantic. Even though there were some construction going on, we could not hear a thing from the room. There were double doors in our room to keep the noise out. The cheese and wine reception was top notch. Intimate feel. Loved every minute of it. The hotel is also close to the restaurants. Don't forget to stop by La Bombonera to try the mallorca sandwiches. They are delicious! And only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The only bad part about our stay was that we had to wait for about an hour before we could get into our room. That was surprising since we got there late in the afternoon, around 3pm.

Reviews.Title: “Old world character and service”
Reviews.Author: frenchtom51
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico's best old school hotel. Beautifully renovated, friendly service, huge rooms with high ceilings, friendly service...doesn't get much better than this. Right in the middle of old town San Juan, close to everything (but the beach...)

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at El Convento”
Reviews.Author: Kandi408
Reviews.Content: When I booked El Convento for our wedding site I knew it was going to be beautiful. But it exceeded my expectations by far, It was absolutely stunning! The staff are very kind and helpful. (our guests loved the bartender at our reception:) and the food was delicious. Our guests said it was the best and most beautiful wedding they have been to, I wish I could do it all over again! We will be coming back for our one year for sure!:)

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise but stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea K
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is the " Grande Dame " of Old San Juan. It is absolutely charming and full of history just stunning! Almost everything about our stay here was impeccable the staff were absolutely wonderful not over solicitous but were extremely accommodating with whatever you needed. The Bose sound system in the room is a nice touch.The hot tub on the roof is a beautiful thing on a balmy evening with great views of the city. There were two negatives for us.The first- that there was construction going on in the courtyard during our stay. I feel we should have been fore warned about this it was too noisy to enjoy eating an outdoor meal which is one of the pleasures of staying at this hotel. The second- the tapas restaurant in the hotel was over priced and the food was not very tasty the drinks were good. I would recommend skipping the food and just enjoying a drink or two. Overall it is a truly lovely property I would absolutely stay here again but would check to see if there were any on going construction projects before booking my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tapas and Sangria on the patio!”
Reviews.Author: jppcrtt
Reviews.Content: A great spot to have a delicious light snack or lunch and enjoy a relaxing time outdoors in Old San Juan while sipping red or white sangria and chatting with family and friends. We did not stay at the hotel but it looks like a great inn!

Reviews.Title: “It really is the best place too stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: CherryGrower1
Reviews.Content: Its a lovely hotel in a gorgeous part of town with incredible service and great staff. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: lclark87
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at El Convento and enjoyed every day. Our vista view room had a view of the bay and was quiet and comfortable. We enjoyed the proximity to great restaurants, shops and the two forts. We also really loved the pizza @ Pizza e Birra! The staff was all friendly and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Facility Even Better Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: larryob
Reviews.Content: Relaxed atmosphere. Not the place for kids or young adults. No beach and only a splash pool. We had a medical emergency and over the course of several days were helped by everyone on staff. Frances O., Guest Services Manager, spent both business time and personal time to help us at every turn. About 10 staff members gathered to personally wish us good bye. The cruise ships dock nearby so let the front desk help you for excursions to a beach, rain-forest, or wherever during the mid day invasions. Or just hop on/hop off the trolley around Old San Juan. Plenty of taxis and don't even think about a car until you are headed out of town. Think Toledo or Seville and slow down and take your time.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hastygirl
Reviews.Content: El Convento, an old convent converted into a charming boutique hotel with outstanding customer service. The appropriately appointed rooms have very high ceilings and are quite comfortable.The plunge pool was the perfect place for an afternoon dip followed by a complimentary wine and cheese reception. The tapas bar located on the second level situated around the huge banana tree had great sangria and wonderful tapas. Yes, this hotel gets busy on the weekends. On our particular visit, a couple had just been married across the street, their reception was being held in the courtyard...it was nice to be able to watch from the second level as the guests and wedding party made their entrance. We continue to return for lunch in the courtyard for our yearly visits.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Thomas F
Reviews.Content: I just spent a few days in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico and had the opportunity to stay at the El Convento. This is a must do if you are staying in the area. It is central to everything, with shops, museums and restaurants a plenty. The staff from the porters, to the front desk to housekeepers and restaurants, could not have been more cordial and on top of their game. The furnishings are tasteful and comfortable. I travel mostly for pleasure, but sometimes for business, and this was truly a delight. It was my first time in Puerto Rico, and it is a must visit again kind of city. I spent the day at El Convento's sister hotel, La Concha, in Condado (about a 30 minute bus ride away), on the beach and once again, fabulous. It is a totally different experience, as far as it is super modern in design, but the employees there, like El Convento, very hospitable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Classy luxury in Old San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Linolakers
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip to Puerto Rico with a two night stay at the Hotel El Convento. After navigating the VERY narrow streets and circling the hotel to find the valet parking, we were treated to a completely wonderful stay. The staff was very helpful and recommended some outstanding restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Our room was beautiful with a picturesque view of the side street of the hotel (doesn't sound like a great view, but trust us it was!). We had never visited Old San Juan so we spent or days touring by foot the city, taking in the sites and history surrounding us. We would highly recommend the Hotel El Convento for your stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “el convento hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosl2
Reviews.Content: a cozy hotel in the old san juan area. beautiful quiet, elegant and clean . Walk to all the historical spots.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mcnallyb
Reviews.Content: I don't want to repeat in detail all of the nice reviews that are already posted. As expected, the location is great, service is outstanding, and in general the hotel is very nice. Just a few things to be aware of... Our first night was in room 503. I wish I had paid better attention to a previous review that noted how noisy this room is. It's the only room on any floor that is adjacent to (and actually wraps around) the elevator. The constant noise of the elevator in operation was enough to awake us many throughout the night. Thankfully we were able to switch to another room for the following two nights. Also, no safe in that room. And the room looks out onto the patios, so you can't really leave the windows open if you want a little privacy. The bedrooms were very nice, but the bathrooms were more of at a 2-diamond level than a 4-diamond level. The bathrooms in both rooms that we occupied looked like they had recently been painted by a blind person (no offense to the blind). Quite a sloppy job with paint brushed onto all surrounding surfaces. Sounds nitpicky, but not something I'd expect in a high end hotel. Also, as noted by others, no counter space and very little shelf space in the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would I go back? In a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_S27_12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Convento last spring and it was just the most wonderful experience!!Having visited other top hotels in San Juan, I can safely say that if you want to truly soak in Old San Juan's culture, heritage and beauty in all its glory, don't stay anywhere else! It is a charming hotel with character and history and we felt as though we had been transported back into time from the moment we stepped into its rustic lobby. Location The hotel has a marvellous location, right in the heart of Old San Juan and almost all restaurants/ places of interest are at a walking distance. This was a big plus for us.We could walk around exploring the entire island until afternoon and come back to the hotel, take a power nap, go down for the lovely wine and cheese reception/ guzzle some Mojitos at El-Picoteo before we set out on our night-time expeditions!There's a beautiful church right across the street and a charming little shop (Poets Passage- be sure to visit both the stores in Old San Juan, you will fall in love with them). One night, there was a guy playing Spanish guitar just outside the hotel and it was simply surreal to sit on the hotel stairs under the stars and listen to him play. Rooms The hotel manager very kindly upgraded us to a Queen Vista(From our original Queen Deluxe) on the third floor. The room had beautiful Spanish furniture and a louver door and looked exactly like the picture on the hotel website. Unfortunately the view outside wasn't great, as it overlooked onto neighbouring houses but on the upside, there was ample sunshine and if we tried really hard, we could see the San Juan bay in the distance! The flat-screen TV in the room was quite neat. Ditto for the toiletries in the bathroom (Aveda if memory serves). The bathroom was quite basic, it had a bath-tub but was a tad small and its rusticity took a little getting used to (but its part of the package, I guess). The room was conveniently located as the swimming pool/jacuzzi is on the third floor too, so we could easily pop over anytime we felt like. Outside each room, in the lobby, there is small table with 2 chairs that overlooks the courtyard (Around which the hotel is built and where the lovely old nispero tree is)- perfect spot for a morning cup of tea! Staff The hotel staff is very courteous and helpful. They were prompt in responding to our requests/ queries and have a range of ideas/tours to help you plan your stay. We really wanted to go for this wonderful Bio-bay tour, but unfortunately we were too late in informing them and all the seats were booked. If you do plan to take any of the tours, it would be a good idea to book as early as you can. Other Old San Juan doesn't really have any beaches, but you can use the beach club facilites at the El Convento's sister hotel for a nominal charge (You might want to keep an entire day for that). The hotel restaurants are great and not overtly expensive. We loved the pizza at Pizza e Birra and the ambience of Patio del Nespiro (in the shady main courtyard). The staff also recommended great restaurants - BarÃº, DragonFly (The duck nachos are to die for),Parrot Club,San Juan Cafe. At night time, the quaint historic San Juan of the day turns into a lively Spanish-Carribean town with thriving night-life. Whether you want a quite romantic meal or an eventful night out, there is a plethora of options to choose from. Of all the cities I've visited, San Juan has the most eclectic mix of cuisines and I would go back for the food alone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful atmosphere but noisy on the weekend”
Reviews.Author: SuzInDenver
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with lots of character. Our 3rd floor room was charming with a nice view and a great bathroom. But we were there on a Saturday night when there was a wedding reception in the hotel. The reception was so loud we could hear the music blaring in our room until past Midnight. I would suggest asking before you book if there are any receptions planned during your stay and either stay somewhere else or ask if there's a room very far away from the reception hall. The free wine and appetizer hour on a roof deck was a nice touch. We ate breakfast at the hotel's courtyard restaurant, which is beautiful but expensive with slow service and mediocre food.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: HMSG
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience!!! This is a and old convent that was converted into a Hotel. I loved the Jacuzzi/pool in the third floor balcony. There is a complement wine and cheese everyday at 6:00 pm, great way to start the night... Rooms are clean and the view from the majority of the room are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “atmospheric, transporting place in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: NawlinsNewYork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and loved it. This is not your typical hotel - it is a converted convent. If you want cookie-cutter rooms or something more predictable, stay at a Marriott. If you want to experience a unique property that reflects the heritage and history of Old San Juan, stay here. You can wander the open air hallways and look into the shady courtyard, have a (free) cup of coffee or a glass of wine in the terraces covered with flowers and plants, or soak in the pool overlooking the rooftops and churches. The staff is very helpful and can arrange for you to go to a hotel on the beach for the day (I went to La Concha in Condado). In my opinion, staying in Old San Juan is the way to go as you can explore the city early or late, when it is cooler and less crowded, and you can enjoy the many great restaurants. El Convento is the perfect place to stay and feel connected to the intriguing neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Courtyard Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: NewLondonCTAdrift
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the hotel but I enjoyed having lunch there twice during our stay. My only complaint about Old San Juan is that all restaurants are inside and dark, but the one at Hotel El Convento is in a lovely bright yet shaded tree filled courtyard. A delightful respite after a long morning of walking in the heat. The prices are very reasonable, the food a good quality. My husband had a pumpkin mango soup he will not soon forget, I had lovely roasted chicken with a guava glaze. I brought some ladies from our traveling group back on Friday who enjoyed the wraps while I had the refreshing tomato gazpacho soup. The staff is very attentive. The hotel is just finishing up a remodeling, we would book a stay there if we ever wanted to enjoy Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but so charming, romantic place”
Reviews.Author: picalexandre
Reviews.Content: Amazing facility, very charming, very friendly staff. Great location in Old San Juan. The rooms are not cheap quite small and really really need a refreshment but well it's part of the charm even if the antiques are obviously fakes from the 1960's. The restaurant (for lunch and breakfast) was a disappointment but the free wine reception every night is really really nice. We stayed there for NYE and we had champagne etc. The staff is nice. The pool is small you can't swim at all BUT you can ask fro a pass to go to La Concha Resort nearby for free ( the best and trendiest beach spot in town). So Overall a very good experience even if the rooms need refreshment.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel in the center of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mxalpert
Reviews.Content: This former convent is a well-restored and beautiful hotel at a perfect location for exploring Old San Juan. The ambience, service, amenities and comfort of the room were all superb. We walked everywhere in the area and returned each afternoon to the complimentary wine and cheese offered in the library. You could sit on the balcony and enjoy looking out at the old city and perhaps make new friends. Coffee, tea and an honor bar were always available. Free wi-fi and 2 computers in the library added to the comfort. This hotel is advertised as a luxury hotel, and my only caveat would be the bathroom. If you are expecting a large modern fancy bathroom like in the newer resorts, you will be disappointed. If you love old European hotels, you will be perfectly content with the marble tiled bathroom, Aveda products, fluffy towels and bathrobes. One of my primary room requirements is a quiet room. The thick, old walls made this extremely quiet at night. I would not recommend the tapas restaurant in the hotel but that is another review. We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must see...”
Reviews.Author: NYDina
Reviews.Content: A trip to Old San Juan will feel most authentic in this boutique hotel. In the heart of the city, you'll walk right down the steps into the streets. Even if you don't stay, just visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city hotel - Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: fbsnyc
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a Hotel Package, and visited over the last Thanksgiving Holiday. We were more than pleased. Very lovely property, exceptionally clean, with two wonderful places for dinner. The afternoon 'happy hour' provided a chance to meet other guests, have a glass of wine pre dinner, and hear other travel stories. The small pool located at the property provided plenty of sun, and a welcome place to just unwind from the colder weather we had left behind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Tangovet
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late January. The room on the fourth floor was very nice, clean with a beautiful view on the harbor. Service was impeccable. The location in the old San Juan made it easy to walk and sightsee. A plus was the double door that completely isolated the bedroom from noise in the patio. The terraces enabled us to benefit from the winds and the view. We were, however, unimpressed with breakfast at the hotel, which was expensive and unimaginative. Otherwise, beautiful historical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: macmami
Reviews.Content: My review is super late but I just could not go without writing a review. We were married at El Convento. The facilities were amazing. We were looking for something traditional historical and their main ballroom fit the bill with their checkerboard floors and mural ceilings. We had cocktails on the patio and our guests were greeted with their signature white sangria and mini Puerto Rican fritters. yum! The main course was also delish. The service was excellent from planning to execution. Our ceremony was actually held outside en la Plaza Rogativa which was down the block but that was a perfect choice. We were given the honeymoon suite for the night. The room was like stepping into the past had a lot of charm. The rooms do face out to Old San Juan which could be a bit noisy at times. If you would like host your wedding our stay in the middle of old San Juan and experience the old charm of Puerto Rico this place is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend time in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Xian24
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Its an old hotel and the staff and the location are great. Really enjoyed our time there and loved being near everything in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Vicki_conner
Reviews.Content: The Hotel El Convento is an old building that was a convent and is rumored to also have been a brothel. It is very well refurbished, in a beautiful part of Old San Juan, walkable to everything. Highly recommend it if you like hotels with personality, not like your standard chain hotels. It even had a second interior door which was soundproof so you didn't hear music from the interior courtyard.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Historic, comfortable, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mazzahs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our week long trip driving around PR. I've been to Old San Juan a few times previously, but never stayed within the city limits. We were tired after a week, so I'm a bit disappointed that we had to awake early from this world-class hotel to catch our flight. We arrived and parked with the valet, which is your only option unless you forego a car or park your vehicle in a garage (which may prove to be more pricey than the hotel valet). The staff were stellar and spoke fluent English. The front desk staff were great, but the bellmen were what set the hotel apart from the rest. They were young local guys and seemed more than concerned for not only our belongings, but for our stay within Old San Juan. They weren't looking for excessive tips, as they were quick to leave you after their duties were fulfilled. They were pleasant and caring to say the least. The room was beautiful with windows (no screens) that opened to overlook this ancient gem of a city. The interior balconies/hallways overlook a beautiful garden & various restaurants. The hotel itself speaks volumes for what was once (and still is) the epicenter of the Caribbean. The nightly wine event/meet & greet is great, but anything but wine will cost you (we paid $6/Medalla) which is charged to your room. This matters not, since the atmosphere of this hotel is breathtaking. It's not beach front, but you're literally a 5 minute walk from the ocean. There is a small pool and jacuzzi on the roof with ample seating that is a spectacular bonus to an otherwise gridlocked city-esque locale. We ate at the Tapas restaurant on site which was wonderful, albeit slow as far as service is concerned. The bill was reasonable, but the island time service lives up to it's name here (maybe they were short-staffed or uber-busy). Regardless, the surroundings are second to none since you are dining within the open & vast walls of the hotel (Coquis are abound here within an enclosed oasis which is El Convento). The hotel was a convent in the 1500's and has since been restored. We had a perfect & calming view of the Cathedral of San Juan Bautista (c. 1521) which is the oldest standing cathedral in the U.S. & it's relevant possessions. It also houses the tomb of Juan Ponce de Leon who was the 1st governor of PR and the Spanish settler responsible for naming Florida, USA. So, yeah....this hotel is that great. I picked this hotel due to the #1 ranking for hotels in PR and we weren't disappointed. This is THE place to stay while frequenting Old San Juan. I just wished we had the following day to explore. The hotel, staff and interior grounds are perfect and deserve a 2-night stay minimum to explore the city and this historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, interesting history, lovely courtyard”
Reviews.Author: SaZimTanz
Reviews.Content: This storied hotel is the perfect place from which to explore Old San Juan -- you step right into it, avoid the parking problems if you are driving in, etc. Sophisticated shops and restaurants blend in with the beautifully restored buildings and historical relics. The courtyard of this old convent is a wonderful place to hang out and escape the heat: it's great for breakfast with the birds twittering in the enormous, ancient trees, it's cool and relaxing for a cocktail before siesta or setting off for dinner. It's quite pricey, but a memorable experience. Rooms are small -- as if some Catholic is punishing you or forcing you to turn inward -- but there is a faint touch of local flavor, wrought-iron touches, etc. Try to have a room facing onto the park square to avoid traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Royalcot
Reviews.Content: El Convento is simply perfect. Its location could not be better, just opposite the cathedral in the centre of Old San Juan and within walking distance of the main historical sights. But what makes El Convento so especial, is not just its excellent location, or the history behind it, neither the beautifully appointed rooms. Its the staff that gives life to this hotel and makes it so delightful. Each and every one was absolutely professional and yet so friendly, making sure we had a wonderful stay. We really enjoyed our stay and it will definitely be our choice next time we visit Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old and has maintained its historical charm. With that comes some definite disadvantages that the traveler should keep in mind. Most notably, the rooms are very small -- our "king" bed was really a double (not even a queen), and the bathroom is teeny. They have a "pool area" -- a 4th floor roof top -- with a plunge pool, a whirlpool, and lounge chairs. This very small area is charming with a beautiful view but the pool is not noticeably larger than the whirlpool. They have an evening complementary cocktail hour which is very nice, and they have an honor bar throughout the day. The hotel was well maintained and everything worked well. We loved the location in Old San Juan, but keep in mind this is not on the beach, which is a $15 cab ride away. Also of note is that old San Juan has cobblestone and brick narrow streets and sidewalks; walking is a challenge for those with mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: mattkrae
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at El Convento after sailing through the BVIs for a week. After a week on the boat, we were looking for some luxury and we found it. The staff was helpful and pleasant. Leishla at the front desk was wonderful on many occasions. The housekeeping staff was excellent and our room was always top shape. If you are looking for a modern hotel, head to La Concha, the sister hotel, but if you are looking for charm (and still a well equipped room) in Old San Juan, do not miss this place. It was great to be in the midst of the architecture and culture of Old San Juan. As for dining, El Picateo was a hip restaurant we visited twice for top notch wine and tapas. We also hit the pizza place - excellent value. We appreciated the little touches like endless water bottles and coffee and tea, and a wine reception each night. The hotel is not inexpensive, but we sure felt we got good value for what we paid. We were charmed by Puerto Rico in general and would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in spite of some disappointments....”
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: We considered many options for our stay in OSJ. El Convento was the choice based on TA reports (#1) and location. It seemed like the perfect choice. In general we enjoyed our 2 night stay at the hotel but have to be honest regarding some disappointments we experienced. ~Booking. We booked a queen vista to insure nice bay views and had a request for room 508 which is a corner room and according to reviews has a bit more space. We booked directly with the hotel and reservation staff were helpful. We booked in October for late Dec. 2011. At no time were we informed about the construction taking place in the central courtyard. For sure it was going on because the project is very massive. That was our first disappointment that we had to learn of this on TA. I contacted the hotel and got various information indicating it was no big deal. Finally after more comments on TA I contacted the general manager who confirmed the situation and shortly after our email exchange the hotel decided to offer the breakfast coupons as compensation for any perceived inconvenience. That seemed fair but only complaint driven...probably should have been in place sooner. I do see they now have some small print on the website about the construction. A few days ago it was a pop up which certainly grabbed more attention. As it is placed now you need to really look for it. Most communication in advance of arrival with the hotel was email as phones to individual departments were not answered, messages left with no return call. Emails were answered with 2-3 day delay and usually after 2 emails. ~Upon arrival we carried our bags up the steps with no bellman in sight. Check in was efficient and we were upgraded to the Pablo Casals Suite. We loved the suite and felt very fortunate to be staying in this historic hotel and room. It was quiet (even on New Year's Eve) and very private in a corner off the reception area on floor 3. I did notice room 302 (a reviewer had been "upgraded" to this room and it is right on the public area with zero privacy if you want to open the drapes/blinds in the room. I would not want that room. Did not see any other rooms. ~Staff had recommended and made reservations at Marmalade Restaurant and it was a good choice. Since it was for New Year's Eve and I did follow up. It was not done by the first person I made sure it was taken care of by the second person I spoke with. ~Service. As we only stayed 2 nights the only experience with daily maid service was the one day and we were gone touring the whole day...upon our return hoping to shower/relax etc. we found no service to the suite. We called and they came shortly to clean the suite. Disappointing. ~Wine reception. This was very nice...only made it one night. Its a nice idea for sure and of course well attended. ~Terrace on third floor and Pool area on fourth floor. Very nice views...small plunge pool. Visited a couple of times just for the views but area was not well maintained and many used glasses/wine bottles/towels scattered all over. Clearly you would have to clean your own space. Disappointing. ~Restaurants. We did eat in El Picoteo and it was very good. The "coupon" breakfast was served in some sort of meeting room with all windows covered so you would not see the construction in the courtyard. The buffet was standard fare with the best choice being the hot station with made to order items. Service was excellent from the hostess to the server. We did not try Patio del Nispero as there was no patio. ~Check out. This is a busy place. There was only one person behind the desk and a line for check out. I would suggest that bills with so many extra charges require extra time to check out and between 11-12 staffing should be appropriate. I did notice some clear mistakes on my bill which she corrected. After getting home I did notice that the actual room rate was not correct and we did get that fixed. There were a number of people in line that did not have a clue on the "resort fee" which is very high. Make sure you understand what the room REALLY costs to avoid shock at checkout. While I am happy we chose El Convento, the property at the present time is over-priced. I do note that they are offering some midweek specials and I would suggest that is the best time to visit. Between the tourists in for a "quick look" who can with a very slow elevator(acessed with room key) easily make their way up to the third and fourth floor and the weddings (some may enjoy this) it is not a quiet place. Music (awful stuff) blares from the restaurants of the hotel into the courtyard. Maybe midweek you could avoid the weddings? We did not encounter this. I do think that once the construction is finished (more than a few weeks off I'm sure) and the courtyard is restored to its former grandeur it will be a great place to stay. In these Spanish buildings the courtyard is so important and honestly reading a sign telling you how "it used to be" and how "beautiful it will be" is disappointing. Thanks to my research we went in with proper expectations and there was very little actual pounding until the day we left. I think management was slow to deal with the situation and when I read "huilhan 1's" review indicating that the "coupon breakfast" offer was suspended for San Sebastian festival I simply could not believe it. In my experience when a hotel is undergoing construction the smartest thing is inform each client as they book and offer some sort of discount on room rate ie 15% would be acceptable. The offer made by El Convento is okay but should not be randomly pulled when a "street fair" happens which in fact causes more headaches for most visitors that did not come specifically for it!! I wanted to give El Convento a much higher rating but just could not. We moved on to another property just down the street for the last two nights in OSJ and found a much better option. El Convento is a good choice for the best location and historical value. Rooms are unique. Go midweek...be specific on room and understand the "quirks" of the hotel including outside noise. Read the reviews. I don't like giving an average review to a property that upgraded me to a beautiful suite but I had to be honest. Just my opinions.

Reviews.Title: “24 Hours in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: travelfans29
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the El Convento was not planned; rather it was made on a whim based on the advice of a friend we made at the W Hotel in Vieques. Though we had originally intended to stay all four nights in Vieques, this friend told us that our first trip to Puerto Rico would not be complete without visiting Old San Juan. And, we were told, no visit to Old San Juan would be complete without staying at the El Convento. Based on this advice, we cancelled our last night at the W and flew back to San Juan one day early. We were not disappointedâ€¦this hotel definitely lives up to its #1 Trip Advisor ranking. We were ecstatic to learn that we would be catching the last day of the San Sebastian festival. We received a courtesy call from the El Convento warning us of the traffic; we thought this was really considerate. Not fearing adventure and having experienced countless Mardi Gras in New Orleans, we felt prepared for the crowds and looked forward to catching some authentic Puerto Rican culture. As a lover of architecture, I was immediately impressed upon arrival by the El Conventoâ€™s stucco archways, elaborate woodwork, and colorful tiles. Though filled with modern amenities and fixtures, the construction is the old-world type that is too expensive to build anymore. Our Queen Superior room was right off the pool deck on the 4th floor. It was a standard size with all of the amenities youâ€™d expect from a four-star hotel: large LCD television, marble and tile bathroom with quality fixtures, solid antique furniture. What set the room apart were the working double French doors that opened to the street scene below. Some of our best cityscape pictures were taken from this window. After checking in, we were pleased to learn that Old San Juanâ€™s best rated pizza restaurant, Pizza E Birra, was located across the hotel courtyard. The pizza was above average; what set the restaurant apart was the central location and cool vibe. We ate lunch and then caught some live Puerto Rican music in the El Conventoâ€™s courtyard. We then headed up to the managerâ€™s reception on the 3rd floor. Whether youâ€™re staying on a normal day or festival weekend like we were, I highly recommend stopping by the evening managerâ€™s reception. Water, coffee and wine, as well as light hors d'oeuvres were complimentary (at other times of the day, I believe the same selection is available on an â€œhonor barâ€� system). We met some interesting people preparing to leave for a cruise and traded travel stories. Before heading out to the crowded streets of the festival, we watched the sunset on the 4th floor pool deck. Because the El Convento is taller than the surrounding buildings and because the Port of San Juan is several miles wide, there is a clear line of sight to the sun setting over the Cordillera mountains. It was beautiful. After having been at the hotel for nearly two hours and not yet left the premises, we were ready to venture out to the festival. Because this review is of the El Convento, I will not get into much detail regarding the San Sebastian festival or Old San Juan. San Sebastian can best be described as Mardi Gras in New Orleansâ€™ French Quarter without the beads or bare breasts. Crowds similarly walk up and down the streets, beer or beverage of choice in hand, listening to numerous live music stages and/or shopping at various art stands. If youâ€™re up for a party and willing to indulge in some different culture, I highly recommend it. Old San Juan itself is also a lot like the Spanish influenced French Quarterâ€¦the buildings are actually about 150+ years older. Think tight, cobblestone streets, stucco buildings, French doors with balconies overlooking the streets. From the El Convento, all of Old San Juan can easily be covered by foot. The peninsula slopes upward to the north, but the incline is not too bad if you are up for a little exercise. With only three hours to tour on Monday morning, we were able to check out â€ªFort San Felipe del Morro, the San Juan Gate (Red Door), the Paseo de la Princesa (near the cruise ships), and the Cathedral of San Juan Bautista. I recommend all of these sites. Whether youâ€™re leaving for a cruise, or the islands, or in town for an extended stay, I highly recommend visiting Old San Juan. And if you spend the night in Old San Juan, you must stay at the El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Experience history by staying at the El Convento”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraFord
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a girl friend from work. We had a wonderful stay at this place where we shared a room. I love the interior courtyard where one can sit, relax, read a book, chill, drink and dine. The courtyard can be hired for wedding services. We got to watch 2 wedding ceremonies from the interior balcony during our stay. I also love their exterior balcony and pool area where one can have a drink in the afternoon, and breakfast in the morning. The hotel provides a free cocktail reception at 6 pm each day in which generous quantities of drinks (beer, wine, spirits) and cheese and biscuits were provided. There is no other place to stay in Old San Juan but the Hotel El Convento! I would come back again and bring my husband. He has to experience staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest”
Reviews.Author: memphisblue44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Puerto Rico this week to visit family. We stayed in old San Juan in the El Convento. It is a wonderful place, a former convent right across the street from the Cathedral and near El Morro castle. The rooms are spacious and very quiet. The food is excellent. There is a free wine and cheese party every day. There is a lounge open 24 hrs with all kinds of drinks on the honor system as well as computers. The best thing about the place though is the staff. Some examples: out cell phone died and Angel from the restaurant charged it himself and the next day charged my wife. We couldn't park near the hotel due to an annual festival which is like Mardi Gras. The valet staff found my car 6 blocks away and retrieved it after midnight when the festival was over. We arrived late due to having to walk and the front desk was able to get us food even though the restaurant was closed. A really caring staff, luxury room, oodles of atmosphere and in the heart of the most interesting part of Puerto Rico. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Quaint - lots of character”
Reviews.Author: cdeast
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the El Convento.The room was an adequate size and nicely decorated, the bathroom on the smaller size but met our needs and had Aveda bath products. We were on the fourth floor and had a view of the water from our room. The AC worked well, plenty of hot water, good water pressure, flat screen tv and free bottled water every day. Room was quiet (soundproof doors and windows) except on Wednesday when the hotel's pizza restaurant is the site of a large get together of young adults. This was extremely noisey and didn't end until midnight. We were told this is a weekly occurance. Why they allow this is beyond me. The common areas of the hotel have a lot of character and are well kept.The inner terrace which is outside the room doors is very inviting and a great place to read or relax. The daily wine and cheese reception is great with QUALITY wine and cheeses. The location is the best - within walking distance of everything, incuding shops,restaurants, the forts and other sightseeing areas. Old San Juan is a great place to stroll and shop ,what a quaint old city! What we liked most about the hotel was the staff - friendly , helpful, and knowledgable. They were sincerely interested in making your stay as enjoyable as possible. We want to particularly mention George and Ivan the bellboys/hotel ambassadors, and Chamil at the reception counter for their assistance in helping us with a transportation issue that was supposed to be taken care of by the hotel that we were going to next. These good people really bent over backwards to help us. They have a positive attitude - wanting to provide the best service they can. The breakfasts were very good . The omelete and pancake station was particularly noteworthy. Yum! Restaurant staff were friendly and efficient. El Convento has an agreement with the La Concha Hotel, which is on the beach in Condado, a 12 minute cab drive from El Convento. However , you have to pay for the taxi ride since the El Convento doesn't provide a shuttle. The positives far out weigh the negatives, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Pablo B
Reviews.Content: Began our honeymoon with three nights at El Convento. A truly fabulous experience, even if slightly tainted by the fact that they were renovating the courtyard. But the hotel provided free breakfasts (which were quite good, the omelette station in particular as well as the rest of the buffet). Tapas bar was good too. The rooms were very comfortable, and the plunge pool and hot tub on the roof were very relaxing and the layout overall was great. It did feel like a luxury hotel, but by far the best thing was the location. Right in the heart of Old San Juan, steps down to the Red Gate, steps up to El Morro and the museums and the Cathedral, all amazing. We're glad we went at the beginning of January rather than in the middle of the San Sebastien festival where we didn't think we'd get much sleep but overall really enjoyed the hotel. Excellent service from the staff as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel El Convento - San Juan, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Travelbabe
Reviews.Content: September 2011 This was my third stay at the Hotel El convento. I had fallen in love with this property on previous stays and was looking forward to the four day break in one of my favorite cities and hotels. This stay was disappointing. It seems that the hotel is increasingly reliant on "Crusie Ship" one nighter guests and have moved away from the exquisite service once provided to longer staying gusets. I felt the service was hurried and non-caring. Certainly not like previous times. The property is still well kept and beautiful ( a big draw for me) and the wine and cheese guest reception is still good but the overall feel of Luxurious for me was not there this time For my entire stay, there was a clanging sound coming from my room which as it turns out was not resolved over the stay. I had placed a few calls to the front desk but to no resolve and finally figured out that it was a loud AC vent (going through my bathroom to somewhere). It was both annoying and disruptive. I was never offered to be moved to another room. On my last day, A renovation Team started to bang away in the room next door. After three calls (with 2 of them over the phone so the front desk rep could hear it), there was some repreive only to start again half hour later. At checkout I again complained and was offered a amall reducton in the rate for that day but my rest, peace and quiet was already ruined. I The incident should never occur if management and staff were overly concerned as they should be about guest comfort. The room was occupied and I don't know that this would happen at another Luxury property. It seems management is out of touch with the guests and it has obviously changed in the last 2-3 years. For my next stay in Puerto, I will book book another hotel and visit Old San Juan. I cannot take the risk of another ruined stay at the Hotel El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “average four star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PRLBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the El Convento. We had a one bedroom suite on the 3rd floor (room 319. The staff were generally very friendly, but my impression was that there were too few staff on duty at any one time. The food in the restaurants is good as is the service in them. There is limited room service available. There were a few negatives: This started with our arrival. We were dropped off at the side of the road by a taxi at 3pm. There was no doorman so we had to carry our own bags around the side of the building and in to the hotel. The check-in experience was good but there was no offer of help with our bags to our room. I do not expect to pay top-level prices for a suite in a luxury hotel where the assumption is that I will be the one carrying my bags to my room. The lift is clearly in need of help. There is a single tiny lift, which is the slowest I have ever come across. Whenever my wife took the lift and I walked up the stairs, even after negotiating the locked gates between floors, I walked to the other end of the building to our room before my wife had managed to travel the two floors in the lift. The room itself is very nicely furnished and of a good size, although the bathroom was tiny at around 5ft x 7ft. The suite has no views and just overlooks the brick walls of the buildings opposite. There was a good, easy to use coffee machine, with plenty of coffee bags and the fridge is re-stocked with water on a daily basis. Oddly, half of the small wardrobe in the bedroom is taken up by the fridge and coffee machine. Guests have to walk from the bedroom through the lounge into another kitchenette to access the main wardrobe. I could not understand why the fridge and coffee machine is not placed in the kitchenette where there is also a sink, worktops and plug sockets, thus allowing guests access to the whole of the bedroom wardrobe. Slippers and robes are provided, although we only had one robe in our room and after two complaints it took reception 8-hours to get another one to us. The broken hairdryer was however replaced immediately. There was also building work going on in the main courtyard during the whole of our stay (now highlighted on the hotel website), although the hotel did provide two free buffet breakfasts to compensate us for this. There is a small plunge pool on the roof with a hot tub and sun loungers. It has no bar but is still a pleasant area to spend some time in. The hotel is in a great spot in old San Juan only a couple of minutes walk from the main square. The fact that it is an old convent adds to its character and charm. We also took advantage of the facilities at the La Concha, the sister hotel of the El Convento, which are complimentary to El Convento guests. This is a fairly characterless four-star hotel in which the service was below par but it has a good beach, a few nice pools and is only a 10 minute taxi ride away from the El Convento, so worth a visit. My overall view of the El Convento was of a hotel with lots of character in a fantastic location but the rooms, hotel facilities and service are at best average for a hotel claiming to be small luxury four-star with room rates set accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: DrFady
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Beautiful rooms. Great location. Wish on the beach. But then it would change character of hotel. Nice tapas restaurant in hotel. Real cool restaurants within walking distance and fun bars. If beach is not a priority this the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful family Christmas holiday”
Reviews.Author: JamieU
Reviews.Content: We spent this past Christmas at the El Convento for a family Chistmas holiday before our cruise left out of Puerto Rico. There were 14 of us. We had 6 rooms one including the Gloria Vanderbelt suite. We had a marvelous visit and were very nicely accomodated for such a large group. We received a special discount on our rooms and the GV suite (contact group sales Rachelle) because we had such a large party. The breakfast buffet was included because of some hotel remodeling ( not a problem at all). The staff was very accomodating and friendly and the service was impecable. The managers wine reception is every night on the terrace from 6-7PM and you are served very nice wine and cheese included for no extra cost. We had christmas dinner on the patio at the tapas restaurant which was quite lovely and a picture perfect family gathering . The hotel is ideally situated for touring old San Juan. The fort and tourist shops all right there and just a short walk. We found a local hole in the wall bar haunt called No No's about 3 blocks up the street on the corner and choose to hang out there for drinks with a local flavor and friendly bartenders. There is a small town park located right outside the hotel where a local oil painter sells his wares for about 20$ of scences of puerto rico that are quite nice. Across the street there is a catholic church that we attended for Christmas eve services. When we stayed at the el convento there was a wedding going on with uniformed guards and cannons going off for a special dignatary. I must say that I highy enjoyed my stay at the El Convento and it was the highlight and favorite part of our cruise vacation.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento Just "Drips" of Old San Juan Romance!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny_Vegas
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is exactly what I hoped for in an Old San Juan hotel. It just "drips" of incredible ambiance and old Spanish atmosphere. The rooms are not the classiest that I have ever stayed in, but they have more romance and atmosphere than any modern, hi-tech establishment. My wife and I love the ability to walk almost anywhere in Old San Juan very easily from the hotel. The incredible restaurants and clubs of Fortaleza Street are only a short, 10 minute stroll from El Convento. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and they speak perfect English. We also loved the 6 PM wine and cheese party that is complementary every evening - it is a wonderful way to connect with other travelers. We will be back to El Convento soon.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: pprahlad
Reviews.Content: El Convento was a 16th century monastery occupied by the Carmelite nuns.It is downtown San Juan across the street from San Juan Bautista Cathedral which ou must visit .The resting place of Ponce DeLeon.There are rumors that tunnels exist between the monsatery and the church! It has been renovated.The building is typically spanish with 3 levels surrounding a central open courtyard which is the restaurant both during the day and when it rains.The rooms are fronted by wide balconies which run all around offerering shelter from the weather. The floors are old clay tiles,framed by sunny curved arches. The rooms are sized at 3 levels,we stayed at the double.A king bed,shutters and a window onto the street.A bathroom totally upgraded with toiletries from Aveda.Thick towels and bathrobes,flat screen TV. The hotel has a ballroom that is used for weddings ,so it can get noisy at night. There is a rooftop plunge pool and sunning area,dont plan on swimming at the hotel. There are amazing nooks and seating areas throughout the hotel. An all day honor bar system exists in one of these areas. The food was great,the evening meal service was excellent. The best part about this hotel is it's location.Walking distance to every thing downtown!!! 2 blocks from the fortalezza,a mile to El morro.We ate at Marmalade and Trois Cent Onze.Marmalde was OK but expensive,TCO was great.Freanch food ,good wine selection. Hotel averaged 275 plus tax a night,the rate varies according to the day of the week so avoid Sat and Sun if possible. Enjoy! The best part

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: CGUESS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento in March of 2011 and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is not "modern" in that the rooms are not all identical to one another and the layout is what you might expect in that regard. The design and furnishings of the two rooms I saw were very high quality. The bathroom in our room was small, but very nice. We actually occupied a small suite which included a living area, a wet bar and the separate bedroom and bath. Our friends were happily upgraded to a beautiful room adjacent to the pool. We tried one of the restaurants and two of the bar areas while there. The most fun was the honor bar, which has a veranda associated with it. We hung out there for quite a while and met some other guests, one of whom we ended up going to dinner with that evening. Very cozy. The pool is TINY and located on the roof. It is very pretty and has a lot of charm, but this is not a pool that would lend to rowdy play and probably not for children at all. I would classify this pool as a "plunge pool."
