It's barely larger than my spa at home. If you got 8 or 10 people in there all at once, you'd become close friends. The service, food, drinks, amenities, surroundings, location -- all top notch. We're staying there again next month, so that says something in itself. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Despite construction, we still had a great event”
Reviews.Author: Otono76
Reviews.Content: When we started looking at locations for a December destination wedding, we chose Puerto Rico largely based on El Convento and its unique character. It really is an amazing property with so much history and character that you can't find easily in the states. After a year of planning, I had a serious breakdown about two weeks before the wedding when I learned on TripAdvisor from other travelers that the hotel's interior courtyard was under construction. Fortunately for us, we had only planned on having the cocktail reception in the courtyard at dusk (so you couldn't see the construction) and our party was small enough to utilize the part that is still open, so it all worked out and we ended up having a wonderful event. I feel badly for the people who had planned on using the patio for their ceremony because they are just out of luck for now. Despite the construction, this hotel is worth a visit for travelers, or for those having a local event - planning a destination wedding in Puerto Rico is a much more complicated endeavor than we imagined for many reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Free daily wine and cheese”
Reviews.Author: deborahcorinne
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past couple years and am truly in love with it. The service can't be beat. The staff speaks fluent english and will help with just about anything (from booking an excursion to recommending what beach or restaurant to visit). The hotel is located in the heart of Old San Juan with walking distance to just about everything. There is a daily wine and cheese hour where you get all the wine and cheese you would like. The selection is fabulous and ...well, I would stay there again just for this hour! The hotel used to be an old spanish catholic convent so the rooms are small but with amazing architecture. Definitely a great once in a lifetime place to visit. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lower Your Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Betty-Ann H
Reviews.Content: You'll be happy at El Convento if yiou don't expect too much. The location is good and the history is here but the rooms smell musty and they have no ionizers to fix the problem. Their answer is to turn the AC down to 50 degrees. It's not very comfortable. Tonight there is a wedding and our room two floors above is reburberating. I am paying $700.00 for a cold and smelly suite with no sleep. Unfortunately, we also came at a time when the courtyard was being re-titled so we can't enjoy it for breakfast. Instead, we eat in a meeting room with no atmosphere. (and drink orange juice out of a carton- don't they grow oranges here??) The hot tub is old and the we didn't get our room cleaned until 4;00 pm. My husband is now saying that we should reconsider booking historical properties but we've had good success with them before. It is funney that they can get it right in Brazil but not Puerto Rico.El Convento is definitely NOT a luxury property. if you come expecting average service and simply enjoy old San Juan, you could be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Even with construction, a landmark worth visiting”
Reviews.Author: Phillylad
Reviews.Content: Even with the patio re-hab work going on a month longer than El Convento management wanted, this is a lovely, very friendly, storied destination. In this our fifth stay, we again had a harbor-facing room, and because of the (to us, minor) dislocations, they gave us free breakfasts for our entire stay. The bilingual staff has always been exceptionally attentive & nice -- and quick to find ways to be helpful. That the entire staff could be described as anything but welcoming is impossible -- and far from our experiences. Worth a stay, and always worth a look. Newer dining area in inner courtyard promises to be -- again, later in 2012 -- exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento Hotel - an old world dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: taggyodulla
Reviews.Content: The nicest most hospitable manager, the most charming old world touches with new world amenities in the prettiest part of San Juan. Loved the wine/cheese daily receptions, which gives you a chance to visit other travelerers and trade experiences. I think of El Convento daily..............

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but beware of room 324”
Reviews.Author: starryrach
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in San Juan. We stayed at the Hotel El Convento, which was great. It is a small, historic hotel in the middle of the Old City. If you are looking for a generic luxury hotel resort, this may not be the place for you. We loved it because it felt very special and unique. The building is beautiful and interesting, the pool deck is very relaxing, and the service is great. They offer free wifi, free coffee, tea, and bottled water throughout the day, and a really nice complimentary wine and cheese happy hour every evening from 6-7. Several reviewers here mentioned that they are currently performing construction on the courtyard, which is true. They told us when we checked in that the renovations were supposed to be finished before the holiday season but they got behind schedule, so to make up for it, they gave us coupons for complimentary breakfast buffet for every day we were there. The breakfast buffet was very good (included an omelet station) and we thought this gesture more than made up for the minor inconvenience of the courtyard renovation. One problem we had: we started out in room 324. On first glance, this is a really nice room...very big with a really high ceiling. It is across a very narrow street from a very noisy bar (El Batey), however we realized that if we turned the air conditioner up high, the noise from the fan drowned out the noise from the bar and it was ok (not great, but ok). However, one night (Wednesday) we came home and there was a HUGE party at the pizza place downstairs (Pizza e Birra). Music was BLASTING and there must have been a few hundred people there. We asked at the front desk and they told us that the party happens every Wednesday night, and that it was going to last until 2AM. There was just no way we would be able to sleep with that noise. The front desk people were very nice and understanding, and they offered to let us change rooms, which we did (into a much smaller but much quieter room which we were happy with). So if you will be there on a Wednesday night, make sure you are not in room 324. It really was terrible. We really had a nice time in spite of that, and I still highly recommend this hotel, just not that one specific room especially if you will be there on a Wednesday.

Reviews.Title: “Location is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Bdsmith51
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here; group had three rooms. Location is great in middle of Old San Juan. Atmosphere was great. Our group ranged in age from 27 to 77 and we all enjoyed. Amenities in room very good as was complimentary breakfast, beverages and manager's wine/cheese reception. However, thank goodness for glass inner door which blocks noise from restaurants. Black out curtains were wonderful. View from room 518 was nothing to brag about. Would not recommend room 503; next to elevator and noise was problem. Staff were all courteous and helpful........from breakfast waiters to room maids to desk clerks. Yes, it is expensive but did enjoy this upscale hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: I travel to Puerto Rico about 6 times per year on business, and whenever I get the chance to stay at the El Conveto I am sure to do so. I have stayed at El Convento three times when my wife made the trip with me. The rooms are very nice, the wine and cheese reception great, and the location is perfect for those of you who like history and like being in the thick of the historical area. If you are a beach person it is not ideal since you have to take a shuttle to an affiliate site. However, there is a nice public beach just a few miles away. The Tappas restaurant, El Picoteo is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 days. Wasnt exactly looking for an elegant, more mature crowd hotel, but am very happy in the end. Amazing front desk service, shocking ammenities like 6-7pm cheese/wine party and free breakfast, free water and wifi. Great location but annoying $15 taxi ride to Condado beach area. They do offer free accrss to La Concha resort once you do arrive at Condado. This was another amazng offer. Judith, restaurant manager, was wildly effective, when she was on duty. Sadly when she wasnt, the waiters were lost.

Reviews.Title: “Not a European style luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkP4
Reviews.Content: The blurb claims the building was saved and converted into a European style luxury hotel. Putting an American hotel into a restored Carmelite convent does not make it a European style luxury hotel, it's an average American hotel in an interesting setting. That said it does have a very convenient location in old San Juan and the rooms do have a certain charm, certainly the ones on the lower floors with the high ceilings. The problems include noise, the convent was a cloister and with the restaurants on one side it can tend to get noisy (assuming you don't use the air conditioning to drown it out). The noise problem was not helped by them doing maintenance work during the day that involved a jack hammer. Breakfast was included in the rate which was a double edged sword as if you had to pay for it it would have been motivation to eat somewhere else. Orange juice isn't something wet the colour of oranges. I wouldn't have thought it was too hard to find some actual oranges and squeeze them. Room 302 looks out onto the terrace where the evening cheese and wine reception is held. It also means that the terrace looks into this room if you don't close the shutters. While the room is quite nice I would decline any upgrade that puts you in it.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel anywhere !”
Reviews.Author: gwdelmar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel (Dec.2011) for a little vacation, and we are very happy we chose it, since we had a great experience in our stay. Service was top notch by all of the hotel staff, our room was beautiful, and very well appointed, we liked the fact that our room had noise isolation doors and windows (a plus, since there could be some noise from the nearby bars or restaurants), the daily wine and cheese reception was very good (although you pay for it in the hotel fees, which I think were probably a bit high), and best of all, it has the ideal location for a hotel in all SanJuan. It is within walking distance to anywhere in the Old San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric ambience for Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Like a Spanish Parador in the middle of Old San Juan...great location, ambience and excellent service. Great Tapas bar and upper floor rooms have a nice view. Small jacuzzi/pool w/ sun deck to soak up the sun/atmosphere of Plaza Dali below. A great short stay hotel for a romantic break in walled old city. Charming and comfortable with thoughtful 'quiet door' between room and inner courtyard entrance (makes rooms very quiet!), nice Aveda toiletries, comfortable beds and good room lighting w/ free water/coffee. Nice touch for the wine/cheese evening too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here around the holidays and had a wonderful time. We had a 5th floor room with a view of the bay. The room was nicely appointed and very comfortable. The floors are tile and the furniture heavy old Spanish style wood. The walls are brightly painted, so the whole feeling is of staying in a hacienda. The bed was very comfy with good linens. As this is an older building, the bathrooms are small, but nicely done with marble, fresh flowers and quality bath amenities. Our room had a mini fridge and complementary bottle water was replaced in the fridge daily. Robes and slippers were also provided. There was nightly turndown service. Service was excellent; all of the staff we encountered were helpful and polite. We were celebrating a birthday and the hotel sent chocolates up to the room, which was a nice surprise. We had booked a room with a view and a terrace - but did not realize the terrace is shared. It looks in to the courtyard with the huge tree and was very cool. We enjoyed seating out there and never saw others, but it was not clear in the description when we booked. The fourth floor has the plunge pool and jacuzzi on a terrace with a view. It is a pleasant way to while an afternoon; sitting in the pool and watching the ships go by. The third floor has a terrace and lounge with coffee, tea and chilled water available 24 hours. The business center and library are also in the space. In the afternoon there is also an honor bar and in the evenings a wine and cheese reception. The rooms were quiet. Old San Juan can get a little noisy and we had no problems in our room. Even the night the hotel hosted a rather boisterous wedding it was quiet in the room, although the common areas were affected. There is currently some construction in the courtyard, so we could not sit under the tree, and the common areas are pretty noisy during the day. We were out exploring, so that did not create much of an issue. The location is perfect for spending time in Old San Juan. We did not have a car, so had to take taxis outside the area, which can get a little expensive. On the other hand parking and driving in the old town, with the narrow cobbled streets is a pain and the lots are expensive so, it is a trade off We loved the hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: PadgettS122
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed here after our cruise in Dec- 2011. The hotel was really lovely. We enjoyed the afternoon drinks, cheese and had wonderful coffee on their patio. The plunge pool was just the perfect way to cool off after lying in the sun on their rooftop patio. We had requested two double beds and the room was great- spacious, really clean, beautifully decorated. The bathroom was small but gorgeous and they had Aveda spa shampoo and conditioner. The concierge helped us find a great little breakfast spot before our departure and the porters were very nice, and courteous. They helped us with our luggage and made great suggestions for the day. Everything went smoothly but the customer service was awesome. Great location for exploring old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Super-noisy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ayaspasha
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in early December 2011. I picked it because it was #1 of all San Juan Hotels in TripAdvisor and marked as â€œFodorâ€™s Choiceâ€� in my guide book. Upon arrival, I have been asked to pay extra for an upgrade to a junior suite on the top floor, which I happily did. My room was near the noisy elevator engine room that kept running until past midnight. There was construction in the courtyard that started at 9am. The lobby restaurant had loud music playing well past 11pm. The walls and doors are very thin, making it almost impossible to fall or stay asleep in the room. After three days of sleep deprivation, I moved to another hotel. Why the second star? The hotel has an unparalleled location, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the building is very charming. All this said, it is managed very poorly and at well over $400 per night it is bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Each time we get there is like coming home”
Reviews.Author: voyageurEurope
Reviews.Content: Tastefull interior. Great service. One of the few hotels in the America's where you will find overwhelming history (check all the functions that this building has had ;-) combined with unequalled service and great F&B. Don't do a one-nighter, enjoy the place as if it was a small village with it;s very own routines and rithme.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Experience in the Heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TravelGator1988
Reviews.Content: OK, I admit it. I love historic properties, especially ones that can maintain their original charm while mixing in a few luxurious touches. The Hotel El Convento doesn't disappoint in that regard. I've always considered Old San Juan to be a tourist trap, but after staying there for three nights and getting to know the place, I have changed my mind. Yes, there are are a few tourist traps dotting the landscape. But there are more than enough authentic Puerto Rican experiences in this beautiful district, including amazing waterfront vistas, Spanish colonial architecture, interesting people, good restaurants and hole-in-the wall bars where drinking rum at noon seems perfectly normal. No need to get a rental car, just take a taxi straight to the hotel. If you're in reasonable shape, the entire area can be explored on foot. Just be sure to wear some comfortable shoes! The hotel itself is five stories high and surrounds a courtyard with a large tree and a restaurant on the second floor. Depending on what is going on at the hotel, it can be quite noisy in the courtyard but once you get into your room, it's very quiet. The rooms are small, but well appointed. There is a wine and cheese reception each evening for the guests and complimentary coffee and tea are provided 24 hours a day. If you want a complete Puerto Rican experience with old world charm, this is your place...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic hotel in the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: wellfleetwaters
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 nights at this historic hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel if you enjoy old world charm. The service is excellent, the beds and sheeting are premier, the location is right in the middle of San Juan where you can walk to everything. There offer high quality wines and cheeses from 6-7 every night where you can sit out on the terrace and enjoy the sun set. They also offer delicious coffee and organic teas complimentary all day. I just loved this gem and will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must.”
Reviews.Author: Swooster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so special, you should push the boat out and pay the $'s to stay. You won't be sorry. We loved the 6pm till 7pm compimentary wine and cheese on the patio. What a fantastically hostpitable thing to do. We got to meet lots of the guests from all walks and countries. The little pool on the roof was a gorgeous place to hang out and relax. There is a great bar on the opposite side of the street called El Batey. Very quirky!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful. Needs work on Customer service in a down economy”
Reviews.Author: Smelliekellie_9
Reviews.Content: Here are the positives: Perfect location for visiting Old San Juan. Very comfy bed, nice room w/high ceilings, quiet location. Friendly Staff. Beautiful hotel. Complimentary coffee/tea all day long. Free wireless internet in hotel and hotel room. Complimentary one hour wine & cheese from 6-7 every evening. Here are the negatives. The hotel was doing construction all in the middle of the hotel. The construction severely deterred from the beauty and tranquility of the hotel. **Here's the solution: When I booked the hotel stay, the hotel should have informed me they were doing construction. I asked for an early check-in. Check in time was 3pm. I checked back at 2pm, still no room available. I did notice that there were many, many keys sitting in the key organizer, ready to be handed out. I did not get a call until 2:45pm to say my room was ready. This really, really irritates me because in this economy you make extra gestures to your guests, especially one's that don't cost you anything. **Here's the solution, let guests check in early if the room is ready. I own a vacation rental. I let guests check in early, if the property is ready. I also let them know if something is broken or not available. My final note: I would have given this hotel 5 stars if not for the two reasons I spoke of. .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms, service, location”
Reviews.Author: mpeterson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our friends stayed at this hotel at the end of November for four nights. This hotel was probably one of the best luxury hotels I have ever stayed at, due to it's staff, location, and the price we paid. The hotel is located very close to SoFo, El Morro, and the cruise ship terminal. The rooms are comfortable, with Aveda products, free water, and sound proof inner doors that keep the cool in and the sound out. Our room, 516, had a view of the ocean and Old San Juan. Our bed was comfortable, and the room was very quiet, even with the construction going on in the courtyard. The wine and cheese reception at 6pm each night was great. They offer four white and four red Spanish wines. The cheese was plentiful, and there is an honor bar should you not want wine or the complimentary coffee, tea, and water that are available all day. Sure, the pool and hot tub are rather small (although we did fit 13 people in the hot tub one night) but the hotel makes up for that lack in a big way. El Convento has relationships with La Concha and Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde. We chose to go to La Concha in Condado, due to the restaurants and activities that would be close by the hotel. La Concha is beautiful, with three pools (one is adult only) and a nice beach. The waves were pretty wild, as it is on the Atlantic, so be careful with children in the waves. The pools were uncrowded, with waterfalls and palm trees. You can charge anything you want back to your room at El Convento. We rented a car and parked in at the hotel's lot, which is right across the street behind the church. The rate was 20/day, with unlimited in and out privileges. The valets and luggage porters were very nice, friendly, and full of recommendations of where to go and what to do. We ate at Patio del Nispero for breakfast (which is inside due to construction) and El Picoteo for dinner. Both were on the expensive side for the quality and amount of food received. The service was also quite slow at Patio del Nispero, but we were on vacation so we didn't really mind. The hotel is beautiful, with lots of old Spanish class. From the piano player in the Salon, to local candies at reception, to turn down service, we felt well taken care of and pampered. If I come back to San Juan, I am staying here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: toothfairyklw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 26th Nov for 4 nights. Our first impression was the sense of being in the most stunningly quaint and colonial building. The rooms are set on 5 floors around a central atrium of tropical plants. We immediately felt at home, from the pleasant reception at the check in area,to the porter who gave us a potted history of El Convento as he delivered us to our wonderfully appointed twin bedded room which embodied the continued colonial feel. The roof terrace with plunge pool was charming with superb vistas across old San Juan. The complimentary evening cheese and wine hour proved to be a popular pre evening get together on another stunning terrace . This hotel is amazing ! A really stylish,tranquil and excellent place to stay in the historic Old San Juan. We most definitely will be back .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historical Hotel in the heart of old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, clean hotel with so much character and history in the center of Old San Juan. I would most certainly stay there again when I return. Staff was friendly, professional and accommodating to our needs. We generally loved the whole experience. We were immediately greeted and luggage taken off our hands, front reception staff were patient with our requests and we were taken to several rooms on 2 floors to choose which one we preferred. Luggage in tow each time, I donâ€™t recall the name of our bellman but he was so gracious about the whole thing. Our room was clean and cool with a view out onto the plaza / square. The hotel was under construction so there were noises and banging here and there but it canâ€™t be helped and since they are doing important work on a piece of history it was hard to be annoyed and it was minimal. The wine reception each day (6-7pm) was a lovely gesture and easy transition into the evening. An opportunity to meet other guests and travelers which we did and shared our stories and made new connections. The hotel was situated in a perfect spot to explore the city and enjoy walks each night to take advantage of the photographic opportunities. Whilst staying there we also had access to 2 other beaches / hotels. One of which that we did take advantage of was La Concha / Renaissance at Condado beach. This is such a tropical beautiful place, from the laid back pool and waterfall to the architecture in general and of course the beach. I was only there one time but really wanted to return to fully appreciate the place. The hotel provided towels and lounger for the beach which is great, the beach is clean and has the shade of palm trees if desired. One other highlight of the hotel was an employee / server named Ruben who was a joy to be around; he was so kind to us not only with his young persona and advice but great drinks. He offered recommendations at the hotel restaurant and bar as well as the San Juan area in general, he is a great asset to both the hotel and the travel industry of Puerto Rico in general. For business and personal travel I would highly recommend El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Room 102, Nov 20, 2011 3:00 pm check in. Took two calls and three hours to get luggage delivered from lobby (then the bellman brought an extra bag that didn't belong to us). Internet did not work after took two calls and four hours, they never could make operable. That night I watched a roach in bathroom scurry across the floor (no kidding!). A wedding reception on the first floor had music playing till midnight that reverberated through our room. When we checked out, the clerk asked how things were and I told her the above issues we experienced (she asked, so I politely told her). The Gen Mgr ( Sr. Rosa) in the back overheard the conversation, walked over to us apologized and asked for my contact information and said he would get back to me- two weeks later and I never heard from him. I wasn't seeking any kind of comp, but a follow-up contact would have been appreciated. I had stayed at El Convento before some years ago but would not return. What a shame- its a very attractive place that appears to suffer from very poor service execution. I would look for another small boutique hotel or even a large international hotel in the future if you are into quality hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis like no other”
Reviews.Author: AEP77
Reviews.Content: El Convento is truly an amazing hotel. The service and cleanliness are unparalled. I have been traveling to the Caribbean for some time now and never stayed at a hotel so luxurious and beautiful. El Convento's staff practically fall over themselves to help you in any way. There is a great wine and cheese reception where the libations keep flowing and they never run out of tasty cheese and fruit. The open air plan and Spanish architecture will also win your heart. If I ever go back to San Juan, I would stay here and nowhere else. The two drawbacks are: no beach and the pool is a small plung pool. My travel partner and I only stayed one night at the end of a trip that had involved more than enough beach so I didn't mind. But the hotel has relationships with others right on the beach and a shuttle to take you there, so it's hardly a drawback. And honestly, the plunge pool is usually totally empty so it's more like a private rooftop pool. If you go to San Juan and want to experience Old San Juan, you shouldn't stay anywhere but El Convento!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with some Reservations!”
Reviews.Author: costafox
Reviews.Content: El Convento is a beautiful well maintained building which is in a great location in Old San Juan and although the room rates are expensive, our bedroom was exceptionally clean and well appointed and most importantly had great air conditioning which is an absolute must have for this city. The hotel has beautiful open cloisters on each floor which overlook a central patio and I would say that in general it was good value for the money.. We stayed here for a couple of nights post cruise and overall I would stay it was a good stay. We arrived early and as our room wasn't available - neither was the porter - so with the help of our taxi driver we dragged our luggage into the reception area and we were told it would be stored until our return and we set off to explore the city. We were told that we wouldn't be able to access our room before 3pm but we arrived back just after 2pm and were checked into Room 504. We were happy enough with our room, we had a super view of the pool area and the sea beyond although the room was in a fairly noisy location close to the lift and we seemed to be staying in the midst of a wedding party. We were told by front desk that our luggage would be sent up to the room so we went to get some coffee (which is available 24hrs) from the lounge on the 3rd floor and decided to check in for our flights on the computers that were available for us to use there and chill for a while. When we returned to our room, probably an hour and a half later our luggage still hadn't been delivered - we rang the front desk and it soon arrived - I'm not sure if they didn't pass on the original message to deliver the bags or what happened. Tha managers daily cheese and wine reception is a great event which is well attended and we found that the charming hostess was kept busy replenishing both the cheese & biscuits and the good quality wines throughout the hour that the event is held. The downside of our room became apparent during the night - I think that the lift machinary was located on the roof near to our room so there was a clanging and thumping noise every time the lift was in use throughout the night. We didn't bother to request a change of room as we were only here for two nights, however if we were to visit San Juan again, we would certainly request a room further from the lift area but then we probably wouldn't have had such a great view - decisions, descisions....! On the morning of our departure we called for someone to help us down with the bags and the phone just rang and rang - we had checked the night before if somone would be available at 8am and were assured it wouldn't be a problem. Eventually the phone was picked up and somone did arrive to help us - however it wasn't the porter as we were told that he hadn't turned up for work on time! Maybe we were just unlucky but our experiences with the porter service in this hotel were not good and this is not really the standard of service we expected in this class of hotel. It's a shame as this was the only thing that made the service average for us - the rest of the staff were friendly, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Building”
Reviews.Author: Eastonlow
Reviews.Content: The El Convento is in a beautiful old building in old San Juan; apparently, the building was used in the tv show, The Flying Nun. The building itself is reasonably well maintained, and makes it a worthwhile choice. The location right inside the main city gate (the one to the ocean on the West side of the City) is also quite nice, central and quiet. The rooms, restaurants and service are ok, not great. The water pressure in our shower was questionable, and both the breakfast and the tapas restaurant were just ok as well. Overall, the price is fair for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great from the outside but problems within.....”
Reviews.Author: Aye-the-World
Reviews.Content: El Convento without doubt looks the class act in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The restaurants look really good too and with excellent service. The room rates expensive but for this high standard appear well priced. The Manager's wine reception each afternoon is a winner but the Wine & Cheese needs replenishing after only 5 minutes with the guests like bees around the honey pot. This continues for the short hour and all is cleared away right on or just before time up. The rooms are beautifully furnished but with absolutely no thought of where to open or store your suitcases. The biggest downfall being the noisy air-conditioners. They offer a pre/post Cruise package but strictly stick to the 3pm check-in which is madness with nothing happening in the hot reception area for hours then everyone starting to queue at 3pm. Even Blind Freddie knows the rooms cannot possibly all become ready at the exact same time. The normally beautiful central courtyard was completely under refurbishment but this was not pointed out to us at time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Latinhunny33
Reviews.Content: We loved our wedding experience with El Convento. The hotel is centrally located in Old San Juan. A converted convent, it was the perfect location for our wedding. It was easy for guests to locate given its proximity to the airport and tourist areas of San Juan. The food was catered by the hotel restaurant and it was absolutely delicious. We used their patio for our wedding ceremony then proceeded to the Paoli room for our reception. We walked the entire hotel taking pictures and you can't help but admire how beautiful it is, and how well cared for the hotel seems. The service provided by the hotel employees was outstanding. We visited beforehand and Carolina was a great help during our visit and wedding. We will definitely look into this hotel for future visits to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LCP2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for 2 nights and loved it. The hotel is charming and beautiful can definitely see why it's named one of the best small hotels in the country. It's cozy without being suffocating. We loved the open air courtyard interior. Best part was definitely the daily wine social hour a great way to try new wines and meet new people. It's ideally located. It was the perfect base as we wandered around Old San Juan. Right in the midst of the shopping area and many restaurants and walking distance to the smaller fort (which provides free shuttle to the bigger fort). We went to the pizzeria that is attached to the property. Yum! The pizza is excellent thin sliced gourmet style pizza. Loved it! Avoid their tapas restaurant tapas are mediocre and overpriced for tapas. But the hotel itself was perfect. If we ever go back to Puerto Rico we are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: stonebridge2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this spot. The hotel was very well maintained and the staff was extremely attentive. They had a nice cocktail hour every night. Beverage service was available 24 hours a day and was steps away from the pool. The pool is great. We had it to ourselves and the hotel occupancy rate was 80%. Rooms : We recommend spending the extra money to stay on the 5th floor. Restaurants : The tapas restaurant attached to the hotel was great. (They provide room services.) Breakfast restaurant attached to the hotel is nice. Great food and Good service. We went onto to stay at St. Regis Bahia Beach and there service was not close to the attention we received at the Hotel El Convento! Great Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming in-town San Juan hotel with character.”
Reviews.Author: Cleonie
Reviews.Content: Fit the bill perfectly for a one night stay in San Juan to get a sense of the city on our way home. Didn't want to stay at a beach resort although we arrived in the morning and asked for a pass to La Concha while waiting for our room to be ready, which was great. Rates were very good and our room on 2nd floor was lovely with high ceilings. Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. Roof terrace was so pretty and the little pool and jacuzzi hit the spot for a last sunbathing opportunity. Free coffee was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Prefect location”
Reviews.Author: wreath
Reviews.Content: stay here if you like antique character and style. Great location. Walk to everything.Wonderful complimentary wine & cheese in early evening.Liked the super high ceilings in the oh so quiet rooms with black out curtains. Small bath but as well presented as could be. Complimentary Aveda products.Sheets, towels, robes very good. Nice refrigerator and wifi worked well. Roof top mini pool and jacuzzi perfect temperatures. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “central location, clean and comfortable, calm Old World atmosphere, outstanding amenities,”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1234
Reviews.Content: Summary: central location for sampling Old San Juan, built around an outstanding old-world courtyard, which offered lots of authentic atmosphere, modern and comfortable room, fun nightly sampling of wines and cheeses, "sister property" ties to two beachfront hotels provided an extra vacation-extending bonus Details: wife and I really enjoyed our two nights' stay at Hotel El Convento on Nov 12-14 2011. Staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel's 6pm gratis wine and cheese hour served as our dinners; from the third-floor porch, we enjoyed hearing serenades from singers in the street. Comfortable room (#320) was sadly small but complete, and we appreciated the free high-speed Internet. The uncrowded fitness room featured modern work-out machines. El Convento's ties to two "sister properties" on the San Juan beaches allowed us to spend our final day at a great pool at a hotel at Isla Verde close to the airport, thereby extending our vacation by another half-day at no extra cost. Sweet!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: WinoElkGrove_Ca
Reviews.Content: This place is the bomb. Not only does it embody the old san juan experience, the food is good, the staff is awesome and you can't beat the location. At the bottom of the street is the San Juan gate. Dignitaries would enter through this gate 500 years ago and crawl on their knees to the church at the top of the hill because they were grateful for their safe passage to the new world. We upgraded to the best category of room. It was on the 5th floor with a view of the ocean. The hallway outside our room was open to the courtyard below with sitting areas. The bar and tapas - both awesome. Our package included an excursion that included the rain forest, the beach and the bio bay that would have lasted from 9 am to 10 pm. ugh - too much. They substituted a trip to the rain forest (do not miss El Yunque) and the beach. It was fantastic. Across the street from the hotel is a tapas place that was a dungeon and a city hall 500 years ago, and really good food. This review would not be complete without mentioning the honor bar. There was a bar set up on the terrace - full bottles of liquor and mixers. You pour your drink and write it down so they can charge you. Based on our full exploring of Old San Juan and Condado - there is not a nicer place to stay in the area. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “So much character - just gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: NZele
Reviews.Content: After visting San Juan for the first time last year, we knew we had to stay at the El Convento if we ever returned. Unfortunatley, we were only staying for one night as this was a stopover on the way to St. Thomas. I would definately return. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, I can only describe it as having so much character and charm. It is unlike anywhere I have ever stayed. The property is very well maintained and the rooms are appointed nicely with great linens, very comfortable beds and good toiletries. Take advantage of the wine and cheese reception in the evening, which is included with your stay. Also, be sure to eat at Rosa Di Triana (across the street) for Tapas - the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the middle of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: sunshine123_10
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. It is wonderful and very special. The rooms are not cheap but definitely worth the money. It is located in the middle of Old San Juan, you can walk wherever you want and find nice bars and restaurants nearby. We didn't eat at the hotel, but there is every evening a complimentary wine and cheese reception which is really nice. Room and bath were very clean and the bed very comfortable. We stayed with the pre-cruise package which included the taxi to the pier. Overall a great experience and we will definitely stay again at El Convento if we return to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! Old-style customer care.”
Reviews.Author: City_Watch
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.One of the best I've ever stayed in ... and I've stayed in a few. The staff are attentive, courteous and never fail to please. To be honest, its like staying in a mate's Mum's house, (one who has servants who are very polite). You really feel like you are very welcome. The very best place to stay in Old San Juan. Food is great - the tapas restuarant on site is classy and not too expensive, breakfast is to DIE FOR (try the eggs benedict - wife-meltingly pleasing) . San Juan is picturesque and needs more than a few hundred words on a trip advisor posting: read the travel brochures, they don't lie! Stay in the El Convento, the bijou pool at the top is cute and gives nice views over the old town, the complimentary cheese and wine at 1800 every night made me want to stay and get puddled ... make sure you do it. Free internet on the seconf floor, they love kids , but its actually very lovely for an 'intimate' weekend ... all told? Excellent .

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Nighthawkjw
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine any hotel being better than El Convento. We were so impressed by their staff who went out of their way to help us find something to do for Halloween. The most impressive thing about El Convento was the beautiful building itself. Upon arrival, our breath was taken by the place as we made our way to our room. Our room was absolutely perfect! The entire experience cannot be summed up in mere words -- you just have to be there! It was the perfect ending to our 2nd honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was the highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: JulietBravo
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a class of its own. if you are visiting PR for a relaxing caribbean getaway, this is definitely the place to stay. it's not on the beach, but in lovely old town san juan near some great restaurants, shops, walkable to all tourist sites. there is also a bus to the condado (trendy beach area, 10 min away) and isla verda (more beach in not so nice area by airport, 15 min away). the rooftop pool and hot tub were also very relaxing for us at night. plus, there is a nightly wine and cheese reception which we loved. it's a great way to mingle, relax and start the evening off w some excellent stuff. the room we stayed in was clean, spacious, noise free with a luxurious turn down service. we visited the ritz in isla verda one evening for kicks, it was quite nice, but we were glad to be at the el convento. its botique luxury feel was much warmer and the surrounding area cannot be beat much unlike the ritz which is nowhere good. the service was very pleasant overall. ignore the negative reviews on this site. sometimes people complain too much unfortunately. the hotel is definitely a 4 star, clean, friendly and luxury. it was also nice to know it was in a 350 year old convent beautifully restored. there was a local wedding done in their adjacent hall, we had a great time looking over it from up above the courtyard. we stayed at el convento 3 nights for my bday, they didn't do anything special for it but we still had the most amazing time in wonderful place. the only negative i'd say is the mattresses were going soft, but we still slept fine. neisha at the front desk was super helpful about everything :) thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: giostew2011
Reviews.Content: We spent the night here after our cruise and had an amazing experience! The hotel has so much history captured in a luxurious setting!! The entire staff from top to bottom was professional and helpful. They went out of there way to take care of our every need. If you have the chance to stay here don't pass it up, you won't regret it. Cant wait until our next trip to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “You can't miss this!”
Reviews.Author: bailar_mts
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Puerto Rico, I stayed El Convento, and within a year I had to return for another visit... It is simply THAT beautiful. The staff is outstanding. Plus, it's perfectly situated in Old San Juan, within walking distance to everything. I will definitely be going back...again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christi C
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is an beautiful hotel located in middle of Old San Juan. Charming, top notch service, awesome happy hour (from 6-7PM every night that includes wine, cheese, and fruit), and 3 great restaurants made our stay pure perfection. Don't bother looking any further, El Convento is the place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience with reservations on restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: NSRPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise after reading Trip Advisor reviews. While rooms are nice although showing some age,the staff is first class. However,the restaurants in the hotel leave something to be desired as qualityand service and sitting in a non air conditioned environment make for a negative experience. Better restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Now here's something different...”
Reviews.Author: MartinDe
Reviews.Content: Old Town San Juan has to be one of the prettiest places in the Americas/Caribbean, and El Convento is its gem. A wonderful almost secretive place reminding me of some of the converted monasteries in Europe. Friendly and helpful staff and fabulous food - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: BGause
Reviews.Content: El Convento was enchanting and the service top notch. We stayed for a night after taking a cruise and loved it! The ladies at the front desk were super helpful, the bartender was amazing, rooms were oversized and gorgeous and we had a charming balcony which overlooked the historic square. We arrived early and were invited to use the computer lounge which also offered drinks and snacks - all top notch! Loved this hotel and make sure to try their homemade sangria.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it (with "caviar.")”
Reviews.Author: Gene_Augusta
Reviews.Content: The El Convento is probably one of the most romantic and beautiful hotels I ever stayed at. The location and the guest services are excellent. Other reviewers already mentioned the gorgeous surroundings and the always accommodating staff. I just want to add a bit of "caviar." By the standards of moderate luxury American hotels, the rooms are indeed small (we had had an upgraded room on the fifth floor). The bathroom is tiny with little room for toiletries. The El Picoleto restaurant at the hotel was a huge disappointment. We ordered various tapas. Half were eatable; the rest over salted, over an undercooked. The flamenco show was a joke. Dancing was of the kindergarten quality. Once we had breakfast at the Patio del Nispero. Great service and a beautiful courtyard! Menu is limited and overpriced. Better places to have breakfast are within few blocks (e.g La Bombonera.) We were interested in walking tour. The hotel recommended a local guide (believe his name was David.) Although a colorful personality, he knew very little history and embellish a lot of facts. This tour was definitely not worth the $40. If you like wine and cheese, the manager's reception is worth attending. Unfortunately, the available sitting is a bit limited. Guests tend to linger. So, arrived early. If you worry about you health after eating all the delicious PR food, use the gym in the basement of the hotel. They have a few treadmills, an elliptical, a stair master, and a set of weights. All are in excellent condition. I don't think they see much use. Our room had a fridge. The staff always stocked it with bottled water. Grab additional water on the 3rd floor patio. We were a bit worried about driving and parking in the old city. Thankfully, there is a designated valet parking lot just across from the entrance. It is very convenient and easy to find. Parking costs $20 a day. Is the El Convento perfect? May be not. However, next time I'm in San Juan I will most definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Javabeandog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary here on the long Columbus Day weekend. The staff was wonderful and made reservations at the restaurant Marmalade. They mentioned to the staff at the restaurant about our anniversary. There were rose petals covering our table when we arrived! The hotel is in a great spot and we walked everywhere. It is a unique place, great big doors are at the entrance. The nightly wine and cheese reception was a very nice touch and a lot of the guests seemed to attend. The room we had was nice, not high end fancy, but very clean and comfortable. It was quiet, we had a room in the back of the hotel. The beds were turned down and music was on when we returned to our room after dinner. We went to their sister hotels and used the facilities there, a nice bonus for those who wanted to go to the beach. We will return to this lovely place and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not for everyone but just right for us”
Reviews.Author: POOLSBEACH
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay celebrating our 30 wedding anniversary! Loved chatting with other guest at the nightly wine and cheese receptions. Good wines, cheeses and grapes. Complimentey Coffee, tea and bottled water available round the clock. Nice quiet rooms. No noise or light when drapes are closed. Queen size beds are a little smaller than American queen. Nice towels and bedding. We were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne in our room after returning from dinner. Thank you! We enjoyed the rooftop and dipped in both the pool and hot tub. After the wine and cheese we really weren't so hungry but we did have pizza in the hotel restuant and it was thin and tasty. We walked all over old San Juan and really enjoyed it. Lots to see and do. Plenty of dinning choices. Some people may prefer the sister hotel ( La Concha ) if you want a beach. We live at the beach so we enjoyed the old city. We never used the car once in four days. All the staff were great. Looking forward to a return visit in the very near future. Best location in old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, didn't Love it”
Reviews.Author: JESTRVLS
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at El Convento, but I may have gone in with higher expectations of the hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews. I spent 7 nights at El Convento on my honeymoon. Features I liked: Unique building, good location, loved the wine and cheese reception (it was a nice alternative to a complimentary breakfast), Aveeda bath products, access to computers, free wi-fi, the plunge pool and hot tub, complimentary bottled water, mini fridge, turn down service ... It was also nice that our room had a "sound proofing" door within which seemed to buffer out construction noise going on in the courtyard. Not as expected: Since El Convento was labeled a Luxury Boutique Hotel I expected more comfortable beds. I thought the bathroom would be a little nicer (not necessarily larger) but have a more luxurious feel. I thought we would get more information on things to do in the area. The few times I asked, I was handed a brochure and given little detail. Maybe the desk staff was overwhelmed with work, but everyone seemed rushed when I approached the desk with questions. Also since it was our honeymoon, I think I went in assuming El Convento would have done something extra special for us. We were guests for 7 nights. We did not get a room upgrade, a bottle of champagne or recognition of our recent marriage. None were needed, but any recognition would have been nice. I emailed El Convento prior to the trip with a few questions and never received a response. Overall, my stay was enjoyable, but I did not love El Convento enough to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MrsTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent my birthday weekend at the El Convento. We loved the hotel and Old San Juan. We spent the bulk of our time walking around Old San Juan and visiting the 2 forts (El Morro and San Cristobal). El Convento is truly charming and our room was lovely. Yes, it's an old building but that's part of the charm. The staff was really nice and the food was delicious (we had breakfast and lunch there). The rooftop pool is small but the setting is lovely and serene. The taxi cost to and from the airport is about $20 (tip not included), There's free wi-fi at the hotel. My husband who has an AT&T iPhone had no problems connecting. I, on the other hand, have a Verizon iPhone and the connection was not always great. It was a great weekend and we'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to run to from NYC.”
Reviews.Author: CiaoNewYork
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite things to do for a long weekend or so is to stay at Hotel El Convento, hang out on the sun deck with a Medalla beer and cigar hand-rolled by the guy down the street. El Convento is a converted convent that is beautifully restored and maintained. Staying there gives you access to some of Puerto Rico's best restaurants for local food and the bars on premises are as much as you could ask for. The reception area, courtyard and banquet room are stunning and private. The rooftop pool is small but welcoming in the hot afternoon sun. Service is subtle and unassuming. The restaurant could use a bit more staff but is made up for by the self-service honor bar and nightly open-bar Manager's Reception, which is not to be missed. My wife and I have been staying here at least once every year since 2002 and look forward to it still. We've stayed in lots of other hotels like the Intercontinental, La Concha, ESJ Tower, Hilton Ponce, Fajardo Inn, Rincon Beach Resort, to name a few. While there is nothing wrong with the others, Hotel El Convento is the most unique of them all with a personality all its own. It's a cab ride to the beach from the hotel, so if that bothers you stay at La Concha instead. The best of both worlds is that since La Concha and El Convento are sister hotels, you can stay at EC and use the beach and facilities at LC. Look into it. It's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: newyorkpaulandliz
Reviews.Content: Staying at the El Convento in Old San Juan is a real treat. The hotel is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are great as well as is the service from the entire staff. The evening managers cheese and wine get togethers are a great way to meet other travelers who appreciate a good thing. From the minute you arrive until you leave the experience is just too good for words. As for convenience it is close to all the action in Old San Juan. Treat yourself, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FScottP
Reviews.Content: A clean room, well air conditioned, in the heart of Old San Juan. Can walk through the entire old city from here. We had a great stay, and I would stay here again when I return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “We had high expectations... and El Convento met them”
Reviews.Author: boyzmom5
Reviews.Content: We are two couples who celebrated our 25th wedding anniversaries with a four night stay in mid-October. Our high hopes about El Convento from other TripAdvisor gurus made us wonder if the hotel could be as great as described, and if we would enjoy it that much. We did! I won't repeat all that others have raved about (charm, cleanliness, high level of service, wine and cheese reception) but will add a couple of other thoughts. We have enjoyed tapas in Spain and can say with confidence that El Convento's El Picoteo rivals the best. The portion sizes are extremely generous and the dishes we tried were exceptional. We ate a second night at El Convento when our daytrip to El Yunque/Luquillo Beach/the Bio Bay at Fajardo (all fabulous and recommended) didn't get us back to the hotel until almost eleven at night. Too tired to go anywhere else, we enjoyed delicious thin-crust pizzas, tomato/mozzarella salads and hearty red wine in the outdoor plaza at Pizza e Birra -- perfect! On Sunday the staff proved why it is consistently complimented on its excellent service. Three of the four of us wanted spa treatments, (my husband wanted to chill by the hotel pool) but the spa within walking distance that they usually recommend was closed. Instead, after some searching, the front desk staff found La Marina, a new spa (open since September 2010) near the port where the cruise ships come in. We took a short taxi there, but hopped on the free city trolley to come back -- just three blocks walk from La Marina. Not only was La Marina clean, and the staff there wonderful, but the quality of our massages was high and they extended a 15% discount to us as El Convento guests! Sauna, cups of tea, ambient music, highly skilled massage therapists... and a break in the already reasonable price added up to a joyful experience. We couldn't have found La Marina on our own. Another reviewer mentioned his unhappiness at the fact that we lost power for about twelve hours during our stay, from about midnight until about noon. The rooms remained relatively cool but a bit stuffy. I heard through the hotel grapevine that although El Convento has a small generator, enough to keep the kitchen and public spaces going with lights and fans, that they won't have a larger generator in place until 2012. We woke up that morning, still without power, and decided to take advantage of El Convento's sister resort: La Concha in Condado. Gorgeous! Four pools, a generous sandy beach with attentive cocktail service, more good food on the pool deck by Solero restaurant, clean changing facilities, fun staff -- we loved our day at La Concha and appreciated that we could access every amenity as if we were hotel guests there. All you need to do is ask El Convento for a letter introducing you as their guests to the La Concha concierge. Another sister resort option is the Marriott in Isla Verde (we didn't have a free day to try it). Overall, we can confidently add our voices to the chorus praising El Convento for being a generous, elegant, unique place to stay. Those who value character and charm will find this hotel sparks a trip back in time in the middle of Old San Juan. Hope we can make it back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: travelsaroundUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is right in the middle of Old San Juan, a few blocks from El Morro. With no traffic, it took about 20 minutes in a taxi from the airport, but going back, it took nearly an hour, because of traffic. There are plenty of cabs waiting right outside. The room doors all face an inner courtyard with lots of plants and places to sit. The room itself was bright, clean, and pleasant. The best part of the stay, though, was the exceptionally friendly staff, especially Karina. She took time to talk with us, make sure everything was satisfactory, and just ask about our day and our plans. The hotel has free wireless and wired internet, but it was a bit tough to make it work consistently. There is an included wine and cheese (with crackers and grapes) reception each evening. Other people have mentioned elevator issues: The elevator was under repair when we arrived, but we were allowed to use the service elevator in the back. The elevator repair did make some noise, that made it into my room. Also, there was a chirping most of the day and night (from a frog?) that made it into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Barrett S
Reviews.Content: I've debated on how to review this hotel. Me and my wife stayed here during the beginning and end of our honeymoon. Two nights at the beginning and one night at the end. El Convento is a beautiful hotel. Perfect location in Old San Juan. Close to everything, but also very close to the edge of town near the water, so at times it is also peaceful. Everything about the property is beautiful, from the rooms to the courtyard to the verandas, ect. Keep in mind that this is a very old building and a convent as well. The rooms are small (I've stayed in standard hotels in NYC with bigger rooms), but they have all the proper amenities that you would expect with an upscale hotel: nice towels, bedding, frig, nice TV (although if you're staying here you shouldn't be watching any TV). We ended up staying in the same room for both of our stays, even though our last night was supposed to be in a cheaper room. We appreciate this, although I was curious as to what the non ocean view rooms looked like, just to see if it was worth the extra money. The wine and cheese hour exceeded my expectations. I've stayed at places in CA wine country that only offered 2-3 wines, El Convento offered 8 wines and 5 cheeses, all very good. OK, now for the bad part and why I'm only giving them a 3. First the construction noise. I realize that this is an old building and in need of upkeep, but at times the noise from the construction in the court yard was quite annoying. My biggest issue though was with the last night we spent here. I had considered writing a separate review and giving them a 1 for this. The electricity went out at around midnight on Oct. 16, and remained out until sometime the next morning. In small rooms such as these, with little ventilation, and in Puerto Rico in Oct., air conditioning is a must. To keep it short, the night was miserable. One of the worst nights I've ever spent in a hotel. I realize that it is not the fault of the hotel's management that this happened, and certainly would not expect them to just create electricity so that we could have some AC. However, the quality of my stay is ultimately the responsibility of the management. There was not even an apology from the staff. I think the correct response from the hotel in this situation would have been to offer everyone in the hotel that night a voucher to be used at a future date. I think this is the least they could have done and would have encouraged people to come back and enjoy what the hotel really had to offer such as was the case on our first stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: buffywell
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is a Puerto Rican jewel! This luxury hotel has a very 'homey' feel but still has that air of sophistication. Friendly and helpful staff are everywhere and their attention to every detail and your satisfaction was apparent even before we set foot off the plane. The beautiful courtyard was perfect for lounging at any time of the day or night as we listened to the charming coqui (native frog who 'chirps' like a bird). There was a wedding happening our first evening there and even with the music/laughing/talking it was still a pleasant atmosphere. El Picoteo tapas restaurant was delicious and their 'healthy pour' attitude towards their drinks made us relaxed and happy. The plunge pool and hot tub were soothing and the roof-top view was romantic. Every evening, there is a lovely complimentary wine and cheese buffet complete with other alcohol for mixed drinks, beer, soda, water and coffee/tea service. This area also houses the honor bar, however it gets closed up in the late evening. Our room was superb. We've stayed in some high-end luxury hotels in Chicago, Milwaukee and in Qatar and this room was just as nice. Keep in mind that the hotel and property are over 360 years old (and has it's own wikipedia page) so even thought there are a few minor blemishes, the room and building themselves are fastidiously maintained. The location is one of the best in Old San Juan! Close to art, music, food, parks, the old walls of San Juan and other historically significant areas, not to mention the Cathedral of San Juan Bautista. The cruise ship piers are nearby and the area around them offers food and a fun atmosphere as well. However, the fact that El Convento is tucked away makes it the best place for a quiet visit with lots of activities close by. Do yourself a favor and stay here for the quintessential Old San Juan experience!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SpartanGirl3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and loved everything about the hotel. The old world charm and character really added to the experience. The service was phenomenal and the rooms very clean. The in-hotel restaurant balcony was amazing and gorgeous for a night out. Its walking distance to all the shops and historical areas in Old San Juan. We would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but beware of the nuns rooms!”
Reviews.Author: roscrea1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in old town San Juan. It is architecturally gorgeous with a magnificent foyer and bar reception area. The location will allow you to walk everywhere and still be a stones throw away from your hotel.The staff were very courteous and professional. We didn't dine here except breakfast which was very pleasant. There re too many options locally that enticed us out of the hotel. The only area which I was not as happy with but still not upset were the standards of the room. I kept expecting a nun to come out of the next room with a stick and give me a good beating. I understand that they are holding on to the history of the convent, but they could have spruced up the rooms a bit more. In saying that, everything else about the hotel is marvelous and again you can't neat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: CityTravelers999
Reviews.Content: Friends celebrated our 50th here - and it was truly unforgettable. The entire staff was amazing. A wedding one night closed the open-air bar. We had hoped for a nightcap. Instead, the staff delivered a pitcher of amazing Sangria to us as we sat talking at a side table - completely unexpected and the type of service that is the standard for this hotel. We had a wonderful experience and enjoyed looking out over the square, watching wedding parties collect prior to the wedding and then come out afterwards - what fun! The cocktail hour was wonderful - we enjoyed wine, cheese and drink with other guests and shared tips on tours and places to go. The ONLY Place to stay in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, and First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Allergytraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay, and all the good reviews are absolutely correct. From the rooftop pool to the many sitting areas, and the website pictures are accurate. Our room was spotless, the view of the bay beautiful (so, what if it was over rooftops, it is a city!), and the old-fashioned turn-down service a surprise. Every question or request was met with a smile, and every staff member seemed to be proud of both Puerto Rico and El Convento. If you have ever been to a hotel where guests seem to be a nuisance to the staff, you will be delighted NOT to find that here - every person we encountered went out of their way to be helpful, and seemed to enjoy doing it. There were several functions in the evenings, and the double doors to our room were totally soundproof. Our congratulations to the manager, Mr. Effrain, who runs a tight ship.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom line. FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: boondocksavvy
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my fiance one night for a quick getaway. The Hotel manager (Effrain) showed us around upon our arrival and gave us a brief history of this beautiful boutique hotel. El Convento is steeped in 300+ year old Spanish/Puerto Rican history. And it shows. The check-in was effortless. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and made us feel as if we belonged there. Dinning: Although there are limitless places to dine in Old San Juan, we found ourselves attracted to El Picoteo in the main garden area. The food was beyond ( try the Empanadillas) .service was great and the drinks were fun. After dinner we had drinks and good conversation at the pizza e b irra. You can sit out on the patio and watch people and look at the stars. The staff repeatedly ask my fiance and I if we were going to join them for the "Cocktail Reception". We did and we had a fabulous time. Its on a patio that overlooks the bay of San Juan. Very cool experience! The rooms and views were spectacular. There was even a card on the nightstand telling us who out housekeeper was (written by her). Very personal aspect! When we returned to the room to turn in for the night, the hotel had layed out rose petals on the bed, with two towels shaped like 2 geese kissing. we were shocked. Great romantic touch by the staff. (Thank You) Overall I would Highly recommend El Convento for a romantic stay in one of the most precious city's in the world! Thanks El Convento. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to taste Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: david011608
Reviews.Content: In the heart of old town San Juan, you can't find a better place to experience the ambience. Old Spanish smell fell into every bit of the place, from the reception to the room, even your old fashioned door keys. Hotel itself can be an attraction for sightseeing, which can lead you shoot some pictures around. The view on the balcony is not super, but you can expect much from the top of a 5 floor tall building. Room is lovely, especially the sheets and pillows; but honestly,It's not very neat and convenient. Given the fact that the whole building haven't been changed much since built, we can accept that. Wished to stay longer but it was really booked out on the weekends. Like other people we were debating whether to stay in town or on beach. After the stay, we didn't regret our decision.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Mesmorizing, El Convento Is for the TRUE CONESUER!”
Reviews.Author: World T
Reviews.Content: Let me first begin by saying I have traveled the world two fold. From Monte Carlo to the China Sea and have found few hotels that truly encapsulate the essence of their surroundings. The Old City of San Juan is honestly a destination of rich history and pure culture. The resonance of French, Spanish and Dutch settlements throughout this islands history bloom beautifully on each rustic cobble stone street. One can feel, while strolling through the streets, the energy of history past. Each edifice tells a story, and every road leads you to a new adventure. From some of the oldest buildings in America, to the incredible array of impeccable cuisine, bustling nightlife and some of the most loving peoples I have encountered in my travels, Puerto Rico and specifically Old San Juan is the definitive destination for any traveler. That being said, El Convento Hotel epitomizes the lifeblood of all these sentiments. My Fiance and I experienced this property this September and from the moment we drove down the narrow street, opening up to this incredibly restored convent, we were memorized. The hotel itself is quite spacious, five stories high and stands ever present caddy corner to a beautiful little old world park. Immediately i felt taken back to Spain in the 1800's. The Bellmen greeted us with a warm "bienvendio" and ushered us to the entrance where you are instantly struck by the incredible art and architecture. The entirety of the hotel is covered and created of original art from all over south and Latin America. You feel as though you are ancient Spanish royalty as you walk through the courtyards towards the concierge, who again, smiles with incredible sincerity. Our concierge told us a brief history of the convent, the local flora and fauna on the property and all that was at our finger tips. Our room was everything I could expect of, from staying in a Spanish villa, complete with mountainesque views of the ocean and port of San Juan. One can imagine what it was like to live here in the convent in the 18th century. It was breathtaking! Our room was perfect size, set with with time period - esq furniture mixed beautifully with the technology of today. Flat screen, Digital output, Wifi, Marble bath and complete with sound proof glass doors! Remarkable dinning options await you within the hotel as well, from traditional Latin American cuisine, to stone and brick oven pizza, a foodies heaven! They even had an herb garden where you can grab what you like and utilize in your cuisine or if daring incorporate at their spa. Every staff member was impeccable, with warmth and sincerity toward their Island. A true gift for any traveler. The courtyards, terraces, nooks, sun decks with all transport you and give you the freedom to time travel. We were even provided with a greeting in the room that had the General managers, Efrain, whom we had the pleasure of meeting later on, telephone number. He was a gracious host and incredibly knowledgeable. IMPECCABLE. This property is over 350 years old, has the best staff and management i have encountered in a long while and will undoubtedly leave an impression on both my fiance and I. If you are planning any vacation to the Caribbean, don't even think twice. Puerto Rico and EL Convento are on the bucket list. Kudos to ownership, your management and staff ARE Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: luvnabby
Reviews.Content: The hotel, staff, food, and location was great! We walked to all nearby attractions. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Fully enjoyed complimentary wine hour every evening. We celebrated our anniversary while there and were suprised to find a bottle of champagne in our room when we returned from dinner. It was perfect. Pricey but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Even better second time!”
Reviews.Author: YancieDale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two years ago at almost the exact same time period (Sept. 17-20, 2009) and enjoyed it so much we booked it for this trip (Sept 22-25, 2011). In fact, this hotel was a huge reason for our return to PR! It is amazing!!!!!! This review is based on our experience during the â€œoff season,â€� so things may be drastically different if you go during the â€œhigh season.â€� There are no bad points; other than it is expensive. The service is exceptional, hotel is immaculate and beautiful, the wine/cheese reception is fantastic and the location could not be any better if you want to discover Old San Juan. All three restaurants are very good, but I do encourage you to venture out and eat around OSJ. Some advice if you are staying here: The nightlife seems to have moved from San Sebastian to near the cruise ship ports. Two years ago there was live salsa on San Sebastian every night. One of the bars we went to last time is now a restaurant, another had karaoke. Thursday and Saturday we ended up at Latin Roots with about half of the city. We went to El Nuyroican and had a great time on Friday. There were very few tourists at either place and we had a blast. (again, this was the off season, so maybe the locals take over during this time, not sure). Donâ€™t eat at either place though â€“ food we saw did not look appetizing and there is some amazing food in OSJ. Have food elsewhere and head to the clubs after 11pm, thatâ€™s when things get going!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service... ok room”
Reviews.Author: L&JinVA
Reviews.Content: We went to San Juan in July and had a hard time deciding if we wanted to stay in the city or on the beach- Old Town won. Location is wonderful- right in the heart of Old San Juan. Steps away from shopping, walking distance to the forts, parks, and restaurants. When we got to our Queen Vista room, we noticed that the view was more of the rooftops than of the water. It was a nice room, but really nothing that special. It was average-sized and the bed was comfortable. The floor felt sticky- perhaps a combination of the wax on the floor and the humidity? There were no slippers provided and only a small area rug, so you had to wear your shoes at all times. The bathroom was on the smaller side and could use some good TLC. A sad, little wilted flower was in a bud vase when we checked in- probably about three days past its prime. It was still there when we checked out four days later. There was a small glass shelf over the sink, but there was really no room to place your toiletries, as it was filled with other things. Some hardware fell off the shelf on the first day. Although, I did not call housekeeping to fix it, it was still in the same place when we left. Perhaps, the most irritating thing was that the lip to the walk-in shower was not tall enough to keep the water inside (no tub). By the time you finished your shower, there was a large puddle on the floor outside of the shower. You had to keep the towels on the floor so that you didn't stand in water. Also, there was only a soap dish in the shower, so not a lot of room for shampoo/conditioner, etc... There is about an 18% "Resort Fee" added to the rooms. I think this is applied to the wine/cheese reception, wifi, and beach club. Since the hotel is not close to the water, you can go to the sister resort and use the beach there. However, unless you take a cab or rent a car, there is no way to get there. Since the beach club is something the hotel talks up, it would be a good idea for the hotel to help you get there. Perhaps a bus/mini-van with scheduled trips or even taxi vouchers? This would probably pay dividends in customer satisfaction, like the wine and cheese reception. The beach club is not really a value if it's going to cost you $50 round trip to get there. There is an honor bar on a separate floor that stayed pretty well-stocked and free coffee/tea. There are plenty of places to sit outside to enjoy the weather. A small plunge pool that was popular given that the hotel is not beach side. Three restaurants to choose from, depending on your appetite. This hotel is THE place for weddings in San Juan, with a wedding each night we stayed. It can probably get loud, but we were on a high floor so we did not really hear any noise from the activity. However, the first floor and lobby are always very busy. El Convento is also open to everyone- tourists, weddings, restaurants. I like the fact that you need to use your key to move between floors as it keeps out non-hotel patrons. The reason we didn't rate this hotel with three stars was because of the history of the property and their exceptional staff. All front desk staff and valets we encountered at this hotel was courteous, professional, and hospitable. It was evident they liked working there. The bartenders were exceptional!
