When we arrived to the hotel, our room was not ready, so we asked for recommendations to go to lunch as we wanted some authentic Puerto Rican food. They gave us several recommendations that were very good. ALL requests and questions were met with a smile and a 110% effort, which was very impressive. We would stay here again if we were to go to Old San Juan and we would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Even though I had a couple of issues with the room, there was no other hotel that I wanted to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 71GRR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very helpful. We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. It is right in the heart of old San Juan and is within walking distance of all major attractions. The hotel has a parking lot ($20 per day), but driving around old San Juan is no fun, so don't get the car if you don't need it! There is a small courtyard right outside the hotel that is great for relaxing after a long walk downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: sdb421
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at Hotel El Convento and we are so happy with our stay. Rooms are small, but gorgeous and well appointed. Staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful and provide fabulous recommendations for restaurants and activities. The wine and cheese reception is a great place to meet fellow guests and the free water bottles make walking the streets of Old San Juan manageable in the heat. Would not stay elsewhere in Puerto Rico, because El Convento is the best. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TrixieBelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the opposite end of the cruise ship ports. There is a beautiful view of the port of San Juan and it is right next to the San Juan Cathedral, where Ponce de Leon is entomed. Nice park-like square right below the hotel for picture taking or listening to a street musician play "Quanta la Mera." The hotel also has lots of well fed cats wandering around. Large air conditioned rooms with teak furniture and small balconies. The beds are "European" style, so they will be smaller in width than the American sized queen bed by a few inches. The hotel has a nightly reception with peanuts, cheese and crackers, some grapes, tea, coffee, and wine for free (sodas and hard liquor must be charged to your room.) There are fruit bats in the courtyard of the hotel that are fun to watch. The pool is almost bathtub warm and divine. It is small but beautiful. Nice jacuzzi, too. This is for the quiet, well-heeled crowd; it is not a "party" hotel. Easy walk to all historic sites, and very near the local Ben & Jerry's.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel El Convento”
Reviews.Author: danrodgerson
Reviews.Content: If any people simply run from the cruise ship to the hotel and don't spend anytime in San Juan you are missing so much. Very cool place, especially el convento hotel. Historic and beautiful. The reception was wonderful, the rooms amazing and the service was wonderful. Not sure I would pay the rack rate of $200 a night but find a deal and spend some time at El convento. Would have loved to stay but needed to come back to work. the complimentary wine and cheese reception coupled with the rooftop pool and balconys were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pab4007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before taking a cruise out of San Juan. This was one of the most unique hotels we have stayed in - beautiful, historic and serene. The staff was very friendly and accomodated us with no problem when we asked to switch to a bigger room (I booked a Twin Superior room which ended up being very small and having 2 single beds instead of 2 full or queen beds as I had expected). The wine and cheese reception in the evening was a great touch and made the stay even more special. The location was superb - right in the center of old San Juan. While this hotel is in the higher price range (higher than we usually stay at) we felt the price was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great second visit after great first visit!”
Reviews.Author: PaCricket
Reviews.Content: We had a second very nice stay this September at this beautiful hotel. When we were booked into a room that was not what I expected, we were immediately offered an alternate room and service was consistently very good. Complimentary wine & cheese nightly was very nice. Food at the hotel restaurants was good. Lovely, unexpected brief Flamenco show on Friday night at El Picoteo tapas restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento the first week in July and it surpassed my expectation. The manager, Osvaldo personally greeted us and made sure our needs were met. The rooms were lovely and kept very clean. The double doors insured that it was quiet. The entire atmosphere of the hotel was one of understated elegance. One of the best features of the hotel was their "happy hour" where they served various wines, fruit, cheeses and crackers. You could also get coffee all day if you wanted. It was really great. All in all, I had a wonderful time, loved the hotel and would go back there again in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Amy A
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the hotel iteself was beautiful, and daily wine/cheese happy hour was very enjoyable. However, the customer service when something went wrong was aweful. I arrived a few days after the hurricane, so the electricity was out. I'm a fairly easy going person so I didn't mind dealing with the flashlights and candles. What I didn't like was that on check in, they had told me that I would get about $40 compensation for the lack of electricity. Expedia would be credited the money, and expedia would credit me. I don't really care about the $40 since it's not really worth my time to be on the phone (especially on hold) with both the hotel and expedia. It's just the principle of the matter that if you promise something, it should be done. So when I checked in, they told me to call expedia about it, which I spent the first hour of my vacation doing. Weeks after my vacation I expected to see some kind of credit on my credit card statment, but when I didn't, I called expedia and the hotel. After a lot of back and forth between the two, and several hours on the phone, the hotel basically said that they weren't going to give me any compensation for that day because the electricity ended up coming back on around 10pm that night (regardless of the fact that the electricity was out for most of the day and night). Their explanation was that despite the fact that the electricity was out for the day and evening, since it came back on before midnight, that they wouldn't compensate me for that night. Let me tell you, it's very hard to get ready for dinner with only candles and flightlights. That brings me to another issue. I had called down and asked for flashlights and candles and someone told me they would be brought up. We left the hotel for a walk and expected them to be there when we got back an hour later. When they weren't still there, we called and asked again and we told that someone would bring them. Eventually, we had to go down ourselves and get them. I didn't complain about it at the time, but when I explained this to the manager on the phone weeks later, she was kind of rude and said that I needed to understand that everyone that night had to come down and get candles/flashlights. If that was the case, then I really wish they hadn't told me several times that they would be brought to my room. I would have been happy to go down and get them myself the first time I called about it. I don't like that the management seems to be ok with unfulfilled promises. I didn't need to go through the trouble of trying to get some kind of compensation if they weren't going to fulfill it anyway. To me, the wasted time on the phone wasn't worth the promise of $40. It's just about the principle.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Brandon M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent business trip to San Juan. The hotel is incredibly well located if you are working in the quaint, picturesque Old San Juan neighborhood. The hotel is visually stunning -- a former convent -- with a large open courtyard. Service is very friendly and includes a nightly turndown service with chocolates (nice touch). Powerful air conditioning (a necessity in San Juan), great views, a 6:00 pm wine reception, small pool, bar, restaurants, and a gorgeous terrace overlooking the neighborhood with a well-stocked "honor" bar round it out. Very convenient location (do not rent a car -- parking is tough in this area!).

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: Dre22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights post-cruise 8/21-8/23. The hotel is located in Old San Juan and is a 5 minute ride from the pier. When we arrived Ivan came out to the taxi and took our bags in. We arrived very early and waited until about 2pm until we got our room. We'll take the hit on that one. This is a popular hotel that stays full. We stayed in room 508 and found it to be very nice. The room was well maintained, stacked with towels, decent view, flat screen television, bathrobes w/slippers, etc. We were able to enjoy the managers reception, got some dinner at Pizza e Birra (great stuff!!) and went to bed. Then it happened.......... Irene hit in the middle of the night and the power went out. Very early in the morning I went down to the front desk and was advised the hotel was on generator power and hopefully the power would return by afternoon. The power didn't return during my stay. Without power there was no A/C and it was very humid. All of the restaurants were closed (they did serve breakfast at Patio del Nispero) and we had to go out for food. In my opinion the staff did the best that they could with what they had. We were issued flashlights and candles, allowed to charge our phones in the lobby, and the manager's reception was held. Upon returning home I contacted the hotel's General Manager, Efrian Rosa, regarding the loss of power and and my concerns. Mr. Rosa responded to my email in less than 24 hours and offered no excuses. He apologized and advised they were already looking into improving their generator. I appreciate the fact he didn't give excuses. My wife and I will definitely be returning to El Convento next year. For me, professionalism, cleanliness and honesty are the top things I look for in a hotel. El Convento has them all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: scampy57
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel. you can feel the history,!! would recommend the el convento to anyone ! rooms are spacious very clean. i stayed twice first time on the 5th floor. great view's. second time on the 3rd floor not so good view's. though still a good room. reception staff were lovely and friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: paula a
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to find reservations at this hotel in such short notice. The room although small, was furnished vintage. The grounds are are well groomed. We had breakfast at their restaurant and totally enjoyed it. The employees are courteous and helpful with directions. We will certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: HedoCouple
Reviews.Content: As the name implies this is an old Catholic convent transformed into a boutique hotel--and a very enjoyable atmosphere. It is located across the street from the San Juan Cathedral in the heart of Old San Juan. The guest rooms are very comfortable with all the expected amenities. Room maintenance and daily cleaning was excellent. The rooms line the outer walls of the hotel. In the center lies a beautiful covered courtyard with eateries, coffee shops and sitting areas. It offers an enjoyable respite from the noon day sun and heat; and provides a comfortable area to conduct informal meetings. Meals were good at expected costs. Many good shopping and eating locations as well as the Cathedral, old prison and other historic sites were within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sselhorst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend in August. Having brunch on Sunday, my boyfriend and I ran into a couple of locals that we had met the evening before. Apparently the wine and cheese reception on the roof is legendary....a nice touch. Regardless. It was a great location, and the restaurants located within are very, very good. Our stay was somewhat skewed by the fact that we were present for the onset of Irene and the power was out for the last day of our stay. We also didn't appreciate that the lower levels were closed due to a private event on the first night of our stay. All in all, nothing to rave about, but the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimmerWB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for our honeymoon and enjoyed our stay immensely! The staff was excellent and attentive in our needs. We reserved the "romance package" and needed to remind the staff about it. They were understandably distracted by the 4 day power outage from Hurricane Irene! They made up for it 5 fold and, once the power came back on, we fell in love with the hotel all over again! Old San Juan is a great place to stay and worth the price to stay within walking distance of the shops, the fort, and amazing restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service and First Class Folks, Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: NoelCam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided on our trip to PR this year that would stay somewhere "nice". We went with my two brother in laws and their wives. One of my sister in laws said they were going to stay at the Hotel El Convento, telling us the place was getting good reveiws. We look at the rate and decided "why not". We opted for the room with a view of the bay. We had to pay little more than what we had budgeted but decided we would do it anyway. Well, let me tell you what. We would do it again! When we arrived it was raining a little, so of course I went in first to see where we could put our bags. The guy in the lobby, very well dressed, George (I think?), asked me if I needed help. I asked him where we needed to put our bags. This is where the greatness of Hotel El Convento began for us. He immediately grabed a luggage carrier, followed me out the car and helped me the luggage, IN THE RAIN! We checked in and everything just went uphill, if it can, from there. First of all, they upgraded us to a suite, we checked in on a Tuesday so I'm sure they had it open. George took us to the room and showed us around. The suite was so nice it seemed unreal. Well, it didn't stop there. Everynight at 7:00 they had a wine and cheese spread on the third floor. Not just cubes of cheese and box wine, but good wines and great cheeses. They had a few hostess's up their as well that kept everything stocked and helped you with whatever you needed. I don't have the words to describe how Fantastic the Hotel El Convento was for us. VERY VERY clean, great rooms, great service, and just all around nice people. My wife and I are not rich folks by any strech of the imagnation and usually go for the more "budget" type hotels, but after our experience at El Convento, we will stay here every trip we make to Puerto Rico! Finally, I can't say it enough. The staff at the El Convento is First Class and they treat everyone First Class. So, if you're planning on going to PR and want to stay in Old San Juan, this is place to stay!! Thank you Hotel Elconvento for the memorable trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Cindy R
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of honeymooning in Old San Juan in January 2011. Hotel El Convento was absolutely perfect! The room was spacious and gorgeous. The courtyard was wonderful for sitting and chatting outside of our room. The place was clean and staff friendly. We were not too impressed with the bar/restaurant, but the patio served excellent breakfast. The terrace and pool offer breathtaking views. We were lucky to be alone at the pool/hot tub area most days. The terrace has a bar area for some treats (try the Medella, Caribbean beer), and this is also where the wine and cheese reception is hosted every night from 6pm to 7pm. We tried to never miss it. The offerings were great, the view spectacular, the staff cordial, and the other guests were quite friendly and interesting. The hotel is within walking distance to many major attractions in Old San Juan, as well as conveniences like Walgreens. And all the restaurants surrounding this area were wonderful. We felt safe wandering around at night or lingering in the plaza in front of the hotel. I would stay whenever we return to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home only much fancier”
Reviews.Author: tugdoug
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but they treat you like gold and it is clean and comfortable. Free wine and cheese from 6:00 to 7:00. it hard so believe it's 360 years old. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinlova
Reviews.Content: This renovated convent makes for a great hotel! I loved everything about it!! and it was right in town, so you can walk to wherever you need to go. I highly recommend this as your place to stay if ever you visit San Juan! :)

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm...perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Troy S
Reviews.Content: Wow...we only stayed one night here, but we instantly loved it. We got a REAL metal key for the room, we had a lovely room on the second floor overlooking the square and the church. If you like the old world feel of a historic building then you will love this place. The bathroom is a bit cramped, but that is easy forgiven. The interior courtyard is beautiful. We have breakfast at the courtyard restaurant and it was excellent. Loved the coffee! Definately coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Juan - gorgeous; staff is superb”
Reviews.Author: HemingwayGyro
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. It is a very well maintained historic former convent (500 years old). The staff is extremely helpful and the restaurants are very good. I cannot recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say, unless you want a big casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: If you follow any of my reviews, you know I look for smaller, less touristy, more locally interesting places, often though with an exercise facility. I scoured the San Juan hotels on the beaches and every other review of those places alternated with great and terrible. So those all raised one thought: inconsistent. Having been to San Juan before, I wanted to stay some place where Old San Juan was walking distance. And with my daughter, it had to have a small gym. El Convento came up over and over again, as having consistent charm, service, nice rooms, great location, and a small gym. Not on the beach but with a beach club that would allow you to access the beautiful San Juan beaches and large pools but go back to Old San Juan for the evening. It is all the great things people said about it. No loud "ugly Americans", or whatever loudmouths you look out for to avoid, as opposed to the big places. The hotel is impressive, beautiful, well cared for and comfortable. Rooms and beds are very nice and well maintained. Aveda products in the bathrooms. The third floor library with its water, coffee and tea always there, and the honor bar during most of the day and evening were terrific. The inner courtyard (the hotel is open air completely) has a 300 year old orange tree and the little tree frogs sing their coqui sound. The manager's happy hour was lovely. The little plunge pool and jacuzzi with lounges and umbrellas very relaxing and with a pretty good view. The three restaurants were quite good and for Old San Juan, not bad prices. We just loved it. Also used the refrigerator for the extra food from a couple of dinners and had cold food for lunches. Perfect. The tapas place was good, the main restaurant was good for breakfast and lunch (didn't have dinner in either) and the pizza and beer place was great for a small dinner after a bigger lunch (and the bartender befriended my 21 year old daughter and showed her around, being nothing more or less than a friendly local, nothing underhanded at all). In fact, everyone was just warm and friendly and nice. My daughter also found the bar down the street, El Batey, filled with locals, including her new friend, and really enjoyed that til all hours, right up from the hotel. A lot safer than the casino bars and discos. Old San Juan had a food and drink festival the weekend we were there so the streets were packed and the food and drink flowed. I liked it that most of the people participating seemed to be locals too as they spoke Spanish. Lots of locals in old San Juan, families during the day, showing the forts to their kids. They take a lot of pride in their city, and their country (I know it's officially the US but feels separate in many ways). El Convento was so convenient to walk all around Old San Juan and really explore it. There is valet parking though there is also a parking garage not too far away, but I used the valet parking. Turned out I didn't need a car really but we did use it to go to La Concha to use the beach, beautiful beach, great service but glad I wasn't staying there in the end. Only things I could wish for: the honor bar and hotel bar to stay open longer. Also know that Old San Juan closes down pretty early except on weekends, except a few bars. Over all, even with a few little things that could have been fixed, not worth mentioning, it was terrific. Marmalade and the Parrot Club both good too. Take pictures with the bird man if he's there, in the plaza Colon. Also note a lot of cats but all very healthy looking due to the cat sanctuary on the island. Very clean and friendly too, no fleas! There are some mosquitoes as expected but not too bad. It does get pretty humid but there is also a nice breeze quite often. If you are using gps: note that the street for El Convento IS in gps but it's not El Cristo, it's Santo Cristo and it's in Antigua San Juan (at least in my Garmin). It took forever to find that and I'm not sure how I did but occasional street signs do name the street calle de Santo Cristo, as often as calle de Cristo. The streets are TINY so I'd recommend a small car unless you know you need a 4 wheel drive. It will take you a while to get out and into town, so take your time. I will definitely go back there. Oh nice little gym by the way and no one there but me. Decent elliptical, two treadmills, a stair climber, bike, free weights and a little weight machine. Kept nice and cool. It was wonderful. But only if you don't want casino, beach right there or big pool, bar that stays open and disco. If you want quiet, culture and a taste of years gone by, I highly recommend it. Not for everyone, but definitely for me!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: spinardo
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels in the world, this is by far one of our favorites. A little on the pricey side but well worth it. The hotel itself, a former Carmelite nun convent, is beautifully restored. Old World charm at its finest. It sits right in the heart of Old San Juan, next door to the Catedral de San Juan, the second oldest Catholic athedral in the Americas. We attended a beautiful mass ( Spanish-speaking) here. The hotel staff is wonderful. They went out of their way to make our stay special. The courtyard bar and restaurant, in an open air setting, is simply beautiful. The food in the upstairs tapas restaurant was excellent. Best sangria we've ever tasted. Room was small but beautifully and tastefully decorated. This is a special place. Elegant, romantic ... you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Next time, comp the room....”
Reviews.Author: erik48
Reviews.Content: I say that because it's the only thing I can imagine that would have made our recent stay more enjoyable. My wife and I arrived at El Convento slightly disoriented after a three-hour flight, a long wait for baggage, picking up a rental car and getting hopelessly lost in Old San Juan (more about that in a couple of paragraphs), but were immediately greeted and warmly welcomed by the valet parking guys, bellman and front desk staff - all top-notch professionals. We were fortunate to receive a substantial upgrade in our accommodations but, really, it wouldn't have mattered. The entire property is comfortable and beautiful and provides a real sense of San Juan's long history. We especially liked the rooftop hot tub and plunge pool, and the terrace where complimentary coffee and water are available all day. (After leaving El Convento, we stayed in another luxury property where small bottles of water in the room were $6. That's just mean-spirited.) A complimentary wine and cheese happy hour is also offered daily. The hotel restaurants are first rate. El Convento is perfectly situated, convenient to historic sites, shops and restaurants, a small supermarket and a drug store which sells virtually everything. Don't miss the cathedral across the street. As for getting lost in Old San Juan, we strongly recommend it, whether you're driving or on foot. There's no part of the city that isn't beautiful. We're veteran travelers and relatively fearless, but it must be said that San Juan totally understands tourism, as evidenced by uniformed police officers on virtually every street corner. We couldn't have felt more secure. El Convento is highly recommended - for its character, charm, amenities, location and superior customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing paired with excellent”
Reviews.Author: AlfaRomeaa
Reviews.Content: The first room we had was absolutely awful. There was the sound of a generator buzzing all night long and we did not sleep at all well. The following day the manager moved us, but offered no apology. Our second room was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: AMS21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at three hotels while in Puerto Rico for 10 days. This is by far the best. It is a "10". It is in the heart of Old San Juan. You can walk everywhere, up and down the cobblestone streets. The food here is excellent and the staff are like your old friends. We had a suite for our family and we felt like we were in an apartment in Spain. They offer free internet and water. The third floor has a manager's reception each evening with wine and cheese. There is an "honor" bar available all day. You have about 100 choices of places to sit and relax in the breeze throughout the hotel. I felt like I was a home. The staff treats you very special and made sure we were happy throughout our stay. If you are used to 5 star accommodations, you need to say here! Also, there is valet parking!

Reviews.Title: “Allows you to relax in old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: drea05
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for four nights and really can't add much to what has already been said. We Had a late (read midnight) check in and they were waiting for our arrival. Checked into our room and it was great-clean, quiet, air conditioned. The staff was very helpful and you received two bottles of water in the fridge each day. Also the wine and cheese reception each night was a nice way to relax before heading out to dinner. We had breakfast one morning at the hotel. I would probably say this was the only part of the hotel the was underwhelming. We also had lunch one day at pizza and beer-yum!! Loved the rooftop terrace with pool and hot tub. I would probably not recommend this hotel to families or those who are looking to party. Perfect for exploring the city and for a relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: GraceinVirginia
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel El Convento in Old San Juan. We chose Puerto Rico for our family vacation this year and had a wonderful time. The hotel is wonderfully located in Old San Juan, there are boutiques, restaurants, street vendors, historic forts and museums right outside your door. The hotel is beautifully decorated, very clean and good hotel restaurants. If there was one thing that would be more helpful it would be to have the concierge give more accurate directions. They provide good choices for restaurants but give general directions, sometimes that makes it a little hard to find the place. But everyone was very friendly and super helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary hotel - a private courtyard setting in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ldm010
Reviews.Content: El Convento is probably the most historic hotel property in Puerto Rico. Original construction dates to the 1500s - indeed as a Convent - and as such is located across a narrow street from the San Juan Cathedral - the oldest church in the Western Hemisphere. The hotel - built on a hillside overlooking the Bay and the Governor's Mansion in the heart of Old San Juan - features rooms on 5 floors - all opening to balcony corridors overlooking the interior courtyard. This is NOT a luxury chain hotel (thank goodness) - nothing cookie cutter here -the rooms are delightful - and typical of Puerto Rican decor. No hint of franchise "formulas" for so called luxury here. The hotel staff is extraordinary and professional and not afraid to be themselves. The front desk will handle all your hotel and concierge needs. Start your day with complimentary coffee - rich Puerto Rican coffee - on the 3rd floor terrace or enjoy a wonderful breakfast in the patio courtyard with classical cello music to lull you awake. (this is the land of Pablo Casals, after all). As the sun sets in the evening - the hotel becomes a magical place - beginning with the Manager's complimentary wine tasting on a patio overlooking the cathedral and a small park. This is the real thing - a place to slow down and relax. To listen to the sounds of the street beyond - the music of the nightlife around you - to music drifting up from the courtyard or restaurants below - and of the sounds of the night - coqui, wild parrots - - take note of the 2 calico cats that wander the hotel - after all - its clearly THEIR hotel - we are just travelers passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: SweetBalto
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is an exceptional hotel with outstanding service in old San Juan! We arrived to San Juan 10 hours late due to airline disasters. I mentioned I was sad to miss the FREE wine and cheese happy hour due to our cancelled flight, and without hesitation the employee gave us vouchers for free sangria at the bar. Now that is customer service! The rooms and decor are awesome. You really feel like you are in old Spain. The restaurants on site are fabulous, and the concierge can also point you to other San Juan favorites. There is a great roof top pool and jacuzzi with a view! Our second night we made it to the wine and cheese happy our. FABULOUS! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattyOregon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, plus it has a handy parking lot. If you are planning on staying in Old San Juan only and not venturing out of the walls, I would not recommend renting a car. Old San Juan is made up of tiny cobble stone streets and can be very congested. All the employees of this hotel are excellent, rooms are charming, and the 24 hr coffee and tea was nice to have around. There are small refrigerators in each room which was nice. The roof top pool was beautiful, but very small. We had 4 kids in our group and it made me on edge if other adult guests were in the pool, as children splash and are noisy. All in all it was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: havetolovethebeach
Reviews.Content: Just spent a wonderful week relaxing at Hotel El Convento. The tranquility and ambiance made it a perfect location for exploring Old San Juan. The room was large, well appointed but welcoming.The hotel staff were gracious, friendly and helpful. We had breakfast a few mornings at the hotel and my personal favorite had to be the crepes. We also tried the tapa restaurant upstairs which had good food and fairly priced for the area. The pizza & beer section of the hotel was different but the beer selection was vast. Each evening there was a cheese & wine tasting on the 3rd floor with a great selection of both. During our stay there were two wedding held downstairs but one would not know there was anything happening as the quietness in our room was exceptional. The plunge pool on the fourth floor was a welcome relief in the evening from the heat of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Patrick56062
Reviews.Content: Awesome all the way. great tapas bar, great location, beautiful hotel, and terrific staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Susan28970
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The hotel is a perfect location and has wonderful accommodations. We also took advantage of going to their sister hotel in Condado for the use of their pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: framgal41574
Reviews.Content: My hubsand and I and our son stayed 5 nights and the hotel was beautiful. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. Our room was super with 2 double beds and a great view of the plaza and church next door. The location was right in heart of old san juan We stayed in July and it rains every day, but the showers are over quickly. Weather was hot and humid, we took advantage of the plunge pool on the roof, a welcome cool off. If you want to see old san juan, than this is the hotel for you to stay, you will not be disappointed. love love it!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ravi01
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Old San Juan we had the opportunity to stay at El Convento Hotel. It is located in the heart of Old San Juan with easy access to historic sites as well as shopping and fine eateries. When we arrived we were greeted by the front desk and a bell boy who quickly took our bags and marked them. We arrived early so our room was not yet ready. We strolled down Cristo Street to Fortaleza Street. There we found a lot of activity with mostly tourist shops and places to eat. When we returned to the hotel our room was ready. The staff promptly brought our luggage to our room and reminded us about the wine and cheese hour hosted by the hotel. We joined other guests in the lounge on the third floor to partake in wine, cheese, and crackers. This was an excellent way to connect with other quests as well as sit outside and enjoy the sunset over Old San Juan. We enjoyed eating at the restaurants El Picoteo, and Pizza y birra. Pizza y Birra was no regular pizzeria, they have a very friendly staff, excellent pizza, bread sticks, and salads in addition to a wide selection of beer. Though there are hotels with bigger pools, private beaches, and fancier restaurants, few match up to the level of service, quality, and personality of this historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TarahC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first night of our honeymoon. The address was not in our GPS, and the very nice man on staff patiently gave us directions to the property at 2 am! They upgraded our room since it was our honeymoon, and it was just gorgeous. The courtyard in the middle of the hotel was beautiful. We heard great things about the nightly reception, but unfortunately we were unable to be there during that time. The location was great as well, we were able to walk to all kinds of neat attractions. Would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel El Convento was Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: SParris11216
Reviews.Content: By choosing Hotel El Convento, I got exactly what I wanted which was a quaint boutique hotel located in the heart of Old San Juan, with the 'old world authenticity', yet modern conveniences which would be comforting and that's exactly what I got!! The hotel was a convent and the architects managed to transform the convent into a modernized hotel while holding onto many of the original structures and feel. The hotel was clean, well maintained, it felt safe and it had just the right amount of hustle and bustle while still being quiet. Annette from the front desk, was always armed with a smile. She helped me get the Bioluminescent Kayak Tour which I found impossible to book while at home, gave me perfect directions and delicious restaurant recommendations. On my last morning at the hotel I was taking pictures and without hesitation, Ivan saw me and offered to take pictures of me and for me. I met the general manager Efraim, who took the time to listen to my comments about the staff and the hotel and seemed interested in how my stay was. Hotel El Convento gets 5 stars from me not only because of the room accommodations, the amenities and the quality of food at the restaurants, but because of the genuineness of the staff!! I'd definitely stay at Hotel El Convento again when I return to Old San Juan without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Historic”
Reviews.Author: PrayingMother
Reviews.Content: I am a professional who is slightly past middle-age. My husband and I stayed for 2 days in June prior to a cruise. We arrived later in the evening after a long flight. My husband had to stand outside in the dark by the curb with our luggage while the hotel located a porter to assist us. There was nowhere for our driver to park so he had to unload our luggage and wish us well. Once the porter was there, he was charming and eager to inform us of the different facilities and amenities available to us. The lady at the front desk was pleasant and helpful. You could not ask for a better location. Shops, restaurants museums, and Walgreen's are within walking distance. A Catholic cathedral is across the street. Their beautiful sung- mass on Sunday morning could be heard on the street. The hotel faces a pretty grassy area which had very good street entertainers both nights. The hotel is simply lovely. The rooms surround an open courtyard with charming tables and chairs on the large balconies that serve as the halls in front of the rooms. The room and bathroom were small but adequate, as I would expect in a boutique hotel. They were spotlessly clean. The room was furnished in Spanish antiques/reproductions. They supplied a cold empty (yea) refrigerator and safe. There was a glass airlock door inside the room which made it possible to keep it at a comfortable temperature in spite of being such a old building. (Thank you!) As advertised they have a plunge pool. Think of it a "cool" hot tub, which is excellent for the warm climate, instead of a swimming pool. The best amenity was the honor bar in a pleasant room attached to a room with internet-connected computers/printers and an outdoor space. It was nice to be able to access liquor, wines, beer, and soft drinks without going through room service or one of the restaurants. We were out of the hotel during the Manager's Reception, but they had a beautiful setting. We dined on tapas and enjoyed flamenco dancers in the tapas bar attached to the hotel on the first night. It was so nice after traveling all day to have good food and entertainment without having to go out. We ordered breakfast from room service. The charge was comparable to that of a 4 or 5 star hotel. The service was excellent. I was surprised at the quality of the food, though. It was not up to par with what I would expect of this hotel. I was impressed by the security of the hotel. Being open to restaurants downstairs, it was nice that you needed your key to access the elevator to the rooms and pool. I wish I could have given this hotel 5 stars because of its location, service, amenities, and appearance. However, I do have two warnings for future travelers. On the first morning we went down to wait for our limo driver. He was not the one from the previous evening so we did not know what he looked like. There were men inside the hotel's entrance who confused and harassed us about their identities and the competence of the company we had hired. I was shocked the hotel would allow this behavior in the entrance hall in full view of the desk. My other concern was I paid well over 900 dollars for 2 nights in a queen vista room. The vista consisted of a view of dirty unappealing rooftops, a partial view of the bay and the industrial area across the bay. I questioned whether the bed was a queen; it felt much more like a double. I would stay at this hotel again but only for a significantly lower rate, and I would definitely skip the "vista" view.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises”
Reviews.Author: tedacuen
Reviews.Content: No bad surprises with this hotel. The building is just beautiful, location is great unless you are looking for beach hotel. Service was helpful, and rooms were nothing fancy but good. On the other side, the swimming pool is too small, but I guess Loved the free cheese & wine at the nice terrace everyday at 6pm Overall, a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, delightful staff, awesome wine and cheese”
Reviews.Author: twostrawsyrah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth EVERY penny. It is in the best part of San Juan: the old town. And it's right in the middle of it so you can walk everywhere you want to go. Tons of great food within walking distance. The staff is kind and accomodating. The rrom was fantastic. Not huge, but very nicely decorated, very comfortable bed, beautiful view, elegant marble bathroom with nice shower. It's just really delightful. And the wine and cheese reception every evening at 6pm is to die for. After a day running around adventuring in Puerto Rico, you come back, take a shower, and go have some wine and cheese before walking to a great dinner later. It's perfect. You have to go. And I promise you, you WILL love it. and you'll want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful! You have to stay in this historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JulietteMarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a month at El Convento, the only "Small Luxury Hotel" in Puerto Rico, a few years ago. This is a wonderful hotel, building & area, full of history, energy & charm. Be ready to walk to streets of Old San Juan, taste its delicious food & enjoy the music all around you. Our room was a standard one with a view to a side street, but we did not care, it was beautiful anyway! The rooftop pool is small, but again, you need to be ready for it when you stay in a 350+ old building, although the view is breathtaking. The Daily Manager's reception was always entertaining & relaxing with a variety of wines and cheeses. The gym was always available & had the usual free weights, treadmill, etc - we did not use it once, but rather walked around the city for exercise. Bring your walking shoes & an umbrella for afternoon showers and/or hide from the sun!

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel- did not live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: veganista
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews for this hotel I was genuinely excited to stay here. Unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. First the pros: - Location is great if you want to spend time on Old San Juan. - The fact that this is an old convent is really cool. - The staff is very friendly and helpful. Next the cons: - As mentioned above, the fact that this is such an old building and an old convent is really neat and part of the reason I chose this hotel, but you have to continue to remind yourself of this during your stay. I felt as though they did not highlight the history of the building enough. - The gates at every floor- if you leave your key with your husband by accident ... forget it! There are gates at EVERY floor to unlock. I know it is for security, but it seemed more of an inconvenience than anything. - The terrace patio was a nice thought, but they missed the mark- there is no view what-so-ever of this beautiful city from anywhere on the property. If you want a convenient hotel- clean and comfortable, this is the place for you. It is truly the only place worth staying in Old San Juan. But keep your expectations in check- it is an average hotel with average accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave the property it was so unique and intimate”
Reviews.Author: Arizonagirl56
Reviews.Content: The ambience of this 350 year old small boutiquey hotel was simply wonderful. This hotel was originally a convent for Nun's, then it turned into a brothel, at one time it was event owned by the Woolworths company. A very interesting history indeed. But the Spanish archeticture, old world rooms, courtyard and Tapas bar upstairs was really inviting . The food was DELICIOUS! in the courtyard they served the best latte's and the Tapa's bar had a buzz of it's own, a wonderful array of food and spirits with gorgeous waiters to wait on you. The hotel offers complimentary wine and cheese in the evening..... an absolutely wonderful selection of both, there is nothing average about this hotel and their accomodations. The people at the front desk couldn't have been more gracious and accomodating. Lovely atmosphere in every way. There is a tiny pool on the roof, there is a nice view of the city as well as the ability to hear the singing mass ( on Sunday's) at the histoically old Catholic church which is located right next to the hotel. I don't think that the location could be any better....a lovely well appointment hotel filled with history, beauty, and charm. However don't expect any grand veiws from your room. All the warmth and ambience lives within the courtyard and restaurant. I would return to old San Juan just to stay at this hotel. We were treated like VIP's. Shopping, that is good shopping, is just a stones throw from the hotel, the church across the street and the old Fort is just a couple of blocks up the street. This is a MUST experience if you travel to San Juan, Puerto Rico, even if it's just for a meal, eat in the courtyard. Fabulous food and service and hospitality in every way. Oh and on Friday nights there is Flamenco music and dancing just across the walkway from the hotel. Enjoy! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Fralfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for 3 nights in May and we were thoroughly pleased!! The hotel was beautiful, our room was spacious and well appointed and the staff were very pleasant. The hotel is built around a courtyard so once you walk out of your room, you feel like you are in a tropical garden although you are still indoors. We had tapas at El Picateo and Pizza at Pizza e Birra. Both were very good. The location was close to all of the sites and shopping (Coach Outlet is on the corner). Don't believe what you have read on other sites, San Juan is very, very safe. If I am to visit San Juan again, I will go back to El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: selenac9
Reviews.Content: Room was fantastic, jacuzzi was great. Staff was friendly & helpful. Everything was wonderful. We loved Old San Juan & would definitely stay again. The complimentary wine reception is definitely worth it. Great wines & great cheeses! Only con: pool was really small. but other than that, its a WONDERFUL place for couples & families alike!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, except for the party below my room (Still going on at 2:00 AM)”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy083
Reviews.Content: The food and staff within this facility seem very nice. I am extremely unhappy with the party in the pizza joint directly below my room. The walls are vibrating and there is no excape. I contacted the front desk at 8:00 PM asking about the frequency of the event and when it would end. I was told the party was going to end at 12:00 AM, but I am still writing this now (2:00 AM). I am not certain if I am going to remain within this hotel for the remainder of my trip, but no other rooms are available in this hotel this evening.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: las0311
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed at ths hotel for one night. Not long enough! It was truly amazing. We called from another locaation in PR for a last minute reservation. We were given a wonderful room with a view of the Cathedral and Piazza. The room was furnished beautifully. The staff was Superior. They also let us use their sister property La Concha for some beach time. That hotel was really great as well. Love the ambiance at both properties. Just perfect! No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel...”
Reviews.Author: edirun99
Reviews.Content: We decided on El Convento for honeymoon and loved every minute of our stay. The service is absolutely fantastic and I really enjoyed speaking personally with the general manager at one of the nightly wine receptions, a must-do. The rooms are cleans and simple, but allow you to relish in their deep history dating back hundreds of years. The staffs welcoming and we enjoyed getting to know many over the course of our trip. The guests staying at El Convento are well aware of the rich history surrounding them and relish in the Nispero tree in the courtyard. My husband and I will surely be back for a second trip and thank all the staff whom have made this trip an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Wonderful Memories”
Reviews.Author: bobbiec29
Reviews.Content: Retired couple. Saved for this vacation and were not disappointed. Hotel El Convento is within easy walking distance of all of the tourist attractions. There are lots of wonderful restaurant choices nearby from inexpensive to upscale. Many quaint bars. We arrived later in the evening and enjoyed food and drinks at the tapas bar in the hotel. The beautiful outdoor courtyard has nice bar and dining as well. The evening wine and cheese reception we looked forward to for a pleasant, relaxing time. Although the hotel doesn't offer concierge service the front desk personnel handled all of our requests graciously and efficiently, from where to eat breakfast closeby to making dinner reservations for us. We enjoyed walking in old San Juan to shops, toured the Governor's Mansion, and visited the forts. Hotel El Convento has much beauty, charm, reflecting the historical setting of the old San Juan area. Our room was very clean with lovely furnishings. Fifth floor location with a pretty view of the harbor from two large picture windows. Near the pool patio but we didn't find that fact to be obtrusive in any way. Restaurants we tried in the area and would recommend are Bombonera for breakfast. Jibarito is great place for Puerto Rican food. Many locals there. Service is good but don't go if you're in a hurry. Carly's for a special dinner and soft jazz entertainment in the evening. Friendly and accomodating bartender. Already planning a trip back to San Juan and will most definitely return to the Hotel El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in Old San Juan - Charming!!”
Reviews.Author: djsdirect
Reviews.Content: We spent our last 2 days in Old San Juan walking around town and seeing as much as we could. We stayed at the Hotel El Convento. We also visited El Morro and San Cristobal forts in Old San Juan on our last day of the vacation. El Convento is the coolest place to stay in Old San Juan with the roof top pool and an awesome view of the old church across the street. It has a bar 5 steps out the side entrance where the bar doesn't close until 7am. My wife and I do a lot of Caribbean travels and welcome any questions on our facebook page. We also stayed at the Rio Mar and Gran/Sol Melia outside San Juan. Find us on facebook to check out some great photos and videos. You can friend me at Jeremy Gearries or join our travel fun page at Destinations Direct.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful placest”
Reviews.Author: pana14
Reviews.Content: El Convento wao nice place on Old San Juan beautiful Hotel Gardens excellent service very close to the airport and to the Cruise port. The had wine and cheese complementary was a nice touch. Highly recomend this place. The food was fantastic and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: wyowinds
Reviews.Content: When you step into Hotel El Convento you are stepping back in time. Elegant, relaxed and a perfect location in Old Town San Juan. Old San Juan is a safe area and there is so much sightseeing to do in walking distance of the hotel--history is all around you. I definitely felt spoiled and pampered at El Convento. Upscale Happy Hour overlooking the plaza with fine wines and cheeses has a relaxed atmosphere. The food is great and the Mojitos even better. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more professional. It is pricey, but a great splurge. This is my second visit and I hope to stay there again. *$$ tip--remember that when you make reservations and are given a figure that around $50 in tax hasn't been added yet*

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, beautiful rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sntx
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I sit outside in the gorgeous courtyard @ el convento. Everything during our stay has been perfect. We are travelling with our 18 month old son and the entire staff, especially Raymond, has been so accommodating of all our special requests! We love that the location isn't in an overly tourist-y area and that most of the restaurants we went to had us rubbing elbows with locals. Will come back to san Juan because of el convento!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location, friendly staff...we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: windvalley
Reviews.Content: My mom and I returned from San Juan yesterday after a 4 night stay at the El Convento Hotel. What a gorgeous hotel with wonderful staff (very friendly, and helpful), excellent location and beautiful and well-appointed rooms, with really comfortable beds. The hotel itself just exudes history, and what a fabulous location to be in OSJ. Everything is in walk-distance (except a true beach) and the wine/cheese reception every evening was a very nice and classy touch at a classy hotel. They have complementary bottled water also (this was a great perk for my mom and I because we are used to drinking several liters of water a day). 2 computers for guests' use and free wifi. This hotel had it all. Dont go expecting a beach resort though, and the pool on the rooftop is very small. We ate at all 3 restaurants and found them to be pricey (except for Pizza e Birra, which was very reasonable and good value) and to have exceptional service. I would have given this hotel 5/5 if it were not for the 2 weddings that occurred on the property over the weekend (Saturday and Sunday nights). The guests were outside late into the night on Sunday, and as our room was on the first floor (101) facing the street and the front of the hotel, we could hear the noise from outside as I guess they went into town for an after-party. We also found that Saturday a few of the guests were staying in the room next to ours, and were going in and out of their room every half an hour or so (perhaps to have some drinks or whatnot, dont see why you'd go in and out of your room otherwise), which I found really annoying and it made it difficult to sleep. I think the hotel should enforce quietness better when they have wedding parties on the property that go on til all hours of the night. That was my only complaint, but it was relatively minor. The second 2 nights were very peaceful and quiet, as there were no more weddings!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and close to everything in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: chachi07
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel. Although the rooms and bathrooms are small and need some touching up, the atmosphere, location and evening wine reception are great! The hotel is whithin walking distance of all the attractions in Old San Juan and you don't need a car. The mojitos at the tapas restaurant were great too! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernie_Valdez
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The rooms are spotless and the bathrooms were notably above good expectations. The food at the available on site restaurants is amazing. Starting your evening at the wine social is a must! Do not miss it. The small pool on the third floor has an excellent view. It is perfect for catching rays and cooling off. You are smack in the middle of Old San Juan which makes everything walkable.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: jimmysim
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, service beyond expectations. Very accommodating staff. The daily wine tasting was in very good taste and an excellent way to meet the staff and other guests. The location was excellent as it allowed you to walk to any place you desired in Old San Juan. a Beautiful courtyard. The pool was not large enough to swim but was good to jump in to cool off.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST place to stay in San Juan!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinspiration
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed 2 nights for our wedding anniversary at this beautiful, historic hotel. We had wanted to stay there for many years, especially as this was our 1st trip to Puerto Rico before going on a Royal Caribbean cruise (highly recommend also!!). Not really anything new I can add, but to just to chime in that the service, cleanliness, and old world charm was incredible! No doubt the best location - no taxi's needed. In my opinion, would stay in old san juan vs. other nearby areas due to amazing historic sites. We also visited other hotels in the area and The El Convento definitely seemed the best! We were suprisingly upgraded to a queen vista room for our anniversary (booked 4 months in advance) and stayed on the 5th floor which was so peaceful. Checking in/out was a breeze and we were there on a weekend they were sold out. We also recommend the tapas restaurant for dinner and on Friday nights 2 ladies do a short Flamenco show - nice to have entertainment while eating. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - absolutely no complaints!!! Also, recommend Legends of Puerto Rico walking tour - see this site for review.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a friendly city, with amazing staff, and located within walking distance of everything in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: NiNi97
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this beautiful historic hotel with modern amenities in May 2011. It's a 20 minute cab ride from the airport which costs $19 plus $1 for each piece of luggage. Upon arrival, our rooms were upgraded from twin superior to double deluxe for free. Check in wasn't available until 3pm but the front desk was gracious enough to allow us to change in one of the bathrooms and store our luggage. They gave us a map of the city and we went out to eat and picked up toiletries at the Walgreens nearby. They even called me on my cell phone when our rooms were ready. The room was beyond my expectations- it had a veranda with a city view, was appointed with a 32-inch LCD TV, mini fridge with complimentary water, and had 1.5 bathrooms made of marble. The hotel has a beautiful, quaint terrace on the 3rd floor with a complimentary assortment of wine and cheese every night from 6 to 7 pm. Its a great place to snack, relax, and meet some of the other guests. Every night, for turndown service, housekeeping placed chocolates on our pillows and turned on classical music in the room....it felt so welcoming and relaxing. The hotel is in the heart of the city, within walking distance of El Morro and San Cristobal forts and up the street from La Fortaleza. There are numerous great restaurants in the area. I definitely recommend Cafe Mallorca on San Francisco for breakfast, La Bombonera and Cafe el Punto for lunch. I also highly suggest hiring a guide and going to see El Yunque national forest. Its about an hour drive but the trails and waterfalls there are a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, comfortable, quaint and cozy!!”
Reviews.Author: evandam
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is very elegant, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the pillows were great. Service is beyond compare, we had such nice friendly people who helped us, turn down service, great wine and cheese and cracker reception each evening. The location was great, very close to all the shopping ad the historic district of Old San Juan. We ate at ll of the restaurants and the food was great. The tapas was espcially good and they make a great Mojito! We traveled with two other couples and we are all from different backgrounds and everyone enjoyed their stay. If I make it back to Puerto Rico I will definately stay there again. PS We were there during Easter Weekend and were departing on Sunday, the front desk made a point of telling us that traffic due to religious processions would be bad so they made arrangements for us to go to the Marriott on the Beach for the morning and afternoon until our flights left so we would not get trapped in old town and so we would not have to sit at the airport ! again great Hotel!~!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: fearfax123
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in the heart of Old San Juan. My husband and I come to Puerto Rico once a year so we decided to stay at this hotel because we toured it 2010. It sort of reminded us of the French Quarter in N.O. We loved the breakfast in the courtyard and to be able to walk to the shopping area, the historic sites, as well to the fabulous restaurants in the old city. If you travel to P.R. make sure to stay in this enchanting little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagekelbi
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here! Loved the decor and how it was so close to shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Muy Encantado... Beautiful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PackLightly
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at El Convento and once again I was more than happy with the service, the comfort, the convenient location. The hotel is stunningly beautiful. Yes, the rooms are older and filled with beautiful carved wood furniture, window treatments, and the gorgeous unique tile floors which can not be reproduced with modern plain square tiles. This is a place for people who appreciate the details and beauty around every corner. The courtyard gardens are stunning. When we arrived to check in, we were completely disheveled after a long day traveling back from Culebra during the Easter holiday chaos. The front desk staff must have taken pity upon us and quickly gave us great advice about restaurants (eat dinner BEFORE 9pm- most kitchens are closed by 10pm), breakfast in the morning (eat at the hotel's patio courtyard...). We had a wonderful room on the top floor overlooking the city and the harbor in the distance. I loved the new double doors in the foyer to each hotel room. The enclosure helps eliminate noise from the hallway and interior courtyard and also hold the air conditioned cool air inside. A few hints: Driving in Old San Juan and especially parking can be difficult. Avoid arriving and leaving during prime traffic hours... the streets are narrow and jammed and can be steep with cobblestones with limited parallel spaces. There is a parking lot at the cathedral across the street for hotel guests for $20/ night... which is very easy and convenient. Plan to explore Old San Juan in the morning and evening to avoid the heat. Wear comfortable walking shoes for the cobblestones and ancient pathways surrounding the city walls and forts. Avoid the cruise ship areas by the port when the ships are at dock. It is much better to stay away from the crowds and eat at the wonderful hidden bars along San Sebastien Street.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: bostonbeachnut
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Old San Juan for the last two nights of our vacation in Puerto Rico. After reading so many glowing reviews about this property, I had extremely high expectations. My expectations were not only met, they were exceeded. From other reviewers, you will be familiar with the incredible location, the charm, the quaint well-appointed rooms, etc. While the hotel offers all of these things, what makes El Convento a standout, in my opinion, was the service. The front desk is staffed with friendly, knowledgable and efficient employees who helped us navigate various restaurant choices, entertainment options etc. Literally each and every staff member that we encountered was courteous, friendly and helpful. We travelled with our 3 children aged 15, 10 and 8, and although I'll admit that this is not necessarily a "child-friendly" property per se, the staff seemed to enjoy interacting with the children, teaching them phrases in spanish, the bartender handing out lollipops etc. Although I know almost all reviewers have mentioned the wine reception held each evening, I would like to reiterate that it is fantastic, with a pleasing assortment of spanish wines and cheese (my children have become fans of Manchego cheese). My husband appreciated the coffee/tea service set which was always available, and appreciated. It is the small details that make this hotel a standout. It is my hope that we can return to this hotel (perhaps without my children this time) as it would be a wonderful place to enjoy a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Old time charm and quiet luxury in the heart of old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: marjorieseaweed
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is a small, gem of a hotel in the center of the walled city of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. The hotel is a beautifully restored convent. There are 5 floors with open hallways that look down to a beautiful open courtyard with a 360 year old fruit tree (native to PR, forgot the name) in the center. The shade of the tree and the open hallways provide a cool and quiet escape after a day of visiting the forts, museums, shops and beautiful side streets of the cobblestoned city. Service is excellent. There are several restaurants to choose from. Every evening at 6:00 pm there is a complimentary wine and cheese "happy hour" for guests. You meet in the library and can look down on the courtyard or go to the open patio which looks out to San Juan harbor and the church and park across the street. A small terrace with a cool plunge pool is another wonderful extra for this "in-town" hotel. Well worth the trip to Old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peachtree10
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento in San Juan is a beautiful and restful hotel. Although the building is very old, the entire property has been carefully redone to ensure a quiet and comfortable visit. The plunge pool is very small but beautiful and the view from the top floor where the pool and jacuzzi are located is fantastic. Each evening there is a reception for guests with wine and cheese. It's a great chance to meet other guests and to relax for a bit on the terrace overlooking the sea. The wines are all Spanish. The hotel rooms are comfortable. We were on the top floor which I recommend because there is a wonderful breeze (there is a large inner courtyard in the hotel). We recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great old world atmosphere in old san juan.”
Reviews.Author: 2bridges
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived to the time we left everyone was very accomadating, the clerks at the front desk could not have been nicer, the bellboys were very attentive. If I had to give one downside to this review it is that the room and bathroom were small but then again it was a re-modeled convent. When going back to san juan we would most defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service does not match price.”
Reviews.Author: lmg67
Reviews.Content: Although the location is great, and the hotel is lovely, we were disappointed in the sevvice We paid more than $400 per night for a room, and did not expect to have to wait for 90 minutes before the luggage was sent to our room. We finally gave up and went out in the too heavy clothes in which we had traveled. And the staff at the front desk seemed indifferent to the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: st8grad9699
Reviews.Content: The service, the room, and the location are exquisite. The rooms are very well appointed and spacious. We stayed on a Monday and Tuesday night, so the rate was a bit lower, as the hotel is a bit pricey, but it is line with other luxury boutique hotels, so don't stay if price is a concern. The food in all of the restaurants was wonderful as well. My wife and I loved our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the regular price”
Reviews.Author: PiscesM1975
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for about $100 a night and we were very excited once we found it was Hotel El Convento, since it looked very nice inside [courtyard] and had a great central location. We booked 3 rooms, but once we arrived around 11am, we were not allowed into our rooms until way after 4:30pm. The rooms were kind of outdated for the amount of stars this hotel shows. The Porter, Carlos, offered us many places to go out to eat and walk around to, but the front desk girls didn't seem as friendly as the porters. The nightly free wine and cheese was a nice touch, but the swimming pool and jacuzzi seemed outdated. The Gym was good. Personally, I wouldn't mind staying there again for under $80-$140 a night, but anything else more than that I'll look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel at Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend stayed at â€œEl Conventoâ€� last September. I personally work in the Hotel Industry, and I have to give them a super A plus in service & hospitality. Once you get to the parking lot you feel so welcomed! This is our Favorite Hotel!! We canâ€™t wait to come back!! Keep up the great work!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, wonderful people, amenities, and location.”
Reviews.Author: Bullpaper
Reviews.Content: Perched in old San Juan, El Convento is big on charm. It is distinguished as a one of the best small luxury hotels and lives up to its reputation. The hotel is gorgeous, with a classic desk with key boxes and staff who get to know you, your interests, and your style. Each evening the hotel serves a wine and cheese, complementary, while one watches the sunset from the pool deck or one of the many open patios. After eating dinner in one of old San Juan's many restaurants, we would come back to the hotel's third floor patio, partake of the complentary coffee that is always ready, and listen to the music that fills the park opposite the hotel. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, beautiful and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RhonJon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel El Convento for 2 nights while enjoying our anniversary. This is a beautiful hotel with a lovely staff. We stayed in a small one bedroom suite which was tucked away in a quiet corner. We were surprised on the first evening to return from dinner to find rose petals sprinkled all over the room and shaped in a heart on our bed. Complimentary champagne was also waiting. A great surprise to help us celebrate our anniversary. The location is perfect for exploring Old San Juan. We were able to walk to all of the shops, restaurants, and attractions. We tried 2 of the hotel restaurants while there. We ate at the courtyard restaurant for lunch, and just found it ok. A little slow with not many choices on the menu. But our favorite was enjoying drinks and tapas one afternoon at the other restaurant. We would return here in a hearbeat and would highly recommend El Convento to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento is the place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: infoontrips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Convento for two days before we took a cruise out of San Juan. First of all, the property is very attractive and seems like a real historical building, until you find out that it's actually a modern property...! Regardless, we loved the location - you can walk everywhere in Old San Juan. The trolleys run very infrequently and are often full, so it's easier to walk. The room at El Convento are very small - that's the only negative that I have. Bathrooms are nice - the service is wonderful at the hotel -especially the front desk staff. The restaurants are all great and Pizza & Birra is a great place for a late night snack. The pool on the roof is truly a plunge pool - but made for a refreshing dip in the afternoon. We travelled to La Concha - their sister hotel on the beach (make sure you bring the letter of referral so you can get beach towels) and it was loud, busy but fun. The beach has a lot of seaweed - not the greatest swimming - but the location was upbeat. We loved San Juan - everyone we met was incredibly friendly - we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service, El Convento saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer145
Reviews.Content: After a truly disheartening night at The Gallery Inn, we checked into El Convento in hopes of a small, quiet and comfortable room. What we got was a gorgeous, beautifully appointed room, for an unbelievably reasonable price. We also enjoyed a complimentary wine service that evening, and invaluable tips from the friendly and knowledgable staff about places to see and restaurants to try. The room alone would have made our stay here a wonderful experience, but the added amenities, and incredible graciousness of the staff just made it so much better. This is truly a gem of a hotel, and I would recommend it unreservdly to anyone visiting Old San Juan. We are truly grateful to the manager and staff at El Convento for saving our vacation. If you are going to San Juan, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Character and Charm!!”
Reviews.Author: AmySyracuseNY
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel...traveled to PR with two of my sisters for a vacation. The rooms were charming and comfortable..nice flat screen tv and BOSE stereo but we never even turned them on.... the maid service was excellent. Anytime we needed anything ~ all we had to was ask ~ personnel so friendly especially Ivan...pool, jacuzzi and garden terraces all lovely. Another plus, the complimentary wine and cheese reception nightly, the restaurants were also very good. We ate at all three!! I don't think I could have complained about anything in this hotel. Very pleasant. I would definitely return in a NY minute!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet historic hotel in great location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a historic building in Old San Juan. Even though the building is very old, the mechanicals (e.g., cooling and plumbing) were very modern and worked well. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the showers had decent pressure and hot water, the people who worked there were helpful and friendly, and the location was great. Housekeeping didn't show up too early in the morning and we always had plenty of towels. They also replenished the type of coffee that I was using which is something that doesn't always happen. The room rate included free wifi. After staying here for 5 nights, I didn't see another hotel in Old San Juan that I wished I had stayed in instead. The complimentary wine and cheese reception was very nice with good cheese, crackers, grapes, and wine. They also had free coffee and bottled water available 24 hours if you wanted to get a mallorca or other pastry and bring it back to the hotel for breakfast. The main negative is Picoteo, the tapas bar, had very weak mojitos and was very overpriced. We ended up spending about $80 for the weak mojitos, some chorizo and olives, 5 shrimp, and 4 croquettes. If you walk down hill from the hotel and turn left at the first street there is a Walgreen's and grocery store. If you continue down Calle de San Francisco there are several small restaurants where locals eat. We found that the best meals we ate were from the least expensive places in Old San Juan (empanadas from Mate, Fefo's deli, Cafe de Mallorca, and Punto de Vista). A cab to La Concha in Condado was $15 each way. La Concha is sleek and modern and noisy....the opposite of El Convento. The beach there is nice but small.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveyoga123
Reviews.Content: Returned for yet another stay at this charming hotel. The location can't be beat. It is right in the middle of Old San Juan. The service is great, and personable. The food is phenemonel. I eat lunch everyday at the beautiful courtyard patio. Dinner can be a little pricey, but breakfasts and lunches are a must. Our room was overlooking the original San Juan square. My only complaint would be that it was a little small. Last year a reserved a Suite which was much larger. All in all, great hotel. Hope to be returning soon

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: baggagecarrier
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights in this lovely old hotel. Located in Old San Juan it was converted from a Carmelite Convent founded in 1646. The public spaces are filled with Spanish Colonial art. An open hallway on each floor overlooks a courtyard filled with tropical vegetation. The area serves as a restaurant - a delight for our breakfast of fresh fruit and Spanish-style pastries. On the opposite side of the courtyard is a famous tapas bar which extends to an outdoor dining area on the street side for pizza and salads. The rooms are done in Spanish Colonial style complemented with a Bose radio set to classical music, high speed internet access, and luxurious bedding. Our room looked out over a narrow street where every building was embellished with lush plants and flowers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: DrChuck59
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Puerto Rico, we were advised by friends from PR to book this hotel. Their advice was "perfecto!" Stunning and immaculately maintained with 5 star service. (Ok, the bell hop neglected to get our rollaway, but the rest of the staff more than made up for this feau pax. Thus 4.8 stars) IMPORTANT TIP: Do not try to check in Sunday afternoon through early Monday morning, because this hotel is just 2-3 blocks from the "festival" area which is absolutely choked with traffic and many of the 1.5-car wide roads are closed or impassable. During this party period, parking regulations and driving laws are pretty much suspended. "Don't hit the other guy" is the only driving law during festival. If you get caught in the traffic circle, expect 2 to 3 hours to get back out (a distance of 1.5 miles). LOCAL INSIDER ADVICE: El Convento has the best "mohito" on the island! Even if you don't stay at the hotel, you must pop in to the courtyard bar for their amazing bartending skill. BEST BREAKFAST "SECRET": Make a point to have a leisurely breakfast in this quaint courtyard setting. The crepes were to die for, and if THIS isn't an indicator: These were the best pancakes I've tried anywhere in 6 countries! (My son convinced this skeptic.)
