WHAT TO SEE: The Fort is just 3 blocks away. Plan 2 to 3 hours to truly appreciate the amazing engineering applied in the 1800s to this Spanish-built fort. WHAT WE LIKED BEST: The BEDS! "Heavenly beds", Tempurapedic, etc. designers need to stay here for a clinic on what makes a perfect sleeping platform.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel !”
Reviews.Author: TheHakes
Reviews.Content: Great location for old San Juan especially forts. (free open trolley bus). Staff at hotel very friendly and helpful. Great happy hour for guests from 6 to7 every night,sampling wines and lovely cheeses. Would definitely stay again and I'm telling my friends. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay (in a good way)!!!”
Reviews.Author: mauikit
Reviews.Content: I spent another quite milestone in this hotel (my first time in PR) and as soon as I walked in my spacious bedroom, I was greeted by a bottle of wine to help celebrate my birthday. What a wonderful surprise! So far, so good. However, the blaring music downstairs and across the street went on until close to 1am, which made it impossible for me to sleep despite having a couple of glasses of that wonderful wine! I requested a room change and without any questions asked, moved me to a room in the back where I can catch some Z's. My surprise when I was moved to the Vanderbilt Suite! an expansive and gorgeous room! I ended up staying in for the night and enjoying my suite. It was such a great experience. The staff was amazing!! thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Historical, relaxing, convenietly located and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: songbird47
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave me the feeling I was looking for in Old San Juan. As the whole city is rich in history, so is this wonderful hotel. When arriving at the hotel, the staff was extremely helpful. There is a sweetness about the people in this area of the island. We did much walking but also used the trolley free of charge. We inquired at the front desk if they knew of any private person who would be willing to do a self designed tour for us. James was referred to us and he was the absolute best. We told him what we were interested in and he designed a private tour for us at a reasonable price, he also added a few things! I thought I had lost my camera on our full day of adventure! Nope, James found it in his van and and brought it to me at the hotel. Ask the front desk about James for a private tour! Don't miss the rainforest, fort and market in San Juan. The park close to the hotel has entertainment some nights and area families are out and about walking and enjoying life! The hotel was beyond expectations if you like older and history! It made me feel like I stepped back in time as the rich generous wood that adorned the halls (which are open air) are everywhere. The courtyard is so nice and sitting there was a favorite of ours. Just sitting around at night listening to the tiny frogs. The wine and cheese is really a nice touch in the evening and the pool area is great. We ate at the pizza restaurant there very late one night and their pizza was excellent and nicely priced for San Juan. We enjoyed St. Germaines Restaurant down the street for salads and healthy beverages. The Old Harbor Restaurant down by the ocean is a nice walk and has great lobster and calamari. We titled our trip "The Best of Both Worlds" our choice was of course, El Convento (4 nights), the old world and Caribe Hilton (4 nights) on the ocean the new world! Great choices! As the island we found is pricey to visit, I would reccommend you be aware of this and knowing this you will go and have a great time. If you are looking for a bang for your buck you will miss much, but choose another destination.

Reviews.Title: “The most charming hotel and service, I wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: travelbug257
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had the most wonderful stay at El Convento. The staff was excellent and a facility filled with history yet accompanied by all the updated amenities one could imagine. I have never felt so cared for away from home. In the heart of Old San Juan you can spend your day touring or just relaxing. We booked one day after our cruise out of San Juan....next time my entire vacation may be at El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Katsandcards_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Convento our first 3 days in PR for our 20th wedding anniversary. Wonderful old world charm hotel. Within walking distance of everything - shops, ferries, forts, dining, etc. The nightly free wine & cheese gathering was an awesome appetizer before we headed out for dinner. The open courtyard was constantly relaxing (bats flying around a large tree at nite - kinda cool - no worries, they mind their own business). The hotel also offers free coffee, tea and fruit in the morning, a late night honor bar, and all day bottles of water (nice touch). Kinda pricey - but one of the nicest large boutique style hotels we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “This is the most amazing hotel i have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: imeisel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a 17th century convent on a quiet square in San Juan. It was a little out of my price range and i would go back in a second. The architecture is breathtaking (it is arranged around a tree-strewn central courtyard) and there is something to discover around ever corner (there is a lovely outdoors space for breakfast, and it was not until I'd been there more than once that I noticed the stairs leading up to the roof). The rooms are lovely; beautiful furniture with a floor-to-ceiling window with double door. I ate at one of the restaurants once and couldn't not go back-it was elegant but not at all pretentious and the food was the same quality as that in super fancy New York restaurants that charge double. The staff was attentive but laid back. The only surprise I had was how necessary a car was for Puerto Rico-we drove around the whole island, but even getting to places in San Juan itself (the hotel is in the old city) a car was necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferB22
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel. The first time I was with my mother and we agreed this was our favorite hotel by far...we are seasoned travelers. The rooms are elegant and the service is normally wonderful. The location cannot be beat. I came back six months later with my boyfriend...we are both in our late 20's. The receptionist eventually let us check in at 3:30. 30 minutes after the check in time and informed us that we could not have our requested king bed. When you're spending $300+/night you should ABSOLUTELY get the bed you request. The hotel is spectacular otherwise but the front desk needs a lesson in customer service and tact.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Springtraveler06
Reviews.Content: We've visited San Juan many times and stopped for a drink at El Convento. This was our first stay and we can't wait to return. Entering the courtyard is always a delight. Having just spent 4 days at Rio Mar, where the emphasis is on usurious prices for every beverage and edible item, it was a delightful surprise to find complimentary water bottles, a delightful wine and cheese reception, and the honor bar. The rooms are marvelous, the staff genuinely eager to please, the location ideal, and the warm ambiance make this a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, needs professional concierge, extras add up$”
Reviews.Author: sagvig
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel. Rooms were smallish, but comfortable and well appointed â€“ pretty marble bath, nice furniture. We were on the fourth floor and had a view overlooking San Juan harbor (and some rooftops). A soundproof door to block out the sounds of the restaurants on the lower floors is a nice touch. The rooftop â€“ with plunge pool, heated whirlpool, lounge chairs and umbrellas, was a wonderful place to read and relax. Beautiful open-air courtyard and arcades. The daily 6 pm wine and cheese hour on the veranda overlooking the churge and park is also a nice touch. I would stay here again, but I have the following observations: 1. A hotel of this caliber should have a full time, professional concierge. The young women behind the desk were all very nice, but somewhat inexperienced. One botched a reservation we had made for a tour; no problem, we just rescheduled it for the next day, but it wouldâ€™ve been a shame if it had been our last day. 2. At this price point, the hotel should bundle breakfast in with the room rate (although we did enjoy going to La Bombonara most mornings), and/or offer a more economical means of using their â€œbeach clubâ€� (privileges to use the beach, pool, etc. at La Concha in the Condado, and Marriott Courtyard in Isla Verde). Public bus was an option, but seemed like a major schlep. So we ended up taking taxis, at $35-$45 RT, w/tip. With so many other guests using this privilege, why not offer a shuttle service (either free or at much lower cost)? 3. El Convento should reconsider the drivers and tour companies they use. On the day our tour was messed up, it was nearly impossible to get a rental car, so we decided suck it up and hire a driver (@$50/hour) to go to Guavate (a town in the Cordillera Central that is known for its roast suckling pig, aka lechon), and also hoping to see some mountain vistas we had read about in Frommers and elsewhere. We were given a very affable young fellow, but he drove a really beat up old taxi (with tinted windows, not great for sightseeing). The place he took us to in Guavate had wonderful Lechon, but other than that, he didnâ€™t really know where to take us and wasnâ€™t much of a guide. The next day we went on our tour. There was only one other couple going, so the tour company decided to hire an independent driver. The driver was clearly knowledgeable and drove a relatively new Lincoln Navigator (this was the type of driver and car we had hoped to get for $50/hr on the previous day). Unfortunately the tour felt rushed and both we and the other couple felt that it was not worth the money. Also, when we booked the tour, we were told by the hotel that we could pay by credit card. The driver told us that it would be very difficult to pay by credit card since he was not directly affiliated with the company. He pretty much insisted on cash and actually drove us to an ATM. He also said that cash would be best since he would not have to pay taxes!!!! We found this not only unethical but also ironic since he praised the taxpayer funded National Forest Service, the Civilian Conservation Core, and other Federal services that allowed the establishment and maintenance of El Yunque. 4. The management should look into the reviews of El Picoteo; again, a hotel this nice and at this price point, should offer a better dining experience in their tapas restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Serene/Old World/Prestigious/Top of the Line- Treat Yourselves!!”
Reviews.Author: taggyodulla
Reviews.Content: El Convento is located on a lovely tree-lined square. After entering the main door, you're back in time to a more elegant era. But, what a surprise to find the prettiest up to date bedrooms/bathrooms/huge flat top TV & terry cloth robes awaiting you.. They have a fantastic patio/library area, where they serve a free wine and cheese buffet from 6-7, and up a few winding steps is a pretty pool with/lounge chairs & umbrellas overlooking the best views of the harbor. There is also a (4) story internal patio/garden in the middle of the hotel, the rooms are wrapped around it, so the smells of the flowers and trees waft into the halls. The general manager comes to the wine & cheese buffet to meet the guests (how charming & old world is that?). Treat yourself, don't miss this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sujenjo
Reviews.Content: Our friends, my wife and I moved to the El Convento for three nights after having spent three nights in the Gallery Inn,while unique and bizarre and good for stories, had certain drawbacks such as noise, mustiness,and a tiny bath with limited water. The El Convento was elegant, comfortable, good location and well worth the small additional cost (about $60. per day) Our room on the third floor was next to the Honors Lounge with a full bar,coffee and water all day and complimentary wine, beer and snacks every evening. It opened to the porch off the the Honors Lounge and was roomy, with a terrific shower, and had a walkin closet with microwave, refrigerator. The staff ,from Carlos the bellman to the front desk, was friendly and helpful. Our only drawback was that we had to call for housekeeping to clean our room at 4:00 p.m. twice although our friends who had to wait until almost 6:00 to check in, had their room cleaned early each day. "Apparently they are understaffed. Neverless, we would recommend El Convento as the place to stay in Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “A magical and romantic hotel in the heart of D San Juan”
Reviews.Author: globerunnerTO
Reviews.Content: After having spent the last two nights at this beautiful hotel we did not want leave. The atmosphere and service was exemplary. The setting was perfect, just what you look for in an independent hotel. Every staff member went out of their way to smile and be helpful. The rooms were simple and lovely, the pool deck had a spectacular view. Loved the wine and cheese reception on the balcony watching the sunset. Will definitely be back, Highly recommend this special place.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible view!”
Reviews.Author: harrodsfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Great location for outlet shopping. Liked the wine and cheese reception. Nice ambiance for restaurants. Room linens and bed good. Room ok but a bit cold. Didn't service our room until we called at 430 pm. No supposedly 5 star hotel should have a view like ours did! The worst we have ever had anywhere !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in OSJ if You Can Stomach the Cost”
Reviews.Author: TomGR
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for 3 nights in late January before staying in Isla Verde for 5 nights. Iâ€™m so glad we stayed a few nights right in Old San Juan! We really loved El Convento. The location is just awesome and, hands down, is the place to stay in Old San Juan. The hotel is beautifully restored and basically everything is within walking distance; at the most, 5 or 6 blocks. Service was great and everyone was helpful and friendly. Having coffee in the morning on the roof top patio overlooking the square and the street was a great way to start the day and we looked forward to the wine & cheese reception every evening. We visited both El Morro and Cristobal which are â€œmust seesâ€�. Very impressive. Our only real negative was the cost. All of San Juan is expensive but, for around $500 a night, we were expecting our room to be a little larger (we were in a Deluxe room; I canâ€™t imagine how small the regular rooms are) or at least have a continental breakfast included. That being said, we would absolutely stay here again. We saw a few other small hotels here but they didnâ€™t come close to El Convento which is probably why they can get away with what they charge. We would probably opt for a suite next time just to have some more space and probably a better view. If you can afford it or if you happen to come across a sale of some kind, stay here. Keep in mind that Old San Juan is not the place for huge resorts and obviously nothing is on a beach. Condado or Isla Verde are the places to go for that. I highly recommend staying in a couple of different areas in the city; the experiences are totally different.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ggdanisavage
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. The layout is absolutely lovely. Quite serene. Surrounding area is very old world, and nice for a bit of shopping. On property restaurants are quite good. Breakfast/brunch....excellent. The coffee is amazing..you will want to take some home. Best of all.....the staff. This is an amazing staff..not stiff, simply gracious, helpful and exuding positive energy.

Reviews.Title: “The way it should be done!”
Reviews.Author: markboo404
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently and have high expectations. The energy from the staff and the beauty of the property combined for a very memorable stay. I always use the front desk as a resource and they were flawless in thier assistance (with smiles and true passion for what they do). The onsite restaurants were fantastic and once again the staff's excellent service and positive attitude made us feel more than a customer but more of a guest in their home. I want to thank everyone there for such a great time. The building date backs to the 1600's so don't expect ultra-clean, ultra-chic and modern. Enjoy the beautiful building with its flow of air and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet stay in top-notch historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbrigham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Convento the night before our cruise. (Book early; it's hard to get a room here!) The property is lovely. It is a former convent whose rooms are much larger now than they likely were when nuns stayed here. The hotel wraps around a 5-story courtyard with giant orange trees and other foliage sheltering the open-air restaurant. I booked a standard queen room, but we were upgraded to the 'Bridal Suite' which was HUGE and had a balcony. There is a very small pool on the roof and tables and chairs on a large third-floor balcony overlooking the town, where complimentary wine and cheeses are served in the evenings. Bottled water is available free of charge at any time. A small library area includes two computers with very fast, free internet. I was a little worried that it would be noisy in the room, since the surrounding traffic is heavy on a Sunday, but once we closed the doors on the balcony it was dead quiet and we slept really well. I have stayed in the Condado area of San Juan and much prefer being in Old San Juan. We had read that crime is up in San Juan, but everywhere we went there was a large but friendly police presence and we felt very safe. El Morro is within walking distance of the hotel, and should not be missed. El Convento is also adjacent to the Cathedral which is well worth a visit. The lovely old buildings in Old San Juan are getting major renovations and the old city looks much 'younger' than she did when I was here 10 years ago. El Convento is a member of the Leading Small Hotels of the World and is very classy with friendly service. Unbeatable atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “El Convento--A World-Class Small Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beebot
Reviews.Content: Unless "bigger is better" is your mantra, El Convento is THE place to stay in Old San Juan. As its name suggests, it was a 17th century convent, which has been lavishly converted to a luxury hotel without losing its charm and grandeur. The rooms are nice, but it's the many common/sitting areas with their beautiful patio and ocean views that are most impressive. The staff is also top-notch, and all English-speaking. We spent three days in Old San Juan (didn't visit anywhere else in PR on this trip), and were able to walk everywhere in town from this central location.. It has no beach, but it does offer a plunge pool, a hot tub, and other hospitality features that guests can enjoy at any hour of the day or night. A lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the El Convento”
Reviews.Author: Berdi_11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. Beautiful rooms in a peaceful environment. Love the attentive service. There are many places to sit and relax. Excellent breakfast. Just loved this Hotel and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to San Juan, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: murphytravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. We stayed for an extended weekend, our first trip to Puerto Rico, and it couldn't have been more perfect. When we booked, we paid to upgrade our room one level to get a better view and it was more than worth it. Our room over looked the patio at El Picoteo and had a view of Calle Cristo and the San Juan Cathedral. On Friday Nights, there are flamenco dancers who perform on the patio and we could watch from our room - very fun. We ate lunch at the Tapas restaurant and it was very good - the red sangria was delicious as were the chorizo el diablo (if you like spicy food). We did not try the pizza restaurant but we did eat a few breakfasts in the 1st floor restaurant. The breakfast was good but a little pricey and the food seemed to take a long time each day (La Bombonera was not a far walk and was well worth it - I think I'd say try going there, at least once, instead). If you do eat in the hotel - get the banana nut pancakes. Our room was bigger than I anticipated and the bathroom was a good size too. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful - the turn down service was so sweet and romantic, it made it feel like a second honeymoon. We were also within walking distance of all the sights we had wanted to see on this short trip so the location couldn't be better for people visiting San Juan (it might not be as convenient for people going on a cruise). There were two wedding receptions while we were there and at first I was nervous about the late night noise/congestion but the staff was amazing and the hotel surprisingly well insulated against noise given it's age :) If you've read this whole thing, then we think you should just go ahead and book it, you won't be sorry :) We know we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and tastefully remodeled old convent that has a romantic touch.”
Reviews.Author: Stargazer111
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in El Convento seven times. We've enjoyed the location as you can step outside and walk around old San Juan anytime you like. There is a free tram not too far away which stops in ten locations. You don't get good views but the rooms re comfortable and have nice decors. The staff are very friendly and ever ready to help. I didn't like the hotel tariff that was added to our bill. When enquired they said that it was to pay the maids etc. I would assume that all hotels would include that in their bills.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Elegance”
Reviews.Author: itchintogetaway
Reviews.Content: 2nd time to stay at the El Convento. We think the value is wonderful. We love to take advantage of the free wine and cheese bar in the evening at the El Convento. We always meet the nicest people there! The rooms are nice & clean and we love the outdoor hallways. On this last stay we were in the Vanderbilt Suite - WOW! It was bigger than my 1st apartment! Love the bathroom! Of course we like Old Town and the history and I like to shop. I always go to the Linen Store every time to pick up a table runner or an embroidered towel. I also love to go to the jewelry shops. My Husband loves the forts and walking around the outside of the walls by the water. The El Convento is located perfectly to do what we like.

Reviews.Title: “Finally stayed at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Juan, either for vacation or business. We have always admired this hotel and wondered what it would feel like to stay in such an establishment. But, it's not by the beach, so had not booked there until now: we stayed at the Convento for a few days on our way to..a week of a pure beach vacation elsewhere. What a treat! Great service, great room, small but very fun pool with an outstanding view of old san juan and its colonial architecture. Walking distance to everything in old san juan. Excellent if costly breakfast. The happy hour: I must say that after all the hoopla online, I was a bit underwhelmed perhaps because it was so crowded. But the food/drinks offerings were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: JoJo60745
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento for 3 nights with my husband. We loved the hotel. The customer service is exceptional. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in a city and a building that was a former convent. The hotel is clean and the rooftop dipping pool and jacuzzi are a bonus! We would definitely stay at El Convento again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Way to wind up our Puerto Rican vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ehight
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge on Hotel El Convento for the last two nights of oue week long trip driving across Puerto Rico, and we could not have been more pleased that we did! The servce from the moment we arrived up until the moment we checked out was five star and the daily wine a cheese reception was delicious and relaxing. Now that I have stayed here, it is hard to imagine a future trip to Old San Juan that didn't include a stay at Hotel El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “WORST EXPERIECE EVER FOR 2000$ A NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: anthi2
Reviews.Content: 2000 $ a night suite with dusty furniture only water in the mini bar no room service at all no help with luggage upon arrival no proper bed arrangements as guarandeed while booking no welcome kit(water fruits etc) so common place in all presidential suites a non shown representative booked by the hotel for tours left us at the pier alone i felt like complete idiot spending 2000 $ and after my email explaing all that to the hotel manager the answer was that the responsibles were either on maternity leave or on vacation

Reviews.Title: “One of the Caribbeans best”
Reviews.Author: Phillylad
Reviews.Content: After several trips here, still excellent. The amenities are exceptional, and well-managed: besides the great location in the middle of Old San Juan, this is resort where one can hang out and do little. Nice plunge and jacuzzi pools on a roof-top terrace, with lots of sunny spots and (a few) shady ones. Very nice wine & cheese hour, in a separate lounge area (indoor/outdoors). Rooms vary as to their view; price does not assure much of a view: best to call and ask what your French balcony will overlook (some rooms don't have attractive views). Inner hallways and the courtyard are inviting and romantic. The second floor bar is very attractive. The courtyard, first floor, outdoor restaurant has somehow become less focused and less attractive (but food is very good). Because of its role in San Juan, this special place is often filled with special events, which can add to noise and make first floor hard to navigate sometimes -- and impact on whether there is room in bar or restaurant. The location is excellent for site-seeing, strolling, eating outside nearby, shopping, and people-watching. Good as a base for a visit, or a place to just chill! Worth a look whenever nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Highs & Lows”
Reviews.Author: annie35805
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that I agree with "Service Let Down". We stayed 2 nights pre-cruise. When we arrived, the desk clerk acted like he could not find our reservation. I had booked on line directly through El Convento, as the rates were much cheaper than through Celebrity. Another young lady working the desk finally helped us, and off we went to our room. Nothing too spectacular about the room itself, but we really did enjoy it's location, on the 3rd floor, right off the terrace. (302 ). We didn't have a window in the room, but our door literally opened to the terrace, which was empty most of the time, so we felt like we had it all to ourselves. There is coffee & tea available all day long out there, as well as the cheese & wine hour. The one thing that really bothered me was the shower. My husband was the first to go in, and there was no hot water. (my husband said it was an easy fix, ( the diffuser, or something). So he called the desk, but since it was @ 10pm, we said that we could wait til morning. It took several more calls down to the front desk the next morning til someone finally fixed it. So, I didn't get a shower for awhile. At the price point that you pay for a room, I find it a bit odd. Still, the hotel is charming, the location can not be beat, and we will definitely go again, and try to stay in the same room. Old San Juan is very safe, even at night. The governor lives @ 1 block away, and there are police (uniformed & plain clothes) everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Service Let-Down”
Reviews.Author: Ingle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights post-cruise at El Convento on Jan 3 and 4. We chose El Convento due to its location, the description on its website, its status as a member of â€œSmall Luxury Hotels of the Worldâ€�, and reviews on TA. All of these factors, including the nightly rate, created expectations of a wonderful end to our vacation. Most were met or exceeded; those around service were not. The hotelâ€™s location in the heart of Old San Juan was unparalleled. The building preserved its unique character as a former convent, and the beauty of the public rooms was readily apparent. The dÃ©cor, furnishings, and warmth of the interior was lovely. The wine reception was a welcome offering, and the pool, small but attractive. The rooms (we were in a queen deluxe room, city view, #314) were perfectly charming. There was some mold in the caulking of the bathtub, some mosquito squash marks, and two dead cockroaches, but nothing to cause much concern. The bed linens and bed itself were deliciously comfortable, although on the small size. Note, it is a European queen bed, not as wide as American queens, but again, this did not cause concern. The flat screen TV, the small refrigerator with complimentary bottled water, bath products (Aveda), reading lamps, room safe, black-out shutters, large desk, and most of all, the separate door into the bedroom from the hallway (to insulate from noise) were excellent features, all as one would expect of a hotel in the category of â€œSmall Luxury Hotels of the Worldâ€�. Where the hotel disappointed was in the service attitude and behavior of some staff. It was especially disheartening as this is the one thing - unlike the building, noise or location - a hotel has complete control over â€“ how its staff treat guests. Often the right words were spoken but not backed up by any perceived sincerity or action. A couple examples: we had asked for early check-in when we made our reservation, repeated in a separate email 11 days before arrival. On our arrival before 10 am, we were greeted on reception by Chamil. She would not tell us which room was ours (â€œthe rooms are not assignedâ€�) so we could not keep an eye on its status, but had our bags stored (as is customary in every hotel) and asked for our cell number so she could call the moment our room was ready. After waiting in the hotel for two hours (â€œno, your room is not ready, we have your cell and will call you right away when it isâ€� â€“ not sure how she knew this as the rooms were â€œnot assignedâ€�), we left to sightsee in our rather warm travel clothes. Finally, we returned to the hotel at 3 pm having now waited for 5 hours, and discovered our room was ready. We had been killing time, waiting for the call that never came. No apology or acknowledgment that she had not called us was forthcoming. We then asked to see a couple rooms in our category (queen deluxe), but were shown a room on the 2nd floor that was clearly in a lower category (no louvered windows with Juliet balcony) and our assigned room. We chose our room, and waited for our bags from storage. We sat in the room and did more waiting and waiting. Finally we went down to retrieve the bags ourselves. Instead of an apology which was not only called for but simple and would immediately have been accepted, Ivanâ€™s condescending response to us was that we were in Puerto Rico and why were we uptight, we should just chill out and â€œjust relaxâ€�! We were speechless. The room was air conditioned, but although the thermostat has settings up to 76Â°, no heat is available, resulting in a quest for a blanket. After 4 calm requests, we finally received the blanket. Unlike Raymond, Nathan did have the grace to apologize sincerely, and it was sincerely accepted. El Conventoâ€™s website states that it â€œhas set new standards of luxury, comfort and serviceâ€�. Although it is a lovely hotel in an exceptional location, and its rooms are comfortable, compared with other hotels we have stayed in in the â€œluxuryâ€� category it does not measure up let alone set a â€œnew standardâ€�. We are pleasant, respectful and courteous guests, and we felt that none of our service issues were of sufficient magnitude to warrant calling a manager, but we remain disappointed that on the little issues where some staff could easily have chosen to take the high road and uphold the service standards the hotel promises and the image it promotes, they fell down. Given the nightly rate ($376 inc taxes), delightful staff (Nathan, Neisha, Angel) did not quite compensate for the failings of the others. Without these negative experiences we would have loved El Convento and would be singing its praises. But despite its obvious advantages and charms, we will look on our next visit to stay elsewhere in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pricey authentic hotel but cleanliness needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Malihousa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on Christmas day 12/25/2010. The bell man's service was excellent. The price for a double bed with street garden view was around US$480.00 on that day. With that price we were surprised to find out that the cups were dirty with debris in it. It was originally a convent in old days. The best part of it is its location. Just across street from the San Juan Cathedral and town square. The spa on 4th floor was good but the swimming pool is too tiny. You can't swim at all. The inconvenience about this hotel is you have use the room key to take elevator or get into the hotel room area. And they only offer two keys per room. If you have more than two then you have to always go together to get access back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Night in SJ after our cruise”
Reviews.Author: Folmoir
Reviews.Content: Rather than flying right out after our cruise ship docked, we added an extra night in San Juan to enjoy the Old City as well. Hotel El Convento is located in the heart of Old San Juan, about half way between the cruise terminal and El Morro. Taxi's are available, but it's not too bad a walk if you don't have too much luggage. (The taxi's will also not be too interested in you since they could otherwise get a fare out to the airport.) El Convento offers historical interest, location, romantic setting, decent views depending on which floor. There are several great local dining options nearby. We spent our day walking the Old City and never felt the need for a car. The front dest had our taxi the next morning and we were off. There are less expensive hotels off the docks, but they'll be the same room as any from that chain anywhere in the world. This place was a convent in the 1600's, so that certainly adds a level to the cool-factor.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding New Years Holiday”
Reviews.Author: CEMiko
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent December 26th trough New Years day at the El Convento. Our stay with the El Convento completed the second half of our trip to Puerto Rico for the holidays, and was by far the most enjoyable part of our trip. The El Convento has a very warm rustic feel, that is complimented by an outstanding staff. I just cant say enough about how helpful each and every individual associated with this hotel was. True small hotel luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my, where do I start?”
Reviews.Author: OrrvilleRedRider
Reviews.Content: My wife, 13 year old son and I spent three fairly unhappy nights at the El Convento in San Juan in late December, 2010. I do not recommend the hotel. I chose the property because I wanted a first class hotel located in historic Old San Juan, and because I had memories of glowing reviews of the property from many years ago. Boy, were those reviews outdated. We stayed in the Pablo Casals Suite, with a very large living room separated by a door from a large bedroom. The hotelâ€™s charge for the suite was $920 a night. The suite is located over the entrance to the conventâ€™s chapel, and so is separated from the main body of the conventâ€™s cloisters. Since the door does not open to the central courtyard, it is insulated from any noise generated by the restaurant located in that courtyard. Unfortunately, the door opens to a fairly dimly lit stairway, making the entrance to the room somewhat unappealing. The living room had a desk and chair and then a sitting area with 2 armchairs and a sleeper sofa. The bedroom had a king sized bed, with a separate sofa. There was a single bath, with one sink and a tub/shower combo. Lighting in the living room was generally decent (although it did suffer from a â€œpart fluorescent, part incandescent lighting problem â€“ an unseemly mix of white and yellow light), although the sitting area was not adequately lit (only one lamp â€“ they need a second floor lamp to adequately light that area). The bedroom was well lit. The towels, linens and bedding were of good quality. The master king bed was comfortable, but the sofa bed was one of the poorest our son has experienced. He reported he was tempted to sleep on the floor. There were separate air conditioner controls in each room. The air conditioners worked well â€“ albeit the bedroom thermostat seemed to require a setting of about 65 degrees to actually get the bedroom to 70 degrees. So, what went wrong? Three things, mainly. First, the room was in dire need of refurbishment. The pictures (showing wear and tear on a lampshade, the gaps in the front window, wall markings and stains and ceiling water damage) demonstrate just a fraction of the wear and tear evident everywhere in the room. In addition to the flaws evident from the pictures, there were additional wall markings where the walls had been damaged, on the desk lamp, the solder holding the shade to the lamp had broken on one side (which is why the lampshade is askew in the picture), the curtains (lacking, in the bedroom, any pulls to assist in closing them) had been partially separated from the curtain rings, and, even when closed, the bedroom balcony doors let in the street noise from outside due to inadequate sealing. The room had a musty, mildewy smell (I had hoped it would go away during our stay, but it did not). The robe hook in the bathroom had separated from its mounting (all thatâ€™s needed is an Allen wrench, for heavenâ€™s sake), such that it could be turned 360 degrees (thus rendering it useless as a hook) Second, lack of adequate cleaning. There was a golf ball sized wad of black electrical tape on the stairs to the entrance to our room (poorly lit, as noted above) upon arrival. That stayed on the stairs throughout the stay. Consistent with the remains of the tape, those stairs had clearly not been vacuumed in some time. In the bathroom, on the floor at our arrival was a fingernail sized piece of orange peel (how could housekeeping miss something that bright?). The glass end table on my side of the bed had a series of water stains from the drinking glasses of the prior guest (yuck!). All these made me terrified of what else I would find if I looked closer, so I stopped looking. Third, significant service failures. There were no washcloths in the room on arrival. We called down, and three were delivered to the room. The next day, housekeeping (i) took two of the three washcloths, leaving one used washcloth and (ii) provided no new washcloths and (iii) left one dirty towel. As we left for dinner, I interrupted the desk clerkâ€™s personal call (she was gracious enough to ask her friend to wait while she attended to us) to ask for 3 washcloths. When we returned from dinner â€“ no washcloths. So, my wife called down again to ask for washcloths. Seventy minutes later â€“ no washcloths. At that point, I took advantage of the personal cell phone numbers of the hotelâ€™s management which had been given us at check in, and called the General Services Manager at home to ask for our washcloths. She was appropriately appalled, and apologized (and offered appropriate accommodation). Our washcloths showed up within ten minutes. But the damage had already been done. Alas, the next day housekeeping took all our washcloths and left us with only one new one. On all three nights, turndown showed up at the room at 5:45pm. Thatâ€™s way too early â€“ it should happen when the guest is at dinner, so that the guest is not interrupted. During our second day, housekeeping was still in our room at 3:45pm when we returned from our day. We went outside to wait for her to finish â€“ when she left, I thanked her in Spanish and got an offhand â€œokâ€� in response. What kind of response is that? From the other reviews on Tripadvisor, perhaps the cleaning/room condition failings of the Pablo Casals Suite are not shared by other rooms, because clearly the hotel has impressed other guests, and particularly other guests with significant review history on Tripadvisor. However, at $920 per night, the types of failings we experienced are inexcusable. Frankly, they make me question how a property can have such problems and still be a member of Small Luxury Hotels. Iâ€™d look elsewhere in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Stellar Experience”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoFan4ever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at El Convento Dec 2 - 9, and our only regret is we wished we could have stayed longer! The location of the hotel is just perfect if you enjoy having the freedom to take leisurely walks around one of the oldest cities in the U.S. This time of year is especially good to take in all the history of the city and to engage in the hoilday activities (tree lightings, street decorations, food), and truly experience the energy, culture, and people of this beautiful island! And . . . speaking of people, I can't say enough about the staff at El Convento - from the bell-men, to the front desk associates, to the staff and crew working the bar and resturant - all of them are well trained to meet (and exceed) your expectations. As a side note, if you eat at El Picoteo, (the Tapas bar in the hotel) ask for Natalia as your waitress, she will provide you with some outstanding recommendations and terrific service! Each of the associates at El Convento convey the sense that they really enjoy what they do! The hotel itself is beautiful! The rooms are charming, and the whole building provides you with a sense of relaxation and ease - it's a quiet oasis from all of your adventures around the city (especially the patio on the roof where the pool is located - what a beautiful view!). You are simply immersed in the history of the hotel; it's location, the architecture, the art-work, and the general ambiance of this gem of a hotel, makes you feel at home. Thank you very much for making our trip so memorable - we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: BKristaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Convento for four nights over Thanksgiving and truly enjoyed our stay and the unique little hotel. Both of us felt that the hotel was really one of the best parts of our trip. The location is ideal- a short walk to all of the restaurants and bars for nightlife, but on the quieter side of Old San Juan. I was surprised to find the room was not as small as I had expected (based on other travelers' reviews) but again, we live in the Northeast and are accustomed to NYC-size hotel rooms, and our room was larger than expected. It even had a beautiful little private patio with a table and chairs- perfect for having morning coffee- and another unexpected plus. I do recommend asking for a room on the first or second floor, as these seem to have the high ceiling (ours was on the second floor and the ceiling was quite high). We also loved all the cats around the hotel and surrounding neighborhood. We very much enjoyed our dinner at Triana- a Spanish-style restaurant just across the square from the hotel. The sangria and flamenco dancing (as well as the food) were fantastic. Another highlight of our trip. We took advantage of the nightly wine and cheese on the terrace- what a lovely way to begin the evening. The wines were good and the cheese selection was also quite nice. The honor bar was also quite handy- a little pricey as compared to the market, but the convenience can't be beat. Overall, Hotel El Convento is a beautiful little unique gem of a hotel and we will certainly look forward to returning. I highly recommend El Convento, especially for a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento”
Reviews.Author: Leemc81
Reviews.Content: A hotel that used to be a convent it was very awesome to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Exelent, beautiful, classical, charm ect.”
Reviews.Author: Jose339
Reviews.Content: This is a very special place. We are from Dorado Puerto Rico located 20 minutes from SJ capital. We were looking for a weekend get away without the kids. So we packed and headed friday night to the capital. Ate in Condado area and stayed first night at La Concha hotel. They gave us an studio. Beutiful just renovated hotel , modern with very much glamour touch. Service exelent. But it was not what we were looking for rest. Maybe at other time in a different mood. Gave us an studio but could not sleep well because you could hear the music until 5:30 am. So with their staff help got a room at El Convento. Just by getting to reception instantly you could feel the warmth and quiteness of the place. Food exelent. Service exelent even the guys at the valet parking. Room extraordinary. Beautiful, classic , and elegant. People extremely friendly and very proud of their job and place. Everything put in place , very clean and specially a place where you can breathe peace. Definitively a hotel that has gained the honor of being one of the small luxury hotels of the world. If you are looking for a city hotel but quiet and warm with a lot of alternatives at walking distance within the historical old San Juan this is the place. We will return. Jose Rossello Camacho Dorado P.R.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Friendly, On-Point Service”
Reviews.Author: CCRE
Reviews.Content: This is how to run a hotel. The rooms are well appointed, good size, and clean. Beds are comfortable. The staff has that winning can-do attitude. When you see the same staff working here year after year, that says something. Very nice facilities for parties / events. Breakfast in the courtyard is a delightful experience. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: CRS65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Convento with my grown daughter for 4 days in November. I have done a fair amount of travelling and stayed at some quite luxurious resorts. This was, without exception, the best hotel stay I have ever experienced. The staff was friendly and helpful. They even recognized us when they ran into us on the street and asked how our day was and recommened places to eat and shop. We were never "nickel & dimed". The hotel offers unlimited, complimentary coffee, tea and bottled water and an honor bar (with reasonable prices) 24 hours a day, and a complimentary wine & cheese reception every evening. Our room was spacious with comfortable beds. The food in the restaurants was wonderful and reasonably priced. The hotel is perfectly situated to explore Old San Juan. All in all a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer the first time”
Reviews.Author: deltadawn103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Convento on November 3rd for one night after staying at the Caribe Hilton for two nights. My husband and I loved the El Convento 4 years ago when we stayed there, but for some unknown reason it didnt seem to have the same charm as it did then now. Don't get me wrong the staff were all great except for the woman server we had at breakfast, she obviously didn't enjoy her job and it was the farthest thing from her mind to make sure we had coffee refills or ask what kind of toast we wanted. We noticed that the evening wine and cheese reception had been down sized quite a bit and when they ran out then weren't quick to replenishing it. It is a fine hotel if you want to be in Old San Juan but after being at the Caribe Hilton we prefer that area and what they have to offer. We found their beds to be quite hard and not comfy at all compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sntlnd
Reviews.Content: The El Convento is a fabulous hotel. We only stayed for one night after a cruise but loved it so much we definitely plan on returning for a longer stay. We were sitting in the open air courtyard imagining the history behind this 17th century building. Great location in Old San Juan. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but room was warm!”
Reviews.Author: mit43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights on our way home from the Virgin Islands. The hotel is very nice, but we did have an issue with how warm our room was. (501) The first night we could not sleep until about 4 am when the room finally started to cool off. We talked to the girl at the desk and she said someone would take a look. That afternoon when we returned to the room it seemed a little better. I think the main problem was the unit cuts off when you leave the room and gets hot again. My wife said it would cut off every time I left the room and she had to get up and move around for it to kick back on. This was the only hic-up we had. We decided that if it was still warm the last night we would check-out and find somewhere else, but we made do. The hotel is very nice. As noted, the rooms are very small. In retrospect we should have stayed in a less expensive room since the view was not worth the extra money we paid for he Queen Vista room. We ate at 2 of the restaurants. The first night we ate at the Tapas restaurant and it was good, but very expensive. The Tapas are small and the recommend 2 plates for each customer. By the time we finished it was quite expensive. The drinks in the honor bar were extremely high. From then on we ate at the local places. Better prices and great local food. DO NOT MISS going to La Bombonera for breakfast. VERY, Very Good! We also ate at The Latin Roots down near the Sheraton, Cafe Manolin, and 2 or 3 other local places. They were all great! The business center with printers was very helpful. The wifi in the room (5th floor) was very slow at times and aggravating! Might need to upgrade the system being used The staff are all very nice and helpful. We did have to wait a couple times when there was only one person at the counter, but not too long. The doorman was very helpful with taxis. There was a little Plaza outside and each night a man was there singing and playing his guitar. We enjoyed sitting and listening to him. Someone mentioned the homeless people. Yes, all cities have some. They did not bother us and we stopped and talked to a couple of them. They are people, after all, and deserve respect just like we all do. Be kind! If we ever stop back in Old San Juan, we will probably stay at a less expensive place. This was nice for one stay, but not worth the price we paid for the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Carribean luxuery hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela4140
Reviews.Content: A bit on the spendy side but well worth it if you can fit it into your budget. The rooms are small as the hotel was formerly a Convent but they are beautifully done and every room has the benefit of the inner courtyard with seating. The staff are absolutely amazing and will tend to your every need. There are several restraunts to choose from right in the hotel and many many more just down the street. One of the few hotels in Old San Juan it gives you a feel of what it would be like to live there. Everything in Old Town is within easy walking distance and if you want to visit the Condado area it is only a short cab ride away. Beaches are also only a short cab ride away. The main thing is being so close to El Morro and right in town.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review, really nice place”
Reviews.Author: pedrony
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 10/13 to 10/16. I booked for me and my GF but we broke up just before the trip, so I went alone. The place is very nice, clean and attractive. I paid $22 with tip for a taxi from the airport. There are taxi fee schedules for different zones. It was raining when I got there, but it soon cleared up and was perfect for the rest of my trip. Check in was smooth and quick. I got a second floor room (queen deluxe) with high ceiling, but it seemed the third floor and higher would have been better because of view and access to pool, wine/cheese happy hour and internet room. The whole of Old San Juan was dead, virtually no one out at bars and restaurants. No cruise ships coming in to port the whole time. Even come Friday night, the few folks out were small, couples on vacation and locals who seemed to keep distant from the tourists. It is not like there are dance places and local action all night long as portrayed in the tourist books. I went to the local supermarket a few blocks away and bought beer and liquor. I did not buy drinks out (way overpriced). I checked out several of the local recommended restaurants and they were pretty much all fine. I got a deal for the hotel where I had a $25 food and beverage credit for each day. The breakfast in the patio each morning was great. That is the only meal I ate at the hotel (less than $20 to fill you up; eggs benedict great as was yogurt and granola). I did not even use my whole FB credit up. Dinner and the food at the other restaurant upstairs seem pricey ($16 for ceviche!!). Between breakfast and free wine/cheese happy hour, I could have spent no extra money on food (but I did because I am a food lover). I checked out and used El Convento's sister properties. La Concha was nice, very populated with a younger and older crowd using the pools, beach and bar. It cost me 75 cents to get there by bus in 20 minutes. Find the bus terminal in Old San Juan and save $20 on taxi. Really though, if I was going to a caribbean island to hang on a beach, I think there are better islands. Casino is small and small time, and drinks at the bar $$$$. I also checked out Courtyard by Marriott in Isle Verde. Would skip. Loud planes every ten minutes, setting off car alarms, not a pretty place. Neither Condado nor Isle Verde are pretty (the towns). If you stay only at your hotel, I guess it is ok, but I like to explore. Old San Juan is a pretty place and interesting, but again, it was deads-ville when I was there. About El Convento, this place is so special (see my Mohonk review for what is special), if I was looking for a romantic place to bring a date for a few nights, you cannot go wrong. As a single guy whose GF bailed, it was still nice but lonely. There were many couples here, and they all seemed to be very happy. Love was in the air. This is not a hotel for a single guy but if you are single, it is still nice. There were no obvious local chicks to meet and bring back to the hotel. The locals are very distant from the tourists. The pool is small but I used it a lot, was very hot and great for cooling off. Open 24 hours. I went up one night at 2AM to swim and interrupted a could having fun LOL. It turned out all good. The business center/room, 3rd floor, has two computers with free internet access to check in to your flight and print your boarding pass. I checked out restaurants and other stuff I read prior to coming here to remind me what to do. The hotel has a very nice staff and good value when you look for a deal and contact them directly. I did not like the many bums I saw around Old San Juan. Disturbing diseased persons that needed medical attention and I would think the city would want to help the folks and remove them from the eyes of visitors. The free trolly system too is nice, but I noticed locals take it to get where they need to go, so that was a bit weird, but understandable. Check out the historic sites and the forts. It's nice. I will not likely to go back to PR, but I was glad I picked El Convento as were the other guests I talked with. I have so many other places to see, PR is done, I am a single guy looking for more fun places where I can meet local single females and have that kind of fun (like the DR, Costa Rica, Cuba and Thailand for example). My friends tell me that the west part of PR is the place to go. Small towns, good surf, not overwhelmed by tourism. If I were going back to the caribbean to enjoy an island feel and tropical island, PR is not the place to go. And where is all this dancing and stuff till all hours of the night going on?? Certainly not here. What's with this false info in the tourist books???

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: ELAMFERN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those looking for a place to stay in Old San Juan. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is romantic and unique. The manager's wine and cheese reception is a great added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: lfc52505
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the El Convento for the first two nights of our honeymoon. They allowed us an early check-in. Every staff member we came in contact with was friendly and professional. We ate once at the tapas bar (which was delicious), but the location is so great, we were able to walk to other restaurants and bars in Old San Juan quite easily. Our room was quiet and air-conditioned, it had an extra door to further limit sounds from outside, but we didn't need to use it. We also loved Trixie, one of the hotel cats!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service and Charming Ambiance at El Convento”
Reviews.Author: Nolanative
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one night stay at Hotel El Convento. We were returning to New Orleans after a week at the W Vieques and wanted to break up the return trip and check out all that Old San Juan has to offer. The hotel lifted its two night minimum requirement when we called about three weeks prior to our visit. I highly suggest looking into this as an option if you are committed to staying at El Convento, but only require one night. Hotel El Convento lives up to the superior service that is the hallmark of the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World" brand. No detail is overlooked, you are never a bother, and, should an error be made, it is literally corrected within minutes. We were so pleased with the service, we couldn't stop talking about it! From our arrival wherein the front desk clerk asked us how our trip to Vieques was (the hotel must keep booking notes) to the beautiful turn down service and timely wake up call/ taxi booking, we were impressed from start to finish. The staff is obviously well-trained, and it is a first class operation. The main areas of the hotel, including the courtyard, are quite charming and well-maintained. If you admire preservation and a sense of real history in a place, this would be a great spot for you. However, if you are looking for gleamingly fresh/clean/modern interiors, I would look elsewhere. The whole feel of the space is very European. El Convento reminded me of a five star hotel in Europe, but a three-four star boutique hotel in the US. Our room, 518, was perfectly suited to our needs, particularly considering the $185.00 price tag. However, it was a bit shabby, with the chairs and table in the room needing a thorough cleaning and replacement of fabric. The ceilings were fairly low and the flat screen TV was fuzzy. It just seemed a bit "worn." That being said, the bathroom was fully renovated and quite clean. It almost didn't match the interior of the room b/c it was so modern and fresh, with every amenity offered, including Aveda products. The room directly faced a maintenance closet filled with mops and housekeeping supplies (instead of the interior courtyard view of a majority of the rooms on the floor) and had a window view of a neighbor's ramshackle back deck. Again, we were not bothered by this for the price, but it should be noted. It seems that the rooms on the second floor of the hotel do not present these issues as they have high ceilings and more of a street view. We did not try the restaurants at the hotel, opting to dine at Marmalade instead. We enjoyed drinks, however, at the tapas restaurant in the afternoon. They were delicious and the service was friendly and efficient. We took advantage of the complimentary wine and cheese hour, which is a lovely detail offered by the hotel. The small balcony faced the square across the street from the hotel, with beautiful views of the church. There was not a ton of seating, though, especially about twenty-thirty minutes into the hour, so definitely keep that in mind if you must sit and if you are with a group of two or more people. I highly recommend El Convento and cannot imagine another hotel in Old San Juan living up to the high standard of service set by it. The location and main areas of the facility are top notch, particularly if you are interested in staying in a historic property. Pay attention to the view described when you are selecting a room over the phone with the hotel and definitely ask about the ceiling height for an optimal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place, should have stayed much longer!”
Reviews.Author: Douglasvblair
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, since we had no concrete plans and we had woke up to late for the bus tour the staff took the extra time and effort to try and find us a motorcycle rental company and when they couldn't they got us a rental car delivered to the hotel, all while we waited in the room. In my opinion they went above and beyond. The room was large and had an old world feeling with cavernous open beamed ceilings and a large open porch for breakfast or drinks. The location was right in the middle of Old San Juan, all we needed was a map and we walked out the door and toured the whole city, it was amazing. They even had a very small pool and hot tub on the roof which we enjoyed immensely especially the view from that rooftop at night into the harbor. Everything about Hotel El Convento was top notch and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm Peaceful and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: joandoane
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ambience of this former Convent for the Carmelite sisters,old Spanish style terra cotta floors thru out check out the fourth floor herb garden and the fifth floor pool with jaccuzi.The beds were sooh comfortable and the linens were top notch,the staff are all happy and polite and most helpful as well.The location is nice it is quiet there is a square across from it where musicians play there guitars and seranade passers by.Each evening at six pm there is a wine and cheese party and it is complimentry,a wide variety of wines and cheeses along with crackers and fresh fruit,we loved it all and plan on going back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: candylion
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fourth floor in room 418. It was small and the bed was very small, but comfortable. The service was amazing, and we ate at the Spanish tapas restaurant on the 2nd floor and that was also good. The cons were that we could hear what sounded like a loud thumping on and off throughout our stay. My husband thought perhaps it was laundry somewhere near our room. Also, the A/C was very loud. Other than that, it was a great hotel in the middle of everything. Shopping and all the historical sites were a short stroll away as were some amazing restaurants. We would definitely return and recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm meets new world comfort”
Reviews.Author: AllHallowsEve
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, great staff, attention to detail. Most comfortable beds EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: timber19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for four nights and couldn't be happier. Everything you could possibly need is at the hotel or available through the hotel. Restaurants in the hotel were amazing. The pool was great, and access to the beach club at the sister hotel was an added bonus. On top of all of the amenities provided, the service was second-to-none. The staff know everything about the area and will help you with whatever tours, meals, or activities you want. We couldn't have asked for anything different. The daily manager's wine reception is a must for anyone that stays here. For those traveling on business, every room has it's own wireless router access point. The only minor issue we had was a sticky drain plug in the sink upon check-in. When we told the front desk, they had it fixed in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “More than my dream wedding!”
Reviews.Author: jcarrington79
Reviews.Content: El Convento is magical and romantic it transcends you to another place and time. There is no need to go over the top with decorations because it speaks for itself. Just know that a wedding at El Convento is perfection. Food, Venue, Ambiance and staff all have 4 Diamond qualities for sure! El Convento made my wedding dreams come true and exceeded my expectations. First I must say that Anna Maria helped me make the decision of picking the venue and was very patient with although it took me forever to make a final decision. One word to describe Monica the food and Beverage Director, AMAZING! From the time that Monica began working with my Husband and it was as if she took the time to get to know us and our vision of our wedding. Monica made the experience so delightful I cannot thank her enough. Angel Morales was our server I am not sure what his title is but again another wonderful part of El Convento Family. He was attentive and very professional and just fun to have working with us on our special day. Thank you so much for making our wedding a wedding no one will ever forget!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeM025
Reviews.Content: After a week-long cruise, my wife and I decided to stay a couple of days in San Juan. We booked El Convento based on Trip Advisor reviews. Expectiations often exceed reality, but not at El Convento! While the rooms are a bit smaller than the big name luxury hotels (common for a historical hotel property), everything else exceeded our highest expectations. The staff was not just courteous but seemed to take pride in the hotel and made extra effort to be helpful and respond to any request. The evening guest receptions were delightful with a selection of upscale wines and exceptional cheeses. The guest lounge and library provided a place to visit with other guests or enjoy complimentary coffee or tea in the morning or cold drinks through out the day. In addition to the free wireless network in our room, the lounge included a separate area with complimentary computers and printers which was expecially convenient for airline check-in. Rather than the usual dreary hall, the common area outside the rooms overlooks the beautiful courtyard and made even the short walk to the elevator (which is passkey protected for guests only access) a delightful experience. This was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in and we will return on our next vist to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: latintrvlqueen
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but we just have to for this hotel! We were on our honeymoon and decided to stay at El Convento, from the moment we got out of the taxi we were greeted with friendly smiles and warmth from the employee's at this hotel. BTW...I've never seen such good looking people!! We were welcomed by (I think a supervisor or manager) Dyaly, boy was she a looker (beautiful young lady)! Warm and friendly, explained all about the hotel. Couldn't wait for the wine reception and meet other people. Bellman, Ivan...wonderful! Wine Reception was absolutely to die for (classy wines and cheeses) Annete was the sweetest person, then we saw the (manager) again. She greeted us by name which surprised us, because I can only imagine how many people they say daily. The room was comfy and romantic. The entire staff smiled and bent over backwards to make sure we were content. Raymond, wow, such professionalism with a smile. I can go on and on about this hotel and it's staff! I will never again stay at a brand hotel. These people made our honeymoon dreams come true and an experience to be remembered. Thank you to our new found family at El Convento! See you in two years!!!! We will miss you!

Reviews.Title: “We can't stop talking about it. This hotel made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: budgetluxurylvr
Reviews.Content: El Convento, how do I love thee? Let me count the ways. My boyfriend and I came here on a romantic 5 day trip in September and paid a little extra for a bay view on the 4th floor. This hotel has so much character, attention to detail, and extremely friendly staff. We took many pictures of the room and hotel, because we couldn't wait to show our friends and family how charming it was. The rooftop pool terrace had beautiful views, and the open courtyard was a lovely sight when we walked out of our room every morning. It's also conveniently in walking distance to everything you could want in Old San Juan. I always felt safe. The concierge was so helpful, and we booked several activities through them. I never got the impression that we were "annoying" the front desk by asking for questions, advice, or help, and because of the small exclusive size of El Convento, several of the staff members knew us by name by the end of our trip. Before booking, I was concerned that we would regret not choosing a beachside hotel. It was actually quite the opposite. Because of the beach club access, my boyfriend and I utilized La Concha, but we were always glad to get away from that more commercialized side of San Juan and return to our charming little luxury hotel. Not only would I recommend Hotel El Convento to each and every person visiting San Juan, I would go back to San Juan just to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Girls Trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Surf_GypsyNY
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I decided to stay in Old San Juan and chose the Hotel El Convento and we could not have made a better choice. The friendly staff, stellar location and gorgeous rooms give is a 4.5 stars. HOTEL: Open-air feel with an interior courtyard. Several restaurants and small cafes within the hotel. Feels small even though it's quite large. Old world charm. Modern design. Fast wifi and free for guests. ROOM: We had a double room on the second floor, room 207. The room itself was gorgeous. 20 ft ceilings, dark wood beams, old world decor. The bathroom is tight, especially given the spaciousness of the room itself. Ours had a juliet balcony facing the courtyard. Clean and very comfortable beds. We did have an issue with the AC. It was constantly stuck on below 65 degrees no matter what the needle actually said but given the high humidity and the very very warm weather of Puerto Rico, it was a blessing. We just used extra blankets at night. AMENITIES: Pool - The one negative was the pool. It's located on the roof deck is the size of a child's wading pool. Fortunately the hotel has a partnership with both the Marriott and the La Concha located about 15 min away on the beach. We choose to visit the La Concha and make use of their pool and beachside access. The La Concha is absolutely beautiful and perfect for travelers looking for a tropical resort feel. It was two pools, one an infinity pool overlooking the beach. We chose the Hotel El Convento because we were specifically looking for an old world, local experience. Restaurant - The hotel has at least 3 restaurants. We chose to sample the Spanish Tapas Restaurant. I suggest you skip in-hotel dining and venture out for tasty authentic fare. The tapas was adequate but nothing special and most dishes were fried or lacking in flavor. Excursions - The hotel originally booked us a biobay tour but we found out that we could book one at half the cost. The hotel quoted us $95pp but if you book it directly, it's only $45pp. We cancelled with the hotel with no penalty and booked it ourselves. The biobay is a can't-miss excursion in PR. Other - The hotel also offers a wine reception from 6-7pm. Don't miss it. It's absolutely fabulous with a different wine tasting each night and fruits and cheeses (delicious!) available for munching. You get to meet other guests and enjoy the 3rd floor terrace. Water and coffee is free at all hours on the 3rd floor. LOCATION: Perfect for those wanting a true San Juan PR experience. Located in the heart of Old San Juan. Close to shops and several very good restaurants. Try El Bombonero for a dining experience you'll crave when you return home. Get a Majorca sandwich (sweet crispy pastry) filled with ham and cheese there. The Cafe Berlin is also close by. Go there for a great mofongo, a classic PR dish! Nightlife surrounds the hotel. PR residents don't start the party until after midnight so make sure to have some of the (very good and free) coffee the hotel offers. The hotel is close to the historical castle fort. It's an enjoyable walkable distance. Overall, we had an extremely positive experience. We loved the Hotel El Convento. The staff could not be friendlier and the location is extremely ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MJBNYC
Reviews.Content: Perfect jumping off point for exploring Old San Juan, and the fort ruins. Great rooms. Near lots of great bars and restaurants. Small pool. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Character! Character! Character!”
Reviews.Author: lv_gedney
Reviews.Content: El Covento in the heart of Old San Juan is oozing with character. You walk to most everything Old San Juan as the hotel is very well located. The hotel staff are fantastic and are extremely helpful. The wine and cheese they offer in the evenings for FREE is also a nice touch. The actual accommedations are not of high quality. The beds are middle of the road at best. However, all the other truely amazing things this hotel offers easily masks any downside it may present. This is not a beach resort, but those are a dime a dozen, this place is uniquely special. I would highly recommend El Covento to anyone considering a trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “beau-ti-ful”
Reviews.Author: CheInMia
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here! The room was immaculate, we had nice views from room 510, and each staff member we encountered was very pleasant. We really appreciated the quality of service here and it appeared that every other guest got the same great service. We had breakfast downstairs and it was delicious. We liked the free daily wine & cheese available at 6pm on the 3rd floor. The courtyard was beautiful and quiet even when there were weddings & parties - never a disturbance or the feeling of being overcrowded (but then again we were on the top floor). Valet was very convenient, though driving out of OSJ can be quite a pain. Great walking distance to shops/restaurants/sightseeing. Our room was a perfect size. I was worried about sleeping in a smaller bed but we slept like babies! The small business center has access to 2 computers & printers which came in handy when looking for activities & for booking our return flight. Only negative was the pool (which is ridiculously tiny, even for a private backyard pool) was closed due to them renovating the deck. We were not notified of this at booking, & found out when we arrived. We got the room for an excellent price ($150/night) by booking directly from the hotel's website (I love a bargain!!!) and I can see why their regular rates are usually much higher, it's worth it! On 2 occasions we spent some time at their sister hotel, La Concha to use the pool & beach access. The property was beautiful, trendy and a great place to relax. The crowd was very mixed & we even made some new friends there, but the pools are a lot smaller than they appear to be on the website. There wasn't enough outdoor lounge space to accompany the amount of people they cater to and it got even more crowded when they closed down the beach front pools for a private party. The beach is not impressive and there are run down/abandoned buildings & graffiti in plain sight when on the beach. I was relieved we stayed at El Convento in comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: V1210
Reviews.Content: I got married here in January 2010. The perfect most amazing wedding! Do not hestiate to (a) get married here (b) go to a wedding here (c) stay the night here. It's such a beautiful property and is romantic for all.

Reviews.Title: “cannot wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: wjbatten
Reviews.Content: to start at the beginning, i looooooooove the look of this place! i'm going to say that on an asthetic level, this is one of the most beautiful hotels that i have even stayed in. now, i know that there are bigger, more all-inclusive, fancy schmancy hotels out there, but for us, this place was perfect!!! the hotel staff were nothing but helpful in advance of our quick two day trip to san juan, and they only continued to be even more helpful once we arrived. Zoraida, at the front desk, checked our bags since we arrived early, so that we could get out and about to start our sightseeing, and she also helped make renting a car for the next day all but effortless. our room was fabulous, even though it was only one of their standard room. we found it super comfy and perfect of our needs...including the extra door within the room to block out the noise from the inner courtyard of the hotel. we loved the rooftop pool! great for a nice couple of hours in the afternoon after a busy morning of taking in the sights, or first thing in the morning after breakfast while you're waiting for the shops to open. the afternoon wine reception was nice...a great way to unwind after being out and about for the day before we cleaned up to head out for dinner. one of the bellmen/porters, Ivan, recommended a wonderful restaurant nearby when we told him that we wanted something a little less touristy and "off-the-beaten-path." now that our first visit to puerto rico and the hotel el convento are over, we cannot wait to return!!! and with PR only being a shirt flight from south florida, it won't be long at all... joel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mareina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel El Convento in late May and LOVED it. The hotel is beautiful, our room was very nice with high ceilings, and daily breakfast at Patio del Nispero was the highlight of the trip. El Picoteo was also fantastic, and we enjoyed a couple of late nights at the new pizza place. I've read reviews that the food at the hotel is too expensive, but our experience was that the hotel restaurants cost the same as similar places on Fortaleza. The only reason that I didn't give the hotel a "5" for value is that our room was somewhat expensive. Not unreasonably so, given how great El Convento is -- it just wasn't a steal. But it was awesome! BTW, La Bombonera is a great place for a cheap, no-frills meal. We shared a mallorca -- pastry, butter, and powdered sugar -- and I had an egg, cheese & bacon sandwich. DELICIOUS. Also good were Raices and Dragonfly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the middle of Old San Juan”
