Reviews.Author: k00lj
Reviews.Content: We booked El Convento on the 19-21 July 2010, We got a room on the 3rd floor which was functional and clean, a bit old though but that is the 'charm' of the convent. The rooms have a sound isolation door to keep the possible noise of the hotel out, just in case they have a wedding or other function. We did not experience any noise. The service of the hotel staff was perfect, the bell boy was welcoming and helped us from our taxi to our room explaining every feature of the Hotel. The receptionist was welcoming and helpful. A perfect welcome and a true testament to Puerto Rican hospitality. The restaurant staff was a bit less polite though. we tried both restaurants on site, and were not too impressed with the service nor the food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitan_chic
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Juan before, and my husband has been there many times, but we had never stayed in Viejo San Juan. For our honeymoon, I told him that I really wanted to stay at El Convento. We booked the Romantic Memories package and got champagne and truffles in our room when we checked in. The whole hotel reminded me so much of the old convents in Spain and I just adored it. The staff was EXTREMELY helpful, and had great recommendations for local places to eat. It's right in the center of everything - great outlet shopping, great restaurants, walking distance to El Morro.... You don't even need a car to stay here, which makes it a way better value than staying in Condado, renting a car, and sitting in traffic! There is a terrace pool on the third floor, and every evening there is a wonderful wine reception with delicious Spanish wines, grapes, crackers, and brie and Manchego cheeses! They also will help you get to one of their sister hotels to take advantage of the beach. I had a terrific stay at El Convento and will return the next time I am in Viejo San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Luxury, Without the Cost”
Reviews.Author: jlteacher
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at El Convento. Because it was the off-season, we were (without requesting it!) upgraded to a fantastic room with a private balcony. The staff were incredibly friendly and went out of their way to help us find restaurants and things to do. One of the staff members even gave us a detailed itinerary for our stay in Vieques! The FREE win and cheese hour featured delightful cheeses and decent wines on a lovely balcony overlooking the Caribbean. The bed was comfortable, and the location in Old San Juan was perfect. There was cheap valet parking next door to the hotel, too. The plunge pool was just right for cooling down before wine hour, too. The only thing lacking was an included breakfast, though you could choose this option if you wanted to spend more. All in all, we had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “If you are in San Juan, you must stay (and/or eat) here”
Reviews.Author: fenster2345
Reviews.Content: The staff of El Convento are the best. They upgraded us from a queen room to a magnificent suite without me even asking. The grounds are beautiful, very well kept up and full of charm. I completely disagree with one reviewer who complained about El Convento not having attention to detail. I would argue quite the opposite. They put a lot of thought into every corner. The suite we stayed in (admittedly way above our normal price range) was straight up opulence. If we are back in San Juan, we will definitely be staying at El Convento. BTW, the tapas restaurant, while a little pricey (akin to NYC prices we're used to paying), is very good. I definitely recommend dining in one night. The courtyard restaurant is also very good for lunch. Overall, 5 stars. We found Old San Juan to be a place you could walk around in 2 hours and be done. Frankly, we spent most of our time at El Convento!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and in the heart of old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: paulandsarahthomas
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay at this hotel. Beautiful to look at, friendly staff, great location. Good food in the restaurants (though we didn't try the fancy Italian one). Comfortable beds. Enjoyed wine and cheese reception. Very classy place. Great view from the plunge pool. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a few days.”
Reviews.Author: westks
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, two sons (8 & 12)) and I spent four nights at the El Convento and had a wonderful time. This is an old place; if you want modern luxury you need to go to one of the new hotels. If you enjoy old architecture, a great location, and an attentive staff this is the place to stay. Don't underestimate the wine and cheese in the evenings, it was a very good spread. My wife and I regret that we were only able to make it on one of our 4 nights. The restaurants are good but breakfast is a little expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, romanic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bburgtravel
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico. After reading the reviews online about El Convento we decided to stay here... and I'm so glad we did! The hotel is right in the heart of Old San Juan and walking distance to shopping, great eating, and all the tourist spots to visit. The hotel staff were great, helping us rent a car and recommending some fantastic places to eat. The room itself was beautiful and unique. The sheets were SO soft! They had a wine & cheese tasting from 6-7 every night, free water, coffee and tea. The hotel also has a fitness room and rooftop pool and jacuzzi. We loved this hotel and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GLizzle23
Reviews.Content: As part of our one-week honeymoon in Puerto Rico, my wife and I spent two nights at the El Convento. I can't say enough positive things about the hotel: the staff, its location, and the hotel itself were above and beyond what we were hoping for. The hotel is located in downtown Old San Juan, right across the street from the oldest church in the Western Hemisphere. (Do yourself a favor and look up the history of the El Convento -- when it was originally built in the 1500s, it was a convent for nuns!) Everything in Old San Juan is walkable from El Convento, and I can't tell you how great it was to be able to stop by our hotel to drop stuff off, take a quick break, etc. Location grade: A+ The staff were also outstanding. One of the people at the front desk gave us a great recommendation for a restaurant (see my review of Marmalade for details), and even made the reservation for us. When we came back, she asked how it went and was genuinely interested to hear about our experience. Tony, our waiter both mornings when we had breakfast at the hotel, also deserves special mention. He was terrific! Staff grade: A+ As for the hotel itself, you will find yourself in awe -- not necessarily because of how "nice" it is, but due to its uniqueness. There simply isn't another hotel comparable to El Convento. I mean, how many hotels have a library or an herb garden? The El Convento has both! It's small (about 60 rooms total) but not "bed and breakfast" small, which means that the staff will recognize you after a day or so. This is one example where the pictures on the hotel's official website gives you a sense of what the hotel is really like, so I advise you to look there. The rooms are a bit small (especially the bathrooms) but are very well-appointed. You get Aveda bath products, which my wife tells me is a good thing. I recommend you splurge for the "Vista" rooms for a better view. Room grade: B+ Overall, I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. The El Convento will truly make your Puerto Rico vacation better. (Oh, and by the way -- check out the fitness center on the bottom floor. You will be blown away.)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, elegant and romantic”
Reviews.Author: macs_cat
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this chaming rehabed old convent. We were on our honeymoon, and boy was this the ticket. The room was graciously appointed and comfy. The roof top hot tub and pool were fantastic with breathtaking views of Old San Juan. The staff was amazing, I can't say enough about how impressed by each member of the staff we encountered. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm with All the Right Touches”
Reviews.Author: JWJMBR
Reviews.Content: El Convento is absolutely beautiful and a wonderful place to stay. It is in the heart of Old San Juan, overlooking a small plaza and next to the Cathedral, with the old city and its sites surrounding you. Set around a central courtyard with trees and flowering shrubs and coquis to serenade you at night, the rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. The plunge pool is perfect for cooling off after a walk around town and the terrace invites you to pull up a lounge chair and a book. The evening wine and cheese reception on the third floor terrace was a treat - a good selection of red and white wines and cheeses, beautiful view of the plaza with the bay in the distance, and a nice time to unwind and interact with other guests. Thank you El Convento - we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel great location.”
Reviews.Author: mflatc
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in Old San Juan. Well situated with some very lovely views inside the property and the old city. Check in was great, rooms were nice, food was good. They even have tap beer in the restaurant which is a rarity on the island. The pool is insanely small and of little use unless you are under 3 feet tall. The courtyard with its giant orange tree is beautiful. Old world feel for sure. Kids museum 100 feet away. They have a wine, drinks and cheese thing in the evening on the 3rd floor which was nice too. The only negatives would be a non functioning room safe and pillows that are impossible to use for sleeping because they are too big and hard.

Reviews.Title: “No one does it better...........than El Convento”
Reviews.Author: MrsJEngland
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel El Convento for 1 week 9th-15th June 2010. I had read most of the reviews on TA and they were positive however the reviews and the pictures are only a glimpse into how amazing this place really is seeing really is believing. The whole convento team housekeeping, maintenance, bellhops, restuarant staff, horticultural maintenance and front of house staff make this place everything that it is which is elegant, charming, immaculate and unlike most hotels of this standard they make you feel welcome. This most definetley the place to stay if staying in old san juan. It is central to all OSJ has to offer sights, sounds, tasty cuisine. We had breakfast and dinner during the week at the hotel which were excellent. The complementary wine and cheese reception on the 3rd floor terrace every night 6pm-7pm is a great way to start your evening before venturing out. For me to go on about the wonderful rooms,surroundings and dining etc...would only be repeating all the great things that have already been written. I just wanted to add our experience and I cannot fault this hotel. We will definetely return to El convento on our next trip to Puerto Rico. p.s a big thankyou to Luis(head of maintenance) one day we had a leak from the shower which was dripping into the bathroom below which we were unaware of a minor thing for us. However he was polite and courteous and caused as little disruption to our relaxing break as possible. Thank you to Luis and the whole convento team for making our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: smalw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of June. We chose the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and we were so happy! The hotel is amazing and just what we were looking for. The girls that worked at the desk gave great recommendations and we loved San Juan. The location of the hotel was perfect to see all the downtown sights and we went over to their sister hotel to visit the beach. (The cab to the beach is a little pricy.) We loved being able to utilize the amenities there. The rooms were great and the sound proof windows and doors helped keep the room extra cool. The gym was awesome too! I can't really think of anything that they could improve on- we would definitely stay there again and have told all of our friends to!

Reviews.Title: “it's worth for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: milukux
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a colonial environment and the staff are friendly to help you out even when you already had checked out, they can take care of your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: nana019
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building, wonderful staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “I never stayed at a hotel that made me...”
Reviews.Author: SLWade
Reviews.Content: I never stayed at a hotel that made me feel more welcomed and more at home. Thank you to all the staff! We will be back! S. Wade and Family June 19-24, 2010

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Hotel El Convento - Paradise in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: adk23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel El Convento for 2 nights at the end of my honeymoon, after a cruise from San Juan. Beautiful location, wonderful room, lots of elegance and charm. Walked all around Old San Juan from the hotel, and enjoyed fantastic breakfast each morning in the hotel restaurant. Nice to have a pool and hot tub with a great view of the harbor, especially in that neighborhood. We were already planning our return trip before the 1st day was done. Staff was very helpful and courteous, and good to have complimentary internet access as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: rowed79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed staying at El Convento during our honeymoon. First of all, the sleep quality was fantastic, as the beds were very comfortable, and the shades to the window could block out ALL of the sunlight. Very relaxing. Our queen size bed felt like a king it was so good. It's in the middle of Old San Juan, so its best to take a taxi, but for that reason it is with walking distance of everything in that area. The honor bar was very convenient, and the wine reception every day was almost enough to cover a dinner if you're a light eater. The hotel had a lot of character, with lots of little nooks to discover, and at night the bar turned into a pretty chic party. I'm not myself very trendy, but it looked like a Project Runway episode. There's lots of nearby restaurants and attractions, and the staff was more than helpful pointing out where to go and what to see. Other than the price being a little high (also know I'm sort of cheap) I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel with staff that shines with personality plus!”
Reviews.Author: heidihope
Reviews.Content: We arrived at El Convento Hotel from a 7-day cruise - the restaurant provided an excellant breakfast (and traditionally I'm not a breakfast person!) with fresh orange juice and early evening on Sunday provided a delightful tea/wine hour. I was impressed with the overall experience - our cruise line did not provide quality food (in my opinion) so our visit to this fine hotel was an award-winning finale. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not impressed w/the room.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany627
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself was very beautiful I was not very impressed with our room (220). It seems that we paid $250 a night for the location only and not the room itself. It was at the very end of the hall passed two doors and it seems like our room was the hidden leftover room. It had no window and the paint was peeling. I did however like the service. The staff was very friendly and like I said before the hotel itself is amazing. The location was the best part about the hotel. Being that it was located right in the middle of Old San Juan we were able to walk everywhere. I would stay at this hotel again IF I found a nightly rate of less than $175...$250 a night was definetly NOT worth the room we were given. I'd also recommend it to anyone that is looking to stay in the middle of old San Juan but would warn them that it is not worth more than $175 a night.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a chance to stay here, grab it!”
Reviews.Author: igbg
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel -- fabulous rooms, first class service, public areas are charming.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbs58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited San Juan along with our 2 adult children. El Convento is beautiful, charming in Old San Juan. It's in a central location and all sites are within walking distance. The rooms were beautiful and the service awesome from the moment we checked in until checkout. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel, ok rooms, but still the place to stay in OSJ”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: HOTEL REVIEW # 176 El Convento MY TRAVEL STYLE: If possible, I try to stay away from business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the â€œwowâ€� experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name). LOCATION: Great, in the heart of â€˜old San Juanâ€™. Area is quiet but a far walk to where the good restaurants are if itâ€™s raining (5 mins). BEST WAY TO GET THERE: Taxi fare from airport is fixed at $19 + $1 per large suitcase. TYPE OF ROOM: â€¨â€¨Standard. BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Bed was comfortable, pillows were down and a bit on the thick side for our preference. Sheets were of high quality. LIGHTING: Good in bedroom & bathroom. BATHROOM/SHOWER: Tiny bathroom and no decent sized shelf to put toiletries. 2 people in one bathroom at the same time would be difficult. Shower is in tub and 50% of the spray came out the bathtub nozzle as opposed to the shower head. Water pressure was weak as a result. TOILETRIES: Aveda. Good stuff. CLEANLINESS: Room is dirty. Lost a contact lens on the floor and couldnâ€™t believe the amount of filth in the room. Outside of room was also very dirty. Dishes were left out in common areas and bird poop is all over the railings and it was clear they have been there for a long time. A/C: Worked very well and was quiet in the lowest setting. STYLE OF ROOM: Nothing special. Looked better on the hotelâ€™s website. COMMON AREA: Nice with all of the trees outside This is the real reason to stay here. Unfortunately it was very dirty. Lobby area is nice but nothing special. New tiles replaced old tiles in the floors and didnâ€™t match the color. This hotel lacks attention to detail. QUIET/MORNING LIGHT: Room was quiet when the second door in the bedroom was closed. There is an outside looking door between the bed and the door to the hallway. This probably to reduce sound of people in the bar. Morning sunlight could be blocked. FOOD: Only had breakfast here because it they cant get this right we wouldnâ€™t give them a chance for dinner. Pancakes had no flavor and French toast were average. TV/INTERNET: Internet (wired & wireless) is at no charge and was fast. SERVICE: Not good. People everywhere but they wouldnâ€™t clean. The free wine and cheese (btw- not free as itâ€™s part of the $30/day resort fee) was nearly cleared out 20 minutes before the time it was supposed to end. Staff was not very helpful and wouldnâ€™t go out of their way for anything. SUMMARY: This hotel is just ok. Donâ€™t expect much but know itâ€™s still the best option for a historic hotel in old san juan. Know what you are getting into and you should still be able to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Know What You're Getting Into”
Reviews.Author: TSeason
Reviews.Content: I wanted to plan a romantic trip for my wife so I read all the reviews on hotels in the San Juan area. Other people rated the El Convento #1, so although it was a little pricier than most, I decided this was the perfect place to stay. We booked their "Romance" package that came with Champagne and Truffles. The hotel touts itself as a 350 year old former convent converted into a "luxury" hotel. Even with an upgraded "Vista" suite, the hotel itself was nice, but FAR from from luxurious. Just to give you a frame of reference, we're not wealthy people with unrealistic expectations. Rather, we're a middle class couple that doesn't typically pay $250-plus per night in hotels. Nonetheless, I wanted to treat my wife and thought this was the place to go. Our upgraded "Vista" suite was probably the smallest hotel room we have ever had. Large enough for one queen bed, dresser, chair, and little else. The "Veranda with a beautiful view of San Juan Harbor" was merely a full height window (approx. 4 feet by 6 feet...only half of which opened) with a railing that almost touched the outside of the glass inches away. There is nothing to step out onto, you must remain fully in the room. I had always thought of a veranda as a small balcony that extended at least a little outwards from the exterior of a building. This would better be described as a window that opens inward, with a railing in front of it. As far as the view...it was there but you had to look over many buildings and obstacles to see the water. I could have overlooked the size of the room and view, but so much else was disappointing such as: - Air conditioning not working properly - Internet Connection not working at all - Large plastic door sign (with fire evacuation directions and daily rates) falling off in the middle of the night scaring us to death that someone was breaking into our room. Our experience was so far from what we expected. After the first night I requested that they let us out of our three-day pre-paid commitment to actually find the luxury that they had promised, but not delivered upon. This led us to experience what really was special about El Convento. They not only apologized and let us out of our commitment, they provided a full refund for the night we were there without our even asking for it. The staff was so nice there, that I actually feel a bit guilty writing a negative review about the place. I am only doing so to let others know what to expect. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is nice...just a far cry from a luxury property in our opinion. We ended up going to the Marriott Stellaris Resort on Condado beach. For a little less money (with AAA discount), we now had a huge room with TWO large balconies, an amazing full view of the Ocean, air conditioning that worked, and an overall amazing experience. I really have to give El Convento their due for an exceedingly high degree of commitment to customer service, even when we no longer wanted to be their customer. They allowed us to salvage our luxury vacation plans and for that, I am thankful. Just know that your room is more likely to be on the scale of a Howard Johnson's than anything truly luxurious. I really can't explain how there were so many glowing reviews of this property...but there are. So you may just have to find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, relaxing, lovely”
Reviews.Author: wynterh8r
Reviews.Content: Historic, tastefully appointed, attentive staff, comfortable rooms, great location in the very heart of old San Juan........this is just to start. Check in has you greeted by friendly staff. Throughout the stay, they were always available to assist with any issues and to recommend places to go, how to get there, how to do things in the most "cost effective" way. Their recommendations for whatever type restaurant you craved was dead on whether it be a local tapas bar or high end elegant fine dining establishment. I believe there are only 45 rooms at the hotel, but the building is constructed in the Spanish style with a large courtyard centrally located which gives the hotel a much larger feeling. Our room was comfortable with a queen size bed, high thread count linens, flat screen tv, stereo sound radio, black out shutters and draperies and a hurricane proof door just inside the entrance to the room as added soundproofing and cooling insulation. A small fridge was stocked daily with 2 fresh bottles of water, a coffee maker ensuite. The closet has robes which seem to be calling your name to begin your journey to relaxation of your room and the complimentary Aveeno toiletries(stocked daily). Nightly turn down service has you returning to your room after an evening out with your drapes closed, bed ready for sleep and radio on with soft classical music. Complimentary safe in the room for your valuables. The desk in your room has a letter of greeting personally signed by the hotel manager with his phone number included where he can be reached at any time. This was a nice touch. A nightly manager's wine and cheese hour (6-7pm) , also complimentary, offered at least 10 different wine choices, 5 cheese choices, grapes and crackers....This was nice to come back to after a day walking about. Also, complimentary coffee and tea all day and an "HONOR" bar. A very small pool and jacuzzi are available with a never ending amount of pool towels with a nice deck for relaxing in the sun. After all of the pleasures of the hotel, there is still all of Old San Juan to enjoy. Enjoy your stay, Susan Molnar-Gallo

Reviews.Title: “You'll feel like you're "Somewhere"...not just anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: FlexMartian
Reviews.Content: We just returned to Nashville on Friday night from San Juan and a classic stay at Hotel El Convento in Viejo San Juan. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a relaxing, getaway, personal service-laden vacation in a beautiful city in a great climate. I never do the same place twice in all our travels...but I will be back to San Juan and The El Convento. The location is priceless; the feeling of old Puerto Rico with the cobblestone streets, the churches the courtyard restaurants, but only 10 minutes by taxi from El Condado, the beach, the "hip" hotels, clubs and shops (which La Concha is a sister hotel to you; you can use their beach and facilities for free as an El Convento guest). As I mentioned in the title, on El Condado you felt like you were "anywhere"...Miami, Caracas, etc, but at El Convento in Viejo San Juan you were...SOMEWHERE! The service was immpecable at the hotel, the manager'snightly wine and cheese party was excelent, and breakfasts (ate twice there) were perfect. Their tapas bar was fun and though pricey, no more than any other Tapas bar in San Juan. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. You will not be disappointed UNLESS you are looking for a giant, luxurious suite a la Vegas...this is a 400 year old convent converted to the coolest boutique hotel imaginable. Go...enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant historic hotel with excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: cheshrgato
Reviews.Content: El Convento has a great unobtrusive staff that simply make your stay ideal. The rooms are small as is typical in a historic hotel. The center of the hotel is an open air restaurant and bar with lovely trees and other foliage. The all day tea and coffee service is a necessity for me and was perfect. The honor bar was also added ambiance which helped us enjoy the patio area. The evening wine and cheese service was spectacular. At least ten wines and five varied cheeses. We enjoyed all the services the hotel offered, even the pizza and beer at their secondary restaurant after the toddler crashed after a big day at El Morro. The location was nicely centered for our historic architectural walks. We never used the pool but it was lovely with slightly warmed water.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charming!”
Reviews.Author: KarenEichhorn
Reviews.Content: We've spent 4 days in Old San Juan. This is an amazing city with incredible culture, food, people. We walked everywhere. Toured both forts. We arrived on the last day of the International Festival where the city was alive with live music and international booths selling local wares. This hotel is very representative of Old San Juan. The people went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and it was! Our room overlooked the entrance to the harbor. The dipping pool was delightful. We thoroughly enjoyed the evening wine and cheese event, which allowed us to get to know other folks staying here and we shared many a story. The tapas were fantastic. We loved this place and it's charm and would come back here again!!! They had a sister hotel on the beach about 15 minutes away that was beautiful, too.

Reviews.Title: “will not spend hard earned money at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: dbjpnj
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spent two nights at the El Convento before catching a cruise. We paid for a suite and ended up with their cheapest room and no apology or reimbursement. Food expensive, room mediocre. Talked to several other people staying there and they were also very unhappy with hotel. When we arrived on ship and went to customer service desk to complain about the hotel, the hotel was one of the properties the cruise line booked with, there were other people also complaining about the same things we were. Emailed hotel when we got home but to no avail, same with cruise line, just got a sterile reply about how unfortunate the experience was. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing except for the food prices”
Reviews.Author: lovevacay83
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento was amazing. Our room and the hotel itself looks even better in person than the pictures did. The hotel is pricey, so that was a negative, but otherwise the hotel delivered on absolutely everything it said it would. I believe most people go for the appearance and history of the hotel, plus its location in Old San Juan. We got everything that we were looking for there. My only negative is price of food at the hotel. We went to the courtyard breakfast and the italian restaurant (Il perugio), both extremely overpriced. We finally found La Bombanera 4 blocks away (recommended by Rachel Ray), just down the street from Walgreens. It is a very affordable place to eat breakfast. We ate there twice for less than $10. They serve everything from pancakes to bacon to pastries. It is well worth the 4 block walk. Also, the hotel will let you go to the beach at a sister hotel (there are 2). We chose to go to La Concha...amazing. The beach and ocean were beautiful, and the service on the beach was the best I have ever seen. Employess placed the chairs on the beach where we wanted them, then dug a hole and placed an umbrella to cover both chairs where we wanted it. They also got towels for us and would take drink orders. The best service ever on the beach. Well worth the $30 round trip taxi ride. It was the best day we had on the trip. They also have about 3 infinity pools there, with beds everywhere for you to lay out on. One great aspect of Hotel El Convento were the employees that they always had posted at the door...they could tell you where anything was and the best way to get there. Old San Juan is amazing...extremely safe, with police on most corners. You could be out any time of the night and still feel safe. The wall surrounding San Juan is just a block down the street...a great place for pictures. The fort is a heftier walk...do not do this in the extreme heat...but otherwise an enjoyable tour. Afterwards you can jump on the open air trolley that will take you around the outside of Old San Juan so you can see what else is near. Old San Juan is an extremely quaint town...lots of history and many souvenier shops to check out. And everyone speaks English there. Back to the hotel...would highly recommend it, but do not go to the hotel restaurants if you want affordable food. The pizzeria located on the second floor (accessable from outside) was very good and affordable though.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, romantic and in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: jdjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento as part of our honeymoon, and it was excellent. Every staff member we spoke with was helpful and friendly, with great recommendations for nightlife and food. The building itself is very old and has a historic/Spanish colonial B&B feel, but is well maintained and comfortable. The wine and cheese reception is the best I have ever had at a hotel, and the 24 hour rooftop pool and hot tub were great perks. OSJ is a very walkable place, and El Convento puts you in the middle of it all (no cab rides needed) while remaining a peaceful oasis. There's no beach there, but they partner with La Concha in nearby Condado to offer some sun and surf. Just a truly awesome place.

Reviews.Title: “Sweetest most Romantic Honeymoon - Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Blusie
Reviews.Content: On our way home from honeymooning in St Lucia we stayed in El Convento for a fabulous 3 days; the last part of our honeymoon. Wow what an amazing experience, from the moment we entered the lobby. Everyone is so classy, friendly, beautiful, and professional. We were taken care of in every way. The turn down service was a sweet surprise; slippers on the foot of the bed, classical music on the sound system, and chocolate truffles with a â€œcongratulations on your marriageâ€� card. A nice way to return from a fun and busy day around the island. Our room was lovely; they gave us a corner room, so it might have been larger than some of the others. We had windows on both sides and not just one. We loved it â€“ so romantic with the old Spanish style dÃ©cor. The pool and Jacuzzi on the roof was a tranquil setting to catch some rays and just enjoy the setting. It was never crowded. Other guests are very courteous. This is a fabulous place. Highly recommend. PS: We rented a car from the airport & used our GPS. We loved the freedom of driving around just like a road trip back home. Parking is tight around the hotel, but if you drive around enough youâ€™ll find a spot. We always did. We loved walking about though; to the plaza and shops. We were surprised how much we loved this place better than St Lucia - Itâ€™s an amazing location. We truly miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful, good value”
Reviews.Author: LaraAnn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a night at El Convento before leaving to go to a large resort on the east coast. We rented a car and the worst part of the trip for us was trying to find the hotel and park the car. We didnâ€™t really prepare for the drive and assumed the blackberry maps would help us find our way. Maps didnâ€™t work, there are no street signs so by the time we found the Valet parking for the hotel we were beyond thrilled. We would highly recommend just taking a taxi to the hotel and not renting a car. Once in old San Juan there is no parking and so the car is pretty useless. There is a wine and cheese reception every evening and after our trip it was nice to sit on the patio and relax. We could sit on the patio with other guests or sit on one of the walkways at a private table. There was also an honor bar that was open for the entire trip so we had cocktails after dinner that we took to the pool. There are free bottle of water in the library so we stopped and got water before walking to the fort on our second day, which was very convenient. The tapas restaurant that is located on the second floor was very good and was a pretty good value too. We got a pitcher of sangria and a couple of different plates for less than $80. We ate at the restaurant in the courtyard for breakfast the second day (not sure what the name was). It was very good and very relaxing. After we left El Convento we went to El Conquistador on the beach, which made our stay at El Convento that much better. El Convento wasnâ€™t cheap but it was a good value. The room was very nice, the property is gorgeous and we felt very relaxed. We agreed that we would definitely return here but would not go back to one of the large resorts.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: glenn1112
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and this is one of the finest I have ever stayed. Location is perfect for exploring Old San Juan, the rooms are beautiful and the hotel has a great ambience. Also, El Batey, a fantastic dive bar, is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and elegant, but not brand new”
Reviews.Author: Elvenfair
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a unique, luxurious experience, Hotel El Convento provides. But if you're looking for brand new, state-of-the-art, sleek, modern, and spacious, find somewhere else. All the charm in El Convento comes from the fact that it used to be a convent -- so it's designed to be peaceful, quiet, and private. We arrived early, but the bellhop was very friendly and stored our luggage for us until the room was ready. We had a small room way off in a corner, but it was still well-appointed (comfy bed and pillows, clean bathroom with toiletries). It was nice to be in a luxury hotel that didn't charge extra for internet! We missed the managers reception with complimentary wine and cheese but others told us that it was fun. All the rooms are around the outside of the building, with a courtyard in the middle, where there are two restaurants and lots of places to sit. On the inside of the walkways are tables and chairs so you can sit outside your room and look into the courtyard, much nicer than looking out at the building next door or the crowded streets of San Juan. As you'd expect of a former convent, there is a beautiful church next door, but alas, they had only Spanish services (although we were tempted to go anyway). The only slow service I saw was when the printer at the two-station computer center was out of paper, but the front desk eventually gave me paper and I appreciated being able to print our boarding passes at the hotel. We ate dinner at the restaurant on the second floor, pricey but delicious and very romantic, and we ate breakfast at the restaurant on the first floor, which was also pricey (what you'd expect for an upscale hotel) and yummy. There is a small plunge pool on the sun deck, as well as (I believe) a jacuzzi - when is it ever cool enough to need one? - and deck chairs. Beach towels provided. Apparently for the price of a cab ride (about $15) you can go to a sister hotel and use the beach club there; the beaches are public but this would give you facilities as well. Since we were there for only one night we didn't take advantage of this.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Don't book weddings through Carnival or Wedding Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennyjenny25
Reviews.Content: Posted on 4-7-10 to trip Advisor on Hotel El Convento I book my wedding through Carnival to get married at Hotel El Convento in San Juan Puerto Rico on March 21, 2010, the hotel is gorgeous! Everything else about my wedding went terrible. It was the first wedding Carnival had done off of the ship, yet failed to inform me of that issue. Carnival contracts out labor through the Wedding Experience and they provide you with an "experienced wedding coordinator." She was no where close to experienced, she picked us up a few days prior to our wedding to get the last details squared away with our marriage certificate. She arrived over an hour late! Then once she finally arrived her car was filthy! She informed us that she was going to be our transportation from Carnival to Hotel El Convento on our wedding day. She arrived to pick myself and my father up at the pier 10-15minuets late; since she was late there I arrived to my wedding late! She proceeded to rush the photographer while he was taking pictures before the ceremony had begun. The photographer that the Wedding Experience hired was terrible; he tried to make me kiss my dad! We had a major language barrier and then he proceeded to try and charge us $350.00 more because he was only hired for an hour, (I had already paid Carnival in full). The minister arrived over 20 minuets late and was rushed by the coordinator to hurry up with the ceremony. The ceremony begins and I suddenly realize the vows that I had emailed to Rosie from the Wedding experience a week earlier were nowhere in the ceremony! Now, I am back from my honeymoon, Carnival and The Wedding Experienced have yet to apologize. I received my marriage certificate in the mail and there is incorrect information on it, after I paid the Wedding Experience $285.00 for the certificate! My husband and I have tried to contact The Wedding Experience to tell them about what happened and they have yet to call me back. All of the staff at Hotel El Convento had nothing to do with my wedding, if they had been involved Iâ€™m sure it would have been fantastic!! I will never recommend Carnival or the Wedding Experience to anyone! No one deserves to go through an awful experience like that! I would recommend the hotel to anyone, although do book your wedding through Carnival or the Wedding Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel El Convento -- This is the place o stay”
Reviews.Author: Kay-go
Reviews.Content: As i write this review, I am sitting on the third floor balcony of the El Convento Hotel. (Its actually Hotel El Convento, according to their website, though Google, which has is mapped wrong, and tripadvisor call it El Eonvento Hotel. The address is correct though - 100 Cristo St.) I am sipping the complimentary tea that is available 24 hours, along with local fresh coffee. This hotel has made all the difference in my trip to Puerto Rico. I am staying at three different hotels on my trip and this is by far the best so far. The location is ideal. In a very safe part of OLD San Juan, right on a piazza. The hotel is beautiful while retaining much of its original historic charm. The staff is fabulous. Not only were they a breeze to work with while booking my room, they gave wonderful recommendations of where to go while in town. These recommendations included a trip to the island of Vieques which requires you stay overnight. The woman i spoke with, Christine, even gave me the name of a good place to stay on the island. Though this other hotel had no affiliation with Hotel Convento. Upon check-in, I received the same exceptional service. The bellman, and receptionist were kind beyond words. They made you feel like you had just made a new friend. The hotel has a roof top pool with breathe-taking views of the bay and the city. At 6 o'clock every night they have a complimentary wine reception. Though i have been to other hotel who hold similar cocktail hours, El Convento's was really fantastic. 6 different wines to choose from and 6 or 7 fresh gourmet cheeses, cracker and fruit to nibble on with the wine. They restocked all of this the whole hour. It was fabulous. In the room, their are great stereos, nice flat screen tvs, complimentary water bottles, and robes (they looked very comfy but i didn't actually use one). I slept wonderfully in the bed, the bathrooms were of a good size, and they offer Aveda products in the bathroom (no cost of course). The turn down service was so nice. I really can't say enough good things about this hotel. I have absolutely fallen in love with it. Though it is a bit on the expensive side, it is truly worth the cost. Without hesitation, I give Hotel El Convento my strongest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: relax_n_eat
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to find a great deal for the hotel. It was about $120/night in October 2008. The staff was very friendly, took care of cleaning the rooms when we were out for a few hours, refilled waters and hygiene products at least once daily. The rooms were decently sized, with nice decor and really comfortable beds. The only downfall of the hotel is their restaurants. The food is overpriced, and the quality is average at best. For breakfast I really recommend going to Bonbonera (a 5-10 minute walk) instead. However, the wine & Cheese hour were excellent. It was an assortment of various cheese and wines, in addition to crackers and fruit, tea and coffee. Some evening we just did the cheese and wine hour and then grabbed a snack from a nearby restaurant. The location is ideal to explore Old San Juan. The place and surroundings are charming. Obviously there is no beach close by, but if that's what you are looking for you should go to other parts of the island like Rincon or visit Culebra (which is amazing).

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: serg94
Reviews.Content: the good - Great location. Wonderful facility. The place felt like a museum as you walk in. Excellent bed. Our window overlooked a quiet sidestreet. The room can be "blacked-out" and has a sound barrier door to seal off any noise you may get from the courtyard. The wine and cheese hour was excellent. good selections available. Free water was a nice perk. Terrace level was lovely, including the undersized pool and jacuzzi. Visited the Tapas restaurant twice. nice bar. good food, but overpriced. The bad - Watch out for the BATS! There's a courtyard that has a large tree that seems to be popular with the bats, as were the evidence of the critters along the upper levels and the awnings and walls. There was also a 2nd/turn down service that the housekeeper does that was nice but not necessary. If you're out and about visiting the city, you wouldn't know that they'd been in your room a couple times that day. I know you can spend over $300 to stay here, but I would not have spent that much. If you're looking to spend that much in the carribbean, you need to either have a decent pool or have a beach. The pool is good enough to take a dip, and the beach is not accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Small, charming, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: elveese
Reviews.Content: El Convento is a lovely choice in Old San Juan. The location is wonderful, the staff attentive, and the food the best in this part of the city. The wine and cheese reception each night is first rate. Lovely roof-top sunset views, too. My only complaint is with the "comp" at Isla Verde. You have to take a cab each way - at $20 per. That's not a "comp." El Convento should provide a shuttle bus. Also, the "comp" is a Courtyard By Marriott, several notches down from the quality of El Convento. If you want beach or pool, stay elsewhere. If you'd like old world elegance, you'll be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful peaceful lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: RicoDeb
Reviews.Content: I had stopped in the lobby of this hotel ten years ago and always knew I would want to stay here if I ever came back to Old San Juan. The hotel did not disappoint. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The common spaces in the hotel - whether it be the table on the courtyard right outside our room door, the coffee / wine & cheese hour serving room and patio, or the staircases between floors themselves, all represented a breezy comfortable respite from the hot and bustling streets outside the hotel walls in Old San Juan. But when we did feel like venturing out, there is no better location from which to walk the streets of the city, venturing into the churches, museums, shops, restaurants or bars. And of course, from this location, you can get up for an early tour of the forts and their grounds before the teaming crowds arrive. It was perfect! Topped off with an incredible Italian dinner on the lovely outdoor patio of the reasonably priced restaurant: La Cucina di Ivo.

Reviews.Title: “I am looking for justification to return”
Reviews.Author: Ajax531
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our stay based on what we read on the internet. I am always leary of internet reviews and tend to discount those on either extreme. In this case we were absolutely delighted. We've done a fair amount of travel in Europe and North America. This was one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. To put this in some perspective my wife will not consider staying in less than a 4 star hotel. The staff were outstanding, friendly and helpful. I've already recommended the El Centro and Old San Juan to eveybody who we've told about the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with a lot of character & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Key2777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near many attractions, shopping areas, and restaurants. Everything is basically within walking distance of the hotel. It has a rooftop pool with a nice view from the terrace. I enjoyed the great ambiance from the open-air courtyard and from the open-air hallways. The suite was spacious and the beds were comfortable, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment - They Try to rip you off”
Reviews.Author: bibo006
Reviews.Content: I booked a city-view room for two nights. When I arrived they put me in a dark interior room with no windows apart from a small skylight up high near the ceiling. The room smelled so strongly of mildew that it almost made me sick. I went back down to the desk to complain. Without too much fuss, they put me into another room, which actually had windows and a city view -- what I had booked and paid for. But I had to move my own luggage. The whole thing wasted several hours of my limited time in San Juan, that could have been spent enjoying the city. I got the impression that they realized that the room they first assigned me was crap, but they were trying to see if they could get away with it. I'm sure there are some people that might just accept what they get without question. The second room, although much better than the dungeon they tried to put me into, was certainly not anything special - not what you'd expect of a first class hotel. And, it also smelled strongly of mildew. The mildew stench was in my clothes (even those I hadn't unpacked) for several days afterward. Won't be returning to this rip-off of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel right in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Roopesh1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location and while the room was a little dark, it had very high ceilings and was very well furnished. I missed one night of my stay due to the pathetic actions of expedia and US airways, and really regretted not being able to stay one more night. I was only in Puerto Rico for 2 nights as I was on my way to the BVI for a sailing trip. On the way back, I stayed at the Marriot which had a distinct lack of character and charm compared to El Convento. The rooftop terrace was a nice place to unwind in the evening and just walking around the old town and the fort was very interesting. The colours in the old town are fantastic for amateur photographers such as myself. Also don't miss getting up early to find the kite seller as there is a fantastic breeze to fly kites in the park at the old fort in the late afternoon which we missed out on...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RayKski
Reviews.Content: The El Convento Hotel is located in the heart of Old San Juan, up the road from the ceremonial harbor gates, across the street from the city's main cathedral. Shopping, restaurants and clubs are all a very short walk away. The hotel room was top rate with all the amenities taken care of. The hotel setting with all rooms opening up on its center courtyard, couldn't be prettier or more inviting. The only negative is the pool. It's better described as a slightly over sized hot tub without the hot water. But you really don't visit Old San Juan to sit in the hotel swimming pool. The hotel is expensive but you'd be hard tested to find a better setting and better accommodations in the heart of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: wildrnr
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, charming historic hotel. But what really sets it apart is the staff. Friendly, helpful and willing to do what it takes to make your stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Historic City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Old San Juan. It is not near any beaches. It is in walking distance of the two main Spanish Forts. It is also near some great restaurants and shopping. The hotel is gorgeous and actually has a very good restaurant on the ground floor. The open air hallways are fantastic. The rooms are gorgeous and quiet, with an extra door in the rooms to seal off noise (and in the AC). Comfortable beds. The rooftop pool is small, only about 5 ft x 10 ft in size. The outdoor patios are great, with some wonderful views of the water. The wine reception is very enjoyable and worth attending. The staff was generally attentive, but one staff member seemed insistent on recommending restaurants that were more associated with his friends or relatives than for the food or quality. However, while others made great recommendations (St. Germaine and Marmalade). The internet and phone system went out for a few hours of our stay, but the staff responded well. Also, they did a great job recommending local attractions. This is a great hotel to see the forts and to enjoy old san juan. They do have associations with beach side hotels, both of which are near nice beaches. One negative is that Old San Juan has many stray, mangy cats and pigeons. Enough that I feel it is necessary to mention. Both types seem to get too close for comfort. Just something to consider if, like my wife, you don't like cats or birds.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl95
Reviews.Content: My husband found this gem for our wedding anniversary. The room was beautiful and the staff quite friendly. Located in Old San Juan, it was within easy walking distance of many historical sites and relaxing restaurants. The rooftop soaking pool offered a great way to see the sunset as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad value for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALagosMarmol
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a small room, small bathroom Nice view yes Good value if it is an all inclusive price Very bad value if you are paying USD400 a night with No breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Haunting”
Reviews.Author: Workhorse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like watching a movie, everything seemed to move in slow motion. It was just so beautiful, almost eerie. Maybe I was a little heady after spending a week at a resort, but the place seemed somewhat otherworldly. The architecture, vegetation, music, food, even the other guests were all enchanting. And thats a word I don't think I have ever used in real life. I was looking for something unusual when I booked this hotel, and I got what I was looking for. It wasn't the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, or the most lavish bathroom - but I would go back there without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ukiah17
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Old San Juan before, so staying at El Convento proved to be a brilliant idea. It was right in the middle of the district, within easy walking distance of shopping, restaurants and historical venues. The hotel itself was elegant and comfortable, the staff friendly and accomodating, the room beautiful and inviting. We stayed in the Queen Vista room on the 5th (top) floor which was on a corner of the building - which meant it had two large windows with French doors and the harbor could be seen from each of them. The bed was very comfortable and there was ample seating in the room. Met some real interesting people during our courtyard breakfasts and at the wine and cheese gatherings in the evening. This is a very top notch, romantic place to be if you are visiting Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair36
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel , and was a bit wary after reading some previous reviews. The room was on the small side , but very nicely done , with a beautiful view of the bay. The bathroom was also small, but it is an old historic hotel , so that is to be expected. The staff was excellent , with the exception of the lady at the front desk that checked us in . She was miserable, sneezing and wiping her nose before handing us the pen or our keys. ! Everyone else was fabulous , from the valet , to the waiter at breakfast. There was great attention to detail , which I appreciate. The complimentary wine and cheese hour was great , and very much enjoyed. The added soundproof door in the room also was appreciated and worked very well at blocking any noise. The complimentary bottled water and turn down service, all good. Is it the best SLH I've ever stayed at ? No , but it was very enjoyable , it was elegant , and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: rwfilice
Reviews.Content: We got married here in February, 2010, and it was a great experience. They were critical in helping us pull off a flawless wedding and reception - everyone had a great time. Patio Nispero is a great place for a ceremony, and their reception area is great too. Drinks and food were outstanding. Many of our guests stayed here for several days around the wedding and everyone loved it. The rooms are beautiful, the restaurants and common areas are great for socializing, and the pool and hot tub are great. The staff is very helpful if you want to do anything around Old San Juan. Highly recommended if you are thinking about getting married in Old San Juan, or if you are just looking for a great place to stay. Wedding tips: Use the El Convento wedding planners - Paola was ours and was awesome, get the Presidential suite for the nights around your wedding - it is a great place for the bride to get ready, use Patio Nispero for the ceremony, and use Salon Campache for the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: edauphin
Reviews.Content: Arrived at El Convento on Feb. 16 for 3 nights after a long drive from Rincon. The hotel is excellent. The front desk staff were great, the room was fabulous with every little thing done right: goose down (not feather) pillows, Turkish towels and bathrobes, turn down service, Aveda shower/shampoo/soap, chocolates on pillows in evening, etc. The wine and cheese reception is fantastic - four different reds, four different whites, plus a very good selection of cheeses (bries, manchego, soft goat, bleu, port salut, etc.). The common areas are meticulously cared for. We used both the sister beaches (La Concha and Courtyard); I would skip the Courtyard - a $20 cab ride gets you to a musty Marriott with a pretty good beach right behind the airport. La Concha is much better - the facility itself is stylish and well cared for with a leisurely but chic atmosphere and although the beach is smaller, we liked it better. The only thing we really could complain about (and it did matter to us) is that El Convento's food is a disappointment. The Tapas place is expensive and the food is sad: sliced olives from a jar, 'chorizo' sausages that were cold and crappy. The Nispero patio for breakfast was also disappointing. Our eggs were room temperature at best (both orders), and we each got about 5 little potato home fries. The service is very good and it's clear that they're trying hard, but the quality in the food department needs help at El Convento. I don't write this to complain too much - our stay at El Convento was absolutely fantastic and we really, really loved it. I would recommend this hotel very highly and I would stay there again. It really was fantastic in virtually every respect. I just wouldn't recommend the food there. Instead, try St. Germain at 156 Calle del Sol - just a 5 min walk from El Convento. That place was fantastic - local, fresh food with a lot of variety and close attention to detail, and surprisingly affordable. St. Germain was the best restaurant we found.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a small, boutique hotel in San Juan...”
Reviews.Author: birdyDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Juan to celebrate my birthday. We went with another couple and spent 3 nights at El Convento. It was perfect for our mini vacation as we enjoyed the Spanish style rooms and open courtyard. It is not the height of luxury, but if you are looking for a small, unique hotel in the center of Old San Juan, then this is your place. It is convenient to shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing but slightly away from the crowds coming off the cruise ships. The staff was helpful and attentive as they made our dinner reservations every evening and made our stay very comfortable. We enjoyed the wine and cheese reception each night and the small pool area was pleasant and comfortable. If you are looking for a large pool area with a poolside bar - this is not the place for you. However, we took advantage of a day trip to the sister property, La Concha, which provided us with the resort feel for several hours. Staff at El Convento provided us with a letter to transfer any costs incurred at La Concha to our bill at El Convento. That was a nice plus. However, we all agreed we preferred El Convento over La Concha because of the smaller more intimate setting. The rooms at El Convento were comfortable; we enjoyed the bathrobes and slippers, yet the bathrooms were small. My husband was pleased with the second sound proof door, which was very effective in keeping the din from the courtyard out of our room. I am not a huge fan of strong air conditioning, so my only complaint was it was too cold in the room. I look forward to returning some time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much I wanted to live at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunset29
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at El Convento. Would definitely stay here again. Pleasant staff, beautiful, historic atmosphere. The hotel courtyard is beautiful. This is not your cookie-cutter hotel. It has lots and lots of atmosphere. I got the feeling I wanted to live at the hotel, I liked it so much. Will definitely be back. It's also very romantic if you want to go somewhere for a special occasion. Although, just go, don't have to wait for a special occasion. The wine and cheese event is a nice touch. It's fun, free and you get to meet other guests. At the end of my stay, I even left my cell phone in the pocket of the white lounge robe in the room and when I called from the airport on the way home, the staff went and retrieved it and sent it to me by UPS. Got the phone back in a few days, no problem. There was a spanish singer outside at night on the bench outside of the hotel who gave quite a good performance. I asked and he is not affiliated with the hotel but it provided a lot of atmosphere. All in all, I absolutely loved my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! But front desk could be better.”
Reviews.Author: star4eva
Reviews.Content: My friend had her wedding reception here : ), and the accomodations were FABULOUS. The reception food was DELICIOUS. The staff is fluent in English, and it's right in the middle of Old San Juan, so definitely take a walking tour (but don't go down the steps into La Perla by youself. ; D ) I can't give 5 stars because I asked the front desk for something a few times, and it never happened, including my wake up call the morning I was leaving. Other than that, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento - Beautiful, Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRa
Reviews.Content: Our stay was on Jan 31, 2010 for one night post cruise. I was thrilled to find this hotel. The location is perfect in Old San Juan though not in walking distance to the port if you have a lot of luggage - just a short taxi ride away. I knew immediately that we would love this hotel as we were greeted by Ivan (with a sincere smile!) to help us with our luggage and to the front desk. The front desk staff is first rate. Though our room was not ready (we arrived early) they immediately stored our luggage as well as took our cell number to call us when our room was prepared so that we could go out and about the town. (Room 322) The room was 2 full size (?) beds but so comfortable with premium bedding and the best pillows ever! Flat screen HD television with satelite/movies etc. Bath amenities by AVEDA. Though small bathroom the tub/shower is nice and decor was perfect. Nice desk area with stationary and even post cards. Complementary bottled water and a refrigerator in the room Bath robes to use/slippers. We did not have any view..except an alley way where a coca cola truck was parked for deliveries in the morning. It did not matter to us as we were exhausted and it was a beautiful view out the front door! :) We were so tired and did not use it but a housekeeper knocked and asked if we would like turndown service, chocolates or ice in the evening. Very nice! The hotel itself is gorgeous with greenery everywhere. I'm not sure if the tree frogs are "real" or not but the chirping sounds in the trees was awesome. Beautiful restaurant areas and an Honor System room/bar/snacks on the 3rd level attached to a scenic outdoor patio area perfect to sip tea or coffee in the morning or have an afternoon cocktail. So many flowers and greenery..someone does an amazing job of keeping this hotel looking immaculate! There is a small pool area on the level above ..I wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy all the amenities. Also, at sister hotel La Concha (friends stayed there pre cruise - directly on beach with also gorgeous amenities!) There is a small but nice fitness area with proper equiptment downstairs. There were only two things that distracted from the beauty of this hotel. (Reminder.. these were just things that I would want to know about ahead of time or when considering a hotel..we booked this hotel through a discount booking agent but if I had to pay regular rates this would have definitely have been more of a factor...) There was a wedding/reception which went late into the night on the Sunday we stayed. It was VERY loud in the courtyard area. I appreciate the fact though that I think someone from the hotel might have quieted it down because it was completely quiet from about 1am to 5am. Front desk gave us a coupon for a free sangria but when we asked in the restaurant it is when you buy an entree. No worries we would just buy the cocktail with an app and then go out for a walk around town before leaving. 2. The waitress was not very pleasant and took a long time with drinks and food. We didn't see her again until time for the bill and then that took a long time too. Luckily, there was a terrific manager (female) who came right over and assisted us. I am just mentioning it because it was so "off" for such a nice hotel. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone..I'm sure the noise level isn't like that all the time and the location, service, rooms and beauty more than make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TerrySisk
Reviews.Content: Historic sights at your doorstep. Not isolated from local culture, like most luxury hotels. Located right in the middle of a 500-year-old walled city, opposite the cathedral. Rooms open onto colonnaded outdoor hallways flanking a large interior courtyard that houses several restaurants and bars. Wonderfully atmospheric. Not for those who want wall-to-wall carpeting (floors are Spanish tiles) or over-the-top luxury bathrooms (marble bathrooms are small and basic). Lounge on third floor has complimentary bottled water, coffee and tea and honor bar. Free daily wine/cheese reception 6-7 pm. Small rooftop plunge pool and hot tub. No beach (hotel provides shuttle service to a sister beach-front property). One-of-a-kind hotel beautifully restored and maintained. Public spaces outshine guestrooms. Member Small Luxury Hotels of the World and Historic Hotels of America.

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful, romantic, what I'd hoped Puerto Rico would be...”
Reviews.Author: LeopardSpot
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here and it was the best hotel we stayed in during our week in Puerto Rico. The rooms were small but beautifully decorated with a Spanish vibe. It had everything we needed - bathrobes, nice toiletries, free internet and great air conditioning. The room also had a double glazed door to keep out noise from the courtyard below. The hotel is right in the heart of Old San Juan which was great. We spent a lot of time wandering the streets checking out shops, cafes and the shore line up to El Moro (all within walking distance). There's a Ben & Jerry's ice-cream parlour around the corner, Cafe Puerto Rico a few blocks away (the best tres leches and mofongo on the island) and Cafe Raices is a must to experience traditional PR food and music. The hotel is across the road from the oldest church in PR and close to markets in the squares. This is a great first stop when you land in PR. Don't waste your time on the flashy uber hotels in Carolina (head to the west coast for that).

Reviews.Title: “also bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SaintLazare
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a good experience in this hotel. It was the longest check-in ever. The girl at the counter was inefficient and overly familiar. The room was small. But that's wasn't it. When we left the hotel, en route to the beach, we realized we had forgotten our cell phone in the room. We phoned the reception to tell and ask to keep it safe as we would return to San Juan in 5 days and we will pick it up then. The phone had been used, someone had been trying to get the code to make calls. When we exposed this situation to the manager he was most nonchalant about this and offered no apologies.

Reviews.Title: “The Room Affects the Experience”
Reviews.Author: ARubins
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at El Covento and I was somewhat disappointed. Although I was upgraded I didn't feel as though my room was anything special. The decor was blah, many pages were missing from the room service menu and I suspect my room had not been cleaned after the last guest - Many of the bathroom amenities were missing, the bath mat was on the floor beside the bed and the sheets were obviously dirty. I insisted that housekeeping clean from top to bottom which they did without question but I expect perfection from a hotel with the reputation El Convento has as a Small Luxury Hotel member. There are also small maintenance issues - my hall light was out and the phone by the pool isn't working. Having worked in a hotel, I understand regular routines staff go through to verify everything is in good working order, but it seems this routine is missing at El Convento. I have seen some of their other rooms and think your experience must be affected by the luxuriousness of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: adventurersnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, but it's not the charming-old-historic-convent-turned-luxury-hotel that people are hailing it to be. It feels like an upscale Marriot - a hundred or so tiny rooms fashioned by a corporate 'design team' with a text book understanding of Puerto Rican culture. There is something very inauthentic here - like Ethan Allen launching a new Spanish-Religious collection. Maybe we were delusional in thinking we would seed old nuns roaming the halls working the rosary instead of sun-burnt adolescents from Cleveland flanking the lobby with bags of Doritos. And while I suppose ambience isn't everybody's issue - there are plenty of other things to note about the hotel - both good and bad. The outstanding attribute is the staff. Everyone working here wants to help - everyone we spoke to was caring, friendly and smart. They are invested in your good time. This we loved. Everyone there deserves a raise. If you want good service and and to really feel looked after - this is the place to go. They are on it!! The food. The service that comes with the food is super. The food itself - not so much. It's good - but not inventive. El Convento is voted the best hotel in all of PR - and itâ€™s expensive. The food should blow you away. It just doesn't. Ceasar salad anyone? And then there is this wine and cheese event everyone is talking about. Newsflash - you won't be meeting you fiance(e) at this gathering. We're not being cynical, really. We went by and checked it out three times (who is going to knock a free glass of wine?) It's not the colorful social scene everyone is making it out to be - there were five or ten obese tourists sitting in solitary groups, not talking. And strong cheese in that kind of heat is never inspired. Not sure what else to say - at the right time of year when the rates are more in the $200-$300 range â€“ this would be a good hotel to check out. I guess when you are shelling out $500 during the winter holidays for a night in Old San Juan - you will have some expectations. As far as hanging at the hotel: The major problem is the pool - there really isnâ€™t one. There is a plunge pool on the 4th floor roof deck. If there's three people in the pool, you've just had a three way. Itâ€™s that small. There some lounge chairs there - about 10 of them - and truly, there is nothing atmospheric that might warrant a lazy afternoon there. On the plus, the view is interesting and you can make yourself a drink from the honor bar. Seemed like a good place to make friends. Drunk hotel guests found their way up there on the nights we were there and were passed out on the floor for the evening. Second: The ocean view they talk about - yeah it's there but its available from about 20% of the rooms ( ours had a view of it - but then it cost us $500 a night) - and it's not breathtaking on any account. You over look a lot of dilapidated buildings and rooftops - and so on a clear day, it's nice, but it doesnâ€™t bring home the Caribbean experience you hope for when you are surfing the net, planning your holiday. The biggest let down of all (which was a surprise when so many reviewers had heralded it) was the location. Huh? Not sure what everyone is going on about - the hotel is unimpressively situated in the middle of a cramped shopping district - loud, not that clean, and not so interesting - are any of us looking to spend time in Coach or Walgreens during an island getaway? We do need to give a plug for San Juan in general. We loved it !! Itâ€™s a great city, very festive and diverse and cool to hang in - but Condado is where it's happening - and that is $20 dollar cab ride from El Convento, and 20 minutes away. We live NYC - we know traffic. We have never seen traffic like this - to get a cab and go anywhere out of old San Juan - you can expect to sit and a gridlock for quite some time. Maybe this is during the holiday season only â€“ but that was our experience. So do yourself a favor - if you are a stickler for details or simply have a pulse, stay at their sister property - La Concha. And then visit Old San Juan for the day dine at Dragon Fly â€“ or have lunch at El Convento. Chk out the forts etc.. But don't stay there unless you are attending a conference near by or something. Not fun. Not scenic. Not cool. If you are looking for a vacation - just don't do it - you'll have no idea what you are doing in Puerto Rico instead of some place beautiful - and you'll have no idea why you are spending this money -

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are looking for location and comfort in the heart of Old San Juan.The rooms are nice, the hotel is beautiful, the pool and the gym are tiny.If you want to explore San Juan this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: morggie
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I spent two nights at El Convento at the end of our stay in Puerto Rico. The timing couldn't have been more perfect... it was the tail end of the low season so we got a wonderful rate (probably wouldn't have stayed there otherwise!). It was definitely one of the best places we've ever stayed at - clean, gorgeous, classy, but not pretentious and with character to spare! We loved the evening wine reception on the balcony. We would definitely stay there again - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: demieux
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay - a beautiful & clean boutique hotel, with a charming history.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MR_Lzy
Reviews.Content: We had room 324 from december 31, 2009 to January 2, 2010. Opposite this room across a narrow street is an open bar (El Batey) with very loud music and drunken people shouting, the first night until 06:30 in the morning, the next night we fell asleep at about 04:00 in the morning, the noise still going on. Furthermore the plumbing was far from perfect (I had to use a string to be able to shower). The promised fast internet connection was not working during our stay, neither was the hotel WiFi working. Only internet on 2 computers in the so called library. For the rest it was a nice room with ample space and nicely decorated. The hotel itself was very charming, the staff friendly and helpful and the food delicious. We would like to come back but in an other room! We found Old San Juan highly-priced, e.g. simple breakfast more expensive than a traditional Christmas meal with wine in Salinas (Cruisers Galley) on the south coast of P.R. M & R

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: wacoraised
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 of our 4 days anniversary trip to Puerto Rico. We truly enjoyed our stay. We appear to have received a good deal on our rate during the poor economy. If you want new and ultra-luxurious, I would not recommend staying here. However, if you enjoy character and personality, do stay here. The room was large and had the two door for sound. The bed was very comfortable. It was pouring when we arrived and we still needed to eat lunch. We received recommendations from the front desk and the bellman provided us with a large hotel umbrella for our walk. The cocktail hour was fantastic. On top of being free, the servers took time to explain the various cheeses and recommend pairings. In addition, the cocktail hour provided a perfect forum to met and chat with other visitors. We didn't use the pool at all. Instead, one afternoon we went to La Concha (i think is the sister hotel name) where I gambled and my wife sat by the pool. The lack of pool and beach was no big deal to us, because we had just come from staying outside of San Juan on the beach, but that is something to keep in mind if you are only staying at El Convento. It is certainly a swank trendy hotel if that is what you are about. Keep in mind that walking in Old San Juan is no small chore. All small concerns aside, it was exactly what my wife and I were looking. Likes: the character and beauty service general personality (both hotel and guests) location Dislike: had to pay for cab to use the sister resort pool and beach. they should provide a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but soso service”
Reviews.Author: SurfJogger
Reviews.Content: Most everything about this hotel is fantastic: the location in the historic center of the city; the rooms (even the small ones are spacious enough); the interior courtyard; the history; the a.m. coffee; and so forth. We really loved this place. The service was odd. The staff was very nice, but never seemed to deliver. Information was incorrect; promised services didn't happen. One would be wiser to consult guidebooks than to ask the staff -- with one exception: the walking tour guide, Sr. David, was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: FreidaMn
