Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at El Convento post-cruise and we found it to be overwhelmingly beautiful with a great staff and in such a convenient location to everything in Old San Juan. We had two connecting rooms, 509 and 510 which worked beautifully for my family. The courtyard is so romantic, and it was such a treat to take a break up on the rooftop where the kids could take a dip and I could relax and enjoy the stunning view. The manager's reception was a great bonus, we were able to enjoy complementary water, wine and cheese and crackers before going out to dinner. There were also bottles of complementary water in our rooms and free coffee, too. We dined one evening at the El Picoteo restaurant where we enjoyed tapas outdoors with a really good white sangria and a delicious creme brulee dessert. There is a coffee kiosk in the Plaza de Armas a block away where you can get a great cup of coffee and pastries for a very nice price. The hotel allows access at its two sister hotels' beaches if you desire, we had stayed at one of these hotels, the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde, before the cruise and recommend it for an afternoon at the beach if you use this service. This hotel is heavenly and I am so glad we had a chance to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing mgrs. reception, and nice rooms in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ChatoAguilar
Reviews.Content: I just organized a trip including 16 others and we chose to stay in el Convento for four nights. It is in a perfect location in Old San Juan... walking distance to El Morro, La Fortaleza, shopping, dining, bars, etc. The manager's wine reception from 6PM to 7PM is awesome. They cart out tons of bottles of wine and nice cheese and crackers. We'd always meet up there on the verandah before leaving for dinner leaving with a few nice glasses of Spanish wine in our bellys. Not too bad. The rooms were smaller per se, but fine. The balcony views were awesome. The plunge pool was warm and sunny, but small. Close by I would recommend eating at Raices and el Jibarito. We had a blast singing karaoke at Lupi's as well, but the food there (Mexican) was so-so at best. You can also visit the sister properties. We went to the Marriott at Isla Verde. Nice to hang at the beach, but glad we didn't stay there with the airport being right on top of us! Also, the beaches at El Condado were not as nice. VERY glad we stayed in Old San Juan and at El Convento while in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable hotel and 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: moretripsneeded
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Puerto Rico and don't intend to just hang on the beach each day, I highly recommend Old San Juan - it's a mix of old and new, traditional and modern, and friendly, clean and hospitable - a joy to discover. If you are going to Old San Juan, I highly recommend El Convento in the heart of Old San Juan. The hotel fits nicely into the traditional looking town. The furnishings, exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, great food, open air restaurant in the courtyard, wine and cheese parties on the roof, and more make it one of the truly exceptional hotels in the world. I believe that I speak with some authority having traveled extensively to Central America, Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the U.S., and having had the privilege of staying in top hotels (and some that claimed to be). And by the way, if you want beach, you can always use their sister hotel that sits right on the beach. El Convento will leave you relaxed and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: natreb
Reviews.Content: My 16 yr old daughter and I visited early in December. We were pleasantly surprised that this was also the SoFo Food festival in Old San Juan. There were over 30 restaurants who set up outdoor bars, food samplings and bands. Lots of fun mingling in the streets and trying different local cuisine choices. We loved El Convento. Explore the hotel and some of the small terraces. We were always the only ones there and great for grabbing some quiet time with a book. Our best find however, by far, was the creme brulee at the Tapas Bar in hotel. A must try! This is the only place to stay in San Juan in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Old Town San Juan, this is a great place.”
Reviews.Author: Jallock
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old convent that has been turned into an elegant hotel. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “History and elegance in a wonderful, walkable location.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is a must if you want to immerse yourself in Old San Juan. It casts a spell on you from the moment you step off the busy cobblestone streets and into the cathedral like entry hall. The building features a large interior courtyard filled with palms and a lovely rooftop terrace. There are silver urns filled with excellent coffee and a tea service available all day on the terrace, as well as an amazing honor bar with the ingredients for personally crafted cocktails. In the evenings a complimentary wine and cheese bar is presented by gracious hosts. Our guest room featured smoothly aged tile floors and wooden shuttered full length windows which could be opened to the sunshine and breeze. This isn't modern luxury, but a step back in time in style and architecture. The location is prime for visiting Old San Juan on foot- very central to the sights. We enjoyed a meal in the tapas bar and a breakfast in the open air courtyard. Both restaurants provided fine service and very good meals. We also enjoyed the small rooftop pool while taking a break in the afternoon. It provides a scenic view over the rooftops and bay. We would gladly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: yanaseca
Reviews.Content: If I could give this hotel 10 stars I would. We first stayed at El Convento in 2006 and immediately fell in love with its charm and warm, friendly service. Since then, we've traveled a lot and stayed in a lot of different hotels, but El Convento has always remained one of our favorites. So when we decided to get married, the question of where to get married was easy to answer. We got married at El Convento over Thanksgiving weekend and it was everything we hoped for and more. I planned this wedding long distance from Los Angeles and when you do that, you never how things will actually turn out, but thanks to the hotel, it was really a truly special day. Special props go out to Carolina who was our wedding coordinator at the hotel and to all the staff who are warm, friendly and professional. The rooms are also beautiful, comfortable and add to the charm of the place. If you're staying in Old San Juan or want to throw a very special event in Old San Juan, El Convento is the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travellotte
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to add to all the other spectacular reviews. This hotel is simply the best! If you like Old World Spanish charm, then you will certainly enjoy yourself here. If you are looking for something ultra modern, stay somewhere else. The hotel is conveniently located near the airport ($22 taxi ride), the port ($17 taxi ride) and Old San Juan city centre (60 seconds on foot compared with a $20 taxi ride from the Condado area). The plunge pool and terrace are beautiful. The happy hour is great with some very nice wine and assortment of cheese. The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful - Melanie and Raymond should be applauded for their service. We stayed pre and post cruise and had different rooms each time. The rooms are well appointed with water, snacks and a complimentary turndown service. There are also complimentary computers on the third floor. These little additions are what makes this hotel a real value for your money. Old San Juan is a lively place and this Hotel is no different. They have added sound proof doors to the rooms so noise was not an issue; regardless, we recommend a higher floor if possible. The El Convento also has a well appointed, though a small gym which we utilised. This is a really nice touch for such a charming Hotel. The food is excellent in the Hotel's restaurants with some of the best tapas we have yet tasted, try the shrimp in garlic! We would not hesitate to stay here again and in fact we have decided this is the only place we will stay when we return to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Hotel with Style”
Reviews.Author: asdlfkj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, we have spent two nights at El Convento in Mid-November. It was a really pleasant experience. As it was low season they gave us a room upgrade without us even asking for it. Rooms are well decorated and have lots of flair. The jacuzzi on the roof is awesome and open 24/7. The stuff is very accommodating helping us with our onward transport and giving restaurant recommendations. It was a real treat to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ACAkka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a few days on Old San Juan. We loved Hotel El Convento!!! A nice boutique hotel feel with many extras. The hotel had a nice intimate and boutique feel, yet felt very spacious due to its configuration with an internal courtyard. We had two days of rain, but thoroughly enjoyed sipping sangria and tapas at the in house tapas bar. We enjoyed the rooftop pool. While it is small, it gave us the chance to have some nice conversations with some other interesting guests. The cocktail hour was also a nice chance to relax around the interior courtyard. I don't want to miss the location, which was dead center Old San Juan and far from the bustle of the cruise ship guests. I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyz2001
Reviews.Content: Our stay at El Convento was great. This hotel is centrally located, close to all local shops and nice little restaurants. We walked around Old San Juan and come back to the hotel to rest a little when we're tired. It was really convenient. The front desk receptions were very helpful in giving suggestions on where to eat and hang out. The room was very quiet (completely soundproof) when you closed the doors, window, and curtains. The bed was so comfortable that I slept like a baby. I love the Spanish designs of the entire hotel and the rooms plus the modern touch (high speed internet complimitary) on the amenities. The only minor complaint I have was that our room was not cleaned timely due to a little misunderstanding. I put out the sign on the door that said "Housekeeping Service Please". I think in general the housekeepers don't read the sign and they assumed that if there's a sign, it meant "Privacy Please". Perhaps the hotel should either reinforce the housekeepers to read better or simply not have double-sided signs to be hung on the doors. Our room was not cleaned until later in the evening during their "Turndown round" or evening room setup. I guess it wasn't a big deal since we were out most of the day. We were too busy trying out local restaurants and cafes nearby, we forgot to try out the Tapas place at the hotel, which we heard it was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Our BEST Hotel Stay anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: stabletrading
Reviews.Content: If you want luxury, comfort, perfect location, the friendliest and most gracious staff, first class accommodations you need to stay at El Convento. We have stayed in numerous hotels and nothing compares. El Convento is PERFECT across the board. Cannot say enough great things about this treasure. We did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric, unique, excellent service .....”
Reviews.Author: LadyLSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in El Convento Hotel before boarding a small yacht to cruise around the caribbean. If you want a glass and steel hotel dont stay here. If you want a unique hotel with excellent service situated in a wonderful position overlooking a small square and the cathedral in the old part of San Juan this is for you. There is a small pool and jacuzzi on the hotel roof which is wonderful and was never crowded - we were often the only two people there. The cheese and wine the hotel offers for an hour early evening is a really nice touch and the balcony where you sit overlooks the square, so you can see the world pass by, weddings take place in the cathedral and there is a very good guitarist who sits in the square for a couple of hours in the evening. The tapas bar served wonderful food, the breakfast was delicious. The only disappointment was a meal we had in the restaurant across the road which is featured on the hotel's website, Il Perugino. We had a very poor meal there, very expensive and certainly not of the standard I would have expected. The rooms are furnished in dark Spanish furniture, the beds very comfortable. The bathroom was small but had everything one would need. The hotel itself is incredibly beautiful situated around the open courtyard with a wonderful old tree within the courtyard. Weddings also take place in this area but we didnt find this a problem at all and in fact it added to the interest of the place. The staff were very helpful and I was very impressed to get prompt response to an email I sent before my arrival requesting a good view (which they honoured) and I received another email on my return hoping that we had had an enjoyable stay. I would not recommend this hotel for children - a beach hotel would be preferable as there are no places for children to play and the pool is small and parents would have a hard time preventing them aggravating anyone else in it. Another positive for me was the Coach handbag shop not far away with some really good bargains! You can walk to most places, the fort, restaurants, shops. I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AOVirginia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect. The location, the building, the rooms, the service, it has everything.

Reviews.Title: “Cell Phone Pirates of the Caribbean at El Convento”
Reviews.Author: christianneanastasia
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were so excited to be staying at El Convento for the first two nights of our much-needed vacation in Puerto Rico--we travel frequently in Central America and the Caribbean, and this property looked like the perfect combination of historic charm and upscale service. We were assigned room 315, on the hotel's third story, and found the bed comfortable, the bathroom small but adequate (good Aveda amenities, too!), and the little seating area with a table and two chairs a nice place to have coffee in the morning. We enjoyed the free hot coffee, tea, and bottled water, liked the manager's reception, and had a nice lunch at El Picoteco (the hotel's tapas restaurant) on a day when rain poured so hard that leaving the hotel really wasn't an option (street drainage in a city that old is, not surprisingly, a little lacking). But all these good memories, unfortunately, are overshadowed by the fact that someone from the hotel's staff came into our room, in our absence, and stole my partner's cell phone from where it sat on the desk just inside the secondary door to the room (each room has a little hallway which leads to the bedroom), along with a small amount of money also sitting on the desk. How do I know it was a hotel person? Well, there were two keys to the room, and they were with us at all times, and secondly, this theft occurred the same night that I had answered the door to refuse turndown service before we headed out to dinner. When we left, the people doing the turndown service were a few doors down and clearly watched us leave (as in, I saw them looking at us as we walked away). We came back around 10 and went to sleep, and thus did not realize the theft had occurred until the next morning (when we noticed the phone charger was still plugged into the wall but, um, not connected to a phone, and that the couple of dollars we'd set aside for the maids was also missing). After tearing the room apart to make sure that the phone hadn't fallen behind something, or gotten tossed in a bag of ours, we contacted the front desk immediately, and the man working said he'd look into it with housekeeping, but when we got in touch with him three hours later he told us he was still checking on the situation. What was there to check out? Someone ON THE STAFF CAME INTO OUR ROOM AND STOLE OUR PHONE. In my opinion, the issue should've ended there with them filing an incident report and compensating us for our stay (you think it's excessive to ask the hotel to cover a two-night stay because one of its own employees is a thief?) And unfortunately, tracking down the thief was made impossible by the fact that a) the hotel has NO video surveillance in its corridors (and yes, I understand that the hotel is extremely old, but I think that's taking an unnecessary risk--what if someone fell in a hallway, or was assaulted by someone? It'd be his/her word against the hotel's!) and b) uses actual keys for their rooms, rather than the digital cardkeys more modern places use (which leave digital records when they're used so that entry/exits from rooms can be tracked if necessary). The front desk guy said he would fill out an incident report, and asked us if we wanted to file a police report too. I said that since it was a theft, we might as well, and he explicitly said that he would take care of both. So we left with no resolution, just a promise on their end to look into the situation (which included calling the place where we'd had dinner the night before to make sure we hadn't left it there--in case we were mistaken, I guess). We went on to our next hotel (we stayed at a total of four hotels on this trip, and this--the most upscale of them all!--is the only one where we had a problem), and heard nothing from them for two days. Then, on the fourth day, WE called THEM and were given a little bit of a runaround on the phone (the manager was not at the desk, but would return in an hour or so and give us a call back; three hours later we called back (incurring charges for all these calls, of course!) and reached one of the receptionists/front desk people--a sweet and helpful girl, but utterly powerless to do anything--who said that the manager had left for the night but that someone would call us tomorrow about it), so on the fifth day of our vacation, we spoke to Soledad, reexplaining the situation AGAIN, and she told us that all she could do was to get in touch with the hotel's insurance company and send us paperwork to fill out so we might be reimbursed for the value of the phone. She also told us that we'd been misinformed by the first man we spoke to at the hotel, and that it was impossible for them file a police report on our behalf--we'd have to be present to do so. We felt that this was completely unacceptable--the insurance paperwork would take several weeks at least to be processed, she said, and we'd been dealing with this situation for most of our brief vacation and wanted a resolution. Soledad called us back the next day and offered to compensate us for one night's stay at the hotel (as well as for a $99 phone usage charge we'd incurred while calling a COLLECT number at El Convento, believe it or not). We were exhausted at this point and accepted the offer so that we could finally stop thinking about it and enjoy the last day of our vacation. Overall, my impression is that the hotel is a great property with nice amenities, but in light of its internal security issues I cannot comfortably recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: CodgersontheMove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly magnificent! The service is incomparable! My wife lost a pair of prescription sunglasses in a taxi. When she mentioned this to the doorman, Jaime, he proceeded to ask her questions to determine who the driver was, where she was sitting in the cab, etc. Two days went by; then he approached my wife to tell her that he had found the driver at the airport, had searched the cab and found the glasses on the floor of the cab. We have never experienced such above the call of duty service! The accommodations were great, and the location is in the heart of Old San Juan--close to restaurants, shopping, and the two impressive forts. The evening wine and cheese was a wonderful way to meet other guests and to relax before going to dinner. All in all, it was a superb hotel--probably one of the very best we've ever stayed in, and that's saying something since we are in our 70's and have traveled the world over.

Reviews.Title: “so nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: liltravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento Oct 30 and 31 09. Though it was way more than I would usually pay ($US245/night), it was worth it for location and quiet. After reading about cheaper hotels in Old San Juan being noisy, I figured the price would keep out the young partiers, though of course that is not always the case. As it was Hallowe'en the night before I left on my cruise, I was afraid I wouldn't sleep, but the hotel is so solidly built I heard nothing at all. There are also soundproofing doors out to the alley and to the middle courtyard. Not so lucky were the people who stayed at The Hilton Caribe that night - I was told they had a 10,000 person party and no one was able to sleep or even approach the hotel in a taxi. The El Convento hotel itself is charming, ancient yellows and dark woods, soft beds, deluxe bath products, and great service. I threw my neck out dancing salsa one night and wished I had my chiropractor from home. Soledad from the front desk fixed me up with Jesus, a registered massage therapist, who did a great job and got my mobility back. Hiram on the front desk attended to my every need including luggage storage. The hotel has a reception with snacks nightly which is very nice and unlimited free bottled water and internet!!! Its location is unbeatable, across from a historic church and right in the middle of everything, a few blocks from all the restaurants, bars, Starbucks, pretty plazas, the fort, etc, anything you want to see or do. Anyone on a cruise must come a few days early to explore San Juan. There are two free trolleys with lots of hop-on hop-off stops, you can ride them all day and they will take you anywhere but the Panamerican pier, which unfortunately requires a $17 taxi for those departing on Royal Caribbean. From the hotel, I walked to the Spirits of Puerto Rico dinner at Baru, put on by Legends of Puerto Rico. Not cheap ($90) but the food was yummy and plentiful and we got a full lesson on rums and tasted 12 different ones. Leader Debbie Morales is great and joining others certainly was more fun than doing it on my own! Had fresh squeezed juice and cinnamon roll at the institution known as La Bombonera, a friendly breakfast place in OSJ. Food at Parrot Club was ok, good if you like Latin jazz and bottomless fresh juice again. El Convento also has an agreement with the beach club at La Concha in Condado, so I went to try it out, and was able to bill lunch to my account at El Convento. I could have taken the bus but as time was a priority, just swallowed the $15 taxi fare to Condado. La Concha was very nice, modern, sort of charmless but great service and gym. A well-guarded beach provided lounges and the infinity pool overlooking the beach was so pretty! I preferred walking around OSJ over Condado. El Convento has a small plunge pool on the roof, which you need when it is hot!! The only reason I would not give the room 5* is there was a lack of good water pressure, but other than that it was a real pleasure at this hotel. See more San Juan comments in my review of Courtyard Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous character hotel”
Reviews.Author: natster1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon following a cruise. We were here for two nights but wish we could have stayed longer. On arrival we were much earlier than the checking in time of 3pm but the staff were more than happy to keep our luggage in a safe place so that we didnt have to carry it with us all day. When we did return to check in the bell boys were excellent and so helpful, even telling us a little of the history of the hotel. The room we stayed in was lovely, full of character ad although we didnt ask for a sea view room we could still see the sea from our room. The room had excellent air con and good tv too. The bathrooms are very clean and have everything you need. The only downside was the size of the bed which was a double - would have been nicer to have a little larger bed, however the bed was very comfortable. On our first night after coming back from a meal out, the staff had thoughtfully displayed rose petals in the shape of a heart on our bed and put some soothing music on for our return. This was so nice to come back to! On an evening they hold complimentary wine and cheese offerings which was nice to go before heading out for the evening. The plunge pool area and whirlpool on the top terrace are lovely and when we were there we were the only ones up there so it was very private and quiet. The views from there are also beautiful. The internet access is free in the hotel library which was great to have on hand. The gym was a little out dated but had amazing air con which is useful when working out in the san juan heat! The hotel is in a good location and is walkable to the pier for the cruise ships (about a 10 min walk). There are some very nice restaurants nearby and our favourite was barachina where the pina colada was invented - the food was great and the staff very friendly. We had stayed at another hotel on the night before our cruise in old san juan which was a little nearer to the pier and had thought that we probably woudlnt go back there. Now we definetely wont as if come back to san juan we will definetely book to stay at el convento!!

Reviews.Title: “First Night of Honeymoon in AWESOME Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plaidbunny
Reviews.Content: Okay, that sounds a little X-rated but really we were on a layover to an island in the carribean and watned to check out Puerto Rico. We chose the right place to stay!! The people at El Convento couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. They sent us to Baru for dinner and to this date it is still one of the best meals we've ever had! The room itself was so cute and fun - bright colors, hand painted walls and furniture, and a great view of the water. The inner courtyard was really cute, too! This hotel is in a great location in Old San Juan. I would highly recommend El Convento to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to like it but...”
Reviews.Author: El_Viajero_Global
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for the first time for 3 nights on the strong recommendation of a friend; booked a "pre/post cruise" package at $225 per night which included a one-way transfer to/from pier or airport and one free breakfast for each one purchased (but, it transpired, only at the same time so, no use for me). The hotel's in a gorgeous, historical building in a superb location in the centre of Old San Juan next to the cathedral which makes sight-seeing very easy and makes an excellent first impression. However, I felt there were too many small inconveniences to make it a memorable trip: > Room: I was allocated 214 which is on the 2nd floor for the US (1st floor UK) and too low to receive much natural light; I would recommend asking for the 3rd floor and above. > A/C: it's quite noisy and not intuitive to operate so that it came on at 2.00am during my first night, waking me up; I couldn't switch it off and had to call a guy from reception to help. > Mosquitos: the rooms open onto a gallery which looks out onto an inner courtyard which allows mosquitos in when they're being cleaned or serviced; I found an insect spray in the room but only after being bitten several times during the first night. > Bulb missing in the bathroom which was not replaced despite my asking. > No room service except breakfast which, as a "solo traveller" I missed (I like the option of having dinner in the room watching TV). > There was only one restaurant open at the hotel for dinner - a tapas bar - which gets a good write-up in the guides but which I didn't much like (there is a cafÃ© but I was told it was closed for the low season); they also have a live flamenco show which you can hear from inside the rooms. > Late checkout: I was asked to request this on the morning of departure which I did and it was agreed (for 1.00pm) but I was later called at 12.30 asking when I was leaving. > Airport transfer: I had to remind the lady at reception twice that this was included in the rate. > Water: there was none on Sunday evening (problem at the hotel) and none on Monday (problem with the supply in that part of the city) - not the easiest place to be without it! Despite this whingeing, I will return because I now know the "dos and the don'ts" and because of: > The service which is generally of a high standard and extremely friendly. > In-room amenities: free broadband, mineral water and Puerto Rican coffee. > Roof-top terrace with small pool and fantastic view. > Old San Juan embodying all that is fascinating for me about the Caribbean: the historical Spanish/Catholic influence, meticulously preserved city centre with spectacular views of the Atlantic coast, very friendly people, great restaurants and bars. There's also a lot more to see and do which I dÃ­dn't have time for on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “No where else!”
Reviews.Author: CEB-NYC
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made by my companion who has a feel for the unique. If you are going to San Juan, then this is where you must stay. Even better if you go off season as we did. Listed as one of the best small hotels in the world, it lives up to its billing. A list of the positives: willingness to upgrade when not fully booked, marvelous wine and cheese hour at 6PM (seven or eight wines to choose from), top-notch maid service with evening turn-downs, lovely open central courtyard where the rain falls freely, honor bar, atmosphere comfortable enough to wear your bathrobe to the wine and cheese hour after an afternoon sunning on the terrace one flight of stairs up where the splash pool and hot tub await, pleasant staff, easy car rental connection, double storm-doored room with absolutely all amenities and a sense of privacy, and just a general sense of simple class. One caveat; the leased restaurant on the second floor is significantly sub-par and obviously not run by the hotel management. This is likely to change in the future because they are aware of the problem. Just ask whether there is new restaurant management since Oct. '09. Aside from that problem, the worst thing that can be said is that the ice tongs on the honor bar are ineffective. How's that for reaching? Do not stay in one of those high rise pink Caribbean box buildings and miss the El Convento if you want a visit to Old San Juan to be an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.. Love it!”
Reviews.Author: CTMACCI
Reviews.Content: I just planned our annual last minute trip to San Juan for husband's birthday. I am sad that I was unable to get accomodations to El Convento. We stayed here last year and the location is just prime. The staff is helpful, the rooms are large and clean. I can't say enough positive things of this historical hotel. The hot tub and small pool at the rooftop garden was just oh so romantic. The hotel also offered a cocktail hour, with an array of cheese, crackers and wine. We hope to return and stay here next year!

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: Where to start- elegant, friendly, warm, helpful staff, fantastic nightly wine reception, perfect rooms, views... This is THE place to stay. San Juan seems to be a dud, except for Old San Juan. It's like a great Mexican or Spanish city- colonial, historic, nice plazas, great architecture, great churches, fantastic old fort ruins, great restaurants and nightlife. El Convento and Old San Juan are gems. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: hopeFairhopeAL
Reviews.Content: This beautiful old convent is situated in an excellent location to everything in Old San Juan. Our room had a lovely view of Old San Juan Bay. The welcoming staff was so hospitable. Treated us like we were special guests. The facility was so beautifully done with old Spanish tile flooring, gorgeous open air terrace. The plunge pool area allowed for on-site sun bathing, relaxing, reading and napping with a view of the bay. Two days I was up there an older fellow with his oils, canvasses and brushes was painting all afternoon off to himself. They had Dasani water bottles iced down all day and evening at no extra charge! (Our hotel later in the week charged $5 a bottle for same!) . A lovely amenity was the 6PM daily wine and cheese tasting on yet another terrace, 3rd floor, which overlooked the bay. There is no charge for this either. It included 8 wines from around the world, 6-8 cheeses, crackers, grapes, nuts. Very impressive.Right beside this was an honor bar of first class whiskies, scotches, vodka, gin. Mix your own and write up your tab and slip it in the box. I've rarely ever seen this in all of our travels. Along with the above the food in restaurants was also terrific. The bottom floor restaurant for breakfast and lunch had delicious spinach salad and Italian bruschetta. We went back 2 days in a row for those. The evening dining was good as well with name brand drinks for only $6.50 (as opposed to the $11-$12 dollars per drink we paid at our next stop). The two old forts within walking distance provide breathtaking views of the area, the kind you would go back and do again and again. We loved it and talked of coming home to build a mini version of the same facility to live in.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: KC-Boston
Reviews.Content: All I can say is wow! This might be my favorite hotel experience I ever had. Great location with very nice rooms and fantastic staff. Hotel Convento does not offer the most luxurious rooms or amenities but it blends spectacular service with unique comfortable room as well as a great location. Special thanks to the front desk staff helping me retrieve my cell phone that i left at a restaurant the night before. And a big thank you to Barbara Velez in the corporate sales department. Can not waite to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Service/Management”
Reviews.Author: evilkitty510
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento with my fiance. We splurged and got a nice room and wanted to really live it up in San Juan before going to Utuado and staying in the forest. We got there right after the check-in time and were checked in at the front desk. When we got to our room, we found that it had two double beds instead of the king we had paid for during our romantic trip... I figured that there must have been an error, so I went back to reception and was told by the manager that they had overbooked for the weekend and could not honor our room request. At the same time, two other couples appeared with the same complaints... They told me that they had upgraded us instead -- which was not apparent from the room, we didn't have a good view or anything. I kept persisting that they either needed to give us a king room or refund part of our stay. The manager finally agreed to move us the NEXT night (we were only there 2 nights...), but refused to compensate us in any way for the difference. She said that since we booked online that we got a special rate so it didn't matter. Overall the staff was pretty rude about it... Aside from that -- the hotel was beautiful. We went to the wine and cheese reception each night, which was really fun before dinner and going out. We also enjoyed the hot tub and the courtyard area. We did not eat at the hotel, so I cannot comment on that. The location couldn't be better - right in the heart of San Juan. The only other comment I have is that I think the hotel is still a bit overpriced. If I did it again I would stay in a guest house or some other hotel. I'm glad we didn't stay at the beach in San Juan though because other couples told us that it was so so and more resortish. We also went to Vieques later which was amazing for beach trips. I also don't think I would go back to San Juan. It's a cool city but a little too touristy and expensive. Other parts of Puerto Rico were so much more amazing - i.e. Utuado and Vieques. I don't really want to go to Puerto Rico to shop (which is what San Juan is all about), and the food was awesome but expensive too. I'm glad we went for a couple nights, but glad we moved on too.

Reviews.Title: “good but one big caveat”
Reviews.Author: goldenfleese
Reviews.Content: The glowing reviews are pretty much on point. We were there for 4 nights and until the last night we would have whole heartedly recommended El Convento. Our room was on the first floor, directly behind a reception room used for weddings. There are a lot of weddings at the hotel. On our last night, a Sunday, there was a reception dance in that room which cannot be more than 20' by 40'. Unfortunately for us, the couple booked a fully amplified rock band that was incredibly loud. We finally got to sleep, but our night was ruined. Upon checking out the next morning I mentioned this to a manager who said "if only she would have known, she would have done something". Like what? Close down the wedding dance? Yeah, right. I expect a more proactive response from a hotel of El Convento's status. The band shook the whole building.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: poidog7
Reviews.Content: Not much that I can add to the very positive reviews for this hotel. Very comfortable and every need anticipated. Nice touches for me include available coffee at all hours of the day, complimentary ethernet and wireless, the honor bar with drinks you can select yourself, the Bose radio, the easy to adjust air conditioning, power plugs in just the right places, tasteful furnishings, and the very comfortable bed. Did not try the hotel restaurants, but I did try and I recommend the Spanish tapa restaurant Rosa de Triana which is located across the square from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “luxury boutique hotel with five star service - best in san juan”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel94
Reviews.Content: a gem in old san juan....luxury boutique hotel of historical relevance, great architectural lines, old world furnishings, with amazing attention to detail in the interior design. many areas to relax and rejunvenate, either solo or in a social context (ie: nice free wine reception each evening on patio). staff are amazing....very friendly, exceptionally helpful and effective in their duties...made me feel very special...property is a well appointed and very well maintained hotel....an experience to enjoy...great location is across from san juan cathedral, but out of the mainstream of busy boulevards...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful romantic hotel in the heart of historic Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: oconnos2
Reviews.Content: I kidnapped my husband for our 25th anniversary and we spent 5 nites at El Convento. We loved the location, the service, and the beauty of the hotel. All of the employees of the hotel were friendly and attended to our every need. Don't forget to ask about access to their sister hotel on the beach. You can even take the bus over there, and a day lounging beside their pool by the ocean is well worth the trip. (The pool at El Convento is small, but refreshing. If you are looking for a place to swim though, this isn't it.) The wine, cheese and fruit manager's reception on the El Convento terrace was a beautiful place to meet others staying at the hotel. The terrace overlooks both the cathedral and the water, and is delightful even in September's heat. One other features of this hotel we especially liked was the double glass door just inside the room door. It sealed in the air conditioning making the room very pleasant and kept the room extremely QUIET. We heard no outisde noise. The only downside we found to the hotel was the bed. The bed was quite comfortable, but a bit small for our tastes. We are both tall, and the bed was closer to the double than a queen. Would have loved a king. Neverthless, we enjoyed the hotel and intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder where the rooms displayed on website were”
Reviews.Author: lpnytraveler
Reviews.Content: @ $800 per night for a room that slept 4 (one bed, one pullout couch that we needed to plead to have made up), we were disappointed beyond disappointment. Restaurant was lovely, credit card number ripped off in tapas bar, room compared to a dark tenement in NYC. Room came equipped with TWO cans of Raid Ant killer, and lots of ant corpses. Bathroom was teeny, insufficient towels. We checked out after one lousy night to Caribe Hilton on beach for two rooms at half the price. We should have gone to Hilton in the beginning. We were oversold by beautiful website. Total waste.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: Asthma_Doc
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with colleagues. The room was large with a spotless bathroom, white bathrobe, LCD TV, and balcony with a view of the old town. Perfectly quiet, with a very comfortable bed and pillows. Many good restaurants were within a short walk. The open rooftop spa, open 24 hours, was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, room, atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: doghotel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the start of our PR honeymoon. The room and hotel grounds were beautifully maintained and had an incredibly old world Spanish influenced romantic atmosphere. We loved the little table outside our room overlooking the inner courtyard. The mojitos at the courtyard bar were stellar and the food at El Picoteo smelled and looked amazing. You are conveniently located near all the Old San Juan sights. Quick walk to El Morro, etc. and close to Fortaleza Street and all the restaurants. We recommend Dragonfly - it was insanely delicious. There is a walgreens, grocery store, bank/atm, radio shack, marshalls, etc within a few blocks. The resort strip with casinos is a $20 cab ride away (taxi stand right outside the hotel). There is a small pool and jacuzzi that were lovely for a quick dip. Lots of nooks and crannies to explore, little decks and patios hidden everywhere. We didn't take advantage of the free wine and cheese, but saw others take some wine and find a spot around the hotel to enjoy it. In the am there was complimentary coffee and tea. Free candy at the check-in desk. Would definitely stay there again if we were in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “If its elegance and luxury that you desire, then el Convento is the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: CARAMELAKAVITA
Reviews.Content: I have been here working here in PR on a tourism feature that will be published in " The New Yorker" . I have had the choice to stay in many of the top luxury hotels here in San Juan and also been obliged some what. Once I stepped into the beautiful world of EL Convento ..... I did not want to leave. Greeted my beautiful, well trained kind staff Excellent rooms with tasteful decoration and one of the cosiest beds I have ever slept on. The feeling of being temporarily transported to another century with the comfort and service of any modern top notch hotel Tasty wine and cheese reception every evening while listening to the beautiful sounds of the birds and guitar player at sunset Taking a morning dip in the roof top jacuzzi while looking over the rest of San Juan Fantastic choice of in house catering, including the best banana pancakes to wake up to ... A truly cosy, relaxing, elegant stay that I woudl recommend to anyone who enjoys the finer things in life..... and all of that in teh middle of OLD SAN JUAN ... Need I say more ?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat in the middle of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: joshonki
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, helpful, polite and knowledgeable from the very beginning to the end. The room was spacious and had old world charm with modern amenities and great air conditioning. The library was nice, had books you could read and 2 computers with printers. The exercise room was very nice, but we didn't actually use it (Fort exploring IS exercise). The 6 o'Clock wine tasting social was great, you get to meet other travelers if you want or just nibble great cheese and drink wine and stick to yourself. We didn't eat at the Tapas restaurant, but the breakfast in the courtyard was very tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Best of 3 Hotels we stayed at”
Reviews.Author: YancieDale
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The building and grounds were beautiful and the location was fantastic. The photos on their web site adequately depict this lovely little hotel. In fact, there are many nice surprises not photographed once you get there. The service was impeccable, the staff would recognize residents of the small hotel after seeing you only once and knew drink or food preferences. Itâ€™s a 10-15 minute walk to El Morro, nightclubs on San Sabastian, shops on Fortaleza, or the piers. If driving to the hotel, get there, park in the lot provided and walk or take a cab everywhere. Old San Juan is a tough place to drive, especially if in a car larger than an economy-size rental. However, if you choose to go to the Mariott Isla Verde resort, negotiate a price with the cab driver before leaving. Our round trip drive to the beach cost us $60US because the outbound trip was $40 (un-negotiated) and inbound negotiated price was only $17. At only $20 for valet parking at the Mariott, it would have been much cheaper to just drive. Its not a hard drive after escaping the tiny streets of OSJ. Isla Verde was an OK beach, but not as nice as in some of the outlying areas. The Mariott was a typical 3-star resort, with the high prices that go along with a beach resort. It is nice to be able to visit another location and charge everything back to the room. Our room was clean, neat and well appointed. The old tile floor was lovely and had been lacquered to help seal it and keep it clean. The bathrooms are small, but this is a 400 year-old building. Despite the small size, the bathroom was clean and modern. Drinks and food were much more reasonable than at the large resorts and in our opinion, of a higher quality. The food at the tapas bar was excellent. The nightly wine and cheese reception was a perfect way to start each evening. Get there early for best cheese selection! Its not a problem, but something to be aware ofâ€¦ the hotel has many bats flying in the upper central courtyard and on the deck by the wine/cheese area. The 4th floor is open and the bats freely fly around for a few hours at dusk, occasionally flying near the rooms. The 3rd floor room area has awnings and we did not see a bat on our floor. In fact, we went up and sat in a chair on the 4th floor to watch them fly around. I had never seen them flying at eye level, so it was a real treat. Remember, healthy bats are harmless and eat a lot of bugs â€“ which is necessary in a tropical area. Of the three places we stayed (Rio Mar, Cielo Mar and El Covento), this was by far and away our favorite. When we go back, and we will go back, we will plan to spend a majority of our time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AvieDesigns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Convento for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon and I can't think of a bad thing to say about it. The room we had, which was the cheapest, was not big, but had 20ft ceilings which made it feel very roomy. The hotel was built 350 years ago, but the only place you feel that is in the charm and warmth of the hotel. The style and feeling was perfect for us. I love to feel that I am staying in a unique place, not a cookie cutter resort. The bed, air conditioning, bathroom & flat screen tv were all great! Each room opens to an open air corridor that has little tables & chairs for you to sit and enjoy while looking out over the courtyard. When we checked in, we were informed that since El Convento is not on the beach and only has a small dipping pool on the roof, we had the luxury of using the facilities at their sister properties which are in El Condado. We took one day and laid by the pool on the beach at La Concha which was great. It was so nice to have that option while still staying in this charming small hotel. We were also informed that there is a wine & cheese & fruit bar every night from 6-7 for free. All the wine & fruit & cheese you want for that hour. It is also a great time to meet and mingle with other guests. They also have an "honor bar" which you can make your own drinks whenever you like and they just charge it to your room. There is also all the bottled water & coffee you want for free. We did not try any of the restaurants in the hotel, but I am sure they are wonderful since everything about this hotel is. The best part was the service. Any question or need we had was tended to with the greatest care. Jaime spoke with us for about an hour helping us get to where we wanted to go and gave us some great tips. If it is raining, they offer you umbrellas. The hotel is located in Old San Juan which, while touristy, is lovely to walk around. Eat at La Bombonera for authentic Puerto RIcan breakfast. Cafe Berlin is great for vegetarian travelers. Overall, this may be the best hotel I have ever stayed at and would recommend it to anyone that is looking to stay at a charming, off the beaten path, luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old world Style and class.”
Reviews.Author: mikeonderon
Reviews.Content: If you intend to stay in Old Town Puerto Rico look up El Convento. A converted convent with wonderful staff and an incredible location. 2 blocks from the ocean on one side and 3 blocks from the fort on another. The restaurant supplies free bottled water and coffee 24 hours a day and a free wine and cheese reception at 6pm on the patio. If there was a deficiency at this wonderful hotel it was water pressure but I think thats typical in older hotels. Also you can use the amenities at two other hotels owned by the same people, right on the beach, excellent hotels, very modern with free lounge chairs and beds on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: finder45
Reviews.Content: Not easy to drive to, but easy to get used to! Small, elegant, and personal sums it up. Even though the room we requested wasn't what was waiting for us, they adjusted easily to another, suitable one. The chef of the main restaurant met us on the elevator and invited us to lunch .. delightful and delictible!! Great location for exploring Old San Juan on you first night to the island. The wine, cheese, fruit, and bottled water spot hit our spot. A must for your first or last trip to PR!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: Oceans14
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I chose to stay in El Convento. After reading many reviews and doing a lot of resarch on my own I settled for this wonderful little property in Old San Juan. The location is perfect! There are many different room categories to choose from. I stayed in a junior suite/1 bedroom suite and found it very practical and with a lot of space. No views, but you could just walk out the door, and then 4 steps to the left we were standing at the pool terrace with fantastic views toward the sea and the old town. Every day they have a wine and chees hours (free of charge) and many guests showed up on both days. The honor bar is a very nice area with 2 internet computers for the guest use. The service is outstanding. El Convento is all smiles! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: historymusicbeerbuff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 wonderful days in Old San Juan staying at hotel El Convento. We chose this hotel based upon the excellent reviews at trip advisor and can honestly say words cannot describe our incredible experience at this hotel. Sure it was hot and humid-it's hot in Pittsburgh too! But the moment you enter this hotel that began as a convent in 1551 you step into a past filled with 400 years of Spanish history in the New World. The nuns left in 1903 and the place became a ruins that housed garbage trucks at one point. In the 1950's millionaire Robert Woolworth of the Woolworth 5&10 fortune (I remember chocolate sodas at the restaurant bar in Woolworth's in the 50's-so now you know my age) resurrected the convent into a luxury hotel visited by Ernest Hemingway and Rita Hayworth etc. It then fell into less prosperous times but fortunately in the late 90's was renovated to the tune of $275,000 per room. Even though the building has a remarkable history the attentive, caring, incredibly competent staff and service lights up your life. As we departed, the gentleman who saw us off said "God bless you' and appropriate send off from a convent. Another highlight was the nightly manager's reception from 6-7 pm with wonderful red and white wines , a remarkable selection of cheeses, strawberries and grapes enjoyed by hotel guests at no charge! We met so many wonderful people and had great conversations with folks from everywhere of all ages. They also offered free bottled water and coffee at all times in this beautiful 3rd floor area overlooking San Juan Harbor.One evening a massive down pour created the most dramatic rainstorm we ev er experienced in the courtyard. Bose sound systems are in all rooms with a university of PR station playing world music and classical music. Flat panel TV's provided us Steeler fans with a Pittsburgh 20 Arizona 10 win to complete a perfect vacation! Il Perugino was a great Italian restaurant across the street and we loved The Parrot Club, Trois Cent Onze and Marmalade on Calle Fortaleza. The Governor's Palace (La Fortaleza had tours on Mon and Fri) and forts El Morro and San Cristobal have amazing tour guides (run by the National Park Service. If you are 62 or over you can get a lifetime pass to all National Parks for $10-guess they don't think we'll be around long. If you're looking for a cookie cutter Hyatt, Hilton on the beach-this is not the place for you. If you want to step back in history, visit a rainforest, meet some of the friendliest people on earth- El Convento is heaven on earth. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here and Experience All Old San Juan Has to Offer.”
Reviews.Author: CamilloinDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. We have stayed at numerous SLH hotels in Europe and El Convento ranks with the best. For three nights we enjoyed the location on Plaza de la Catedral, within walking distance of the forts of El Morro and San Cristobal and everything else in Old San Juan. Our first impression of the friendly and expert service offered by the hotel was from George, the doorman/porter who was always eager to help. This was followed by more of the same at reception. The staff proved to be reliable resources for dining and any other information requested. We had a deluxe room located next to only two others on a small private hallway just off the courtyard and a great view of the plaza. Even with events going on, such as the wedding during our visit, we heard no noise from either inside or outside the hotel. And the very cold air conditioner kept us comfortable considering the oppressive July temperatures. Making good use of the third floor roof terrace every morning for coffee and each evening for the wine and cheese reception proved to be a great benefit. Perfect for starting the day or before heading out to explore the neighborhood restaurants. And after dinner, a good place to retreat for a nightcap from the â€œhonors bar.â€� We also took time late each afternoon to cool off in the rooftop pool and Jacuzzi. Though the pool is not large, it was relaxing to plunge in while admiring the views of San Juan Harbor. There are plenty of lounge chairs and never a problem getting one. If you are going to San Juan you should seriously consider this hotel. It might cost a little more but is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we didn't stay at a huge hotel in Puerto Rico!!!”
Reviews.Author: UnionSqNYCTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were torn between this small boutique hotel without the huge pools or one of the larger resorts with pools, beaches and the rest of the scene that comes with it. In the end we decided to stay at El Convento because we wanted to explore outside of our hotel. WE ARE SO GLAD THAT WE DID! Old San Juan is a gorgeous town filled with history and all you have to do to be part of it is walk out of El Convento. Each day as we walked in and out of our hotel there was a man strumming his guitar and singing on the bench just outside the hotel. It was very romantic. The hotel is a piece of history and is very well decorated and maintained. Our room was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a small pool on the roof of the hotel which was just fine. It was quite and had very few visitors. We did decide to take an excursion to El Convento's sister hotel which is La Concha. A huge beach front resort with 3 pools. The hotel was very swanky and had a great pool area but we were so glad we didn't stay there b/c the area surrounding it had no character. When we came back from La Concha we breathed a sigh of relief because we were so happy to be back at our charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in the heart of the city (but make sure to take the turndown service)”
Reviews.Author: anne_dougherty
Reviews.Content: From the rooms to the court yard to the staff to the atmosphere, El Convento was everything I hoped it would be. I particularly enjoyed the availability of seating on the balconies that ringed the interior courtyard. They allowed me to sit and read and take advantage of San Juan's gorgeous weather without feeling like I was going to bake in unaccustomed heat of a tropical February sun. My spouse and I are both fresh air people and the prevailing breeze required that if we were sitting on the courtyard balcony and wanted to get air into our room we would have to prop our door open. When I asked the front desk staff for a door stop not only did they not balk when they did not have a standard one they made one for us out of cardboard accommodating with ease our (slightly) strange request. El Convento boasts a "manager's happy hour" every night with wine, cheese, and fruit that provides a pleasant way to pass the early evening either with your traveling companion(s) or socializing with other guests. Staff are so attentive to the services that they provide that one night when we refused the turn down service not only did we get a call from the front desk to make sure that indeed we had refused we got a written note asking that if we found the service lacking that we please let them know what they could do to improve. We found this seriousness highly amusing and incredibly charming. The location of El Convento, too, was a selling point when we booked and came in quite handy as the hotel is just a short walk from two of the main plazas in the city and from a lot of good restaurants and shopping. El Convento also maintains a "sister" relationship with a couple of other hotels allowing guests access to the beach and the ocean. On our next visit, we will stay at El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: calijournalist
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The old-world charm can't be beat, the room has a small fridge full of free bottled water to beat the sticky heat, the bed was soft and luxurious. The building can be a bit creepy at night, but that was likely just because I'd read the haunting stories beforehand. The tapas bar is great for a quick drink; the courtyard restaurant was delicious. There's a beautiful plaza outside and the second oldest church in the Americas (I went for Mass en Espanol before my flight). It's a little bit of a long walk from the coast, especially in humid August weather, but there's good shopping just a short walk up the street (Dooney and Coach) along with many more food choices in Old San Juan. I would definitely recommend that travelers get a higher floor than the second floor, though. That was the "superior" room off Travelocity and it had a small walled patio and no view. So spend extra to get the better room.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay anywhere else..you'll miss the true PR experience”
Reviews.Author: NewlyWed0718
Reviews.Content: Honestly, if you plan on staying in Old San Juan (the historic district) and stay ANYWHERE else, you will miss-out on so many wonderful things by far. So first, lets start with service...because that is what completely blew us away. When I had booked the room online a few months ago, I had briefly mentioned that we would be honeymooners. As many other hotels forget little things like that, I expected the same but WOW was I surprised when we checked-in an 11 pm and in our room waiting on our bed was a huge heart made of purple and yellow fresh rose petals and well as accompanying plush robes and slipper sets. It was the perfect start to a trip we'll never forget. The hotel is centrally located around so many wonderful things within walking distance: a cathedral built in 1511 that is the second oldest on the entire island is right across the street..the famous restaurant "La Bombonera" is only 3 blocks down and other restaurants serving authentic cuisine such as "Raices" and "Cafe Puerto Rico" are also only a few blocks away. Both Castillos (San Felipe and El Morro) are also both walkable and well worth the 3 bucks they charge to get in. The pictures from both are breathtaking. The only drawback (you would think) is that the hotel is not on the beach..but not to worry! El Convento has a deal with their sister hotel La Concha on Condado Beach where you just say "hey I'd like to go the the beach" and they type you up a cool little letter that gives you a FREE beach and pool pass to the resort for your entire stay. There is a $15 cab ride involved, but it's only about a 10-15 ride depending on traffic since the streets are pretty small.. Definitely worth it..all those wallpapers of carribean beaches with palm trees?? That's EXACTLY what it looks like! Needless to say, we wore ourselves out during our week long stay..thats why on nights likeThursday night when we were so tired..but I HAD to have some sangria..it was worth the $ to stay here especially when I called the front desk and said "guys..I'd love some sangria..but we're too tired to go out.." and then within 15 minutes the bartender was at our door with a pitcher and 2 glasses. Honestly, if you're looking for the cookie-cut resort kinda thing..stick to Condado Beach. But if you really appreciate history, beauty, and the "good like" in general...El Convento is definitely the place for you. No questions asked. Special thank-yous to: Hiram, Shannon, and Uncle Bob. You made our honeymoon hard for anyone to beat. We'll never forget your warm smiles and AMAZING service. Hopefully we get the chance to come back soon; I'd never dream of staying anywhere else. Sincerely, Kelley Sweeney-Berrones

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to visit San Juan, make it worth your while and stay here.”
Reviews.Author: la_desaparecida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento during our May honeymoon. First, we loved Old San Juan and after seeing the rest of the area were VERY happy we chose Old San Juan over the beach. Second, this is the best hotel in Old San Juan! --Location. Old San Juan is beautiful, historic, and there's a plethora of interesting things to do day or night, family or couples... --Even the most basic rooms have beautiful furniture and are not too small, despite other reviews. The shuttered balconies were a nice touch. --No rental car necessary. Not only CAN you walk everywhere, but everywhere you'd WANT to walk to is closeby! The fort, the churches, the pier, restaurants, bars, town squares... it's all close. --The daily manager's wine & cheese reception is not to be missed! Also, we tried one of the hotel restaurants and had a fine meal. --The rooftop pool, hot tub, and sundeck area not only give you a chance to cool off in the water but also see the bay and the rest of town from 3 or 4 stories up. I could go on and on... we loved El Convento!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Mahvelous Darlin”
Reviews.Author: baddogsmom
Reviews.Content: I must say that my/our stay at El Convento was the most perfect stay I have ever had anywhere I have traveled. The staff was great, accomodations wonderful, loved the courtyard in the center, the availability of restaurants everywhere, the rooftop pool and view was lovely, the honor bar with balcony area was nice, and on and on . I don't have one single thing to complain about. We had a marvelous time. There for a wedding with family and friends galore, it was the perfect setting. And there ballroom for the reception was exquisite and perfect for our needs. Kudos to the management and staff. Loved it!! Smallish, but dynamite!! Other wedding goers stayed in cheaper hotels but by the time they paid for extras, and enormous hassles (no personal touches), they would have been happier at El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: gambelLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in early July 2009. It being the off season the hotel was quieter than I had thought which was a benefit. We felt like we had the run of the place. The staff were incredibly attentive and pleasant, with none of that "forced" good service we see so often where behind the smile is just somebody doing a job they don't particularly enjoy, for people they don't particularyly like. It seemed to us the staff genuinely enjoyed working at the hotel and enjoyed seeing us experience and learn about their city. We couldn't have asked for more. The patios out front of the rooms which serve as hallways are beautiful. There are tables and chairs outside each room where the guests can lounge and enjoy the views overlooking the courtyard (which is huge). The location could not be better. Old San Juan is an easily walkable area. There are numerous restaurants around, including an excellent one in the hotel itself called Canas by Cafe Bohemia. Excellent service and atmosphere. We walked all over Old San Juan from the hotel and the furthest place of interest is maybe a half mile at the most. The sense of history that surrounds you here is profound -- when our city (Los Angeles) was just a tiny spot on a small map, San Juan was several hundred years old. Many of the buildings date back hundreds of years -- the hotel itself was constructed in the late 16th century! The only downside was the heat and humidity. Being from the Los Angeles area we are used to heat, but not humidity. That being said, most of the days were quite nice, with the exception of one hot and muggy day. It cooled off nicely at night. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Stay”
Reviews.Author: Godiva420608
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed El Convento, perhaps most for the amenities like wine and cheese on the roof overlooking the cathedral across the street. The feel of the place is extremely sophisticated even though you will see tourists in their t-shirts in the elevators. El Convento is pricey, but being in the best part of the city is a huge advantage. The staff are incredibly friendly and pointed us toward an excellent, small, local salsa club and the best restaurants. The rooms are not overwhelmingly large, but they have high ceilings and are well-furnished. The courtyard in the center of the building is also a lovely space. The couple of nights we spent here were a great finale to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere else to stay unless you can't possibly afford it!”
Reviews.Author: pjay46
Reviews.Content: It's not for nothing that this hotel is rated #1 in Old San Juan. There's simply nowhere else you should stay unless the price is prohibitive. The building, the setting, the location, the food, the little pool and hot tub, the free wine and cheese in the evening, and the staff, all combine to make this a no brainer. Stay here if you possibly can. Believe all the raves. They're true.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: pastular18
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in the heart of the city. Small but lovely pool and cocktail hour are just a couple of things that make this place special. Enhanced our trip because of the quaint, authentic, old world feel to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: delily
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in. Service was great. Very clean and the beds were actually comfortable (really rare for a hotel bed!). The staff was very helpful. The pool and jacuzzi are outside on the 4th floor. A beautiful location where you can watch the cruise ships come in. The restaurant in the open courtyard is beautiful and serves the most fabulous food. We gave up trying other restaurants and just stuck to the hotel restaurant. They make a Cuban sandwich at lunch that is to die for! Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: tagonza
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel El Convento & can say it's been one of the best hotels I've ever stayed. The staff, especiall Jamie the doorman, were so helpful & accommodating. The location is keen & parking is directly across the street. Cost is $22.00/night. The rooms were decorated so beautifully & extremely clean. Every night between 6-7 they'd host complimentary wine & cheese. A great selection & nice touch. Going in the off season makes a huge difference when negotiating rates.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip, but worth a mention”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Boy
Reviews.Content: I needed a last minute hotel room in San Juan this past weekend. I was so excited to see that El Convento not only have rooms available, but they were at a very decent price. I'd visited the hotel's public space a year ago and fell in love. That's the big draw, a huge open courtyard in the middle of the building that is quite lively at night. The hotel does right by the guests and installs these sound proof glass doors. That and the concrete walls, a little air conditioning and you can't hear a thing. But honestly, they are a little out of place and take away from the aesthetics. It's often a toss up. We were a little disappointed by the bathroom, but we may have just had higher expectations. I'm not a fan of those curtain rods that are bent for "more room" in the shower. My only complaint was the lack of a mini bar. It seems most hotels in P.R. don't have them. Hey, it's easy money and nice for the guests... why not? I love a hotel with character. This one used to be a Convent. I don't think I have to tell you that it has natural charm built in. But I was pleasantly surprised by the round the clock (or so it seemed) coffee service. I was blown away by the roof deck and pool! The worst part was not having enough time there to enjoy any of the perks!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, excellent location, can't get enough of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: kirstenaline
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeding my expectations. I fell in love with the area just as we began driving through it. Old San Juan is spectacular to say the least, and El Convento, is truly the only place to stay in my opinion. It holds one of the best locations in town, and is renovated to be such a beautiful property. Ben and Jerrys up the street for mid-afternoon or evening treats, La Bombanera the 100 year old breakfast and pastry spot for delicious malloracas down the street. The forts and historical monuments all within walking distance and a plethora of food, fun, and drinks are right at your fingertips. The hotel staff went above and beyond with everything. Jaime at the front door.... you are the best. Between trading tips for using our iPhone there, and offering suggestions of places to go/see, we loved you! You deserve a raise! The gals at the front desk were super friendly and also always offered excellent advice as to where to eat. The inside terrace is gorgeous as are all the hallways that the rooms of the hotel lie on. We also particularly loved the upstairs terrace on the 3rd floor where they hold their nightly wine and cheese reception (complimentary!). We spent a night in the jacuzzi and pool on the rooftop terrace enjoying the views and beautiful weather. We had a regular queen room, and honestly, I couldn't even imagine what the other rooms are like, as ours was spectacular. To be able to open the floor to ceiling doors... or errr... windows??? was amazing. We had a view out to the cobblestone streets and beautifully painted homes. I wish we could go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, great location, quiet”
Reviews.Author: MCShelberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nites before heading off to Culebra. A beautiful hotel with lovely accomodations, room was neat, clean and quiet. Happy hour every nite and coffee drink bar open all day. A great way to start or end your trip in PR!

Reviews.Title: “So good, we went back!”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: Well, I guess it's all been written already, but my friend and I stayed here before heading to Vieques and then were planning to stay at one of the beach resorts after returning, but decided to stay here again as the hotel was just that good. The staff is friendly and always said hello. Since it can start raining at anytime, it's nice that they provide umbrellas at the entrance for use as needed. Our room 201 (both times) has two double beds and is right over the main entrance to the hotel and under the 3rd floor terrace where the wine and cheese reception occur nightly. I thought it would be loud, but aside from normal Friday and Saturday night singing outside the hotel, it was pretty quiet. There is a great view of the San Juan Cathedral. The restaurants were a bit expensive, but the food was really quite good and the staff friendly. The basement gym is large and nicely air-conditioned. There are two treadmills, yes older models, but they work. There is one recumbent bicycle and one stairmaster machine. There is a multifunction weight machine and dumbells from 5 to 50 lbs. Two weight benches are available, but no mats for stretching/yoga/crunches. There is a flat screen TV and a stereo system. The wine and cheese reception was ok. Mostly a bunch of people grabbing free food and drink...me included :-) It can get crowded and there can be difficulty finding seats. The red wines were ok, three Spanish and one Californian. A very nice selection of cheeses, grapes and watercrackers round out the free stuff. Also, here is where free coffee/tea/bottle water is available 24 hours a day. 2 bottles of Dasani water are provided every day in your room fridge. The honor bar is here as well. 7 dollars for a cocktail, but it's self pour. It's 8 dollars at the tapas bar. The library has the computer with an excellent internet connection and a printer. Printed our boarding passes easily, but would recommend a time limit for people on the computer if people are waiting. We ended up heading to the computer after getting back from partying to finally get on the computer to print out the passes. This place is close to everything in Old San Juan including the nightlife in SoFo, the forts, the museums, etc. That said, to get out of the area can be tough as the streets are narrow and packed (it's puzzling why everyone has a behemoth SUV). If it is a busy time (weekends), I would suggest walking down to SoFo and catching a cab from there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: abconnolly
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The architecture and decor set it far apart from your typical resort or hotel. You really feel like you are staying in Old San Juan. The resaurants were supurb. The courtyard was magical. The staff were outstanding without being overbearing. Our room was small, but very comfortable with everything we needed. The air-con was so quiet, we didn't hear a thing. This hotel is worth the money. You will have an outstanding and unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could be my favorite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: christens02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento with my elderly mother for 5 nights. The staff was wonderfully attentive to her. We met lots of interesting people at the nightly wine and cheese reception. The room was super clean. I loved having breakfast in the courtyard. The waitstaff was wonderful. The room was expensive, but worth every penny. It's walking distance to everything in Old San Juan and it's easy to get in and out to the beaches and the coasts. I would definitely stay here again! The only negative is that the treadmills were not designed for someone who actually wanted to use them -- they're a bit rudimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to return and stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: hemea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights post cruise. Excellent choice if you can do it. Across the street from catherdral and small park. Central to all things cultural in Old San Juan. Shannon and Jamie were our first contacts and their service was great. We had a room overlooking the covered patio connected to honor bar. Did have a partial view of city/bay. Room/bath was large, quiet and comfortable. Nice flat screen TV and we had no problems with air conditioning. We did not eat on premises as we were out sightseeing both days and ate locally. Did not use pool either, but did use honor bar for several cocktails. A little pricey but if you figure the view by the pool in the price, it was well worth it! Taxi's are always available if needed any time. We left @ 6:00 am on Tuesday and there were several waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: flytrap01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at El Convento and it was truly a great experience! The location is right in the heart of Old San Juan and in walking distance to restaurants, shops, and sightseeing. The hotel is charming and the staff is very helpful. Although we are beach lovers, we would choose El Convento over any of the Condado beach hotels. The plunge pool and jacuzzi on the top floor are just enough and if you do want to go to the beach the hotel will provide you access to La Concha where you have access to all of their amenities (pool, beach, etc.). Only drawbacks: tapas bar was very overpriced for what they served and parking is $20/day if you have a rental. But really, if you go to San Juan...STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “A truly excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel-DC-NYC
Reviews.Content: This is a truly charming hotel with attentive staff. Our room was graciously sized and had many amenities, along with a small balcony. There is a roof deck small pool and spa, which was ideal for a bottle of wine and relaxing. The location, in the middle of Old San Juan, couldn't have been more centrally located in the district. The only drawback is the price--it's expensive, but this is a very unique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: matthew_osborn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are eternally grateful to the staff at the El Convento so hosting our wedding this spring, and making the experience so perfect.
