Many of our guests stayed at the hotel with us, and without exception had glowing reviews. The building is overflowing with character, history and culture and served as an ideal backdrop for photos, and an ideal spot for gathering with friends over great food and cold drinks. With the exception of a brief trip`e arranged all of the hundreds of details from Virginia, and relied on Paola to coordinate with all of our vendors to make the evening picture perfect and error-free. From the band, to the cake, to tracking all of the paperwork for the Cathedral to running the reception...she handled EVERYTHING with aplomb and grace and was invaluable in helping us navigate what would have otherwise been insurmountable language and culture barriers. She, like the rest of the hotel's staff, could not have been more professional or helpful. Particularly worthy of mention is Jamie, one of the hotel's fantastic bellhops. We'd initially met Jamie briefly during our quick 'fact-finding' trip last fall, but were immediately in awe of his friendly and facilitating manner. Whether it was hailing a cab, or suggesting a restaurant to suit your needs, Jamie's concern for the success of our vacation always seemed genuine, even though he was ultimately just doing his job. Arranging a cab to take my and my best man to a beach down the coast ....giving us perfect restaurant to eat at while we were there...then texting me while we were gone to make sure we got back into the city on time (there were protests causing traffic havoc that weekend) do NOT fall into his job description. Overall, our experience with the hotel was flawless, and Paola and Jamie were essential to that experience. We will be back to Puerto Rico often, and no trip will be complete without staying at the El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was comfortable, but my wedding planner sucked”
Reviews.Author: bubbles1987
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very nice, a little pricey for what we expected. In the heart of Old San Juan, very peaceful and quite. I wasn't impressed with the food,other than breakfast. I actually had my wedding there, I was very dissapointed with my coordinator, my flowers were sloppy, my husband never received his boutinare, Our Coordinator only meet with me once, very stand offish. Our air conditioning did not cool the room properly, my makeup was sweating off of me. I do have to say other than my coordinator the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: toobusytoday
Reviews.Content: I spent way too much time planning our trip to Puerto Rico but picking the El Convento was a slam dunk. Who could resist an upscale small hotel perfectly located in Old San Juan that boasts a complimentary wine and cheese mixer every night? For a one night splurge for our last day in Old San Juan, this was perfect. A cool bonus was the fact that Johnny Depp and company were filming just outside of our window in the alley below! It was rumored that Johnny was staying there too but, alas, he did not show up for the wine and cheese event and we did not bump into him in the hall. Our room (513) was clean, quiet and cool- that's a good thing - it was hot outside. The staff was friendly and professional. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and our 30th anniversary. I had asked for an early check-in when I made the reservation on-line and mentioned our celebrations. We were able to check in quite early, just after noon. Even the bellhop was surprised at our good fortune and said that early check-in's are unusual. We spent the day walking around town and doing a Segway tour and then going back to the hotel for the mixer at 6 pm. While there we met another couple and decided to have dinner together. We finally got back to our room around 11 pm. Imagine our surprise when we saw a giant heart on our bed made with rose petals! Now that was neat extra for a turn down service! On our way to check out the next morning we snagged a couple of bottles of water from the third floor guest services area. Earlier I had used the guest computer in the library, (also in the third floor guest area) to print out our boarding passes and check on the flight time. Nice fast broadband connection. Coffee and water are complimentary and available 24 hours. We got a discounted rate but I can't remember if it was the AAA rate or just the El Convento special. I checked everything they had to make sure we had the lowest price possible. I won't pay full price if I can find it lower. I highly recommend Hotel El Convento - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with El Convento.....”
Reviews.Author: heathery
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Convento over Thanksgiving in 2008. While researching a second trip for 2009, I found the review I'd written and never posted about the hotel: We enjoyed a wonderful Thanksgiving week at El Convento hotel in Old San Juan. It was truly the perfect place to stay. We booked a â€œFall Vacation Dealâ€� through the hotels website and got a wonderful deal under $200 per night for our Monday-Friday trip. Our room was on the second floor and looked out onto a â€œwalkingâ€� alley decorated with beautiful flowers. Out the front door of the room we faced the hotel's gorgeous courtyard. Even though there were loud private parties in the courtyard two of the nights we were there, the sound did not filter into our room. Other rooms on the higher floors look over rooftops to the San Juan Bay, but our view was just right. We were greeted on arrival by Soledad, who immediately put us at home with her warm personality and activity suggestions. She arranged a rainforest tour for us with Native Tours (a private tour with just us and one other couple from the hotel) and did not steer us wrong. It amazed me how everyone in the hotel switched so easily from English to Spanish. I donâ€™t speak Spanish â€“ wish I did, but didnâ€™t really need it. The hotel offers many amenities, as described by other reviewers: the roof-top patio with teeny pool and hot tub offers a wonderful place to relax in the afternoon. The third-floor meeting room, library and public area hosts free coffee and water all day, an honor bar for alcohol, and a canâ€™t miss wine-and-cheese buffet every night. The little library has one free computer, and all rooms have wireless access. Thereâ€™s a fitness center as well, but we didnâ€™t see that â€“ we did plenty of walking in Old San Juan. The room was old with gorgeous high beamed ceilings and antique furniture. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bathroom was just right. We had trouble with lighting one but that was quickly resolved. El Convento is truly close to everything â€“ the cruise ship-focused shops, a grocery market and drug store, the two forts (El Morro and Catille San Cristobal â€“ donâ€™t miss them) restaurants and beautiful walks (El Morro and La Princesa â€“ donâ€™t miss these, either). We recommend El Jibarito for true Puerto Rican comfort food at low prices, and Al Dente for Italian. Ostra Cosa offers great appetizers and tree-frog serenades â€“ where else can you get that? Our cab to the hotel was $22.50 from the airport. Aside from that, we were able to walk everywhere. We did cab one night to dinner at the Ritz Carlton (BLT Steak â€“ very expensive but highly recommended), also $22.50. At the Ritz Carlton we felt like we could be anywhere â€“ in any beach hotel in the world. It made us appreciate what we had at El Convento! El Convento is a small boutique hotel. You need to know going in everything will not have the same rigid procedures youâ€™ll find in a Hilton, but that is part of the charm. We never got confirmation of our room, I wrote asking if theyâ€™d found a camera when we returned (I think I left it in a restaurant) and never heard back, and they are slow to respond to email. I only hope itâ€™s because theyâ€™re busy because I'm ready to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, clean room- at a price.”
Reviews.Author: mariasoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week at a cost of about $450 per night (including all taxes), no special packages, just a regular room. It was nice though, with a window that opened to the square in front of the Cathedral, and a view to remember! And it was never noisy, in fact, the square was mostly PEACEFUL, and we had no trouble sleeping even with windows open. The room was very clean and dry. No smell of humidity or mold. The ceiling fan and open window were enough to keep it cool without the AC. A closet with plenty of hangers, small fridge with complimentary bottles of water, and a coffee setup. Flat screen TV which we didn't have time to use much. Free, fast wireless Internet, yeah! The bathroom was also very clean and fresh flowers appeared there everyday, but it was small and in need of minor renovations; the shower pressure was quite low and one should be careful with the water temperature, as it varied from just warm to extremely hot. Breakfast at the patio cafÃ© was wonderful: very friendly waiters, good and relatively inexpensive dishes, e.g., eggs benedict for $10 and a wonderful tropical fruit platter for $8. Lunch there was also priced sensibly and of good quality; try their chicken wraps with sweet plantain and cheese! Now, the bar was a different story: terribly overpriced, drinks and tapas were only average, and service was patronizing. Better to get your drinks at neighboring "CaÃ±as"!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Personal, Vibrant, Historic and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Pumauren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for our mini-honeymoon from March 13-17 2009. When trying to figure out where to lodge during our honeymoon, we researched quite a bit, with things like price, location, comfort, etc. all as important factors in our decision. We initially booked our room at the beautiful La Concha hotel, primarily because it seemed young, cool, modern and intersting. After a few months of thought, and after reading more about El Convento (which has the same owners at La Concha, I believe), we decided that for a relaxing and romantic honeymoon, El Convento would be a better fit. I read many of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and I will confer with the majority of the descriptions. You would be hard pressed to have a bad time in this especially lovely hotel. The service is truly wonderful, with warm and friendly staff, attention to detail and helpful advice. As soon as we walked into the foyer, I knew we had made the right decision. I felt as though we had walked back into time, but still had all of (if not more) the comforts of a technologically advanced home (ie: bose soundsystems, flatscreen televisions, A/C). The decor is charming, the bed was fabulously comfortable, the views are quite memorable, the pool is "adorable", and the location is unbeatable. We had excellent recommendations for things to do and places to eat, which I will relay here: Breakfast: La Bombinara--local diner, super-good food, order the ham and cheese mallorca. Dinner: Marmalade--best soup I've ever had, great service, super fun Dinner: Baru--great atmosphere, wonderful raw bar Botello Art Gallery--just something cultural, and you *might* be able to find a poster for under $50. But it's worth it. Most importantly: If you stay at El Convento, you should make every effor to attend the wine and cheese reception. It's free, and a chance to relax with some nice wine, good pre-dinner snacks, and to remember how lucky you are to be in such a sweet spot in the world. Lauren and Erik Perley

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find”
Reviews.Author: CareBear4844
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights before our cruise and wish it had been longer. Loved sitting by the pool, so quiet and relaxing. Cocktails were great every evening. Restaurants on site were excellent. View was fabulous. Food was excellent and loved the bar.The beer was nice and cold. Staff were very friendly. Can't believe the hotel is older than Canada. So close to shopping, nightlife and other restaurants. Wow what a fabulous find!!!! Karen Sullivan Burlington, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel?! Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: LuxseekerUk
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe after reading the other reviews that rate this "5", that the reviewers were staying in the same hotel. The hotel was by no means pristine which is what I expect from a "luxury" branded establishment. (The word luxury is banded around too freely these days). The air conditioning dripped in the room, we had to ask for housekeeping to clean the room both nights of our stay, they "forgot" about us when we ordered room service breakfast. When we had dinner in the hotal (4 tapas dishes and a bottle of red for US$88) we sat under a ripped, mouldy umbrella and a dirty, musty canopy. The hotel is old yes, it has character yes but for US$410 per night excluding breakfast, I do not want to see bird droppings on the walls because there is an open courtyard. I do not want to see a rusty railing as I sit and take in the view of the square from the terrace, I do not want grime on the bathroom basin. If you, like me, expect "luxury" to mean Rocco Forte or Relais & Chateau type standard then do not stay here - you will pay a lot of money for very poor quality. We did complain and they were gracious enough to deduct an amount off the bill, but that is not the point!! We were very disappointed with the hotel which ruined the weekend for us. We are now in dire need of a trip to a legitimate luxury hotel to recover!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: blondzai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento knowing that this is a boutique hotel and for the experience of the Old San Juan charm. We were not disappointed! This room is a converted convent across from a charming church and situated across from a wonderful little plaza. Down the hill is the old entrance to San Juan and the boardwalk and you are within walking distance to anywhere that you might want to explore, whether it be shops, restaurants, the old Forts, or the pier (which had wonderful live Puerto Rican entertainment at night) and a masterful photography exhibit about the world's environment during the day. We were all craving Mexican food and the hotel directed us to a little restaurant a few block away, but you honestly don't need to leave the hotel to eat as the food was delicious and very well priced. As well, the restaurants sit in the courtyard which is a little bit of heaven in an otherwise busy and bustling outside world. Because the hotel is in the middle of Old San Juan and there is an eternal traffic jam, it takes a little bit longer to get there by cab (only $19 ride to/from the airport (plus additional $1 per bag). If you are looking for the five star experience of a Four Seasons Resort or other box type hotels, this is not the place for you. If you want to experience a little history, get great service, great food and a comfy bed, then I would highly recommend El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sc_family4
Reviews.Content: I have been to PR for business a few times before, but this was my first stay at El Convento. It is situated in the Old San Juan district, and just a few blocks from one of the historic forts and a few blocks from the Harbor. It was about a 30 minute ride from the airport (mid-day), and if you are renting a car it looked like there was some parking available (valet, across a street). Many of the roads around the hotel are very narrow and one way. The building is about 350 years old - and in pretty good shape! At check in, I was presented with an actual key for my room (don't remember the last time I had a real key!), and all hotel staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. My room was on the second floor - no view to speak of, but a quaint little patio with a table and two chairs. The entry to the hotel room was off a courtyard - and like a previous posting stated - there was a double door to help block out any noise from the Courtyard. The room was perfectly sized for one or two persons. The room had a fridge with two bottles of water, which is a nice touch. The room had complementary high speed (wired) and common areas such as the Library had wireless service. I found it to be quiet - didn't really hear anything from adjoining rooms, outside or from the Courtyard. The bathroom was a bit small - but for one or two persons would be more than adequate. I ate at two of the on site restaurants - and there were a number of very good restaurants within walking distance. Lots of shopping, too! As a single female traveler, I was impressed with the security at the hotel. You had to use your key to access the Hotel guest areas (elevator, stairs and of course rooms), and I noticed plently of on site security. The price was a little high (avg. $200 per night) although my busiess colleagues were able to get better rates. That said, it was a better deal than many of the other hotels in the area - and better quality in my opinion. Overall - very quaint and charming hotel! I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old World Charm, but Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Convento one night before a cruise. We could not book on line because there was a two night minimum for that weekend. We called and explained we would be booking two rooms for one night, and had no problem. This hotel is amazing, gorgeous, just so charming. All rooms face into an interior courtyard. There are flowers everywhere, and each floor has tables outside the rooms that overlook it. There is a rooftop plunge pool and "warm tub" as we called it, that is so well done, with cushioned chairs and breathtaking views, especially at night. A previous poster mentioned it was not good for kids and teenagers. Well, not if you tried to stuff a family of four in one room, but we had two rooms, and they loved it. We had connecting rooms. Ours had a queen, theirs two doubles. The beds were very comfy, nice linens, mini bar with complementary water bottles (well needed when you walk down to the El Morro fort on a very hot day!) Bathrooms were fine, loved the small vase of fresh flowers, nice touch. The rooms had complementary robes to use, as well. They also have a second door that both seals off the noise from the courtyard and helps keep the room nice and cool. Location can't be beat, in the heart of old San Juan with many restaurants and stores all around. We had breakfast the morning before the cruise in their charming courtyard. The food was very good, service excellent, and the experience unforgettable as the setting is so beautiful. The only negative I have would be the price. We paid approx. $380 per room, with a tax of about $90 PER ROOM on top of that. This makes a stay for one night for our family nearly $1,000. Whew. We have stayed at many top hotels, and this is definitely one of the highest prices we have ever paid. We sometimes stay at Four Seasons and other luxury hotels, and they often offer the second room at a reduced price. The hotel did not seem to me to be full, so perhaps some discounting might be in order? Also, if you are expecting American sized rooms, luxury baths, Four Seasons style, you will not find it here. This is a charminig, European style boutique hotel. Also in one of our rooms the air conditioning was barely working, but not uncomfortable enough to call down and change rooms late at night when we discovered it. We just told them upon check out so they could fix it before the next guests. Would I stay here again? Definitely, but I would only rate it five stars out of five if the price were a little less or they would offer a discount on the second room. Then it would be just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Traveltini2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento in December of 2008. The hotel is in a great location in Old San Juan, the staff was very friendly, and the property was beautiful. The restaurants are great, especially the tapas bar on the second floor patio. There is a great honor bar on the roof to kick back with a glass of wine in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm with great restaurants in the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: PFT3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and have been quite pleased with each stay. We simply love the architecture and charm of this historic hotel and are very pleased with both the Italian restaurant they are partners with across the street as well as the Tapas restaurant overlooking the courtyard. The rooms are small as one would expect and do not really accomodate more that 2 adults with 2 small kids, but you know that from the get go. The terrace with the wine and cheese party daily is a very nice touch. Breakfast is acceptable and the setting makes it better. We have found the staff both friendly and helpful. We have reserved both times from the hotel web site and have not had any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirklander5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from a cruise. We booked three nights and wished we had stayed the whole week. I would go back to San Juan just to stay at this place. The rooms are clean, beautifully furnished, and have all of the comforts of home (air conditioning, lots of hot water, great bedding, etc). The staff was warm and friendly. What I really loved about this place was the atmosphere. It is so "old San Juan". There is a lush courtyard in the middle of the hotel where you can eat or have one of their amazing mojitos, an adorable rooftop pool and lounge chairs, a sweet little nightly wine and cheese reception, and a cute little tapas restaurant. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is not really a negative but just a fact: If you are expecting American-style sizes and luxury here, you wont find it. Go to one of the larger chains out side of Old San Juan. But if you are looking for a small boutique hotel with lots of charm, then this is the place for you. We took our three teenagers who absolutely loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: This place has a 25% TAX! Except that they tried to charge even more!”
Reviews.Author: sillyrabbitt
Reviews.Content: If you're spending $1,000 or more for a few nights, 25% is an enormous tax. Also, they actually somehow managed to try to charge me 27%! I booked on tablet hotels and it stated that there was a 20% tax. (That's outrageous enough.) But then at checkout, there was over $375 in taxes on my bill! They said that when I checked in I signed a statement that said 25%. I was like, "Well, why am I being charged 27%?" The manager had no answer, of course. I showed them my confirmation which showed the 20% rate, and she replied with the classic, "Tablet hotels quoted you an old rate." So, I replied with the even more classic, "That's your problem, not my problem." Even before the nightmare at checkout I felt that this place was terribly overpriced. It is charming, sure. It is, at best, a $200 per night hotel. PEAK! You know when you have decades old tile and it can't be cleaned because it's just dingy? Well, that's the floors in this place. I really didn't want to walk barefoot in the room on this dirty tile floor. I dropped my pillow on the floor and a huge dust bunny came back up with it with hair and everything. The security gates make you feel like you're in Cuba. They are hideous. The maids bang on doors and yell and you can hear them coming from 8 rooms down. Very annoying. Chinese water torture-like. All in all, this place wants you to think it's High End and it SO is not. The staff, up until checkout was nice. They reserved a car for me no problem. Although, considering 15% of the tax is a service fee, I ended up paying $200 for them to book me a car. Don't we have the internet for that these days? Please stay away from Puerto Rico. It is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: angelaho3
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed at the El Convento for 5 days/4 nights. It is a beautiful old hotel with charm. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Our favorite were two helpful bellhops - Jaime and Jeshua. Always ready with a "Hello - how was your day?". We had an easy check in (although the area is small and if there are more than two groups checking in, you'll have to wait out in the entryway). We had a nice unexpected surprise upon arrival. We booked a standard two bed room, and was upgraded to a suite for no charge - YEAH! I would recommend that you ask for a room that does not face Cristo. It is a busy street and on the weekends, there are people partying well into the night (ie...I kept getting woken up until 4am). The overall location is great - we had an easy time getting around Old San Juan. Its pretty central to the Forts - San Cristobal and El Morro - as well as quick access to the SoFo area for bars and trendy restaurants. Upon check-in our bags were promptly taken up to our room and we were given a "tour" of our suite explaining many of the features - like flat screen TVs and free WiFi in the rooms. They also have a nice turndown service every day. The rooms are charming - bathroom a little small. Tile floors and some of the corners (less traffic areas) were a bit dusty. As an old hotel, I did have some allergy problems - which I attribute to the older building, b/c when we went outside - no problems at all. They do not replace your toiletries everyday - and we had to ask for them - which I was disappointing....For the price you pay at the 5 star, I don't think you should have to ask. They do have great amenities - everyday they have a wine and cheese happy hour for guests from 6-7pm. Nice selection - four whites and four reds - along with about 10 different cheeses and grapes for a snack. Bottled water is free in your room - but like the toiletries, you'll have to ask for more bottles when you run out.. You also have access to a modern resort hotel on the beach - La Concha (which is a part of the Renaissance Hotel chain). The La Concha was very nice and you can go and have everything charged back to your room at the El Convento. Just ask at the El Convento front desk for a letter to get you access to the resort and its beach. They have three restaurants on-site. We tried two - the courtyard restaurant for breakfast - and the tapas restaurant. They will tell you its the best in San Juan...which I wouldn't disagree with since we didn't go to another Tapas place...but I didn't find the food fantastic. I've had better tapas. They do have a nightly Flamenco show - which you can see on the balconies of the interior courtyard while enjoying the nightly wine and cheese happy hour. If you're renting a car, be prepared to pay for your parking. Its a very small lot next to the hotel, but guests always get priority in parking and you can charge it to your room. We paid $25 for our rental car for the whole week, but paid $80 in parking fees. Getting around the area is easy...its mapped out like a grid, and everyone knows where the El Convento is located. Be prepared for traffice on small one way streets. Overall, we really liked the hotel but I think it is a little overpriced for $300+/night. Here's a brief summary: PRO: Happy Hour each night, free upgrade, friendliness of the staff, access to La Concha resort and beach CON: Bit dusty due to the old building; replenishing toiletries/bottled water, and parking

Reviews.Title: “My Happy Place”
Reviews.Author: Here4Now
Reviews.Content: One night wasn't enough. We booked here for our last night in Puerto Rico after having been on Vieques Island for four days. This was an excellent way to end the trip, although relaxing on the breezy, third floor terrace just made me crave another day or two like that! We booked the smallest room but were given an upgrade to a suite that had a balcony overlooking the church. We felt very pampered. We showered before the complementary wine/cheese reception and when we returned, staff had already changed our soap and had given us a new bar. Then we left for dinner (excellent choice = Marmalade, at the suggestion of the staff) and had turn-down service when we returned. This is an expensive hotel, but I have to say that if you can swing it - even for a night - stay here. It's historical, the place is very clean, the staff are always available yet hardly ever in sight (unless you need something). There has to be at least two chairs in breezy, quiet out-of-the-way places for every guest! No problem finding a dreamy spot to sit - if you like shade, you can find it. Sun? You can find it. Breeze? Yep. Do you want to meet other guests and chat? There's always someone to chat with. Do you want it quiet and to be on your own? No problem. This was by far the lowest-key and most tranquil place I've been in a long time - and to think that it's in the heart of Old San Juan. We kept our rental car while in Old San Juan and really should have returned it to the airport on our way to Old San Juan and just taken a cab from/to the airport. Street parking is a hassle in Old San Juan unless you get there right when day visitors are leaving and before night visitors arrive. The walk outside the old wall is great. The gate to San Juan (which means, also, the gate OUT to the walkway) is just down the block from El Convento. Lots of cats live in the rocks, but we also saw a big iguana - maybe 3' long from head to tail, right on the rocks. We walked out on the pier at were prompted to look down into the water at the end of the pier. What a beautiful bunch of fish were swimming around and between the rocks! The little tapas bar across the courtyard was excellent - Rosa de Triana. Jose - the owner/partner - was a fabulous bartender/host. If he's there when you go, ask him about flamenco and he might find a photo of himself with some famous flamenco dancers. We feel like he's a friend now. Their mofongo with chicken gravy was expensive but really good. The sangria, also expensive, was very good. Even so, our little lunch turned out to be one of our favorites we've ever had and was a beautiful way to close our trip to Puerto Rico. About dinner at Marmalade in Old San Juan. They sold us on a four or five course meal. The smaller courses were nothing short of excellent and the staff were very willing to explain the food, how it was prepared, how it should be eaten, etc. We were a little disappointed in the main course, but everything else was absolutely scrumptious. To sum it up - we were very pleased with El Convento. Why did I make this caption? Have you ever had a time when you needed to concentrate on a "happy place" in order to get through an ordeal? Well, this hotel is my happy place. Even when I'm not going through an ordeal!

Reviews.Title: “El Convento, El Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: billyboy18
Reviews.Content: We went back to El Convento for the second time and found it just as satisfying as the first visit. Beautiful hotel, amazing public rooms, terrific breakfast room, free managers cocktail party every night, lovely plunge pool, good deal with La Conch for a day at teh berach in Condado. Friendly staff, nice views, right in the heart of Old San Juan. Can't wait for trip number 3!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee28
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at this hotel after a Carribean Cruise and were highly impressed. The setting is magical and we got a fantastic corner room on the 5th floor with great views. Our stay was part of our honeymoon and the hotel went to a special effort to put us in a nice room and covered the bed in rose petals which was a lovely touch. The location of the hotel couldn't be better in beautiful old San Juan and the service is impeccable. The roof top pool and spa are great and are a nice way to kick back after a day exploring. The complimentary evening wine and cheese was a really nice touch and a good way to meet fellow guests. We had breakfast in the ground floor courtyard and this was also amazing! The hotel sticks very strictly to its 3pm check-in time so don't expect to get into your room any earlier than this. A few small gripes; 1. an hour after we arrived in our room we still had no suitcases 2. when we tried to ring down to reception to enquire about the whereabouts of our luggage, our phone wasn't working so we had to go down and bring our own cases up. We reported the faulty phone but nothing was done about it. It then started beeping non-stop in the middle of the night and NOTHING would stop the beeping. We ended up having to take it into the bathroom and wrap it in towels to block the noise out! 3. The water pressure in the shower is best described as a trickle (this may have had something to do with the fact that we were on the 5th floor) Despite these little things we still loved the hotel and would highly recommend it to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: APM617
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in mid-Feb 09 in Room 508 (mentioned in other reviews). Never appreciated the history, charm, restaurants, or local amenities of Old San Juan. El Convento is perfectly located to take advantage of all. Nicely appointed room with views west and south. Note that south view is over 4th floor swimming pool and not private with the shutters open. Hotel itself is very well done. Interior courtyard is excellent place for breakfast and, well, beautiful! Service was excellent. Staff very friendly and eager to help. We booked a 'package' that included a walking tour of the area - clearly worth it for us. Could not imagine staying anywhere else in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: the2Dacys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise. We wanted to stay in Old San Juan and enjoy the historic portions of the city. We were pleased that everything was easily accessible by foot and a car was not needed. Our room was very nice as was the hotel itself. Our one complaint was that we had requested an early check in but out room was not ready until almost 4:00 pm. We were offered the library area while we waited and did walk around the city. We were a little irritated when others were being checked in and we were still forced to wait. We would have like to have gotten settled in our room as we had just come off the cruise ship. We did eat at the restaurant on site and the service was very good and our waitress was great. A huge party came in while we were there, but the level of service was consistent. The pool was very beautiful and it was very calming to go up in the evening and relax by it. We did enjoy our stay and would recommed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TamsenTM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for a one night layover on the way home from the BVI and were so happy we switched to this grand hotel from a high rise resort on Isle Verde. The taxi ride was a bit longer to reach Old San Jaun but so worth it: we felt like we were in a combination of New Orleans, Savannah and Venice . . . such old world charm! Despite prior warning, our children were thrilled with the choice and made to feel very welcome (they're 8 and 11 and weren't the only children staying here.) Walking around the city is convenient and enjoyable from this central location and there's a plethora of dining choices in all directions. THe room was medium sized, two full beds with yummy linens and clean, marble tiled bathroom. The view beyond the full length swinging terrace doors overlooking the plaza enthralled my kids (looked down at the sculptures in front of the children's museum) The interior courtyard is luscious with greenery and sculptures and the tapas and mojiitos at the restaurant hit the spot for a mid-afternoon snack. If we need to layover again on way to the islands, this will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over on the way to Nevis, WI!”
Reviews.Author: JoyJourney
Reviews.Content: This was a stop on our way to Nevis, WI. We wanted a romantic stay in the heart of Old San Juan. The Hotel itself is a fairly long taxi ride from the hotel - but put us in a part of the city we could walk for the remainder of our visit, which was great. The bellboy greeting our cab was very nice - but immediately assumed we were sisters travelling together. In fact we are couple of 12+ years. It was a little off-putting, but I realize there are cultural roots there. We had a lovely lunch in the courtyard dining room (the food was excellent). The only downside to our check in is that our room was not ready until well after 4 pm, despite the fact we had requested an early check in. Once we got the room, however, it was terrific. Beautiful tile floors, gorgeous woodwork, high beamed ceiling, etc. One note: the full bath had a peeling bathtub finish, which we thought was odd. What was really odd is the next morning we discovered that what we thought was another closet was actually another full, gorgeous bath - complete with marble walk in shower! I believe the room number was 103. I wish the bellboy had shown us that when he took us to the room. I know it sounds dumb that we could have overlooked another full bath, but trust me, we travel a lot and have never seen anything like this! We went to the complimentary wine/cheese reception -- the quality of the cheese was excellent, and we met some nice people there. We did not dine that night at the hotel, but instead chose to walk around Old San Juan (where we did feel safe in the streets with all the other tourists) and had dinner at a small tapas restaurant within sight of the Hotel. I wish I remember the name of it - it was excellent! The Hotel workout room leaves some to be desired. They have weight equipment, but the cardio equipment is very shall we say "economical home version" stuff - poor incline, poor impact beds on the treadmills, etc. We ended up taking our workout outside, running up and down the cobbled streets and up and down the old stairs - which was really fun. We never got to see the plunge pool, so no comment there. All in all, I would say it is a pricey, but lovely hotel. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “The El Convento is still the best hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: marisol-7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another stay at the El Convento. This has become our favorite hotel in Puerto Rico. Old San Juan has much to see and do and we never tire of it. The hotel has a wine reception in the evening which is a great way to meet other guests and find out about their excursions that day. This reception is held on the third floor terrace overlooking the square and the Cathedral of San Juan. On Friday evening we were able to watch a wedding party leave the Cathedral and be serenaded by a Mariachi band. It was charming and very old world. The roof deck pool is a perfect place to relax after shopping and sight seeing. There was always a lounge chair, and plenty of shade or sun depending on you preference. The staff were very friendly, professional, and responsive to all our needs. They remember your name and make you feel very welcome. The guest rooms have all been recently redecorated with new luxury linens, bedding, and fabrics. These rooms are so quiet you would never know that there are other guests. Many excellent restaurants are within walking distance, making a rental car unnecessary if you want to enjoy the city. We are already trying to plan our return!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven for This History Nerd”
Reviews.Author: sulsal
Reviews.Content: After chilling at La Concha indulging in some quality beach time, it was time to get in touch with our inner history geekiness and move to old San Juan -- a world heritage site. El Convento was the perfect place to stay -- just a few minutes away from the San Juan Gate and the passage below the city walls. I was enchanted from the momemt I had lunch in courtyard as I let my mind drift back almost four centuries. The staff was fabulous, the hotel architecture amazing, the restaurants great and the small rooftop deck and pool a serene place to recover after the excitement of touring San Cristobel. If you want sun and sand go elsewhere. If you are a history nerd with a yen for luxurious good taste, go to El Convento which embraces the wonderful history of San Juan. ps. Go to Fatty's on Calle O'Donnell, a hole in the wall that serves great home cooked Jamaican food for less than $8. We enjoyed it as much as the Parrot Club

Reviews.Title: “Beware great internet rates during busy weekends”
Reviews.Author: takojin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento in early November over Veteran's Day weekend after booking a queen room with limited view three months in advance. We got a great discount rate online for booking three months in advance and paid a 50% deposit at that time. Therefore we were dismayed to arrive in November and learn we had been moved to a room with double beds. The matter was not adequately handled by the manager on duty, but we moved the second night to the room type we had reserved and enjoyed the balance of our stay. After our return, I emailed a complaint to the manager and was impressed with the manner in which he handled the situation and the prompt response to my complaint. We would have been very satisfied if the same level of concern had been exhibited when we discovered the problem after check-in. The problem should have been acknowledged and handled at check-in rather than left for us to discover, complain about, and then not be resolved to our satisfaction. However, El Convento is a beautiful hotel. The restaurants on-site were some of the best meals we enjoyed in Old San Juan. Cana offers a great lunch value and it's lovely to enjoy tapas and wine on the balcony patio outside El Picoteo. Additionally, the wine and cheese reception is well done and we appreciated the complimentary coffee in the morning. We also enjoyed using the beach facilities at a sister hotel and appreciated the tip from the bellman regarding catching the city bus back to Old San Juan. The only other complaint I have is the quality of the mattresses. The mattresses in both rooms were beginning to sag in the middle and were not especially comfortable given the overall quality of the hotel. I would not dissuade people from staying at El Convento as it is beautiful. I would, however, doublecheck and confirm your room type before arrival, especially if you've gotten a really great rate and might get bumped in favor of those paying more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AlissaPaul
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at El Convento Dec. 17 - 19, 2008. After we parked the car (parking lot across the street) a bellman greeted us immediately and took our luggage so we did not have to haul it to our room. The front desk clerks was very polite and friendly. The hotel is very charming. There is a huge terrace in the middle of the hotel. The hotel has a complimentary wine and cheese reception every night from 6-7. This was a nice touch and allowed us to talk with other guests. Also, they have complimentary coffee and tea 24 hours which was great! The pool and hot tub are on the top floor and were very nice We have stayed all over the world and various hotels. This hotel is one of our top 5. It was clean, charming, the people were friendly, and the overall experience was top notch!!! We would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: pinva
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Great location. Helpful and courteous staff. Just make sure to not stay in room 401. It is over the terrace where guests gather late at night and talk loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved El Convento”
Reviews.Author: frankie868
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento from 12/27/2008-1/2/2009. Not only is the hotel well run by Efrain Rosa, General Manager, but the entire staff from houskeeping to restaurant personnel, to bellmen, to utility personnel, and last but not least, the front office office staff. Special mention is reserved for Guest Services Supervisor, Judith Gantenbein. We travel quite a bit, and we found her to be the most helpful, pleasant, professional concierge of any hotel we have ever stayed in. Her personal attention to every detail of our trip was over the top. What an asset to El Convento she is. If you go to El Convento, you could communicate with her via e-mail before you get there, so you can get a head start on restaurant reservations, and excursions such as the rain forest and walking tours etc. And now a word about Mr. Rosa, the General Manager. Not only was he visable on New Year's Eve, he greeted the guests and poured champaigne for all of the guests at the daily complementary wine and cheese/fruit get together. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico two years ago at this time, and the General Manager did not do this on New Yer's Eve. Additionally, a lovely touch was that every room on New Year's Eve received a complementary bottle of champaigne and two glasses in a decorative ice bucket delivered to each guest room. The room also had a flat panel t.v., radio, and internet service. The rooms are turned down nightly and you receive clean towels twice a day, as well as chocolate placed on the bed . You will not find better service anywhere in Puerto Rico, and the Hotel is central to any place you want to go to in Old San Juan. We also took taxi's to the sister hotel, La Concha several times. La Concha is right on the beach, so between El Convento and La Concha, you have the best of both worlds. Our room (513) was very clean. As you can tell, we will return to El Convento the next time we go back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Maybeti
Reviews.Content: Lovely little luxury hotel - such a romantic place. Everything was just perfect. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ctaylo25
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good place to stay in old san juan. This is a very unique part of the city and this hotel is unlike any other I have ever been to. Very cool property with a large courtyard, multiple bars and restaurants, rooftop veranda with a small pool and hot tub. Service was three stars for four star prices, but the location makes up for that. I was disappointed that they do not have readily available valet parking and charge extra for the service, as navigating the streets of old san juan by car is not an easy task. The rooms are small and housekeeping sometimes takes till the late afternoon to clean your room. Other than those few things I have no complaints. The location and beauty of the surrounding streets makes up for the shortcomings. Overall a very cool experience. I would recommend this hotel for a stay in San Juan and would advise to stay in old san juan as opposed to condado or isla verde if traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “On business, and I am in love with El Convento”
Reviews.Author: dinnerparty2010
Reviews.Content: A mix between 4-star and local, your room is one of 50+ in an extraordinary, converted convent. The care taken to maintain its beauty and charm is second to none (I saw them varnishing the banisters and polishing the stunning antique furniture). Hospitable, unpretentious, generous, El Convento deserves a "Best Of" nod amongst leading American hotels to which we've grown accustomed, from the finest Schragar and Hilton properties, to the extraordinarily Ritz Carltons and Four Seasons. All the amenities are the same with the exception of a concierge, including privacy, comfort and elegance. The bed is delicious, and there are no smells to speak of which are notable in old cities and on islands. And the 24-hour, rooftop hot tub, plunge pool and fresh coffee are the icing on the cake. It's a safe, perfect location for romance (especially a much needed escape) and business meetings (a board room, outdoor/indoor library and business center) and has excellent restaurants. You'll never feel like you're on a hotel property...there's a courtyard that shades diners from the beating sun below, while rooms rise 3 floors above it on three sides of the building. You'll feel like you went back in time, though spoiled by the modern offerings. The place was nearly fully booked, and I rarely saw guests except at the nightly wine and cheese reception, most of whom were on vacation, there for a wedding, or on honeymoon. Convinced? I'm a snobby NYer who travels for work regularly, so please don't even consider the Sheraton in the same area but opposite 17-story-high cruise ships and other tourism clutter. You'll get what you bargained for -- literally -- if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Great historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: workin'guy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a piece of magificient history - the staff were wonderful, excellent service, the place was very clean, the wine and cheese tea each afternoon a wonderful treat - you can sit on the terrace on watch bats fly about early evening while a piano or band plays in the courtyard. I did find it very expensive though, our room over 300$/night, nice kept room but not very large, and our "ocean view" , well, we could see the ocean all right, but over top of a group of other , not well-maintained buildings. The pool is a splash pool, I have a living room rug about the same size. I guess I had expected a pool I could do laps in. I loved the hotel itself, the history with it, BEAUTIFUL floors, but i did find the tappas restaurant in the hotel very expensive for such tiny servings, After a 200$ bill for three of us, we went out and got something else to eat to fill up; and the room rate I thought was high for the quality of the room that's all. I did enjoy the stay and thought it was a great place, If you don't mind the price tag - you will enjoy it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at El Convento”
Reviews.Author: VAMike
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at El Convento. Great location, our room was very nice, and service was excellent. Everyone was helpful with booking tour, restaurant recommendations and reservations, etc. We spent a day at the beach at their affiliated hotel La Concha, which was excellent. We would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abh123456
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely hotel. The staff is quite knowledgeable, especially the managers. The other staff (the woman who checked us in, the bell boy) were clearly not as well trained as the manager - the were overly solicitous. A weird thing: The bell boy didn't set up the luggage rack for us. Instead, he pushed the TV to the side of the bureau and placed the bag on the bureau. The downsides: they say they want to protect the environment, so hang up your towels if you want to use them again. We did, and when we got back to our room, they had put in new towels. I guess it's better to err on the side of fresh towels, but then don't have the eco-friendly sign up. The room was wheelchair accessible. Like many hotels I stay in, the shower head was placed at it's highest height, and therefore out of my reach. Additionally, I had requested a shower chair before my stay, and they assured me it would be in the shower when I arrived. It wasn't, and I had to remind them to deliver one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Greg187
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night last week at the El Convento and it was a great stay. I doubt you could find a hotel with more history or character in all of Old San Juan. Not to mention an ideal location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room and ammenities were very nice. As others have noted the plunge pool is small and lounge chairs are limited but it was kept very nicely, has great views and was overall just very enjoyable. The highlight of the stay was the afternoon wine reception. A really nice selection of cheese and wine were served on the terrace with brilliant views of the illuminated cathedral. While we did not have the chance to eat or drink at the hotel restaurants, the tapas bar looked real cool. There was however one slight problem - the air conditioner. In the middle of the night (2AM) my girlfriend and I both woke up on the verge of a sweat (the AC was on the lowest possible setting but clearly not working). We called the desk and someone came up super quickly. However, it was only the desk clerk who was helpful but not qualified to fix the problem. He offered to call the off-site engineer or move us to another room. In the interest of time, we took the other room down the hall but he sort of insisted we take all of our belongings with us. Which, as you can imagine, wasn't too fun at that hour. I'm not sure why we couldn't leave them there until morning. These things do I happen and I understand. However, I was surprised that there was no apology or modest compensation the following morning (like sending morning coffee/breakfast up to the room or a small credit). Aside from the air conditioner it was a great stay and I would highly recommend it. It was convenient to all the historic sites, shopping and dining. After a long day of walking the sites, it was great to have our room so close. After a nap by the pool, a shower, and glass of wine...we were only a few minutes walk from our dinner reservation. Oh but just a reminder - this is not a beach hotel. They have an affiliation with a property about 20 minutes away. But...if you are looking for a true beach front/resort type property, you may wish to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best choice for Hotels in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Bermuda2NC
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for a place to stay in San Juan, you can stop your searching now and book at this magnificent hotel! After reading all of the reviews, we decided to trust tripadvisor and book this hotel and we could not be happier about our choice. I could not possibly describe what a wonderful place this is with words, but I will try. From the moment you walk in the front doors of the hotel, you feel at home. The doorman greets you and sends you on to the concierge. While checking in, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us suggestions of what to do around the area, where to eat, what beach to visit, and a map of the area. El Convento is not on the beach, but it has a sister hotel, La Concha that is. Just take a cab over to the sister hotel and you can use their beach chairs, towels, and pool for free! The room was large and the bathroom looked clean and updated. The room had a flat screen TV, hair dryer, radio, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and mouthwash. On the 3rd floor of the hotel, they offered free bottled water anytime you wanted it. This is great to have when walking around downtown or going over to the beach for the day. The wine and cheese hour was amazing! For one hour, you get to mingle with fellow guests and enjoy red wine, white wine, and a variety of delicious cheeses and grapes. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. It is in Old San Juan within walking distance to El Morro (the fort) and a lot of shopping, restaurants, and bars. We found all of the people in San Juan to be very friendly and welcoming also. We were very impressed with how fluently everyone we encountered spoke both Spanish and English. We felt very safe walking around during the day as well as at night. I have stayed at another hotel in San Juan and did not enjoy my stay nearly as much as I did this time. The atmosphere, amazing attentive helpful friendly staff members, and location of this hotel make this hotel number 1 for a reason. I can't wait to go back for a much longer stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved El Convento!”
Reviews.Author: 10sfan
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel that is ideally situated for exploring Old San Juan. We had a wonderful if brief (one night) stay here in a queen vista room and enjoyed the view over the harbor. The plunge pool and hot tub were great day and night. The staff were very charming and helpful, and the service at the hotel and the tapas restaurant was excellent. A special thanks to Jaime who helped with our bags, and Gus who served us in the tapas restaurant. Overall I can't say enough about this hotel and hope to return for a longer stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HLeigh_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a wedding planning trip. El Convento is a wonderful hotel. The service is outstanding, the location can't be beat, and the hotel is full of character.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: UnderwoodNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: I checked online for locations in Old San Juan and El Convento kept being mentioned as the best choice. It was for me also. It mixed location, a very nice section of the old city, with historic charm. I was very surprised by the modern twists to such a historic hotel. Flat screen tv, data ports on the desk as well as a house terminal for those who didn't bring their laptops. The staff was numerous and as helpful as anyone might hope for. I was refered to local-style restaurants even when they have three fine ones of their own. The rain forest tour booked for me was first class. The staff listened to what I wanted and was delightfuly helpful. I would recommend the El Convento to anyone traveling to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Romantic Hotel in the Heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: WorksforTravelMoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for two nights before boarding a cruise ship bound for the South Caribbean, and I can only echo the other guestsâ€™ favorable comments. The hotel is gorgeous, in a perfect location and the staff is excellent. We booked a room with a balcony view of the ocean and found it to be large, comfortable and clean. The staff servicing the room was great â€“ we didnâ€™t see them too often, but when we would return from exploring the city, the room would be made up or turned down in the evening. The location is great â€“ El Convento is close to many bars, restaurants and some of the best shopping in Old San Juan. We only ate breakfast and lunch at the restaurant in the atrium, and both meals were pleasant. Unfortunately, we missed the wine and cheese reception, but enjoyed the free bottles of water. In addition to the bottles of water, there is also a self-service bar where you can mix your own drinks and on the honor system, charge them to your room. We had an excellent experience with the staff; both prior to and after our arrival. They were helpful, pointed out the many amenities and gave great restaurant/bar recommendations. One thing I can add to the other guestsâ€™ great comments is that El Convento is a member of Small Luxury Hotels of the World (which only includes 440 hotels around the world and each hotel much maintain a high level of quality to stay on the list). To find out more visit â€“ http://www.slh.com.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tearitup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel El Convento for 7 days in September. I loved everything about the hotel. We were treated wonderfully by the staff. Soledad specifically went above and beyond to help us with tour bookings and other things before we even arrived. While the pool area is small as some have said, it is a beautiful oasis in the midst of Old San Juan. We enjoyed sitting in the hot tub in the evening, very peaceful. One of the things we enjoyed the most was that most everything is within walking distance of the hotel. We even walked to the cruise ship docks and took the free ferry across to where the Bacardi factory is located. We much preferred the local Don Q rum though. The staff is really great. We never had a problem with our room being cleaned. Each day when we were out our beds were made, fresh towels and toiletries were left and the drapes were opened to let in the sun. At night, again while we were out, the beds were turned down, chocolates left on the pillows and soft music tuned in on the Bose radio. Very nice service and never intrusive . If you do stay at the hotel be sure to stop by the managerâ€™s reception held nightly from 6-7pm. A nice variety of wines and cheeses are provided and itâ€™s a good opportunity to meet some of the other guests. There is library on the third floor where besides a small selection of books and newspapers you will also find a public internet terminal. This comes in handy for checking email (if you must!) and printing out boarding passes and checking flight status. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel. Itâ€™s a beautiful boutique hotel in a unique location.

Reviews.Title: “So worth it”
Reviews.Author: AlexofMelbourne
Reviews.Content: E; Convento was recommended to me by someone who used to work in the Carribean. While it cost a little more than I hoped to pay, I got a terrific deal and reallyl helped to make the holdiay fantastic. It is a beautiful hotel with lots of character. The hotel is in a terrific position yet without the noise of the town - lots of salsa pours out into the streets which some hotels will not be able to stop. Free cheese ad wine nightly from 6-7pm can allow guests to meet, the pool and sundeck was popular and of course the rooms are lovely - mine was anyway. Free internet in a lovely library. Good products provided in the bathroom, turn down service brought nice chocolates, and overall cannot fault this hotel. Very much worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved El Convento”
Reviews.Author: bardfan75
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent two nights at El Convento on a trip to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is old-fashioned and elegant, but not glitzy, which is what I like. It reminded me of European hotels. Because we were there in the off season, we found a rate of $125/night on the hotelâ€™s website, a bargain compared to the high season rates. The hotel is in walking distance of all the major sites of the city. I recommend this hotel for travelers who want total immersion into the charms of Old San Juan. I do not recommend it for anyone who wants a new building on the beach with big rooms, Jacuzzi tubs, a casino, dancing, etc. The hotel is built around an open courtyard, featuring a restaurant surrounding a large old Nispero tree. Instead of hallways, rooms open on to galleries overlooking the courtyard. Outside each room is a small table and chairs overlooking the courtyard. Our room was small, but had old-fashioned charmâ€”wrought-iron headboards for the beds and antique furniture. A fullâ€“length window at one end offered a view of a small street below and in the distance, the Atlantic Ocean. A plus was an area with a refrigerator, stocked with free bottled water, and complimentary terry-cloth robes. An honor bar with drinks and snacks was on a terrace downstairs. Tea and coffee were complimentary. At 6 pm, a free reception offered a number of kinds of wine, plus cheeses and fruit. We enjoyed talking to fellow guests at the reception. The pool is small, but the view of the cathedral from the upper terrace is spectacular. There is also a hot tub. We ate at El Picateo, the El Convento restaurant that specializes in tapas. Our server recommended empanadillas filled with lobster to go with the pina coladas we had been craving. They were scrumptious and started us off on a week in which everything we ate was delicious. My only complaint was the $20 resort fee charged on top of the room rates. We arrived after 10 pm the first night so I asked that it be waived since we did not take advantage of any resort features, such as the option to get a pass to a sister hotel on the beach. However, we still had to pay it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing place in center of town”
Reviews.Author: Jmraggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several days as a pre-cruise hotel so we could relax and see the city before embarking on our cruise. Since the moment we arrived, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Check in was fast and we quickly went to our room on the 5th floor via the elevator. The room was fairly large and very nice with a view to the pool deck area and the San Juan Bay in the distance. We had a queen bedroom which had a nice flat screen TV, nice stereo that sounded fantastic and a desk area. There is ample room in the closet but we couldn't find a safe even though the hotel indicated that there was one. I didn't even inquire as it wasn't a big deal for us. The bathroom was nicely done, not huge but not small either as there was plenty of room for us. The hotel was very quiet and it seemed like we were the only ones there. The outside courtyard is beautiful and hardly used by anyone. We found the food prices at the restaurants a little on the pricey side and that's why I think that not many people were there dining. We did eat at the street level restaurant with patio area which I think was called Cana but I am not sure that was the name. The food was excellent but a little on the pricey side ($10 for our appetizer) but we enjoyed the food at least. The drinks we ordered didn't show up until we were almost finished with our meal even though there were only two other tables of people in the place. The staff seemed a little confused on what drink to make and who requested it. When we finally received our Martinis, but they weren't even what we ordered as far as the flavor, but we just drank them anyway as we didn't want to wait anymore since our meal had now finished. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with suggestions on where to go for local flavor dining in the area where locals dine. They were correct in all of their suggestions. We dined at some great local places. The wine and cheese reception was very good, nice selection of wines and cheeses. We tried the pool and spa a few times just to unwind and it was very enjoyable and a good way to cool off. I would stay here again because it's very close to everything in the center of town but in a very quiet area and the staff was exceptional in friendliness and helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blockster
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 YO son, and I just came back from a four night stay in Old San Juan, at the Hotel El Convento, September 1-5. It is my new favorite hotel and the ultimate romantic experience. The rooms were gorgeous. We were on the fifth floor, with a view of the harbor, tile floors, a very comfortable bed, and every amenity. The decor is in the Spanish style. Unlike what was posted previously, we found our rooms to be immaculately clean. The housekeeping staff provided turndown service each evening. Not just opening up the bed and putting out chocolates (which were yummy), but the Bose radio was set on classical music, the wet towels were exchanged for new ones and the bathroom cleaned, a bathrobe was placed across the bed, the toiletries were replenished and more bottle water (which is free) was placed in the refrigerator. Perfection. The entire staff was very accomodating. Special kudos to Jaime (AKA James, Jim), the doorman (though we think we got a promotion while we were there. Congrats!). He was so warm and friendly, remembering our names and giving us excellent recommendations when we asked questions. The men and women behind the desk were always pleasant and available to share a map, answer a question, or make arrangements for touring the rainforest. AND the resident cat was often available to accept a head scratching. The wine and cheese reception at 6 each evening was a lovely event, which we attended twice. A large selection of wines, cheeses, crackers and fruit were available, along with the ubiquitous bottled water. And I could purchase my personal vice, Diet Coke. There are candlelit tables, inside and out, and a hostess to faciltate. BTW, the location is perfect for taking off by foot to tour Old San Juan. Please go to my forum posting if you are interested in a summary of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: PearlAtlantaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights at this hotel on 8-30 through 9-1. My husband celebrated his birthday at this hotel. At first, it was not a wow factor for my husband but certainly for me....I called house keeping attention to our bathroom, to what we thought was a unclean bathroom sink. Immediately, after notifying the house keeping department the maid came and cleaned her life away on the sink. Then followed by the manager "Soledad" to inspect, what appears to be flit was residue of paint that the contractors didn't do a great job cleaning up after the renovation. That evening we went out to the happy hour, which was Fabulous!!! Then returned to our room to hear the radio stationed on jazz, robe and bed slipper laid out on our bed and the sheets were pulled back. The night of my husband birthday was another wow! Rose petals shape in Heart on the bed, robe and slipper laid out, sheets pulled back, a bottle of small champagne/two wine glass and radio station on jazz. We felt like King and Queen!! The only thing that kinda was disappointing, we either didn't listen well enough or wasn't told that the beer and soda at happy hour was for sale. We learned that the next day, after my husband drank a beer. The sign is sitting on the counter top, but too small and really...who really is going to be looking for that sign. I just think it needs to be more visible...But beyond that we were happy and pleased with everything. I immediately bought it to the manager attention and it was taken off my bill. I would definitely return with my husband again! I tipped both maids that serviced our room during our stay at El Convento. Believe me...I wouldn't have tipped even a dollar if the service was not Excellent !!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: ephraime
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Old San Juan where we stayed at this hotel. The room was comfortable; however, the maids do not clean the room. We stayed for four night and on three occasions we had to call housekeeping to have them go over the room that was supposedly cleaned while we were out. On one occasion my husband and I sat in the corridor and watch a maid go into our room by taking a fresh set of towels from the car standing in the corridor and he went into the room. He spent 15 minutes and he came out and went into another room. He did not have any disinfectant,, glass cleaner, clean classes in his hands. We went in after he left the room. I found that he had just taken the soiled towels and wiped down the face basin and the class shelf above it. He had not touched the tub which was dirty I do not know how he cleaned the cups and glasses in the room. I went to housekeeping and called the â€œsupervisorâ€� she came and examined the room then she sent him to get the disinfecting solution to clean the tub and then asked me if it was better. Having to complain about the cleanliness of the room three times made me not appreciate the uniqueness of the hotel and it ruined my stay. Also, do not eat at the hotel because the cost is outrageous, even higher than Hawaii. Breakfast for two, with two eggs and toast, three pieces of fruits is $30.00 and up. Here is another example, two tasteless appetizers in the hotel cafÃ© with two fruit cocktails, $60.00.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: thehappypig
Reviews.Content: I had my heart set into this hotel for a very long time. I have to say that the staff is very friendly and the hotel is charming but it had too many problems that made our stay in there very umpleasant. First, the hotel is being remodeled and we were placed in the same floor where the remodeling is taking place. We booked 2 rooms and in the middle of our rooms they had a storage area where they were moving furniture among other things even late at night because of the renovation process. El Picoteo restaurant plays loud (very loud) music certain days of the week. To make it worse one of our rooms is located directly on top of the restaurant music area. We were not warned at all. The music was so loud that some bottles we had on top of the bathroom vanity fell on the floor and going to the bathroom that night was an extremely unpleasant experience. The music was very loud even after 2 AM. The rooms were very dusty in certain areas. They did clean but the coffee pot on top of our refrigerator had dust that was there at least for a couple of weeks. We also had mosquitoes on our rooms. My children had about 6-10 mosquito bites all over their bodies. There is even a can of mosquito spray in the room so I assume they already know about the problem. The rooms are really pretty but like I said our rooms were not remodeled yet and they are really very outdated. The location is wonderfull and most od the staff is really very nice. Some of them go out and beyond to try to help. But for us is not a place that we will go back again. Yes I did love the experience of being able to stay there and walk Old San Juan at any time, but when I stay in a hotel I do not expect to be awake past 2 AM because the walls in the room are vibrating because of excessive noise. If they are going to have a tenant who is so disrespectful to the guest of the hotel they should probably consider closing those rooms or letting the tenant of the restaurant go. I will stay someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ericinatlanta
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is a charming boutique hotel in the heart of Old San Juan, one of the most enchanting cities I've had the opportunity to visit. In the heart of the best of San Juan's best dining, shopping, and siteseeing district, it makes up for the lack of beach access by giving you passes to one of its several sister properties with oceanfront beach access. The hotel employees were extremely helpful in arranging activities, booking services and providing area recommendations and directions, and the hotel is everything one could hope for in the city - beautiful views, gorgeous decor, a beautiful courtyard and a few charming resident cats to greet you at the elevator every night. The nightly wine and cheese reception is an added bonus. Overall - one of our favorite hotels we've ever stayed at. Very highly recommended. If you're considering a visit to San Juan, I'd recommend you stay nowhere else... in talking to the many people we met during our trip, El Convento is everything (location, charm, ambience) that all of the big resorts lack.

Reviews.Title: “Great HOtel”
Reviews.Author: d_loRiverside
Reviews.Content: The staff was great!!!! Ms. Cristine was always there to help you out she is very knowledgeable. Also, Jaime was always there with a smile on his face giving out directions for diferent locations. Shanon and Melody were very helpfull as well. By far this hotel experience has been the best yet!!! I recomend this hotel to everyone!!! The facilities are clean, the staff is friendly, and the hotel is at a great location in Old San Juan, where you are walking distance from two different historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the history and location of this charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: babygoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento in early July, our last three nights in Puerto Rico. The hotel was not fully booked and the only crowds we saw in town were on the days that cruise ships docked for the afternoon. We booked a standard queen room and were given a newly renovated room on the 5th floor (room 515) with a nice bay view. It was fun to open the French doors (no balcony) and see the cruise ships passing by. The room and bathroom were not large but the space was well used and the furnishings were in keeping with the old Spanish feel of the hotel. The bathroom was nicely done with good lighting and marble tiles. The bed was very comfortable with soft sheets and good pillows. Twice daily maid service is provided. The entry to the room is a small hallway with a closet that holds a small refrigerator and a coffee maker. Bottled water is supplied daily as is Alta Grande Puerto Rican coffee. There is a desk in the room with a free internet connection. Nice touches include rustic pottery and a live ivy plant. The heavy wooden doors open to the outside with glass doors behind them that can also be opened. There is a modern glass door between the room and the entry hall that can be closed to keep out the noise and heat from the courtyard. Many of the rooms face the alley along the back of the hotel but it is actually quite nice because this is a pedestrian only alley with pots of tropical flowers in front of the houses. Since the building was originally a convent all the rooms open to broad open-air walkways that face the interior courtyard. Outside each room is a small table and chairs overlooking the courtyard. It was a very nice place to sit with a cup of coffee or a glass of wine listening to the music from the hotel restaurants. At night they come and put candles on all of the hallway table which adds to the ambiance and old world feel. There is currently renovation work going on at the hotel and while we were there the 4th floor was closed. We were told that the renovation started on the 5th (top) floor and is being done floor by floor. I never saw an unrenovated room so I canâ€™t compare but our room was bright and fresh so I recommend requesting a renovated room. Since the work is being done inside the rooms there is little construction noise to bother you. We never used the small hotel pool but it has a lovely rooftop location. Unfortunately the hot tub was closed during our stay (which was never mentioned when we booked or checked in). We would have enjoyed that if it had been available. The best amenity at the hotel is the 6 oâ€™clock wine and cheese reception that is held on a covered patio on the 3rd floor that overlooks the cathedral. A good selection of wines and a very nice spread of cheeses, crackers, and fruit is offered all at no charge from 6-7 p.m. nightly. It was also a nice way to meet other guests. In the same lounge there is also a 24-hour honor bar with wine, beer, liquor and soft drinks and free coffee service. You simply sign a ticket and leave it in the box and it will be billed to your room upon checkout. There are several restaurants inside the hotel on the 1st and 2nd floors of the courtyard. We had breakfast each morning at the Patio Nispero and one night had a wonderful dinner at the El Picoteo tapas bar. The location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing in Old San Juan. It is a small town and you can walk everywhere. The streets are hilly and lined with charming houses painted in tropical colors. It is a short walk to El Morro and only a slightly longer walk to San Cristobel. Both forts are worth seeing. Less than two blocks from the hotel (turn right as you exit the front door) is the Old San Juan gate. Once you exit through the gate you can turn left for the Princessa walkway that will take you past the beautiful Raices fountain and down to the cruise ship docks. If you turn right as you pass through the San Juan gate you will be on the 3/4 mile El Morro Trail which is a lovely seaside walkway with the ocean on one side and the towering city walls on the other. Beautiful views from this trail and you will see the famous San Juan cat colony that live in the rocks along the bay. The cats are taken care of (neutered and fed) by the Save A Gato humane society. This is a perfect hotel for Old San Juan if you want to stay in the old town and donâ€™t care about not being near a beach. We had already spent a week at a beach resort so we didnâ€™t care to stay at a modern beach hotel in new San Juan; we really wanted the old town experience.
