Ask at the front desk for a leaflet on the history of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: dfa9a
Reviews.Content: (The) El Convento Hotel is a wonderful place to stay if you want to stay in Old San Juan. We only had 2 nights in all of Puerto Rico, so we had to choose a place that would maximize our stay, even if it was a little pricey. El Convento worked out perfectly. The furnishings are wonderful and the staff is incredibly friendly (perhaps to a fault, actually). If you want a place in Old San Juan that is beautiful, luxurious, and definitely high class, then this is the place. Tip: the wine and cheese reception is great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Citychick_0274
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Puerto Rico last week and because tripadvisor reviews were such a great help to me during planning, I thought I would do my part and write a review. Now mind you, I am a person who realizes that I am on vacation and that the culture anywhere I go is going to be different than home. I don't take much seriously when I am on vacation. After all, the purpose is to relax and go with the flow. With that said, the hotel itself is gorgeous!!! The rooftop garden/pool is beautiful as is the entry foyer. The location is optimal as it is close to shopping, food and sights. My biggest complaint (which is really not a huge deal) was that all the glasses in the room were dirty. We brought some plastic cups from the previous hotel so we used those. No biggie. The bathtub was not the cleanest thing I have ever used, but it was in the corners of the tub so I just stayed away from those sections. Although I expected it (it is a converted convent after all) the room is really small and smells a bit musty. Again, no biggie. The bose stereo was nice and the flat screen tv was cool for watching tv before bed. HAHAHAHA! We had a haunted phone that would turn it's speaker phone on by itself and refused to hang up. Eventually we just unplugged it after it woke my boyfriend I in the middle of the night. The alley view from our room was nice and the staff, including the parking valets, were super friendly and knowledgeable. The 24 hour water, tea, coffee service was nice as was the wine/cheese reception every day at 6pm. All in all it is a nice hotel but was not my favorite of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: wmchica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our honeymoon and LOVED it! It is the perfect location from which to explore Old San Juan. The hotel itself is beautiful and well-kept, our room was very comfortable and we enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi on the roof. We liked having breakfast each day in the courtyard and the waitstaff was very attentive. The only drawback was they did not have any rooms with a king size bed, and since my husband is very tall we would have ilked to have that. Still, the bed was comfortable, just not quite big enough. Everything else was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Would visit again”
Reviews.Author: cayci03
Reviews.Content: Overall this place was great! Unbeatable location, great terraces, spacious rooms, friendly and very helpful staff, and who could help but rave about free wine and cheese?!? My family and I took one of the tours listed in the guest services books (Rain forest and beach) in the rooms and had an amazing time. The hotel took the hassle out of finding and booking a good tour guide. I thought the tour was a bit pricey at first but following the tour I'd say it was worth every penny. Only complaint I have was that my bed definitely had bed bugs. Every morning (and sometimes throughout the night) I'd wake up with new bite marks all over my legs. Now I don't recall being bitten by anything when I was out and about (in fact I can't recall encountering many bugs at all in Puerto Rico) but, by the time I returned home I i have quite a few bite marks all over both legs. Considering we never opened the patio door I think it is a safe bet to narrow it down to bed bugs. Other than that a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: Tink1234
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been happier with our one night stay in June. We had spent the previous 5 days at the Wyndham Rio Mar but we wanted one night in San Juan in order to see the city more fully. We had not originally booked here only b/o the two night minimum on weekends and instead reserved the Marriott in Condado instead, even though honestly, we would have preferred this hotel. Unbeknownst to me, that Marriott was the old Dupont Plaza where the tragic fire of 1986 took place. We had been booked at that hotel for arrival the day of the fire in '86 (when I was but a teenager) and the only reason we were not there was our flight was delayed. To put it mildly, we feel it was a miracle we were not there at the exact time of the fire where 97people lost their lives. Anyway, I found this out only the morning we were supposed to check into the Marriott and I will give them credit, I explained my story and they cancelled our reservation without penalty. I was then scrambling for a hotel and Carlos at El Convento worked a small miracle for us. He found us a double room and waived the 2 night minimum since we were calling for a room for that day. I can't tell you how much his effort and hospitality meant to us. The hotel itself simply could not be more atmospheric and the location was ideal. The nightly wine and cheese reception was a treat with a gorgeous assortment of cheeses and interesting wines, all served on the 4th floor terrace. The 24 hour coffee and tea service and the rooftop pool overlooking the cathedral were also big hits for us. Our room, though without a view, was enormous! All we had to do to get a view was walk 5 paces, so no complaints there. My only word of advice would be for travelers with children. The hotel staff themselves were nothing but gracious and welcoming but I would not say the same for all of the guests - I understand this to a certain point, it is more of an adult hotel but the fact is, they allow children so if other patrons want absolutely no children, they need to find an adult only hotel. We have 2 children ages 5 and 10, who are seasoned travelers and know when they are to be on best manners, and still we got some dirty looks. So while I wouldn't steer families away from the hotel, one night was just right for us. The four of us also had dinner at El Picoteo and thought the food and the atmosphere could not have been beat. I would recommend this hotel for everyone who wants to have total immersion into the charms of Old San Juan, even those with children. I asked my kids to be respectful that the guests were mostly adults who didn't want to hear a lot of screaming kids, and made sure that they were on their best behavior but after that I just didn't let the other guests spoil what is an unforgettable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: fbusa
Reviews.Content: If you like small hotels, in central locations, with bags of character and history, an outdoor dining terrace and bar area overlooking the old town square then you will probably like El Convento. If you like big, modern with a casino then this isnt for you. Maybe the hotel overplays the rooms with views and some reviewers have been disappointed - all I can say is that San Juan has mainly flat-roofed buildings with satellite dishes etc. From our room you could technically see the sea but the foreground is the quirky, characteristic roofs - charming in a San Juan way. I loved El Convento for its pretty courtyard, old architecture, the wine and cheese hour on the terrace, a quiet late night drink over-looking the old town square and floodlit church, easy stroll to the water.. San Juan is interesting and the bars great fun ! and 2-3 nights about right if just doing the tourist stuff. (if you are a small quiet hotel-type person I would also recommend the Horned Dorset Hotel, Rincon vs the other large Puerto Rican hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with a story”
Reviews.Author: Wyonative7
Reviews.Content: I booked El Convento as the first night in a 10-day stay in Puerto Rico. The hotel has such a great "feel" that it was a near-perfect beginning to our vacation. Its location is exceptional to tour Old San Juan and only took 15 minutes from the airport. We parked at valet parking ($20 charged to the room) and proceeded to run around Old San Juan. There were 13 of us so we booked 4 rooms (3 double doubles and one queen). I was a little nervous about paying so much money because I'd seen a couple of reviews where people complained about the room size or quality, but that was certainly not a problem. It was a thrill to stay in a hotel with such history and character. Several members of our group really enjoyed the complimentary 'wine and cheese/fruit' from 6-7pm although not all even attended because some were out touring the sites. No one in our group regularly pays out over $250/night but it was definitely worth it for our one-night stay in San Juan. The one story I will share though is I left my wife in the room to go help others in the group get settled in their rooms and when I returned some 20-30 minutes later my wife was trapped inside the bathroom. I tried in vain to pull the bathroom door open from the outside and finally called the front desk. They had 2 guys up in about 2 minutes and had to take the doorknob off to release her. She thought it was a funny story so it didn't put a damper on our overall experience at the hotel, and no one else in our group was victimized by the El Convento ghosts so I imagine it was a not-so-common experience. We followed their website and then called them directly for rates. I would recommend getting a price by phone (they spoke perfect English) and then also checking Internet rates because I got better rates over the phone although they promise Internet rates are cheaper. We would definitely stay there again, especially for any days wanted to visit Old San Juan, but there are better options for an extended stay outside of Old San Juan (Luquillo Playa Azul/Sandy Hills).

Reviews.Title: “Skip El Picoteo-go across the street to Buren's”
Reviews.Author: bahstengirl
Reviews.Content: We chose to eat her based on some other reviews. It was during a food festival and things were busy. The traffic was terrible and parking cost us $27! The food was ok at El Picoteo, certainly not cheap for what we got. It is tapas style but very expensive. Drinks were also expensive. We actually had a better experience across the street at Buren . We went here before dinner since the roads were so crowded and our reservation was not for another hour. The bartender Emmanuel was wonderful. He gave us great suggestions for sightseeing all around the island and made a mean batch of Sangria! The prices and food were more reasonable and better. We had just a few items at El Picoteo and then went back across the street for more food and drink!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mlc00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. The hotel is in a great location and is a beautiful building. However they seem to rely on their "historic hotel" designation way too much, as the hotel is very expensive but the rooms and management leave a lot to be desired. The management was not very helpful when we encountered a problem with our room. Also, housekeeping does a subpar job - i don't think they clean the toilets very frequently. We were in a queen deluxe room for $300 (plus tax), although that was the smallest queen bed i have ever seen and my husband and i couldn't fit in the bathroom together (and we are fairly slender people). The first room we were in, which I was told no less than 75 times was their "model room" (i still have no idea why), had this extremely annoying banging noise coming out of the AC duct that happened every 30 seconds or so (with the AC on or off). We complained that night, were told they had no rooms in our rate, so to check back tomorrow. The banging continued all night, so we complained again the next morning and were told they would send an "engineer" to look at it and if they couldn't fix it we could switch rooms. When we checked back at 5pm, we were told that the "engineer" sat in the room for 30 minutes and never heard it. The manager acted liked we were making it up, which is always a nice attitude. She told us that if we still heard it when we went back, she would switch our room. Of course, within 1 minute of being in the room, we heard it. After making the manager and their engineer come to the room with us, they also heard it within a minute or 2. Then the engineer said "Yeah, I have heard that before, just not today." And you didn't try to fix it last time? Excellent work ethic. They did switch us to another room, which was very quiet. Upon checkout, when we saw that we were billed the full rate for the first night, we complained to the manager on duty (same one as before, lucky us). We didn't want the room for free, but considering the aggravation I felt a little customer coddling was in order. She was clearly annoyed that we were bothering her again and before I even completed my sentence she said she would give us 30% off the rate. That's all I wanted. Well, with a little less attitude. Bottom line - its a very unique building with a gorgeous patio inside (excellent breakfast at their restaurant), and they have a complimentary wine/cheese thing which was lovely, but the management and housekeeping could use some serious work. It was certainly not terrible, but was far from stellar and its WAY too expensive considering the problems, no matter how much free cheese you give me.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanted - Could be better informed”
Reviews.Author: FullofPureLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel El Convento for one night after a weekend in Culebra. We didn't have reservation so we thought we couldn't get a room. A friend mentioned us about the hotel. We then did some research. We first review the Hotel in Trip Advisor. My couple and I had a curiosity from the reviews in the web page and how the Hotel Manager always writes back to any comment. This is not normal, it was clear that service was important for the hotel. The Rooms are small but we didn't expect anything big specially in a 300 old small luxury building-hotel and for the price we paid last minute. We met Jaime the door man. Everyone talk's about him. Almost a Celebrity. The location is great next to Coach, Guess, Burberry, Puma and Ralph Lauren Outlets. What I like about Puerto Rico is that you don't have 100 people jumping on top of you trying to sell you something like it happens on other islands, the south of spain or other countries. Early that evening we started walking around the hotel and for our surprise we went to the this little room and the hotel that had Wine and Chesse of the hotel. Great romantic view. We only had bottled water, but they had a full self service bar. I am originally from Spain and we decided to visit the tapas rest for a salad and some drinks. I could only say that only in sevilla you see restaurants so beautiful like this one. Well then we heard music coming from the outside terrace and from my surprise a really nice jazz band was playing. It was another restaurant but we didn't know because there's no signage of the rest inside the hotel and the front desk didn't mention anything. The hotel only has a sign to The Patio Rest and the Picoteo Rest. The two tables seating next to us at the terrace were enjoying a 5 Rum Flight with a Rum Expert. They really seemed to be having a good time. The hotel should hand out or provide a small information recommendation guide mentioning all the rest they have and its concept. Because they are all unique and different and they all have there charm and theme. Well it was a Rum Bar called Kane or CaÃ±a. Really good mojito. We enjoy the rest of the night enjoy from the jazz band the hotel provided in the outside terrace next to a incredible art statue. My couple wanted to stay viewing some sports game inside the restaurant but not on our only night in Puerto Rico. That night we then continue walking around the Old City and ended up with the view of the fort El Morro. At night the light effect of the fort makes it look like floating in the air. A Must See. We slept like babies that night. During the morning we had breakfast and left. Overall â€“ The Hotel is beautiful. Being old one couldnâ€™t expect thing to be like new building hotel. Having this in mind help us enjoy the hotel structure and dÃ©cor even more. The next time we visit Puerto Rico I will stay in the hotel at least one or two night then move to a beach front hotel. We still have a big curiosity of the Rum Flight those two tables were having at the Rum Bar Kane or CaÃ±a!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abigs_FL
Reviews.Content: The El Convento was highly recommended by friends and also by Trip Advisor so we felt pretty confidentant in our choice of hotel. I have to say, it was a pleasure staying there. In addition to the beauty of the hotel itself, these little things made the stay highly enjoyable: 1) Free internet in the rooms. 2) complimentary bottled water in the in-room fridge and 3) complimentary nightly wine and cheese hour which also included water, coffee, tea, soft drinks, beer, and mixed drinks. The wine choices were excellent as well, 4 different reds and 4 different whites. This area also had complimentary coffee, tea and bottled water all day. I found it so refreshing to not have to pay for an internet connection and also to not get charged $6.00 for a bottle of water like is often the case in many hotels. The other great plus is the location of El Convento, right in the heart of Old San Juan and walking distance to great shopping and dining as well as the forts.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: SarahASeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an overnight layover on our way to Antigua and it was such a great place! The rooms were very large and clean and beautiful. The hotel had such a charming feel about it that it is a challenge to capture it in words. Cute bar, great little courtyard area that was incredibly picturesque and located in a great part of town for walking the shops and cafes. We felt completely safe here and took advantage of our afternoon to check out what we could of the area. Admittedly we were kind of sad to leave and head to the island, we will definitely stay here again. All of this and it was a really good price as well. It was within good proximity to the airport, maybe a 20 minute cab ride. I highly recommend this hotel. Relatively small and intimate, doesn't feel like those large boiler plate chain hotels. Charming.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible houskeeping!”
Reviews.Author: mjack1997
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night caribbean cruise and decided to stay in San Juan 1 night post cruise. We chose El Convento based on Tripadvisor's review and the location in Old San Juan. Booked the hotel online for $220/night (twin superior). With taxes and fees, the charge was shy of $300.00. So this is not a cheap hotel. Called the hotel a few times to confirm the details of my reservations and requests I made. We requested for an early check in, a late check out and a roll away bed, as there were 3 of us traveling. We got to the hotel around 10:00 am. The hotel was beatutiful, has the elegant old world charm of Spanish colonial times. And being that it is a small hotel, it has the homey feel of a large mansion. The ladies at the front office/reception were very nice. We were told that our room was not ready as it was still occupied and need to be cleaned and should be ready by noon. At this time, I have mentioned my request for the rollaway bed (1st request). I was told it will be taken care of. So we put our luggages in the holding area and went to the courtyard which was lovely and had drinks and we were admiring the hotel architecture. The bartender and the concierge at the courtyard restaurant were very welcoming. I went back to the reception around 11:00 to check if the room was ready, it was not. So we went out to lunch and came back around 1:30 and we were able to get into a room. The room was beautiful, spacious and had a nice view of the cobble stoned streets below. The bathroom was clean but noticed that there was no extra roll of toilet paper (there were 3 of us in the room). And no rollaway bed. I went outside our room to ask the housekeeper we saw in the hallway for a rollaway bed (2nd time). He said, I must let the reception know, which I have already done so. Meanwhile, my cousin just realized that she left a bag at the port. She called reception ASAP and a lady named Christine helped her right away, called the cruiseline and the 'lost and found' at the port. We thought that was really great. On our way out to pick up my cousin's bag and walk around Old San Juan, we stopped by reception to thank Christine and mentioned the rollaway bed (3rd time). Came back to the hotel around 6:00 and enjoyed their complimentary wine and cheese hour. Went to our room and again, no roll away bed. Rested for awhile and headed back out to look for a place to eat, went back to reception and asked to reccommendation. They were very helpful and pleasant. I mentioned that there was no rollaway bed (4th time). This time, the lady asked me if I want it at that moment. I said not really, since we were on our way out to dinner but would like to have it placed in the room when we get back. Got back around 9:30 10:00 pm , and guess what? No rollaway bed. Now I'm annoyed, called the reception right away (5th time) and even they were surprised that at this point in time, there's still no rollaway bed. Since we we exhausted from the day's activities, I just wanted to lie down. I pulled the bed covers and first thing I noticed was the bed sheets did not look fresh and clean. I grabbed the pillow and I was just shocked, the pillow case had stain on it. In my mind, this could not be for a supposedly small luxury hotel. I called housekeeping, a lady answered and told her about the sheets and pillow case. I even asked her to come see it for herself. Meanwhile the housekeeper came with the rollaway and the first thing he said to us was 'it was not my fault', not very professional, I thought. I then showed him the bed sheets and pillow case and asked him if he thinks they were clean? And of course, after he saw the stain on the pillow, he had no response. A lady supervisor came and explained that it was cleaned last night. Of course, they were cleaned the night before for the previous guests, but they were not replaced for the next guests (us) after the previous guests checked out. She did apologize, but I thought it was a stupid excuse. She left, and a houskeeper came back with 1 sheet set, and asked me if I want the other beds changed too? Of course, we do. Then, another housekeeper came with the extra sheets and another guy who seem be wearing a security uniform which I thought was weird. He did not do anything but stood at one corner, while the housekeepers were changing the beds. I even asked the housekeeper, if that was his bodyguard? He did not respond. We got up the next morning, and one by one we showered. As the 3rd person showered, the bath tub was clogged and now we run out of toilet paper. I don't remember whether I called housekeeping about the clogged tub and the toilet paper or if I mentioned it to the receptionist on our way out to breakfast? But nevertherless, they fixed the tub and gave us 1 extra roll of paper which was placed on the table instead of replacing the empty roll in the bathroom. I know that is a minor detail, but it they claim that they are a small luxury hotel, small detail like that is what makes a luxury hotel stand miles apart from the big chain hotels. The hotel is beautiful and the location is really great. I'm not quite sure if I will stay there again. Not so much for the numerous times we requested for a rollaway bed, but really more importanly, about the stained pillow case and used bed sheets. The rest of the staff were very professional and welcoming. Housekeeping really needs help.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 24 hours!”
Reviews.Author: kevart
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience elsewhere in the City, called El Convento after a sleepless night. Could they book us a room for tonight? Could we check in early? Front deck clerk Christine asnwered yes to both questions and turned our Old San Juan nightmare into a wonderful 24 hours! The room was beautiful- clean, quiet and elegant. The property is wonderful. The resturants are good, the shared spaces - the library, the pool area, the decks are all lovely. The location is close to the fort, musuems and other places we wanted to visit. We found everything we needed, we were treated kindly and we had a wonderful time. We were in Puerto RIco only to go to VIeques and just by chance had to spend two nights in San Juan before heading back up north. We now would return to San Juan just to spend time in El Convento. This place is wonderful and worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming!”
Reviews.Author: debbie173nj
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I recently spent a week at el Convento and loved every minute. The decor and history of the hotel is wonderful and the minute you enter the hotel it is very peaceful and calming. I loved the turndown service in the evening and returning to my room after dinner to beautiful music. The wine and cheese in the evenings is a nice way to relax after a long day and there are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. I definitely look forward to returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaRiv
Reviews.Content: Well, we stayed here in November 2007, sorry it took me so long to do this, I completely forgot! Anyway, we were there for a very close friends wedding, it was great! From check in to check out, the employees were very friendly and attentive to our needs! Our room was small, as expected, but cozy and romantic! We had a little roommate all week long, a lizard. They were everywhere, so if you don't like lizards, you have a problem! We ate in the restaurants in the hotel and they were both really good! I recommend doing this at least once or twice, then venture out into Old San Juan for some meals! There were some fantastic restaurants and bars in town! The pool: It's small!! We didn't particularly mind this minor detail, as we weren't intending to swim laps and neither were our friends. The view from the pool was amazing, San Juan bay on one side and the town on the other!! I hope you enjoy your stay at El Convento, we defintely did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, less than great customer service”
Reviews.Author: iwannalilsunshine
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel over the Easter holiday. Check-in was a lengthy process since the front desk manager gave us a smaller room than the one we booked and attempted to convince us that we were incorrect despite our having paperwork documenting our specific reservation. This problem was resolved after a few hours and we did receive a room consistent with our booking. The room was fairly small however and one of the showers leaked due to poor grading of the tile. We did report this to the front desk. We heard many customer service complaints while we were there. We were given conflicting and inaccurate information about an excursion to El Yunque. On a positive note, Shannon at the front desk was professional and helpful. The hotel itself is quite pretty and in an excellent location. You can easily walk to the forts and around Old San Juan. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent and service was good. The wine and cheese hour was good, with a wide selection of wines and cheeses. The hotel was clean with comfortable common areas and many antiques. Overall, after check in, our experience was very positive mainly due to the hotel's location. El Yunque is worth the trip if you can plan a day to visit. The pool is postage stamp sized but the view from the pool area is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeD
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in San Juan before our cruise and we chose the El Convento based on others reviews on TripAdvisor. I was so happy we did! Even though it is in the middle of bustling Old San Juan, you feel as though you've entered a sanctuary with a lovely courtyard and big rooms. We opted for one of the less expensive rooms and even though the windows didn't have the best views, the room was very large and comfortable. On the day we had to leave for the cruise the town was so busy there were hardly any cabs available. We were able to walk right down to the piers to our ship. The terrace where the continental breakfast is served looks right out at the Cathedral and we could here Easter Morning Mass going on. The only thing I didn't care for was the tapas restaurant at the hotel. While the dessert was delicious the tapas itself was very bland. We're from Chicago and I've had much better, flavorful tapas here! The staff, especially Jamie the bell man, was extremely accomodating and helpful. Many of my family whom we were traveling with stayed at big resorts and were disappointed - my husband and I were so happy with our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Old World elegance”
Reviews.Author: alamocitygal
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at El Convento before debarking on a cruise and those three days were wonderful, ammenities are above most exclusive hotels. Our problem arose on our return from the cruise. We had reservations for one night before flying home. We wanted to relax after the cruise and not rush to the airport. However, that last day almost ruined my entire trip. We were off the ship at 9 a.m. and the dock is only a few blocks from the hotel. Upon arrival they told us we could not have a room until 3:00 p.m. Having not slept well the night before I was exhausted and wanted to just lay down. Waiting 3 hours in a very uncomfortable "lobby" and another 3 hours up on the 3rd floor in their honor bar area was exhausting. Next time we stay in San Juan I think we will pick one of the bigger hotels where we know we can get into a room upon arrival. This small "boutique" hotel is just not equipped with enough staff. Having check out at 11 a.m. I can't understand why it would take 6 hours to clean so few rooms unless they don't have enough help. Try the El San Juan Hotel and Casino across from the airport. Wow, they've done an amazing job with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Te Amo, El Convento.”
Reviews.Author: Dianeyz
Reviews.Content: Located in Old San Juan, this former convent is now a charming small luxury hotel. It is located directly across a blue-sheen cobblestone street from San Juan Cathedral, the city's main Catholic Church. The hotel was recommended to us for our one-night stay prior to our cruise by the Royal Caribbean agent, and it is a treasure. The El Convento is luxuriously appointed, and with its open-air lobby and halls, it was always cool and breezy. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 2pm, but check-in was not until 3pm. The desk clerk provided us with a heavy key for the elevator that allowed us to get up to their beautiful 3rd floor and take advantage of all their amenities. They had drinks on ice, a small library with one computer, quiet patio space overlooking a garden and the cathedral, and a small plunge pool/hot tub area with view of the ocean. We ventured down Calle de Cristo, just a couple of blocks, and went into an old bar called Maria's that a Puerto Rican friend recommended we try. We ordered cheese nachos and fresh strawberry smoothies. It was a nice way to start the trip. At 4pm we went back to the hotel, but the room was still not ready. We were told that they had been at capacity last night and were having trouble making up all the rooms. I asked them to please call me on my cell phone when the room was ready. They provided us with a map and recommended a fabulous restaurant that served vegetarian food, Cafe Berlin, on Calle de San Francisco, just a 15-minute walk from the hotel. Here we enjoyed a veggie version of Argentinean steak with loads of wine-soaked veggies. It was perfect, and I'd recommend the clean, elegant, and easily affordable Cafe Berlin to vegetarians and carnivores alike. The room was finally ready at 6pm. This was outrageous, but I have to admitâ€”the room was worth the wait. You entered from an open-air hall that overlooked a cheery restaurant with trees dripping white lights. From our balcony you could see multi-colored row houses that made for some amazing pictures. The sheets were luxuriously soft; the ceilings high. We were given robes and slippers to use; there was a safe, a fridge, and a flat-screen TV--everything you could want. My hubby went upstairs to the free wine and cheese hosting they do every evening and brought me down some to try...but I was fast asleep, and I didn't wake up until morning. For breakfast, try La Bombonera--also on Calle de San Francisco, just 10 minutes on foot. They serve fresh-squeezed juices and wonderful Spanish danish called mallorcas, which have a variety of fillings and are dusted with powdered sugar. Even with the delayed check-in, I thoroughly recommend the perfectly situated El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Much more to love than the room”
Reviews.Author: dcbeach
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, we loved this hotel. Except, that is, for the times when we were in our room. But even with that caveat, this is an excellent hotel, and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The room: The room was fairly small. The bed was small. The bathroom was small. We booked a queen bed room. We have a queen bed at home and I know a queen bed. This was not a queen bed. I was assured by the front desk that it was, but it wasn't. If it was a full, rather than a double bed, I'd be surprised. She assured me that all the other rooms had the same beds. I doubted this but decided to stay put rather than ask for a new Now I am fairly small, but I actually fell out of this bed. And no, it did not involve sangria or other delicious beverage. It was just too small a bed to roll over in. It is pretty funny now, but I had a huge bruise, as the tile floor was not a good landing pad. (nor were my high heel wedge sandals). I recommend you not roll over in bed. There was a little table with little chairs. No place to relax in the room. But that was ok, because here's where the hotel gets good... even great! The hotel property: Oh my! How wonderful!! This hotel's charm lies outside the rooms, in nooks and crannies all over the hotel. There is a lovely little plunge pool, on a nice sliver of a terrace with loungers with towel service. There is a covered area with tables and chairs adjacent to the pool area, and another beautiful covered terrace with tables and cushioned chairs where you can enjoy a glass of wine, beer, coffee or tea from the honor bar area just inside. There is another long sun deck overlooking the interior courtyard and each floor of the hotel has chairs, tables outside of each room on a wide corridor that rings the courtyard. This is where we sat almost any time we were not out and about wandering Old San Juan. There is a little library, and no doubt we missed some other little hidden corners to sit and read or just enjoy this great little property. Activities: We used the 'beach club' service, and found the sister property to be a nice alternative for a day. The front desk arranged everything and made the day easy and seamless. The beach was ok, not great. But the beach service (umbrella, chairs and facilities at the hotel) were quite nice. We thought we would hit the beach more than we did, but Old San Juan was just such a joy to explore. There are plenty of touristy souvenir stores for the cruise ship day trippers, but there are also many excellent art galleries, excellent restaurants and sights to see. El Morro was a surprise and well worth the walk. Incredible views of the roiling sea at the harbor into San Juan and La Perla. Walking outside the city wall to the city gate, and back up into the town was well worth the time. Old San Juan was fascinating and was excellent for walking. (caveat - not so excellent for walking in heels.) Narrow little blue cobblestone streets, interesting architecture, beautiful balconies brimming with flowers and plants. Loved it! Dining: The hotel has some excellent restaurants. But there are so many great places to eat in walking distance, make sure you get out and taste the town. In fact, everything is within walking distance. Overall: We spent five days and thought that was just right to do and see what we wanted to do and see and do without feeling like we missed something or feeling like we had taken one spin too many around town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: lolamini
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for one night at El Convento in Old San Juan. It is a lovely hotel set in a building with a long and interesting history. The lobby area feels like you stepped into a museum or an important building of some kind and it's decorated in old pieces to bring out the historic nature of the structure. I had read other reviews that the staff was not responsive to guests, but we had the opposite experience. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so the front desk, which was very helpful, stored our bags, told us how to get an internet connection up in their library (which is a nice area with coffee/drinks etc), and then they came up shortly after to tell us our room was ready. There is a pretty bar/lounge in the courtyard of the hotel with a giant tree going all the way up in the middle of the courtyard. The pool, on the roof top, is quite small, with a hot tub next to it, but there are lounge chairs and it's nice to sit and look out at the old city. Our room had a huge and well-stocked bathroom and was decorated in a unique manner;definitely not the usual chain hotel room. The only negative in the room was that it had a queen size bed (they didn't have many rooms with Kings) which moved when you leaned back against the bedboard to watch TV. The hotel is located in an utterly charming part of San Juan - small hilly cobblestone streets, with pretty buildings, cafes, stores etc., and it's also just a few blocks from the forts and the water. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful El Convento”
Reviews.Author: Allegre
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel El Convento in Old San Juan. Our stay was wonderful. We contacted the hotel in advance and the hotel manager, Efrain Rosa, was very gracious and kind. He arranged for us to be upgraded to the Pablo Casals Suite because other suites were unavailable during our stay. The suite was lovely: the hotel itself is a pretty, calm oasis in the middle of Old San Juan. It's walking distance to everything there so you don't need a car. For our anniversary, the hotel created a path of rose petals from the door of our suite leading to an enormous heart of petals on our king-sized bed. They also chilled a bottle of very nice champagne for us and gave us a lovely bouquet of flowers. We enjoyed the many restaurants on site and also the Manager's cocktail reception every evening at 6PM. We also liked the complimentary coffee/tea and honor bar that remained open all day. We enjoyed our stay tremendously, the staff was always friendly, helpful and courteous and we would recommend the hotel highly to anyone staying in lovely Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. We only stayed one night while on our way to the BVI to sail and have decided to lengthen next years trip so we can stay at this hotel and enjoy all it has to offer. The location lends itself to exploring Old San Juan in comfort and to enjoy the history of the area.

Reviews.Title: “NIce stay in Old Town from a frequent traveler”
Reviews.Author: lilmic1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Covento to experience the charm of Old San Juan (this hotel is not the place to stay if you want to relax by the pool or beach). However it is a lovely place to stay if you want to shop, eat and experience some history. A good place for couples. A great place for adults- I would not recommend bringing children. It was quiet and beautiful albeit somewhat expensive (an additional $90 in fees PER night for hotel tariff/taxes in addtition to the nightly hotel rate when booking trhu the hotel website). Walking distance to many great restaurants, and the forts. There is a small but very nice hot tub on the roof with a beautiful view. The "pool" is TINY. You do have the ability to use one of the beaches in Isla Verde. There is a complimentary wine and cheese reception every evening which was very nice. If checking out at noon- i may recommend checking out a little early because there is somewhat of a crowd. My husband and I stayed here for a few days to experience the city and the restaurants and then moved to a beach resort to enjoy some surf and sun... (which is what i recommend doing if coming to san juan for the first time) Cons of the hotel: 1. Small "pool" 2. I thought our tariff was slightly expensive (a little over 800$ for 2 nights) 3. Frazzled staff when checking out on Monday afternoon- come earlier than noon if you want to beat the line (however, staff was normally polite and helpful during the other parts of the stay) Restaurants in walking distance: -Marmalade- great food, atmosphere ($30 per entree) -DragonFly- small restaurant, but great food, service is only OK/ sometimes rude on the weekends when it is exptremely busy at prime hours- but food makes up for it. may have long wait. (25$ per entree) -Aguaviva- great food, wonderful service

Reviews.Title: “Beware room 220”
Reviews.Author: veggielover08
Reviews.Content: We were travelling to Tortola and got stuck overnight in San Juan. The room we got had no windows and a terrible loud engine noise coming from the other side of the wall. After travelling for over 24 hours we were in a dark noisy room with no air. To be fair at 2am when I went down to see if we could get moved they gave us another room. They gave us another room which was beautiful. Original tiles, great windows. My question - Why didn't they give us that room to start with if it was empty?

Reviews.Title: “Holy wow!”
Reviews.Author: bionic15
Reviews.Content: El Convento is THE place stay in Old San Juan. It is the perfect location from which to explore the Old city, with a totally unique atmosphere and layout. It is within walking distance of restaurants, tourist sites, and the waterfront. Inside, there are some cool historic remnants of the convent it once was, and the long, wide hallways and heavy doors definitely made us feel we were in a former nunnery. My partner was even reminded of a scene from the Sound of Music! Itâ€™s also worth noting here that we are a lesbian couple and found the environment completely welcoming and comfortable. The staff was very friendly, the service excellent. Each evening there was a complimentary wine & cheese reception right next to the library, where we found some books to swap as well as internet access. As for restaurants in the hotel, we tried two out of four: breakfast downstairs at El Patio del Nispero and lunch at CÃ£na, both highly recommended. Room service was handy, but stick to breakfast in the courtyard to enjoy the fruit pancakes at their freshest and most delicious. The other two restaurants did appear to have a few stairs to climb for access. We spent several hours reading & sunning on the beautiful roofdeck, which had gorgeous views and a small plunge pool for cooling off (you will need to climb about 10 steps to access the roofdeck, and a few more for the pool). The only downside was that a few cellphone-talkers, clearly "business travelers" stretching the meaning of â€œworkâ€�, thought that this otherwise peaceful area was their own personal conference room! Our room had a partial view of San Juan Bay, and luxurious sheets, towels & toiletries. The bed was comfy and the flat screen TV was a luxury we don't get to enjoy at home. We stayed for two nights and wished we had planned for more. Itâ€™s a little on the pricey side, but well worth it and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in all of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Tessie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live on St. Croix in the U.S. Virgin Islands and go to San Juan at least twice a year. We always, always stay in Old San Juan. El Convento is our absolute FAVORITE place to stay. In fact, I will be booking our next stay in Aug. very soon. El Convento's facility and rooms are beautiful. However, what keeps us coming back (this trip will make number 12, I think) is the people. Front desk personnel, porters, and room attendants are all fantastic. The Manager's Reception in the early evenings is lovely. We've met and chatted with so many terrific people there, it's really a not to miss for us. Do yourself a favor, visit Old San Juan and stay at El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Enhanced by Superior Service by Staff”
Reviews.Author: 032611s
Reviews.Content: We selected El Convento, with no prior knowledge of Puerto Rico or the hotel, using Trip Advisor...and we were very well advised indeed. The hotel is not a beach resort. It is wonderfully located in the most historic part of Old San Juan. The location across from the cathedral and very near to the primary shopping areas allows for walking nearly everywhere in the old city--the museums, restaurants, historic buildings and waterfront. There is a free shuttle bus loop should you tire of walking, or want to begin your day at the far end of town. The hotel is an historic building begun in the 17th century, and was one of the early historic preservation efforts in the old town when it was converted from commercial use to hotel in the 1960s by a member of the Woolworth family. Today it has just over 50 rooms, plus a lovely terrace and plunge pool on the roof with harbor and town views, a nice gathering area where wine and cheese are generously served each evening, restaurants and meeting facilities. Our room was not large, but we had access to so many other facilities--including nice tables in the open air hallways of the hotel--that it did not much matter. The bathroom was also quite small, as is often the case with historic hotels. If you are looking for space, this is not the place for you. The furniture was dated, but the room was clean and had doors that opened to a harbor view. There was an up-to-date flat screen TV and complimentary hard-wire internet access (as well as a computer in the library for those not traveling with their own). Linens were clean, and towels were promptly replaced during turn down service. Air conditioning was just adequate, and would definitely be a concern in warmer months. The hotel building and furnishings are comfortable, not lavish, but the staff is exceptional. The evening wine reception was truly a chance to meet and interact with staff and other guests, not the usual one glass of cheap wine and run. We enjoyed our fellow travelers and talking with staff, and we got lots of pointers on restaurants and things to do. Judith, the front desk manager who is originally from Sweden but has 17 years in Puerto Rico, was particularly welcoming as well as wonderfully efficient. She and the entire staff team never failed to be welcoming, courteous and helpful. That put the real luxury into the stay. There is access to a beach club at Isla Verde, which is actually the Marriott Courtyard Hotel, adjacent to the airport. This requires a $20+tip taxi ride each way, but once there we were treated very well and the beach was superb. You can sign for food expenses at the Marriott that are billed back to your El Convento account, so you need not carry much money or credit cards for your time on the beach. We dined twice at the in-house Tapas restaurant, a nice follow-up to the healthy serving of cheeses at the wine reception. Breakfast in the courtyard was very good with good service, but the morning kitchen is very slow. Our 5 night stay was at rack rate in high season, so it was not inexpensive. The hotel is used by cruise lines for pre-departure stays, and some travelers reported much-discounted room rates...but only for one night. We felt that we received good value due to location, historic ambience and the very special treatment given by all of the staff. If you want a beach resort, or the most up to date interior design, El Convento is not for you. If you want to be in Old San Juan with easy access to cultural sites and wonderful dining, and with an atmosphere that reflects a very historic place very well, then select El Convento. We are very glad that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn_Lefty
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon! What a great central location in Old San Juan - close to several restaurants and stores. Very close to the outlets (Coach, Polo, etc). Make sure to dine at the Parrot Club restaurant. The rooms are somewhat small compared to what we are used to in the States, however quite romanatic. There's alot of history and architecture to enjoy. The ambience is also nice. We did get lost on our way to the hotel from the airport, however we soon realized most of Puerto Rico does not have good signage or any signs at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Guidor
Reviews.Content: After 7 days at the Caribe Hilton, where every little item is charged for as an addition to the room rate, it was such a refreshing change to stay here for three days. The old convent was tastefully restored 10 years ago and although in need of some minor renovation this did not diminish our enjoyment. Close to the shops and restaurants - it was simple and safe to walk around the Old Town. (NB away from the no-go areas of La Perla & its nearby graveyard). Impeccably and frequently cleaned, the service from all staff was beyond expectation, (UK-USA electrical transformer loaned at no cost), the daily wine & cheese reception (comlimentary) was superb and the restaurants dished up very tasty food. If dusk is between 6 & 7 pm, the bat aerobatic display is an interesting entertainment during the wine & cheese reception. There is a 350 year old tree in the courtyard - a roost for these bats & birds. A most enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location with some minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: barbara_2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Convento is located on the corner of the very narrow, busy, noisy streets of San Juan. We arrived early from our cruise ship and were greeted by Fernando, who made us feel welcomed immediately. He took care of our luggage and stored it until we came back later when our room was ready. The desk clerks were very helpful and suggested we walk around and have some lunch and check back about 1 p.m. to see if our room was ready. We walked down the hill from the hotel and found plenty of shopping. A Coach store, Dooney and Bourke store, Polo store, and a Guess store were just a few of the shopping options within three blocks of the hotel. Just past the Dooney and Bourke store is a great place to have an afternoon frozen drink and a taco. It is called Maria's and they serve the best drinks in San Juan. Up the street from the hotel (towards El Morro) is a great place to grab a hamburger called El Patio De Sam. Fort El Morro is within walking distance and we took the free shuttle service to other Fort. Upon returning to the hotel at 1 p.m. our room was still not ready so we waited in the beautiful courtyard of the hotel. They have bar service there so you can get a refreshing drink while you wait. Our room was ready at 3 p.m. and we were given Room 103 which was a little hard to find since there are only three rooms on the first floor and it has an entrance around the corner from the elevator. The room was large with two queen beds, a full bath and separate room with a shower. The mattress left a lot to be desired. Upon sitting down, every spring in the mattress could be felt. Needless to say I spent two sleepless nights in San Juan. Another problem was the toilet. Usually a toilet seat covers the toilet bowl. This toilet seat was about an inch smaller than the bowl and moved all over the place. On our second day in San Juan we came back from a tour to find the room next door had put their lunch trays in the hall on a table. When we departed 24 hours later, they were still there. The food was starting to smell. When we checked out, I mentioned all of the above to the lady at the front desk and she apologized and said she would have someone check on it. All in all the hotel is very nice and located in a great area for sightseeing and shopping. I am not sure I would stay there again due to the three problems I listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but expected more”
Reviews.Author: savesthadayagain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at El Convento on Christmas day 2007 for the first part of our honeymoon. I booked our accommodations through whatahotel.com, a website that was suggested on another couple's review. I was happy that I booked with whatahotel.com because I received a fair rate in addition to several other perks: early check-in (when available), late check-out (when available), free upgrade (when available), continental breakfast vouchers for two daily, a $50 credit towards meals at the Patio del Nispero restaurant, as well as a $25 credit towards a massage at the hotel. We arrived at the hotel around 11 a.m. on Christmas day and we were greeted by our favorite hotel employee, Roberto. He congratulated us on our marriage and told us that our room was ready and we were able to check in early. I believe check-in time is usually 3 p.m. so this was a great perk for us. We had room 516 on the top floor which had a partial ocean view. The room was nicely decorated, however I was surprised that nothing special was done for our honeymoon. One criticism of the room was that the front door's handle was very loose and we had a hard time opening our door from both the inside and outside. For the second day of our trip, the 26th, my husband and I planned a catamaran snorkeling tour. We booked it ourselves but asked one of the front desk attendants to book us a taxi for 7:30 a.m. the next day. She assured us that we did not need to book a taxi because taxis line up outside of the hotel every morning. To our dismay, Alessandra (I believe her name was) was wrong and there wasn't a single taxi outside. We had a time schedule that we needed to keep in order to make it to another hotel in the Condado area at 8 a.m. When we didn't see any taxis outside, we spoke to another front desk attendant who called up a taxi for us and we were on our way. The fourth day of our stay at El Convento, we came back to a room that had not been cleaned even though we left the "Housekeeping please service" sign on our doorknob. Instead, the "housekeeping please service" sign was turned around to "privacy please", the bed linens were still unmade and the dirty towels were still on the bathroom floor. However, the garbage cans in the bathroom and room were emptied and to top it off, the hair dryer that I had left in the bathroom was put away in the hair dryer bag in one of the bureau drawers which contained my undergarments. My husband and I were puzzled to say the least. We went down to the front desk and told the desk attendants what had happened. One of the attendants, Talia, brushed it off and even hinted that "ghosts" might have done it since it has been rumored that El Convento is "haunted". Luckily, Roberto appeared and was very concerned and made sure that a maid went up right away to clean our room. The last day of our stay at El Convento was the 29th and we were able to check-out one hour later at 1 p.m. When we went down to the front desk to check-out I asked one of the attendants about my bill. As with all hotels, you must present the hotel with a credit card which they keep on file in case of any incidentals. When I gave my credit card the first day, I made sure that nothing was charged on that credit card and that it was only held for incidentals. My father's gift to us was our honeymoon and wanted everything to be charged to his credit card. Well, the entire bill was charged to my credit card even after I stated that I wanted nothing billed to my credit card and that it only be held for incidentals. Finally, after repeating this to the attendant several times and her having to "see" if she could have the general manager remove it, it was done. Instead of the attendant being polite and making sure that the charge was removed immediately and charged to another card, she kept asking me to sign the "Guest Folio" or guest bill. I refused to until I had a new bill printed up which reflected the credit to my MasterCard. Additionally, if you do not ask, the attendants will not tell you that you can use the $50 credit towards meals that you charged to your room. As previously mentioned, when you book with whatahotel.com they guarantee that you will receive certain perks such as a $50 credit per stay towards meals at Patio del Nispero or room service. After I showed the attendant a copy of my hotel confirmation, she took it again to the general manager's office to "see" what she could do for me. Again, the charge was taken off. During our stay, Roberto stood out as one of the best hotel employees. When we would pass the front desk he would always ask us how our day was, if we did anything interesting, what restaurants we ate at, etc. He was very hospitable and concerned and made us feel as if we were talking to one of our friends. All in all, the atmosphere of El Convento is extraordinary. If you are into antiques and boutique hotels, El Convento is the hotel for you. If you do not want to be bothered by a lot of loud tourists with children, again, El Convento is the hotel for you. My husband and I loved the patios around the hotel and on our last day there, bought cheese and crackers and a bottle of wine from the local supermarket, SuperMax and enjoyed it on the rooftop patio beneath the stars. We never felt like the hotel was crowded and felt like the only people there most of the time. El Convento has a romantic setting and old world charm that is suited for both young and older couples alike.

Reviews.Title: “Still Beautiful, traditional and Unique But in Need of Repairs”
Reviews.Author: SAMAID
Reviews.Content: Just finished a late Dec. stay at the El Convento and it is still beautiful (stayed there before). Interior Courtyard is truly gorgeous and such a restful place to sit and have coffee. However, the rooms and hotel common areas are certainly in need of repair. The hotel hot tub has a thick layer of mold around the top and is completly cracked and broken. The wall above the pool is also cracked and in need of paint. While our room had a lovely balcony and was the standard unique "el convento" style -- our sheets had holes in them and the tub was stain and cracked and in need of repair. In addition, the staff is very friendly but quite inadept with directions and recommendations. Three times we got wrong directions/addresses (for locations as close as three blocks away), reservations were made but we were never informed (they forgot) and information on major attractions such as the Bio Bay and the Bacardi Distillery were faulty if they had any information at all. That said, the location is the best in town, much rather stay in Old San Juan for the food and entertainment and walking proximity to the fort and piers etc. There is a great flamenco restaurant across the little square outside the hotel and La Bombombera can't be beat for any meal especially breakfast. We paid less than $200 to stay and that made it worth is but as the price of El Convento creeps up they must really make more of an effort to ensure the little things are kept up as well (holes in sheets are just unacceptable)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel with Very Small Dark Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GoneTravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento for two nights. The public areas of the hotel are elegant, and the staff friendly and helpful - although not well-trained or efficient. When we inquired about the message light on our phone going on the second morning that we were there, and us not being able to access the message (we were expecting a call from our son who was arriving later that day at the hotel), the day staff at the hotel was not at all quick to try solving the problem and took several hours trying to figure out the code to access the message (it should have been the arrival date, but wasn't) and finally determined that the message was an old message. They couldn't even figure out how to turn off the message light, so it kept on blinking. Finally, in the evening, the desk clerk knew exactly what to do, and fixed the problem in a few seconds. The first room that we were taken to was fairly large, but the air conditioner was obviously being worked on (part of the ceiling insulation was on the floor), and the bellhop immediately called the desk to assign us another room. That room was very small and dark - and not exceptionally clean. The time was getting close to midnight, and after a delayed flight and a time change of four hours, we just wanted to get to sleep. The wine and cheese hour was very nice with a nice selection of wines and cheeses. We love Old San Juan, and El Convento is in a very convenient location. We were able to walk to San Cristobal Fort and took the free trolley to El Morro Fort. The hotel is close to the only remaining city gate. It is also close to lots of shopping. Go to La Bombonera for breakfast (259 Calle San Francisco), and be sure to order a Mallorca. It's about a five minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Happy Place”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer50
Reviews.Content: I just returned with a friend from El Convento after a hard year of work. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and what I liked it is is not the same "chain type" hotel. I would call the rooms cozy as opposed to small and each one unique. I know because when we arrived late at night, we discovered that our first room had one bed as opposed to two beds. A call to the front desk and we were immediately moved to a new room. I loved the proximity to deep discount shopping at Dooney and Bourke, Coach, many, many other shops and wonderful restaurants - all within a few blocks. We were treated to mass in Spanish early Sunday morning were we could listen from the third floor veranda, and two weddings that we could watch overlooking the atrium (which all runs face) This is a place that I will return to again most definately. It was truly a magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “gem in the wall”
Reviews.Author: petkaufamily
Reviews.Content: WE loved the location of El Convento. Great staff, small but nice rooms. wine and cheese a hit, great food in the hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is within walking distance to Puma, Guess, Tommy's etc. nice walk around the old fort and to the pier. loved the spanish architect in the hotel. would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting El Convento”
Reviews.Author: DreamEagle
Reviews.Content: This was a marvelous way to celebrate my husbands 59th birthday. The month of October is perfect without the holiday crowds. It was our first time in Puerto Rico. We spent a total of 4 nights at the El Convento which is perfectly located in Old San Juan. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed the rooftop pool and hot tub. The complimentary wine and cheese each evening was wonderful. The food in the restaurant was excellent and we had the added joy of watching 3 weddings while we were there!! There is parking nearby if you have a rental car and the valet is always available. The location gave us an opportunity to explore Old San Juan (mostly walking) and to spend a day in the El Yungue Rain Forest. I felt so much a part of the culture and people by staying right in the hub of all of the action. Our room was very quiet, despite the city activities surrounding us. It was a wonderful vacation and El Convento with it's charm and history made our trip one we will never forget. Thank you to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great old world style hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dminner1
Reviews.Content: I really like this place. All the reviews are on the money and you can walk to some great shopping and historic sites. .dont miss the Tapas restuarant while you are here. Get the nicest room available, you wont be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: ninora
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my trip to Puerto Rico wonderful. It is upscale and elegant. I awoke on Christmas morning to the sound of hymns, and opened my balcony doors to listen as the songs drifted up from the stately white church across the road. The staff was professional and courteous, the dining experience in the open air courtyard unique and tasty, and the honor system drink bar near the pool was a class act. They had internet access and a pretty outdoor lounge area overlooking the city. I highly recommend this hotel, and will be spending every Christmas there myself!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambience, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chocolatelady
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late, tired from a very long, tortuous drive from Naranjito. We visited PR to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary, it was our first trip there. Check-in was painless, but we soon found one of the room keys did not work. We reported this, someone came up to look at it, he promised to bring us another key and never saw him again; this left us with one key. Due to owning our own business, we need to use the Internet for a couple of hours daily, this is a necessity for us. We logged on, no Internet, we tried and tried, no Internet that first night, the front desk clerk said there was a communications problem. Next morning, no new key, no Internet. Clerk said Internet was down in this whole area, some problem with the phone company. Finally came on late afternoon, worked OK. A clerk came up with several keys, none worked. He came back with more keys, one worked, he said heâ€™d be back soon with a key chain and a new key. Didnâ€™t see him for hours. Finally another one showed up, tried several keys and was able to get us a working key around 7 p.m. on our second night. While I was at the office asking how to retrieve voice mails because I had tried several times and couldnâ€™t retrieve them following instructions given to me, a tourist walked in all distressed because her key was stuck in her door and her husband couldnâ€™t get the room open. She asked for someone to please come up right away to which I replied that the term â€œright awayâ€� doesnâ€™t seem to exist in PR, itâ€™s â€œwheneverâ€�. Hotel has a wine/cheese function every evening from 6 to 7, we went the second night here, itâ€™s just wine, 3-4 cheeses, crackers and grapes, no big deal, I wouldnâ€™t suggest changing your plans just so you can attend this free function. Hotel has an honors bar area on the 3rd floor with bottled water, juices, peanuts, and I believe beer and wine, you take what you need and jot it down on a notepad so they can charge your room. The elevator leading up to the rooms is well protected from people off the street, you must have your room key to access the elevator, this was a good feature since there are homeless people all around the Old San Juan area. Thereâ€™s a small park across from the hotel and, of course, a few homeless persons congregate there, the elevator safety feature is great. The room has a small refrigerator with 2 bottles of water, coffee maker & coffee, a safe, a closet, a nice desk with an uncomfortable, low chair on which I had to put beach towels to elevate me to a comfortable typing height, a large dresser, a very good and big LG flat screen TV, two night stands, plenty of light, long colonial wood windows with shutters you can open and close to let daylight in, a curtain by the window, a small round eating table with 2 chairs, and a thick clear glass door which closes off the room from the entryway/closet area which we assume must be there to keep out the noise other guests may make while they sit on the tables placed on the open terrace directly outside the rooms. We slept well, everything works fine in the bathroom, plenty of towels and basic toiletries, plenty of wood hangers and 2 robes. We found the hotel to be a lovely, old hotel which has been wonderfully restored. Thereâ€™s a lot of history in this hotel which is located directly across from a very old church (founded in the 1500's) and a small park. Valet parking is across the street, $20/day. Employees are helpful and courteous. Two female employees came around at night to ask if we needed water, ice, toiletries, towels, etc.. Walking on the cobblestone streets is hard on the feet, wear comfortable walking shoes! Many times you have to climb up steep streets....get in shape before making this trip. The streets are very narrow; if you will be driving, bring the smallest possible car you can bring, trucks such as F150's are quite difficult to maneuver on the streets, to make the narrow turns and are very hard to park. Bringing an umbrella might be a good idea, it rained heavily on and off while we were there. If you will be driving or taking taxis, get used to very long waits in traffic which just doesnâ€™t move, 20 minutes while moving 4 inches is not unusual, we spent 2.5 hours on a two lane expressway (Hwy. 30) which drivers turned into a 4 lane highway on their own with some of them driving down steep embankments to get away from the traffic jam or tapon as they call it in PR. Everyone says you should plan to leave for the airport at least 3 hours prior to your flightâ€™s departure because of traffic and because of how long their security check-in takes. We ate at El Jibarito where prices ranged from $7 to $15 for dinner, food was OK, nothing spectacular, casual clothing is OK. We had breakfast at La Bombonera which has been in its present location for 105 years, itâ€™s a bakery and a luncheonette, they close at 6 p.m., breakfast was OK and under $5, the pastries were very good, you can ask for breakfast once breakfast time is over (11 a.m.) by paying an additional dollar, the staff was courteous and friendly. For the fast food or American food crowd, all the standards are around: Burger King, Subway, Wendyâ€™s, Macaroni Grill, Chiliâ€™s. Plenty of pharmacies around, as well as dozens of stores and souvenir shops. I was surprised by the large number of jewelry stores. At night there was a strong police presence on the street even when the stores were closed. All in all we had a very pleasant stay at El Convento and would highly recommend it for travelers without children and for romantic getaways. We found it to be a beautiful, romantic, historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Weekends are 100% better”
Reviews.Author: WrestlingEuphony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights prior to our cruise (Sunday departure). The hotel was everything we expected it to be: unique, charming, "old world", etc. with all the amenities you would expect: robes, turn-down service, fabulous concierge, etc. We asked for (and got) a room on a high floor (5th i think?) with a view of the bay. It is WELL worth the extra money. Looking out over the rooftops and the water is amazing. And because the climate is so prone to short rainstorms, it's quite a site to watch the clouds roll in and the lightning start! Breakfast in the garden patio every morning was beautiful, with perfect service and delcious food (it's costly, but there's no where else to get breakfast in San Juan practically). The "tapas hour" every night on the promenade was our highlight. Delicious cheeses and wines and a nice seat outdoors - it was heaven. We used the concierge to book a trip to El Yunque for us and to call taxis a few times - it was a great service. Everything about this hotel was romantic and classy and wonderful....except - when the other cruisers checked in. On Friday (and worse on Saturday) - a total barrage of Cruisers took over the hotel. The fact that it was "crowded" was unpleasant, but more than that (and i'm about to sound snobby) was that so many of the cruisers seemed "out of place" at El Convento - they were loud, they were dressed inappropriately, they had throngs of screaming children, etc. When you're shelling out this much money to stay at a "luxury" hotel, you don't expect it to turn into a holiday inn overnight. For example: El convento has an "honor bar" - where they leave out bottles of booze, mixers, soda, snacks, etc with a little sign that says "this is an honor bar, if you make something for yourself, please fill out a receipt and leave it in this box - your room will be charged" - on Wednesday and Thursday night the honor bar was "honored" - on Friday and Saturday my husband and I watched as handfulls of new guests (cruisers) stole from the bar - many of them laughing about it while they were doing it. some of them going so far as to grab armfulls of bottled soda and water and carry it back to their room! That was the only downside of El Convento, some of the "losers" it brought in they day before the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: yandm
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal booking last minute directly from the hotel. Hotel is amazing!!! very historic. Did the room up nicely for our honeymoon. Free wine and cheese in the afternoon. No need for a car, you can walk everywhere and you just pay the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_Tamir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely! Firstly, because it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to a suite which was great! The place was very romantic, and between 18:00 and 19:00 they have complimentary cheese and wine and grapes on the roof patio with a great view of the habour. I thought the place was posh, romantic and in an ideal location. We spent 5 days wandering round the old city which was magnificent. There is no way of getting lost there. The hotel has free internet which was very handy. And free bottled water, coffee and tea. I would definately stay there again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Joyce C
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a 3 night stay in San Juan (our first). El Convento in not only a AAA 4 diamond hotel, but it is right in the middle of Old San Juan and walking distance to shops, restaurants, and attractions. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful from the porters to the front desk everyone had a smile and helping hand. I will definitely be returning to Old San Juan and to El Convento (and will let my husband come next time).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, unique "hotel" and very romantic”
Reviews.Author: kimcorbettrn
Reviews.Content: What a great find!! This hotel is not your typical hotel. We had a wonderful stay, from the time my husband and I arrived via taxi from the airport the bellman, Luis was there to assist us, with our luggage and a smile. After check in, Luis, showed us to our room and showed us where everything was, including the ice machines, pool and hot tub, wine reception venue each evening and told us about each of the resturants within the hotel. The room was very comfortable, cozy and clean, and decorated beautifully. Each room has flat screen TV and Bose radios. The hotel has a nice wine and cheese reception each evening on the patio which is very nice to sit out on and relax , and the view is exceptional, it overlooks the San Juan Bay. The pool is small but very nice and serves its purpose and you could not ask for a better panoramic view of San Juan.There are plenty of lounge chairs and sitting room in the pool/hot tub area. I can not say enough good things about El Convento, its not your typical hotel but is a very nice and unique place to stay. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon and they had a beautiful flower arrangement, champagne, and chocolates waiting in our room when we arrived from dinner our first night. The hotel is in a great location, close to pier, in Old San Juan and shopping, great resturants, the forts all within walking distance, the hotel will even assist you in arranging tours to El Yunque Rain forest, the Phosphorescent bays, etc. Venus and Carlos, in reservations, were very helpful in assisting me with my reservations. You will not be disappointed. We will definitally come back here to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: favre96
Reviews.Content: My wfie and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend and can't say enough good things about this hotel. 1. If you have the opportunity, book a Deluxe room. These rooms are located on floors 4 & 5. Our room overlooked the bay which was cool to see the storms/cargo ships pass through. The room itself was elegantly decorated. The huge flat screen TV and Bose sound system were major pluses. 2. Another tip is to book via the hotels website. I did a ton of research and you can't beat the price from [--]. 3. The hotel has three restaurants. Each restaurant has a good selection of authentic dishes. We recommend eating at all three. 4. Located in old San Juan. Within a few blocks from the water. There are wonderful restaurants and tons of places to shop (Coach, Puma, etc) all around the hotel. 5. The staff is attentive and courteous. The shower head was spraying water every where and within 10 minutes someone was up fixing the problem. 6. The hotel recommended the Eden Spa. My wife had a miserable experience. She said that it would have been worth the cab fare to go the spa at the Ritz or another well known resort. 7. The only thing I would hope the hotel would add at some point is room service for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and classy - we loved El Convento!”
Reviews.Author: CultureSleuth
Reviews.Content: El Convento is a boutique European style hotel, with character and comfort. It is not lavish, but the grounds (an old convent) are lovely and the rooms small, yet comfortable. The staff was exceptionally helpful in suggesting local restaurants and attractions. They have an evening wine tasting that is really more like an open bar - all while overlooking part of the city and a glimpse of the ocean. Our only complaint was that the hot tub didn't work. The location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: MexicoBob25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento prior to leaving on a cruise. The service was outstanding from the time our taxi pulled up to the door to the time we left. Very unique hotel that just oozes charm and character. Not your typical hotel by any means. The location in the middle of Old San Juan was very convenient to explore the old town and also close to the dock. We enjoyed the Tapas restaurant, El Picoteo. Best ceviche I have ever had.
