The bars served excellent mojitos. Nice to have good restaurants and bars within the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel, but to someone not looking for your typical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, super staff”
Reviews.Author: IRAGLYPHIC
Reviews.Content: July 2007. Stayed pre and post cruise. Charming hotel, delightful staff, nice location in old San Juan. Extremly helpful front desk. Rooms above average and each slightly different. Excellent Tapas restaurant on location.

Reviews.Title: “Another "5" No Surprise”
Reviews.Author: crackofdawn
Reviews.Content: We've frequently visited Old San Juan, but last week's trip was our first opportunity to stay at El Convento. I'd certainly agree with the other top reviews. We stayed 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the "all smiles on deck" attitude of every staff member you meet in the hotel. I know they must have some bad days, but you'd never know. TIP: don't bother trying to drive into/park in Old San Juan-- even the taxis have problems negotiating the streets. A cab for 2 people with 4 suitcases from the airport, with tip is about $26-27. Over the months prior from booking to actual staying, I watched the hotel's website for changes to their rates and was pleased to find rates in the $160 range shortly before we left. Do watch their website for similar changes and packages. I also enjoyed the LG lcd 37" television in the room and the BOSE Wave radio. Bring your MP3 player and connecting cable! Couple of good restaurants within walking distance that we've enjoyed in the past and this last trip: Amadeus Cafe and La Mallorquina. We tried a couple of newer ones (for us). We tried Raices on Recinto Sur (behind the Sheraton) -- very noisy and not impressed with the food. And the other, for lunch, I don't have the name but it is two doors west of Amadeus -- very attractive decor with good rates and I noticed several menu items geared for kids, as well.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with El Convento”
Reviews.Author: ddmg730
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 children) stayed at the El Convento post cruise. We arrived at the hotel at about noon. We were dropped off at valet parking, and had to carry our bags across the street and into the hotel. Check in was at 4:00 and they held our bags for us until our room was ready. It wasn't ready until 4:20 . It seemed like forever with 2 kids after an exhausting trip. Our room was wonderful, however they lost 2 of our bags. One was found and brought up to our room, but the other remains a mystery. It contained our prescription medications, 3 pairs of shoes, and several articles of clothing. We frequently checked back with the front desk who assured us they would find it, but everytime we checked back they didn't know anything about it and would try and give us some one else's bag that was in their store room.We had an early flight the next morning and still no sign of our luggage bag. We completed the guest questionaire which supposedly goes directly to the manager, but still have not heard anything from the hotel in a month. Very dissapointing. Also, the hotel charged our credit card an additional $12.00 10 days after we checked out with no explanation. My husband called once more and was told it was a municipality tax, but we were never told about it at check in or check out. We booked the room via hotwire and were asssured that all taxes were allready paid.They seem to have poor follow through to resolve any conflicts.Certainly not what we would expect from a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: bsealex
Reviews.Content: Short version: rooms were nice, safe area to walk around in, near just about everything, staff was helpful and very professional; quiet and relaxing hotel. Would recommend for couples and singles wanting some peace; not so much for families. A great weekend-getaway hotel to unwind and write. Parking suuuucks. Extended version: This hotel was just lovely! I'm not used to staying in luxury hotels. In fact, we'd stayed the previous four nights in an ecolodge in El Yunque rainforest (beautiful by the way!). To catch our early morning return flight, we decided to stay in San Juan on the last night instead of making the 1.5 hour drive back in morning. El Convento was such a change from "camping" in the rainforest, and was a wonderful way to end our vacation in Puerto Rico. El Convento is only a few blocks to everything, so we walked around for a few hours. It's pretty safe around there, too. I was concerned about that, never having been to the area before. I felt very safe walking around by myself though. The staff was very nice and helpful. The only thing I didn't like was that they put us in the corner under the staircase. For real! As we followed him to our room, we kept walking and walking. I joked that they were probably going to put us under the staircase....and they did! It was strange considering they weren't that busy. We did get a pretty good deal on the hotel (~$170/night!), so maybe that had something to do with our room location. :) No big deal though--the room was fantastic. It was small, but the bed was comfortable, the decor was tasteful, the robes were comfy, the shower was great, the bath products were very nice (Bath and Body Works!), etc., etc. Highly recommend if you're willing to spend the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaBoricuaCubana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento on our last night before we left Puerto Rico. We also received a much lower rate by just calling the hotel directly. The staff was great and although our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 3, we didn't mind and walked around Old San Juan to do some shopping. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful and although it was only one night, we had a great experience. We would def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Treasure!!”
Reviews.Author: selecthotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets 5 stars from me. You can read all the other reviews to get a fuller picture and also look at their website but I would like to extole their virtues in a somewhat different manner. Service, service, service and always with a smile. From arrival to departure we had 5 days and nights of sheer enjoyment. Front desk, always manned, alert and attentive. Directions and recommendations for restaurants, churches, museum's, etc professionally given. Valets and Porters(who all speak English) quick and attentive and on more than one occasion in the elevators they mentioned that we shouldn't miss the free cheese and wine being held each evening from 6-7pm, which was superb by the way. Rooms, spotlessly clean, authentically Spanish in design(as is the whole Hotel). Maid service, prompt, smiling, efficient and turndown service was also included and found this to be more superior than many other top-rated hotels we have stayed at. Room service was answered quickly and delivered quickly and again, always with a smile. What the hotel website doesn't make abundantly clear is that outside each one of the rooms, you have your own table and chairs, where you can drink, eat and smoke(if you wish)whilst enjoying the fabulous views of their 300 year old nispero fruit tree from Spain and all the other plants, whilst refreshing breezes and great music wafts the senses. On the third floor one finds complimentary tea, coffee, iced water and assorted nuts(24 hours) plus an extensive honour bar and a Library that houses free internet services. As mentioned before, you can read all of this in other reviews..what I want to bring to the traveller who has not visited San Juan or indeed the El Convento is a Hotel that clearly strives to stand out from all the rest and actually achieves this difficult task by offering the kind of atmosphere and service, be it in any of their many outstanding Restaurants or from difficult to simple requests, that sometimes get that scorned Caribbean frowned upon look elsewhere in this part of the world. We have all been there, havent we? I have actually seen Management walk around and talk to the guests, asking how their stay is or was and can they do anything more for them? So if one is able to find a hotel that is fanatical about making sure their guests come first, no matter what and always trying to improve(as nothing runs like clockwork), plus have possibly the best position in all of downtown San Juan, followed by stunning hotel scenery and authentic culture, well one just hopes that one can return in the near future. I know I will. Finally, if you are the sort of person who relishes glitz, gambling, noise and hob-nobbing with people, especially around the usual brash pool, go elsewhere. If you require authentic refined elegance and beauty from another era, backed up with truly outstanding service, you have possibly found a hidden secret and from my point of view one of the most exclusive hotels in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: purrfctprncss
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, great location, great restaurant and happy hour. We stayed there for 2 days and enjoyed every minute of it. I would definitely recommend El Convento 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sweetsie
Reviews.Content: The El Convento is a beautiful old hotel. The rooms are rustic (it's an old building!), but very charming. The courtyard is gorgeous with beautiful palms, plants and flowers. There are all kinds of nooks and niches to check out in the hotel--patios, restaurants, bars, a library! The staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was kept very clean for the entire stay. The location is great for exploring Old San Juan on foot. There are many bars, restaurants and shops in the area. If you don't absolutely need a car, don't get one! Driving in Old San Juan is a nightmare. The streets are just too narrow, and parking is practically impossible. However the hotel does have a valet parking service available. We'll definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you I was not sure we made the right choice from some of the opinions I read,but this hotel is incredibly beautiful, in every corner is some ornate carving and the vegitation around is not to be believed! The fortress down the street is amazing! If you want an experience and excellant service in a plush setting, this is the place for you, if your looking for a generic American style hotel you won't be happy. The small pool is amazing and the wine and cheese is wonderful, they also have coffee and an honor bar that is available all the time on the 3rd floor. The room itself is cozy and immaculate. We got a bay view for $245.00 a night simply by calling the hotel directly. There is a flat screen tv and bose stereo in the room and outside you can have your morning coffee listening to the birds and looking at the amazing tree in the courtyard.Try the tapas and champagne sangria at night. The music is great! We stayed at 3 hotels in Puerto Rico and this was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Queen of the El Convento”
Reviews.Author: mt_tam_fisherman
Reviews.Content: My wife was labeled the 'Queen of the El Convento' by the assistant manager while he was reserving her a visit to the 'Eden Spa'. The label well describes the type of treatment my wife received from the staff of the El Convento. The whole experience during our stay was beyond expectation. The hotel is historic and charming. The architecture and the artwork (Salon Martorell) is amazing. The staff is very warm and friendly and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. The hotel restaurants are great and the hotel is in the heart of historic Old San Juan. I just can't say enough about the friendly, helpful staff. We can tell that customer satisfaction is a high priority at this establishment and we were definitely satisfied. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Puerto Rico. For a wonderful dining experience visit 'Baru' located a few blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Totally torn”
Reviews.Author: pfg07
Reviews.Content: I, like others on this website, am torn about my time spent at El Convento. The hotel itself is majestic. Located in the heart of Old San Juan, my wife and I were able to walk to all of our desired sights. We enjoyed the complementary wine and cheese reception every evening and also enjoyed the plunge pool on the roof of the hotel. The rooms were like history themselves with modern updates - vaulted ceilings, Spanish marble floors juxtaposed with a Bose CD player and flat screen TV. That being said, my wife and I paid over $400 (US) to stay at the hotel. When we first arrived, our bathroom did not appear to be cleaned (urine stains on the toilet seat) and it took three phone calls to get someone to clean it. Additionally, we rented a car while in San Juan - somehow a light was left on in the car (we think by the valet as he was in the car last although we are not sure) and were not apologized to for this inconvenience nor were we helped by the hotel staff. Overall, our stay was nice (this is a very nice hotel, please do not get me wrong) although for the money we spent we expected so much more.

Reviews.Title: “A feast fo the senses.”
Reviews.Author: Stineman
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Puerto Rico my wife and I had the opportunity to leave the kids with family and get away for a little time by ourselves. After receiving recommendations from family and friends we decided to stay at the El Convento Hotel. We were not disappointed! The beauty and grandeur of the hotel with it's high ceilings, arched doorways and marble floors impacted us as soon as we walked through the front doors. The walkways between the rooms and the courtyard were wide and airy. The courtyard with the nispero tree and tropical plants is tranquil and welcoming. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed -- they even have electricity and running water (a thing unheard of in buildings built over 300 years ago:-) . The restaurants are great; we particularly enjoyed a relaxing late night visit with friends at El Picoteo over Cafe-con-leche, Tres Leches cake and Creme Brulee. However, if you prefer to find a place off property ther are many options to choose from and all within walking distance from the hotel. We found the staff to be attentive, helpful and friendly, a combination not often found in hotels of the caliber of El Convento. Located in historic Old San Juan, sharing the old city's charm and allure while adding to it a blend of old and new to create an atmosphere that is both unique and captivating, my wife put it best when she described El Convento Hotel as "a feast for the senses".

Reviews.Title: “We could not have been happier with our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sfmartinez
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I went with my husband and our very active toddler in December, and we had a wonderful stay here. The hotel is incredibly charming and elegant, and located in the heart of Old San Juan. We had rented a car, but ended up leaving it in their parking lot for our entire stay because we could walk everywhere. It is also across the street from the Children's museum, which was a nice place to go to give our little one a break. Our room was large, super clean, with very high ceilings. And the staff was terrific. The one criticism I had was that the on-site restaurants were very expensive, but I guess you'd expect that at such a nice hotel. There are a lot of cheaper places to eat nearby. One tip- call the hotel directly for their rates. We had searched online for deals for this hotel and were convinced it was out of our price range, but my husband called the hotel directly, said we would be in town to visit family, and was quoted a rate more than $100 less per day than the cheapest price we had seen on the internet. We will go back to this place every time we visit Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, butâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: dweymouth
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t ask for a better location in Old San Juan than the El Convento. The hotel has a wonderful history and a charming courtyard. The evening wine and cheese function is first rate, with a surprisingly good selection of wines and cheeses. The rooms, however, leave much to be desired. We were moved from our first room when a drainpipe in the floor above broke and water cascaded down. Our second room lacked the extra door for soundproofing that has been installed in some rooms overlooking the courtyard, and the noise from the restaurant was quite noticeable late into the evening. Perhaps some of the rooms have been renovated, but the two we tried definitely showed their age. For the money that El Convento asks (plus the $75 per night in taxes!), I expected something better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in the most beautiful of cities”
Reviews.Author: Dr_owheatl
Reviews.Content: I would like to preface this comment by stating that I travel extensively for business and for leisure. When I book my travel, I always aim for safety, cleanliness, and accessibility. If I am lucky, good service will come along with the other criteria. At El Convento, I found everything except good service. Instead, I found OUTSTANDING SERVICE. There are very few places for which I will actually take the time to sit down and write a review, in fact, this is the second attempt since the first review did not upload. But because I feel so strongly about my wonderful experiences at El Convento, I am determined to get my review posted. I have always been treated like royalty at this hotel but never more so than the time when I required extensive assistance due to travelling while recovering from surgery to repair a broken ankle. I could not have travelled had I not been coming to El Convento to stay. I was helped in every imaginable manner by ALL of the hotel staff. A shower chair was placed in my room, a chair with wheels was immediately sent to my room so I could manage better in the room (I did not want a wheelchair) extra pillows to elevate the leg at night were always brought in, extra blankets, ice for my ice bag, as well as extra water and coffee. Oh, and they scanned the room to anticipate possible problems for me and then determined that they would remove all the area rugs and move the furniture to insure my safety. During the nightly wine reception, the managers would place an extra chair for my leg, sit me down and would proceed to bring me my favorite wine, a plate with a generous serving from their extensive selection of cheese and crackers, and a bundle of grapes to top the plate. As I progressed from being in a boot with two crutches to being able to walk unassisted (a period of over four months) they celebrated with me and applauded me as I would show off my steps. They all went above and beyond the call of duty. Truly, if you are looking for a place with top notch service, nestled in the most beautiful of cities, there is no better place to go to than the El Convento Hotel in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “OK , but you're paying for location not hotel quality”
Reviews.Author: gibbscr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights before a cruise. Wonderful location right in the heart of Old San Juan. Staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. BUT, the room we had as well as the room our friends had leaves a lot to be desired. Ceiling fan was filthy. Entry way room ceiling was black with dirt and mold. Maid did not show up until 4pm our second day complaining that she had too many checkouts and 18 rooms to clean already. New flat screen TV remote would not turn TV on or off but other functions did work. If staying in Old San Juan is your desire then this is probably your best bet but you'll pay big bucks for a room that's at best mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zjtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the El Convento in March during a weekday. We had a wonderful experience. Both my husband and I have traveled extensively and I would say this is definitely one of the best small hotels we've been too. We booked two rooms(one for us and one for my parents) at a special "mid week" price at $230 per night(a steal for Old San Juan). They reserve you a room but don't assign you a specific room until you arrive. As soon as we stepped onto the hotel property someone met us and took our luggage. When we checked in, they had my parent's room ready but ours wasn't. As an apology, they gave my parents a suite next to the pool and assured us that our room would be ready within the hour. True to their word our room was ready in less than an hour and they gave us a top floor suite with our own private deck overlooking Old San Juan as a thank you for our patience. The hotel offers a wine tasting from 6-7pm every night with great wine choices and a fabulous selection of gourmet cheeses and crackers. The location is excellent--within walking distance of all the historic sights. The rooms are tastefully decorated with relatively new furniture keeping with the convent's history and spanish theme. As for complaints about being interrupted in the early evening by housekeeping--it was for the hotel's early evening turn down service. They do it during the wine tasting hours as a little extra. My husband and I would stay here again and again. The staff was helpful and the rooms clean and the location the best in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel At 5 Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrank
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the rates at El Convento!! We stayed one night pre-cruise at nearly $500 per night. Definitely overpriced for the product being offered. 3PM check-in turned into 3:45PM due to the very pleasant staff being over worked due to understaffing. We were offered a rather unpleasant room, which we rejected and ultimately were offered a bay view room after another 30 minute wait at the front desk. All metal surfaces in our room and in the public areas are showing signs of rust. All plastered surfaces are either cracked or mottled. Any repairs that have been made, such as painting, plastering, etc. have been performed substandard. Rooms are small and dark. Bathrooms are smaller yet and in need of renovation. Tenament views on the first 3 floors just add to the disappointment. The "Taxes and Hotel Tariff" of over $90 per night are ridiculous. The hotel does have its' charm, very atmospheric including all of the restaurants. Of course all venues are high priced. $25 for breakfast, $35 for tapas lunch. Wine and cheese on the deck is nice touch. At $250 per night (tax and tariff included) it's a very acceptable experience. Think Doubletree not the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a convent”
Reviews.Author: B0st0nB0st0n
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Convento last week for two nights on my way to Antigua. We planned on staying an additional third night before returning to the US until we experienced what felt like being trapped in a convent. The two nights were awful. The hotel is way overprized for what you get. The rooms are mediocre at best. We stayed in two different rooms and in both rooms the flat screen TV buzzed. The bathroom in the second room was missing a bath stopper and had no water pressure. When we were napping someone attempted to enter the room in the early evening (not during cleaning hours). We asked the front desk and they knew nothing of it. Additionally, we inquired about a scooter rental at the front desk. The concierge said he would look into it and never followed up with us. The next morning we ordered orange juice and was charged $12 for one glass!! The only newspaper they offered could only be read in the lobby. After these bad experiences we tried to cancel our third night while we were in Antigua. The front desk kept on transferring me to a reservations line where no one picked up. Finally after asking to speak with the manager they said we could not cancel less then 72 hours before the stay. We explained that we already stayed there two nights at almost $400 a night and they still would not allow us to cancel without being charged. After arriving in San Juan for our third night in the city we were forced to return to the hotel since they already charged us. Once we got there we had to request the manager again and only after stressing that our stay was unpleasant and that we felt like we were being forced to stay at their crappy hotel did they credit us. This was all done in the lobby in front of other guests and I believe they only gave in because of this. I found this hotel on the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World" listings, the hotel claims to be a "4 star luxury" hotel yet we were greatly disappointed due the poor treatment we received and the just average standard of the rooms. My advice is to skip out on El Convento it certainly is not worth the price and headache that awaits you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building”
Reviews.Author: oeil21
Reviews.Content: The building was beautiful and in a wonderful location. Staff was great and free wine and cheese hour fantastic plus. Locals I knew before visiting go there for dinner or drinks and consider it one of the best on the island. Unfortunately the rooms were not that fantastic - they badly needed some updating and the bed was pretty uncomfortable. It was freezing in our room - we immediately turned the air off and opened the window but everyday housekeeping would pump it back up again. The bathroom was ok but definitely not four star. The linens seemed old and one night the bottom sheet came undone and I could feel the icky old matress pad with my feet! The tile was clean but the rugs I didn't want to walk on barefoot. Also if you rent a car better see what the hotel can do for you as far as parking goes. Its better to walk and take the free trolley around. If you rent a car there is a free shuttle from the rental company to the hotel - the front desk will arrange this for you. We were also under the impression breakfast was included but alas... it isn't. Check out the awesome breakfast places in the surrounding area that look like they have stayed the same since the 40's. The hotel serves seriously Americanized breakfast at New York prices. I think the building and staff was the biggest draw but might consider staying elsewhere next time. Definietly better than any large generic hotel along the beach. (They aren't that great anyway along the Atlantic...)

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PuravidaCT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel extensively for work and leisure. We recently spent 10 days in Puerto Rico and stayed at 3 properties. We found all of them big on rates and low on service. This property was no exception. The front desk treated us as if we were first time travelers. We were assigned to a room that had a view of the side of an adjacent building on the 2nd floor. We were told we would have a bay view. Upon complaining to the front desk I was informed, in a demeaning way, that "this was a city hotel" and I should not expect a bay view. The staff was rude and unbending. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice property with proper customer service. It was extremely overpriced for what they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: caponte
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at El Convento, and it will not be our last. Our first was in July 2006. The hotel's charm, location, staff, service and food were all to our satisfaction. The wine and cheese reception was a nice surprise. The pool is indeed small, but is not billed as anything but a plunge pool, so we didn't care that it was small and used it often. The staff at valet parking are kind and helpful. We love interesting small hotels, and if you do too you will love this one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely except for bedding, big deal to us”
Reviews.Author: tnkrbl53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there over a post-Xmas break. We found the desk staff doing triple duty, not informed, and overwhelmed (but very polite.) The hotel could do an immense service to patrons by putting some cushioning device on the heavy wooden doors that slam at all hours, and in the tiled, open-air echo chamber of the room area, it's a recipe for no sleep (and we sorely needed some.) But, it is very lovely, romantic, with little places to sit and talk and eat (food good) and enjoy the atmosphere of this great place. Here's our biggest gripe: we travel extensively and stay only in top hotels. I need good beds, high thread count sheets, great pillows and comfort if I'm going to pay top prices. Most of this made the grade, but we, strangely, SWEATED and felt uncomfortable sleeping all four nights, (room temp OK) until the last night, when I finally thought, "What IS that stiff crackle of a feeling?" I pulled off the sheets to find a plastic coated mattress pad, the kind they use in hospitals, the kind you use with kids who still wet the bed! I nicely asked the maid about it and she said it was to protect the expensive mattresses. So here we are with heavenly sheets and plastic underneath. And, to boot, the mattress pad looked old and icky. I've never seen or felt anything like it in any classy hotel I've been in anywhere in the world. And if you are a "Princess and the Pea" person, you may be turned off by it too. I'd never sleep there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Phil6184
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews Of the El Convento I must say my expectations were running high. I'm happy to report I was not dissappointed. The hotel is a Gem. The staff was excellent and the service near perfect. On arrival, I had a problem with the room's thermostat. One stop at the front desk solved that. Within 5 minutes a technician arrived and swapped out the faulty unit. The restaurants are just ok. The pool is tiny. But the many lounging alcoves and the unique setting make up for any slight deficiencies. About the only negative thing I can say is that the front desk seemed to have only one person working. Since it functions as concierge, reservationist, as well as front desk the lone worker is at times overwhelmed. This resulted in a dinner reservation request not being made until I made the request again. This isn't to say the staff was incompetant or uncaring, he was just overwhelmed. Management needs to pull someone from the back office at times when the front desk is so busy. Having said all this, I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: lawsonld
Reviews.Content: We were flying to St. Kitts for our honeymoon and were having a hard time getting there because Mostertat was spewing ash (we were told it does this regularly). We ended up having to stay the night in San Juan unexpectedly. We went to the information center and they gave us a book of hotels. We started calling and everyone was booked or the rooms were over $300 which is more than we wanted to spend for an unexpected overnight stay (we had to get to the airport early the next day and it was already after dark). The price listed for El Convento in the directory was expensive but I had my husband call them anyway and they ended up being the cheapest one yet despite the fact that they are one of the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World"!! We loved our room, the courtyard was beautiful, and the service was great. We wanted to make our night count so we asked the man at the front desk for restaurant reccomendations. He reccomended Baru and it was one of the best (and most expensive) meals we've ever had in our lives. I had filet mignon and my husband had veal. Service was also good at breakfast. Our only regret is not being able to stay longer. I highly reccomend this hotel if you are staying in Old San Juan for one night or many.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the El”
Reviews.Author: J&H74
Reviews.Content: We usually prefer the Ritz or the Four Seasons, but decided to try El Convento to have a more authentic local experience. You could probably say that we are demanding and have high expectations. We were on a one-night stop over in San Juan. The choice was well worth it. The hotel exudes old world charm. Our room (508) overlooked the bay and the small plunge pool. It was small but acceptable. The hotel was refurbished in a manner which remains true to its era. The lobby was impressive with soaring ceilings and a patterned marble floor. The courtyard is lush with tropical vegetation and acres of terra cotta tile. While Old San Juan is very busy at night, the room was very quiet. We ate in the tapas restaurant on the second floor and the breakfast restaurant on the first floor. Both settings are in the courtyard and very romantic. The service was very good in both cases. We appreciated the morning newspapers (including the New York Times) that were available in the breakfast room. There was a pianist playing in the lobby salon at night. We ate at a nearby restaurant called Amadeus. It is within a short walk. The appetizers were great: corn fritters with mozzarella and dumplings. The main courses were bland and uninteresting. dessert was excellent: cheese flan. There was a good wine list. El Convento is located in the heart of Old San Juan. The area really comes alive at night. During the day, it is dominated by typical tourist shops. There are a couple of small legitimate antique shops but mostly the usual tourist stuff. The staff is very attentive and efficient. . The fitness center is small but has two treadmills, nautilus and some free weights. It is also open 24 hours a day The internet connection was excellent. What are the drawbacks? The hotel is in the middle of Old San Juan, so there is no beach. The traffic is heavy at all times of the day. Mosquitoes are thick and hungryâ€”probably drawn by the fresh tourist meat and the lush vegetation. So like many hotels it is a question of your priorities and compromises. We were heading for the islands so a day without the beach was not a big issue. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark635
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to this amazing hotel after a 2 week Caribbean cruise. The hotel is located in the heart of the old town near all the shops and restaurants. Our room was located on the 4th floor with views of the bay. It was a very large room well equipped with a large flat screen TV, en-suite bathroom and coffee making machine. On our floor was a small pool with separate Jacuzzi on the roof terrace with sun lounges, which was much need after shopping all day. There is an amenity room on the third floor with an honour bar, but free tea & coffee all day. A nice touch was that they served free cheese & wine in this area from 6pm until 7pm every day. There were several restaurants in the hotel located around the ground floor courtyard and on the 1st floor, all very nice. Not the cheapest, but would highly recommend it! Please do not hesitate to contact me if you need any further information.

Reviews.Title: “Great gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: NYC91
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the El Convento during the Thanksgiving holiday. The rooms were recently refurbished with quaint charm including color scheme, flat screen TVs, and Bose sound system. We had a great room-413, that overlooked the sea. Try to book this or rooms 410-414. The 4th floor is the best, in my opinion, as it has the pool and another open tanning/lounging area. The wine and cheese at 6 PM is great- great wine, great cheese. The pool is VERY small, MUCH smaller than it seems in the photos, but does the trick. Staying at the El Convento is like staying at a friend's house (or mansion). It's very comfortable, relaxed, and leisurely. The interior coutyard is amazing- like you're in Havana in the 50s. Amazing. Service is excelllent, with ONE exception. This terribly unpleasant woman at check-in. I didn't get her name, but everyone who encounters her knows who she is since she is the only one on staff with an attitude that does NOT flow with this hotel. Also, be aware that the beach is a cab ride away to the Mariott Courtyard if you want the typical tourist experience. And the BEST part, that no one tells you, is that the beach for the Mariott is located DIRECTLY across the street from the airport, making it EXTREMELY loud as planes take off and land. It's funny if you're in a good mood, and soooooo annoying if you're not. This has nothing to do with the El Convento property, more of an FYI. I could go on and on about the El Convento. You should definately stay here if you are looking for a European experience in the heart of the Carribean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilbo1001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at El Convento in Spetember 2006 and we found it the most comfortable and beautiful hotel we have ever stayed at, although it wouldn't suit those with a family or a group of young people. The staff were exceptionally friendly, attentive and helpful, particularly the Manager, Soledad, and Juan Carlos, and we were made to feel most welcome. We had a very comfortable suite which was quiet and cool, considering the heat outside. Other than the rooms the hotel is entirely open air which adds to its magic. There are several restaurants on site serving tapas or more substantial meals, and breakfast in the courtyard was delightful. There are also several roof top terraces wherre one can sunbathe, sit and relax with a drink, or have a dip in the pool, which is tiny but splendidly situated. The hotel is located on a cobbled street in the heart of Old San Juan, just a short walk to the shops, restaurants, or the port. However, Old San Juan doesn't have a fantastic array of good shops and restaurants. Overall, we loved our stay at El Convento : an oasis in the heart of bustling Old San Juan and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again in we are ever in Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the heart of the historic district”
Reviews.Author: caribchakita
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Old San Juan featured a stay at a former Carmelite Convent, El Convento. Steeped in history this gem is nestled in the heart of this historic area. It is an old style property, not glitzy or glamourous but well appointed for comfort. The public areas are not really appealing due to the outside heat. No drinks are offered upon arrival (which took 1 hour from entering OSJ to arriving at the hotel due to traffic at 11:30 AM) and the reception is small but Soledad greeted us warmly and allowed an early check in. Our room 205 was well appointed with comfy beds, a large LG flat screen tv, Bose Sound machine, in room internet and more. The bathroom was equipped with nice apothocaries and thirsty towels but no fan for much needed bathroom ventilation. Our AC was not working well so we waited a long time for people to come. They came and left as we did. Around 9 we called to find out what would be done but they said it was so hot out the system was working as best it could. I would say the temp in our room was around 26 celcius. I prefer 20-22 for sleep. We were offered another room at that hour but it was too late. Too bad one was not offered earlier? A fan was brought up to remedy the situation. Turn down service feature a lovely note and chocolate. Nice touches like this make EC special. The bar is lovely as is the courtyard. Security is paramount here ..they do a good job. Each day at 6 is a wine reception. We did not meet any staff but the guests appeared to have a nice time. A lovely touch. The rooftop pool and spa was wonderful. What a gem..I will go back for sure..and will refer others..close to El Morro, the walk way and more..

Reviews.Title: “The best of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: snmi47
Reviews.Content: We had a great time on our honeymoon and stayed at the El Convento for two weeks. We stayed in room 217 which had high ceilings and a great little back terrace. The room was quiet, even though there were times with a variety of activity outside. The staff was very attentive, polite and patient with my broken Spanish, although everyone speaks English very well. The Old San Juan area is great to stay in and we'd explored a number of other hotels and found this to be the best authentic Puerto Rican experience with a great degree of class. I would advise against booking events through the hotel (unless you don't have a car) as they can add up quickly. We booked all of our activities individually and on our own (because we rented a car) and we covered the entire island. A must do is a trip to Vieques to see the bio-bay, but plan to stay overnight as the ferry does not run very often out of Farjardo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ct968
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. We had planned on eating at El Picoteo but we had a problem with our luggage and the airline didn't deliver it until after 8:00. We did enjoy the wine and cheese party. Our room was very comfortable. We paid $169 for a run of the house room so I was a little worried by what type of room we'd get. It ended up being very nice. We were right off the pool area. The bathroom was large and the bed was a double bed and very comfortable. We weren't able to use the pool (again didn't have our luggage) it was small but there was no one there so you'd have it pretty much to yourself. The El Convento is in a convenient location. It was easy enough to walk around Old San Juan and nice being so close to the fort. We rented a car and the parking lot was right across the street. It cost $15 per day to park but parking is hard to come by in Old San Juan. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Character/Modern Comforts”
Reviews.Author: Geanne
Reviews.Content: El Convento is ideally located in the heart of Old San Juan, within easy walking distance of many outstanding historic sites, shops, restaurants and cafes. Our room was incredibly clean and comfortable, with plush bedding, a modern bathroom and flat-screen TV. Yet, the architectural details were beautifully preserved and the thick walls and high ceilings added to the room's authentically historic ambience. The design details throughout the hotel were stunning and there was no question of the building's architectural and historical significance. Internet access, a cozy library, self-service coffee throughout the day, and a daily wine and cheese hour helped make guests feel welcome. The hotel's tapas restaurant, El Picoteo, was fabulous. Our only regret was that we only had one meal at the tapas restaurant. El Convento is a one-of-a-kind gem of a hotel and we were grateful that its building has been so meticulously restored and that the hotel is so well managed.

Reviews.Title: “So very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: misscreole
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights in late August and had an excellent time there. I want to add that I am a female who was travelling alone and everything went smoothly. They have a lovely little pool and hottub on their roof at which I hung out until my room was ready. The room was large and tidy. I had a regular room not a suite so the interior was not spectacular, but served its purpose. Bathroom was nice, with stuff from Bath and Body Works. Plenty towels. I had a huge flat screen TV with DVD player and a Bose stereo system with remote. The AC worked flawlessly. At 6pm every nicht thei have complimentary cheeses, crackers and wine at the terrace which is great to kill the hunger before dinner. Their courtyard indoors is beautiful but bring bugspray (mosquitos everywhere in PR). I was also able to go online on their guest PC and check in and print my boarding pass the night before my flight home - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect escape for some city and civilization”
Reviews.Author: juleve
Reviews.Content: We live in the Caribbean, working at a very posh resort hotel in the British Virgin Islands. We took a week off in May and escaped to Puerto Rico to enjoy good food, Latin ambience, shopping, and above all, the staples of civilization: things like bookshops, cafes, and cinemas... which don't exist in the BVI. We stayed at El Convento the entire time and loved it. The hotel is beautiful with its central courtyard and the room was definitely unusual with its thick double wooden doors and high ceilings. We could definitely imagine the years of history the hotel had seen in its past life as a convent! The location was perfect. We loved Old San Juan and mostly stayed around there... took a taxi a few times to get to the Plaza de las Americas for shopping and cinema. We rented a car for two days as well to explore El Yunque rainforest and drove all around the island. The friendly staff at the hotel made the arrangements for us for the rental car - they also found us a men's barber shop! We weren't looking for beaches and were avoiding the sun since we get more than enough of that at home in the BVI (although I've heard that PR does have some great beaches - and its own virgin island is apparently extremely special). Next time I'm in Puerto Rico, I will definitely stay in El Convento again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: hogs12
Reviews.Content: If you stay near San Juan than you must stay at least one night here. My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Hyatt Dorado and 2 nights at the El Convento for our honeymoon and the El Convento was the highlight of our time there! It was full of charm and was a beautiful old hotel. Here are a few reasons: - The staff was always helpful and friendly. - We found it very clean (and my wife is a clean freak) - Free bottled water in your room's refridgerator - Beautiful courtyard in the middle - Tapas bar in the hotel was excellent (white sangria is awesome) - We loved the wine and cheese hour - Great location (right in the middle of Old San Juan) If you want to buy some leather goods then you need to haggle for them at the market. They are pretty cheap already but they'll go down. They've got nice stuff. My wife bought a purse that she loves.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at the El Convento in late June was nearly perfect. Here is a breakdown: Good Things Two free bottles of water each day in the mini fridge Free coffee in the morning along with a wine & cheese "happy hour" nightly Perfect location LG LCD TV's in every room Hot tub with a view Areas of Improvement Rooms are smaller than I expected Air conditioning had to run non-stop to keep the room somewhat cold Tiny pool with a view Hotel restaurants very pricey for what is served We would highly recommend staying at the El Convento but just make sure to dine at any of the nearby restaurants instead.

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: jon o
Reviews.Content: Just loved this place. It's really friendly and the layout inside brings such an air of space in a part of the city which could feel cramped. One thing to note, valet parking is $15 per night if you've got a rental car --- that caught us by surprise.

Reviews.Title: “They WILL cheat you!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I dined at both their tapas bar AND the restaurant (El Bohemio). 2 out of 4 of us were overcharged on our credit card statements from $11-$25. The manager says this has happened several times before but since their receipts match up, you just have to take it up w/ your bank and did NOTHING else about it. While this is not much money, hitting several people a day for a little bit of money ADDS UP to SEVERAL HUNDRED DOLLARS A DAY. And since they do NOTHING about it, you can see how this will continue to be a problem. AVOID THEM! They're cheats conducting BAD business.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine”
Reviews.Author: sloemocean
Reviews.Content: Now this is a Hotel that has character, charm, antiquity and excellent service. A converted 17th century convent, these accomodations were nothing short of fantastic. El Convento has it all: LOCATION, several excellent restaurants & bars on site and great service. The rooms were Spanish influenced & fine. If visiting San Juan for the first time, I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “well worth its excellent reputation”
Reviews.Author: tirelesstraveller
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We couldnâ€™t fault any part of our stay there. The hotel is charming and beautiful, and the service is first class. The last restoration of the hotel was very sympathetic to its original use, and even though it has all the modern amenities you still feel a sense of history about the place. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary afternoon wine and hors d' oeuvres whilst watching the sun set over the bay. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! You can't go wrong!!!”
Reviews.Author: A794135
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms and service!! Elevators are very slow so it's much easier to take the stairs. Staff was very accommadating, clean, updated rooms. Small rooms, but that is easy to over look at this historic hotel. Don't rent a car, everything you need is within walkingn distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wish we had more time at El Convento! The hotel staff were excellent in manners and service, the restaurants were delicious, the location could not have been better. Rooms were lovely and relaxing. Could not have asked for a better hotel. You're guarenteed to love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd had more time at El Convento”
Reviews.Author: ejcrowe
Reviews.Content: I decided that spending our last night in Old San Juan after three nights on Vieques would be a good way of easing back into the hustle & bustle of the real world. Hotel El Convento is definitely more than we tend to spend on our hotel rooms, but Iâ€™m very glad we splurged. Resort-type places aside, it is the nicest full-service hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in and I have to say that I would be hard pressed to stay anyplace else in OSJ in the future. The location is perfect for walking around, the courtyard of the hotel is a peaceful place to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee and a book in the early morning, and the views from the rooftop pool and decks were just lovely. Our room had two double beds, a flatscreen TV, a Bose CD player, small refrigerator, small safe, full bathroom, air conditioning, and a small Juliet balcony whose doors we could throw wide open to see the plaza right below us and the cathedral to our left. Every staff member, from the concierge to the bartenders to the bellhop exuded graciousness and made us feel welcome in a solicitous but not overbearing way. Included with the price of the room is an outdoor, early evening rooftop wine and cheese reception, which we were very glad to take advantage of. Our flight from Vieques was timed so that it would have been very difficult to eat an early lunch before hand, and our arrival at El Convento was such that their restaurant had stopped serving lunch already, and we did not want to eat a full meal at 3:45 pm, so the reception was ideal. The hotel provided a wide variety of hard and soft cheeses and other nibbles, plus a choice of about 6 different wines, an honor bar for those who want a cocktail, as well as coffee, tea, bottled water and soda. So the adults sat with our wine and martinis and our teenager with her soda as we watched a cruise ship leave port and saw the clouds to the west become tinted with the pastels of sunset. Check-out is at noon, but the hotel provides a secure closet for leaving behind luggage if, like us, you have a late afternoon flight and want to spend the time walking around OSJ. Guests who have already checked out can still take advantage of all of the hotelâ€™s facilities, so we also had access to the pool but more importantly to the shower rooms in the fitness center so that we could change clothes before leaving for the airport. Our breakfast in the courtyard of the hotel was quite good, accompanied by excellent coffee, which my husband and I drank while waiting for our companions to join us. The fare was varied and priced in keeping with hotelâ€™s prices. For our evening meal we walked down to Aguaviva, which served us some of the best seafood and cocktails we've ever enjoyed--the watermelon sangria was especially good. All in all, we loved Old San Juan and we hope to return sooner rather than later. The next time one of our flights to the Caribbean has a nasty layover (Grenada being the worse) we will definitely just plan to overnight in OSJ and stay at El Convento again.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of the Old World in the Caribbean...”
Reviews.Author: kzdallas
Reviews.Content: We loved El Convento! This was my second time staying at El Convento and I would be thrilled to go again. It is a wonderful old hotel with a European atmosphere, personal service, modern conveniences (flat-screened tv, bose radio, fitness center, etc.), and the best location you could ask for in Old San Juan. You can easily walk from the hotel to all the historic sites in OSJ --El Morro, San Cristobal, the governor's house, San Juan Cathedral, the home of Ponce de Leon, etc.-- and to numerous shops and restaurants. There are duty free jewelry stores on every block, boutiques selling clothes and local handicrafts, outlet shops, and unusual and interesting art galleries. And the restaurants are superb. Most are small and unique. Dragonfly has incredible Latin-Asian fusion food (great sushi). The Parrot Club makes the best pork sandwich in the world -- and the Parrot Passion is quite refreshing! Agua Viva is open for lunch and dinner and serves good Latin inspired seafood (I loved the calamari sandwich and the big steel bowls of ceviche looked really tasty). Tantra is an exotic Latin-Indian restaurant, La Bombanero serves mallorcas fresh from the oven at breakfast time. This is a local spot which is more than 100 years old and looks like a cafe/diner/bakery combination...the coffee's great, too. Baru on San Sebastian Street is very good Mediterranean/Caribbean food and the Cafe Puerto Rico is good, cheap PR food. And the best tapas in the world are served at El Picoteo in the El Convento Hotel. We had a variety for dinner one night and had to go back the next day at lunch for more! They also make a superb Tres Leches cake and chocoloate mousse cake. You can have dinner at 7:00, hop in a cab and head to Isle Verde to the Casinos -- the Ritz, El San Juan, Intercontinental or many others -- and come back to El Convento afterward for coffee and dessert! The next time you have to change planes in San Juan to get to the Virgin Islands, Antigua, St. Martin, Aruba, Barbados...or other points south, think about a stopover in Puerto Rico. If you can only manage a day or two, stay at El Convento and enjoy Old San Juan. If you have longer, be sure to get out and explore the island. You shouldn't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lounge”
Reviews.Author: busterlucy
Reviews.Content: While we didn't stay overnight at this hotel, we stopped in for a drink and found it was worth a visit. Great bar, beautiful building, and lovely interior decoration. They serve an inexpensive pina colada in the open-air lounge which is a perfect way to rest after touring Old San Juan. Great, comfy chairs line the lounge and offer an old-school environment. Had we stayed in Old San Juan overnight, this would have been our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento, Best Old San Juan Location, Gracious Property - Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: maverick_cp
Reviews.Content: El Convento is located in the heart of Old San Juan, in the center of great art and food. I wanted to move to this area after visiting! Yes, it's touristy as this area is a cruise ship port of call. The staff was great, our room was huge (3 separate rooms, marble bath with 2 showers, rooftop with direct pool/spa/oceanview.) We dined at the trendy restaurant (El Picoteo) in the hotel and visited the nearby Botello gallery *wow* great art!! The Honor Bar and 'secret' library with computer and printer made the hotel sublime, sensuous, and luxurious. Coffee, water, tea and lots of beverages in this gem of an area. Very, very civilized touches. We walked and enjoyed the architecture and all the renovations. These properties aren't cheap to buy/restore either. Ben and Jerry's in Old San Juan?!? Yes! And owned by a former Olympic Gymnast and her Mom (Michelle Di Campi.) It's the best shop around - very artsy, funky, and Michelle is very sweet. El Convento is around the corner from El Morro the amazing fort. Families fly kites there and adorable school children eat their lunch there. There's a lot of life in OSJ. I LOVE it and wished we could have seen much more of PR. Next time.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on making a reservation at this hotel try not to use 3rd party online websites and make the reservation with the hotel directly. You can do this either online at [-----]or by telephone at 800-468-2779. Online prices for a Deluxe room are around $350 USD, if you go to the hotel directly you will pay around $215 USD and can request a particular room if you like.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a dream come true. The staff was more than kind and helpful in every way! Our room was beautiful with a breath taking view. The food was wonderful. We found ourselves away from the hustle and bustle of the cruise ships and yet still in the heart of this beautiful city. We were able to explore and se the sites. The tour guide we were set up with was incredible, we learned so much. It was such a lovely experience that I almost cried when we left. I am looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TessM
Reviews.Content: I just arrived a few hours ago and I don't want to leave! The staff couldn't be nicer and the tapas restaurant attached to the hotel was fabulous. My room is roomy (but the bathroom is on the small side), large French doors looking out onto the Catherdral, ceiling fan, flat sceen TV and a Bose CD player. Perfect location (easy walk to El Morro) for sightseeing. Me gusto mucho!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's the best decision we made. We stayed at EL Convento for 4 days, the staff is extremely nice (as everyone in PR), the rooms were fantastic, the location cannot be better...you are right in Old San Juan...close to historic sites and night clubs & restaurants. We love the El Convento and we are recommending it to everyone! PD: And they have complimentary happy hour from 6-7Pm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Kravitz
Reviews.Content: A small, luxury boutique hotel with LOTS of charm. We stayed in a large corner room on the top floor (#519). It had a full, private, rooftop terrace with table and chairs. Highly recommend ordering the sinful burger (even though its pricey $11.00) at the hotel's lovely interior courtyard restaurant. Check out the small "dipping" pool and hot tub on the roof for a great view of the city. Hotel is in a terrific location for sightseeing in Old San Juan. Thank goodness too for valet parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyOBRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento Hotel the night prior to going out on a cruise ship from San Juan. It was beautiful, clean and comfortable with a great location to shopping, restaurants, and site seeing. We were two young females traveling alone to San Juan for the first time and felt very safe anywhere we walked around this hotel. The breakfast was great and the relaxing surroundings helped us after a long flight from the States. We walked up the morning before our cruise to a fort and did some site seeing, we saw rare parrots in a tree and the walk along the seashore was just beautiful. We highly recommend this place as well as coming in a day early for a cruise so that you can relax before going on board ship. We have another cruise out of San Juan scheduled at the end of this year and have already booked another stay the night before at El Convento Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rwilcox
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. This place is dripping with history and we felt warm and welcome the minute the hotel unloaded our bags from the taxi. The staff had great attitudes and when ever we had a glitch (hair dryer in room broke and a miscommunication caused our taxi to be given to someone else) they really hustled to correct it, very friendly and impressive service. One couple we met was there for the 18th year in a row! If (when) I go back to San Juan I will not consider any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again!”
Reviews.Author: CAG5563
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the El Convento Hotel for one night before our cruise. The staff was very pleasant from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. Our room was very clean and a very good size. We ate in the tapas restaurant in the hotel and had a very good meal with very good service. It is a little pricey, but we think it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy place with lots of history”
Reviews.Author: Getmearumpunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Convento only one night, en route to Vieques. Although it was a bit pricey and not quite as plush as I expected, it was a real treat. A very classy place, with high ceilings and comfortable beds. The staff was excellent, the food was terrific, and we could walk to all the Old San Juan historical sites. The wine and cheese reception was so good, we took a pass on dinner and just had some tapas in the second-floor tapas bar. If you go, be sure to check out the painting of Christ in the hallway just outside the restaurant area. I swear it looks like he's talking on a cell phone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San juan”
Reviews.Author: baskin
Reviews.Content: El Convento is by far the best place to stay in Old San Juan, the interesting part of this large city. While the rooms are not large, they are quiet (internal glass door inside the corridor door)and full of superb amenitities. A large plasma TV, a Bose Wave radio and the strongest shower that we have ever experienced. Breakfast or lunch in the patio dining room is a wonderful oasis from the teeming outside activity and, unlike other hotels, El Convento is on a relatively quiet street. We found everyone at the hotel to be friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Take it for what it is”
Reviews.Author: princeton12321
Reviews.Content: Is this the Ritz Carlton? No. Does it pretend to be? No. This is an absolutely charming hotel located right in Old San Juan. Wonderful architecture and character you cant get in most places in San Juan. Yes, the prices can be high, but we got a great deal and the room was clean, comfortable, and the service friendly and attentitive (if a big slow, but that is pretty par for the island). When you are looking for a distinctivly Puerto Rican experience, but dont want to trade off some of the luxuries of home, this is a great place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed . . .”
Reviews.Author: webwiz99
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for four days. On arrival, there was no bellman, so I found room 217 myself. The room was next to an electrical generator which vibrated noisily --- and the air-conditioner was very loud. I asked for a room change and they put me in 321. I enjoy reading on vacation. There was no comfortable chair with an adjacent light. When I tried to read in bed, it slid away from the wall because it was on wheels. And the draperies were ripped. The third room had a chair, but no light next to it. So I shoved the chair into the entry area and read there. Overall, the rooms are dark. I thought the breakfasts were poorly presented, more like a diner. In the lunch restaurant, the service was terrible. The swimming pool is 6 x 10 feet and the lounge chairs there were taken most of the time. The bathrooms are very small. There was a nice porch where one could sit out and read or visit. The hotel building has great charm. The people working there are friendly. El Convento seems to me more like a three-star hotel. It is not luxurious, but â€œgenerally pleasant. I thought $397 a night for a single was too much. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento is absolutely terrific”
Reviews.Author: flosue
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It's in a beautiful section of a fascinating city. It's not easy to taxi to because the traffic is awful and the streets are so narrower. However, the hotel is lovely inside & out & worth the crazy taxi drive. Our room (Room 206)was quiet, cozy, & pretty. We had a great view of the cathedral across the way. We enjoyed the nightly manager's wine & cheese party (they need to include chocolate). The exercise room was well-equipped with machines that worked. One disappointment was the breakfast restaurant on the ground level. It was VERY expensive, not enough food, and SLOW service. The same could be said for the hotel's bar. We quickly learned to go to some local places for speedy, delicious, & cheap breakfast meals rather than waste our time & money eating at the hotel. The roof top pool and deck area was absolutely perfect for reading & people watching & sun bathing. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 324!”
Reviews.Author: ScotTravller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to San Juan (fri/sat night stay). The hotel has rustic charm and the staff were all very friendly (as were the other Puerto Ricans we met). However, make sure you don't stay in room 324. This room has an outlook onto the street and is very noisy. The hotel cafe which was just below and played loud music until it closed at 1am. The main problem was the bars and people in the street. The bar directly opposite was open until 5am (the time when i eventually got to sleep - for all of 3 hours). The next morning we complained and the staff were very accomodating and changed our room to one which although smaller was much improved. The staff seemed unsurprised by the complaint so i imagine this happens regularly. The other (minor) problem is that the hotel is right in the middle of old san juan which is great for walking about the streets but if you travel elsewhere and get a taxi back it can be difficult as the streets were jammed with cars. On the sat night we ended up getting dropped off by the taxi a few streets away and walking the rest (the taxi driver was very apologetic). This is a nice hotel (if a bit pricey) and the staff were helpful, just don't stay in 324!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Building”
Reviews.Author: Azniv
Reviews.Content: First of all old San Juan is beautiful. Very European. The Hotel El Convento is an old Convent that has been converted to a hotel. If you like historic buildings you will love this hotel. So charming and comfortable and a beautiful courtyard. I only stay in five star hotels and this meet my expectation not because it was super luxurious but because it was such a beautful building and the rooms were nice and the bathrooms as well. Also I loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suntrvlrgirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the El Convento. The hotel staff upgraded our room to a suite and were very friendly. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The hotel is in walking distance of resturants and shopping. We stayed two days after a cruise and were well rested after 7 days of island hopping.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Romantic Hideaway in the City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th or 6th time back to El Convento and each time we find a new room that we love! You can not buy charm like this! The tapas bar/restaraunt has the best Mojitios in the world! The pool is small but just enough for a relax after walking around the city. The staff has always been incredible to us they really can answer most questions you may have. If you love the big hotels stay away, this is not for you. If you like personal service and lots of history in a fabulous location this is it!!! Our room is always ready when we arrive( which is my pet peeve in a hotel)and I mean clean and perfect! Love the chocolates at night what a nice touch that we didn't expect. See you again next year! Perhaps the only down fall is that we don't get to stay longer each trip. Simply a great hotel that delivers everything for the price.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tamiris
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the El Convento in Old San Juan. We loved everything about it - the location, the building, the service, the views from the terrace on the 3rd floor and the pool on the 4th. I would highly recommend it. Our room was very attractive, even though not very large and even though it did not have a lot of natural light. It had 6(!) lamps and/or wall sconces, which we appreciated since we like to read. There was turn down service every evening. The bathroom was not large, but nice. The room opened onto an arcade going around the courtyard in the middle of the building, which had been a convent. There were trees, plants, etc. in the courtyard, including fruit bats flying around in the evening (they stayed in the courtyard and did not fly into the outdoor corridor. Every evening they lit candles on small tables set up overlooking the courtyard. There are 3 restaurants in the building, one in the courtyard, one on the 2nd floor overlooking the courtyard, and another on the 2nd floor near the side entrance of the building (which is onto the 2nd floor, since it is built on a hill. Every night from 6-7 pm there was complimentary wine and cheese on the terrace on the 3rd floor. We enjoyed talking to other guests there. Old San Juan is small and you can walk everywhere from the hotel. I would love to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the El Convento after traveling to other places in the Caribbean. The hotel is centrally located for exploring Old San Juan. Our very clean and tastefully decorated room was on the 5th floor with wonderful views and (to my husband's surprise) a really nice flat screen tv! The staff at the hotel was friendly and very accommodating. We were pleasantly surprised by Old San Juan and cannot wait to return. We spent 2 nights just walking around eating tapas and drinking our way thru the city. There is a very good Tapas restaurant right in front of the El Convento through the courtyard - I would highly recommend for a casual lunch (try their Sangria). We went to the Ritz Carlton one night to check it out but really wish we had just stayed right in Old San Juan - so much to see and do. I would go back to Old San Juan in a heartbeat, the nonstop flights from the States and the approximately to the airport makes Old San Juan and easy getaway destination.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: tvsp
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful building but the standards of service, given the cost, left a lot to be desired. I had complaints when I left- they said a manager would call me... three weeks on and I've heard nothing. I booked a package which their website calls 'Romantic Memories of Old San Juan'; disappointingly it promised 'Fresh Flowers In Your Room'- which we never got; and a 'Hotel Signature Bag' (not sure what that is but we didn't get it). When we checked in the hotel couldn't give us a key for the in-room safe- they said they'd let us know as soon as they had one... we were there for three nights and I think they need to order more because they never got back to us. As for the evening drinks reception- I'd prefer they included breakfast instead- which is very expensive in the hotel. Oh- and two other things to look out for- I almost made a local call until they told me it would cost $1.30 per minute. And don't trust your postcards to them- they said they'd send some for me- judging by the postmark they took two weeks to mail them. All in all, a nice hotel in a great location... but the service isn't anywhere near as good as it should be for the high prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Like the curate's egg - good in parts”
Reviews.Author: Miner1
Reviews.Content: El Convento has the possibility of being one of the great hotels, but is let down by needless inefficiencies. Its position, architecture and ambience are superb, but there are too many problems, individually small but adding up. We stayed for three nights in November. Like other previous respondents we arrived at a reasonable time to find no room available, nor any forecast as to when one would be. Eventually, at about 4pm we were given the keys to a room which was not made up. This was quickly remedied but annoying. No complaint about the reception and concierge who were pleasant. The new room was satisfactory, although not large. Again like many others, we found the lift out of order one day. The barman at the Tapas bar was downright unpleasant, although we were later informed that this bar is not part of the hotel. Best avoided, there is plenty of choice in the area. The main hotel restaurant was adequate and although not inspiring the staff were pleasant and efficient. The maid service left something to be desired with heavy dust in some areas. Other complaints were they lost our laundry (found eventually), and the telephone did not work. When we did manage to make a call, the pen did not work! However, that did not mean we did not enjoy our stay. Staff at the front desk was always helpful, especially Carmen, and other staff were always pleasant. The design and ambience of the hotel are stunning, at the centre of a beautiful historic city. The complimentary bar between 6 and 7pm is a lovely idea, and although the pool is small, the deck area has a beautiful aspect and is a pleasant place to relax. We still think this is the best place to stay in Old Sann Juan, but just wish they would get their act together. We booked through expedia.co.uk at a reasonable rate with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: pman38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Convento for two days prior to a cruise. We selected the hotel, as we like Old San Juan and were pretty much able to walk anywhere to shop or dine. We were celebrating our tenth wedding anniversary. We had booked the room through the cruiseline. Upon checking in after a long day, we were told the only room available had twin beds. We explained that we had requested a room with a queen sized bed. They stated they had no other rooms, but would try to get us another room the next day. I am not sure where the mixup took place. I did contact the cruiseline who stated a queen sized bed was requested. ???? We had to take the room. Upon retiring for the night, the toilet in the room overflowed all over. We had not even used the toilet as of yet. Water was everywhere. We called the front desk and they sent a maintenance person up. It took him awhile, but apparently he fixed whatever caused the problem. After he left, the toilet started running and making very strange noises, and would not stop. I called the front desk irate, as it was late, and we were very tired. Miraculously, another room became available after we were told earlier there was nothing available. The person at the front desk stated this room also had twin beds. We immediately took the room, as we were very tired. This room was OK but the hotel really needs to do some upgrading, especially in the rooms. Obviously plumbing is an issue as well. The following day the front desk called and stated a room with a queen sized bed became available, as someone had cancelled. We declined, as we did not feel like packing everything up again. On a positive note, the wine/cheese reception each night was outstanding. A nice assortment of cheeses and wine. Cafe Bohemio was excellent as well. One last note. The hotel is all open. We do prefer at times to be in air conditioning, as the heat bothers us at times. The only place we found air conditioned areas was in the rooms. All dining areas are in the open. Ceiling fans are present, however. We will stay at another hotel on our next visit to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at El Convento”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife an I stayed at the El Convento for 3 nights during our honeymoon. This was the last leg of our trip after spending a week over at St. Johns and we were not disappointed. The service was stellar... The woman at the front desk (can't recall her name but she had braces :)) had taken note that it was our honeymoon, congratulated us and then put us in what many considered the best room in the house on the 5th floor. Since this was the first time someone actually really acknowledged with some excitement on us being newlyweds and went out of their way to find a great room, make us reservations on the spot for dinner, etc... it really meant a lot to us and really set the tone for the rest of our stay - great service. The room itself (I *think* 508) had been featured in many magazines with two windows/doors that had a view of the bay and also the pool area. The room was extremely tasteful and well thought out in terms of color scheme, decorations and furniture... along with being extremely clean. On our first night we took advantage of a pre-dinner snack at the nightly free cheese and wine hour only to come back to our room afterwards to find our bed turned down with rose pedals put into the shape of a heart on our bed (very nice touch). Several moments later there was a knock on our door with a bottle of champange and truffles. The inner courtyard was very nice, with breakfast in the morning and a tappas bar overlooking looking it - which ended up being our favorite place for drinks and snacks as the food was excellent. The location of the hotel itself in Old San Juan is perfect with walking distance to the shops and several execellent restaurants. If you want to go a bit further there is always a taxi out front. One night we took a taxi over to the Sheraton at Isle Verde for dinner and the casino, 15 minute ride at about $18, a little expensive but still reasonable. We would definitely stay again (in fact already setting up our next trip) and have absolutely nothing negative to say about the hotel or service of the resort... and I consider myself picky. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with Victor of New York”
Reviews.Author: FlashPackingIt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the location cannot be beat! Everything you could possibly want or need are right here, practically on your door step. One word of advice, if you need directions - ask the bellmen instead of front desk. I am still here with my husband at El Convento on our last night. We have been here for 4 days and all 4 days have had periodic downpours throughout. Our room also leaked. After informing the front desk of this problem, we were disappointed that the staff tried to pass it off as condensation from the air conditioning. The leaks are so bad that at one point it soaked the bed on one side!
