We have since pulled our bed from the wall to avoid sleeping on a water bed and placed towels on the floor (by the way, housekeeping keeps replacing our towels even though we hang them up daily to show that we would like to keep them). Having said all that, we were moved from a standard room to a junior suite on our second night here even though we booked for a deluxe room (which is a really nice bonus). Unfortunately it is the suite that is leaking but wild horses wouldn't drag us out of here for the space! The Tapas bar at the hotel is very good and has great ambience. We have not tried Cafe Bohemio. You can visit the Barcardi Rum Distillery by catching a ferry from Pier 2 at the waterfront (5 minute walk from El Convento) to Catano ($0.50) and take a taxi to the Distillery ($3.00). All in all a great experience with few disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Elconvento”
Reviews.Author: shannyh1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico, staying 6 nights at the Hotel Elconvento...October 10-16th. After booking our room through Travelocity, we had a bit of a problem when we arrived in that the staff stated our room was a superior instead of the deluxe booked. Upon showing them proof, we were happily given room 501. During our first night, San Juan experiened more than average rainfall and our room had a couple leaks (one in the bathroom and one from the ceiling); Also we were unable to make telephone calls to the US mainland through the telephone system from the rooms. We informed the desk of our problems of leakage and were cheerfully transferred to room 510, which had a better view of San Juan Bay. This room was very satisfactory and nicely appointed with it's decor. Our CD player did not work, however. The room was clean and comfortable. Dining at The Elconvento was a bit 'iffy' as the Bistro was closed for refurbishing. We enjoyed our breakfast each morning in the inner courtyard (when it was not raining)..however, breakfast was a bit high-priced ($39 for two of bacon and eggs, toast, juice and coffee). There were a few times the lift did not work as well. We are assuming that the heavy rains were responsible for the malfunction. The pub, El Picateo was lovely and offers not only drinks but light snacks such as tappas and sandwiches. In the evening dinners are available as well. Rich Puerto Rican music wafts through the bar and restaurant sitting. From 6-7PM is free wine/cheese offerings. The cheeses were nothing special, however, the many wines were lovely. The corridors are lovely and the terraces are beautifully lit. Many different plants, flowers, and trees line the hallways and terraces, giving a romantic air to the hotel. The swimming pool and hot tub are very small, but clean and there is ample area for sunning. There is a lovely view from the swimming area as well as the terraces. There is free internet access in the library. Hotel Elconvento is centrally situated nicely in Old San Juan and in convenient walking distance to all attractions. The city is very hilly, so wear comfortable footwear! Just a few blocks away from the hotel is a trolley (small bus) that will transport you throughout the city for free. There is no need to rent a car if Old San Juan is where you are going to stay for the entire trip. We hired a driver for one day to take us on a tour, visit the Bacardi Rum Distillery, and treated us to an authentic Puerto Rican restaurant for lunch. The cost of this was $120 for 5 hours. There were other tours the concierge desk (same people as the front desk) offers, but dont hesitate to ask to make up your own package. They are most accommodating. All in all, we found the Hotel Elconvento staff very helpful and friendly. For a 350 year old building, it is well maintained and has more than enough staff to meet your needs. We were a bit disappointed by the housekeeping staff. They made up the bed each day, but towels were not replaced as needed. I think in the future we would not stay an entire 6 days in Old San Juan, but visit the beaches in Ponce and other areas of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: sookirincon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beautiful hotel over the past weekend. The staff was friendly and helpful. Nice setting, relaxing and clean. My room was small but cozy. Complementary water is put daily in the refrigerator. And daily complementary wine and cheese is served on the third fl. A great way to relax in the evenings. The swimming pool is small but cute. Perfect when there aren't too many people. I used it at night, and it was great!!! No need to use the car is staying for a weekend. You will find shops, clubs, bar and restaurant within walking distance. The Spanglish Restaurant offers great food and very inexpensive. The Old San Juan is like being in another Country. I highly recommend El Convento Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility, and free wine”
Reviews.Author: sahman
Reviews.Content: One always takes a risk when booking a hotel, sight unseen, in an unknown town. Staying at El Convento made me look like an genius. The hotel is a large, romantically lit facade set on a small plaza. The setting is romatic, relaxing, and a fabulous respite from the busy town, despite being a 2 minute walk from good shopping, art galleries and restaurants. My wife and I particularly enjoyed the daily wine and cheese offering. It provides a unique opportunity to meet other guests, and watch the sun set before going out on the town. The service was very good, without being obtrusive, and the rooms clean and comfortable, with high ceilings. Each room has a small cafe table outside the front door, looking out on the central atrium. I'd highly recommend this hotel if you are more of a city person than a beach person, however the beach is a quick cab ride away. Definitely a great alternative to the cookie-cutter "resort" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “best option for diverse san jaun”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeach1
Reviews.Content: el convento has an excellent location for a city tour of san jaun -- walking distance to excellent shops, restaurants & clubs. the property is charming and historic, although could use renovation to bring it back to 4-star standards. we found the staff very friendly and able to answer our questions and give excellent advice on shopping, clubs, restaurants, etc. el convento is no where near a beach. however, a $16 cab ride gets you to their sister property on isla verde -- which is a wide, clean, safe beach with lots of ammenities. the pool at conventro is small, esp when any children decend and start splashing water into your adult beverage. the rooms and bathrooms nice. overall, convento is a better alternative to the Ritz Carlton. the Ritz was quite crowded and a little worn -- certainly not what I expected hearing it was 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely not come back”
Reviews.Author: katyshay
Reviews.Content: Bad experience first day--at tapas restaurant in hotel--we were ignored in an empty restaurant by the three or four young male waiters--we finally left without dining. The room was adequate, and the staff at the patio restaurant where we dined the rest of our stay fortunately made up for the bad staff upstairs. The location was good if you could figure out how to get through the maze of one way streets especially at night when police blocked certain streets off. Fortunately I didn't let the worst dining experience I'd ever had ruin a wonderful trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our way to Antigua. The staff was fantastic, the rooms were brilliant, and the rooftop pool and hot tub were breath taking. I can not wait to go back. There was so much to see! I wish we could have stayed longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Brilliance”
Reviews.Author: MrTetley
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this next line may sound conceited, but: growing up, I was lucky to stay in some of the world's best hotels. We'd watch Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous, read lists of the best, and say, 'Been There, Been There.' Well, I may've been a student traveller between then and now, but this place ranks as one of the absolute best I've been to. I was only there for two days, one night, but oh how I wish it was longer. It was, no less, the last night of our honeymoon, and we'd had a lovely week in the BVIs on the beach, and were sad to leave, but El Convento was brilliant. Every staff member was great. Fantastic bellboy (Gadrial, I think was his name), great check-in, restaurant staff were great. And the room was lovely. So many nice touches, like the tables and chairs with candles outside the rooms in the hall, the gorgeous courtyard, the views, the location, etc. Almost best of all, though, was their lovely convention of having a free wine and cheese affair every afternoon from 6-7. open bottles of good wine, nice cheeses, and you could go to town. And their honor bar was also a nice way of telling their guests that they're different from the rest. The tapas restaurant (El Picoteo) was lovely looking, and had some nice stuff. My wife and I had a great meal, and woke the next morning feeling truly blessed to have stayed there. We stayed at the Water Club on the way out to the BVIs, but this was so much better. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our Expextations”
Reviews.Author: missntl
Reviews.Content: Even after everything we read about this hotel and Old San Juan they both exceeded our expectations. Stayed for an extra 2 days after our cruise - wish we had stayed longer. The hotel is amazing and the staff is wonderful. It has so much character and charm yet contains all the modern ammentities you could ask for. Old San Juan itslef is a unique and wonderful place that we will go back and visit again - reminded us a lot of a Europe - just can't say enough good things about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best!”
Reviews.Author: TresSirenas
Reviews.Content: As an owners of a small Inn on the West Coast of Puerto RIco, we often travel to San Juan for a quick getaway, having stayed in the many hotels in Condado and Isle Verde, our absolute favorite place to visit is the El Convento! On our most recent visit, traveling with friends from Europe who also own a B&B in the south of France, and our children, we took 4 rooms, after finding a great rate on the internet. The architecture and ambience exemplify the charm of old San Juan, the rooms ar decorated to reflect the Spanish influence, and the service is unsurpassed. We especially enjoy the wine happy hour with a great variety of cheeses and fruit, offered every night, complimentary on their terrace overlooking the old city. After enjoying a great dinner at one of the many fine restaurants, this last visit Perigino's, fantastic, we enjoy their roof top pool for a swim under the stars before retiring. We often reccomend to our guests arriving in San Juan to stay at the El Convento before traveling to the west coast. It's no wonder this hotel is rated #1 by tripadvior, it clearly deserves it. To anyone visiting our beautiful Isalnd, before you head to the beaches, spend one or two nights first here, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, full of old world charm”
Reviews.Author: JuliusNomad
Reviews.Content: El Convento was the perfect place for my wife and me to stay for the first night of our honeymoon. We also got a good price through Hotels. We arrived early at 12pm and mentioned to the front desk that this was the first night of our honeymoon; they were very courteous and put us in a lovely room (#519) on the top floor which has the biggest private terrace in the hotel. In the evening when we returned from dinner and our paseo (evening stroll) we found on our bed a large heart-shape made out of rose petals, with a rose in the middle and two chocolates, together with a card welcoming us and wishing us well. When we were walking out of the room in our bathrooms (heading for the pool) we discovered an ice bucket with a bottle of champagne and two glasses -- a very thoughtful gesture from the night manager. The hotel itself is beautiful and charming, located in the middle of Old San Juan, adjacent to a large church and beautiful square, and a short walk along blue tinted cobblestones and Havana-like street scenes to historic buildings and boutique stores. We mentioned our plan to travel the next day to the islands of Culebra and Vieques (collectively known as the â€œSpanish Virgin Islandsâ€�, located about 30 miles west of the US Virgin Island of St Thomas) -- Carlos at the front desk quickly called Avis for us and arranged for hotel pickup to their car rental office, securing a competitive price of $58 (including tax) for a one way rental to Fajardo. This rate is slightly lower than the $60-70 you pay if you travel by taxi, and allowed us to visit the rain forest en route. Lastly, we should mention the complementary wine and cheese in the evening -- which gave us the opportunity to mingle with other guests and look out from the third floor to the church -- and complementary breakfast. We greatly appreciate the excellent and thoughtful service of the staff of El Convento; they made our visit truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento is the best!”
Reviews.Author: mfp718
Reviews.Content: It's a gorgeous old hotel, worth every penny. We got a good deal through Hotels, so it's worth checking around online. The rooms are gorgeous, the courtyard unbelievable, and the amenities spot-on. What a wonderful staff, too. Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: dm2123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a lovely stay at the Hotel El Convento. This was a suprise trip for my birthday and was originally set for a stay at the Water Club, but after reading other traveler's horror stories we changed the reservation to El Convento. I could not have been happier. The hotel is very charming and conveniently located in Old San Juan. We checked in at 12:30 am and our room was ready, the bed had been turned down for us and soft music was playing upon our entrance to the room. Our room was on the fifth floor, which is the highest floor and had a nice view of the city, the bay and mountains in the distance. The room was very clean, as well as the bathroom. The food in the hotel was excellent. I did have one gripe and please ask the hotel about this before choosing a room. There was a very large wedding in the hotel on Saturday night. The noise during the wedding reception was not nearly as bad as afterwards. Our room was located somewhat near the elevator and by the pool area (which is on the fourth floor). The wedding guests brought their party to the hallways and the pool area and loudly carried on until 5:30 am. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, so it thankfully drowed out some of the noise, but it was a bit ridiculous. So, I suggest if there is any function, such as a wedding in the hotel, ask for a room towards the back of the hotel to avoid a possible sleepless night. I know some people have commented about the pool being extremely small. Well, it is, but we happened to be the only people there most the time. On Sundays, you can hear parishioners singing spanish hymns in the church across the street if you are on the pool deck. Our room also had doors that opened up to a mini terrace, and we were treated to live music from a nearby festival. I definitely reccomend this hotel - the staff was very polite, and you really are in the middle of "all the action". I swear by the reviews on this site, so thank you for the all the reviews that helped me choose and experience this nice hotel. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento, simply gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Juanka2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at El Convento for our anniversary night. I can only say that I can't wait to return for another stay. The hotel is very charming and romantic. The staff is very helpful and they take care to all the details so you can have a very unique stay. The hotel offers an excellent wine and cheese in the evening. This is not the usual wine and cheese you are used to. They will offer several different labels of wine and arround three to four kinds of cheeses, of course, grapes and crackers are also offered. You will enjoy all this in a beautiful terrace overlooking a small plaza just in fron of the Old San Juan Cathedral. The rooms are well appointed with all the ammenities you are used to find in luxury hotels, although they are not huge, they are very charming and add up to the enchantment. During our stay, the staff went the extra mile and decorated our bed with yellow rose petals and a solitary rose, WHAT A DETAIL! As we stayed in the 5ft. floor, we had an excellent view of the San Juan Bay and harbour. In the 4th floor you can find a jacuzzi and a small pool in a very cozy terrace. In the morning, we had breakfast at the hotel's CafÃ© del Nispero. We ordered the continental breakfast. We were expecting the usual toast, juice and coffee. Instead, we received a fresh fruit cocktail, assortment of pastries and fruit jam, toast, juice, and coffee. Wow, this is an enhanced continental breakfast. The checkout was quick without any hassle. I deffinitely recommend this hotel and will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and enchantingl”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel El Convento for six nights. I found it to be an enchanting visit. The hotel is unique, historic and beautiful. Right across from the cathedral and in the historic quarter of Old San Juan, the hotel offers beautiful architectural detail, a service oriented staff and a setting that is relaxing and elegant. My room was quite comfortable with a view that looked out over Fortaleza (Govenors's Mansion). The pool, though small, offered a wonderful view of Old San Juan and the port. The interior of the hotel was historic with beautiful marble floors, furniture and art. The courtyard below was lush and shaded by a magnificant tree. On the thrid floor terrace there was a wonderful outdoor patio which served as a great place to read and relax as well as a library room with internet access. Each night at 6:00 Hotel Convento has an incredible wine and cheese gathering for guests. So nice to visit with new friends each night and the wine and cheese was quite generous. The staff were wonderful and gracious. Every effort is made to meet guests needs and make them feel comfortable. And each night, your bed is turned down and wonderful choclates on the pillow. I found the Hotel Convento to be a delightful and magical. James

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa77
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for two nights at the end of our honeymoon, after touring the rest of the island. It was by far the best place to stay in Old San Juan! The staff was courteous and very helpful, esp in restaurant recommendations (they have a huge binder full of menus). Our room was spacious, had a TV/VCR/stereo system, mini-fridge, a beautiful iron wrought bed and a nice view of the city. The best part of the stay was all the little nice touches they provided, like the 2 bottles of complimentary Dasani water left in your fridge daily and the turn-down service at night. The complimentary continental breakfast was also fairly extensive - breakfast is served to you in the courtyard, where there's a piano player, and involved baskets of toast or bagels, pastries, and a large plate of tropical fruits. The wine & cheese daily from 6-8pm is a don't miss! (it's free too!). It's the best time to sit out on the balcony of the 3rd floor and watch the courtyard where there's a large 300 yr old fruit tree with these really cool bats that fly around at dusk. The pool is very small, but the jacuzzi is nice to unwind in after a day of sightseeing and the view from the terrace is nice. The location is perfect to walk to all the city sights. (Driving & parking is a nightmare in old san juan.) One thing about room selection - we stayed on the top floor in room 501, which is next to the old chapel portion of the convent where they have all the weddings. the weekend that we were there, there were weddings on both nights, and noise was an issue. Also, the pool area is on a terrace outside of the 4th floors, so if you are staying in a room on that side of the 4th floor, you might have people in the jacuzzi looking into your room. All in all, we were very happy with our stay and we'll definitely be going back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “positives exceed negatives”
Reviews.Author: bbaltic
Reviews.Content: I own a small historic inn and I like to stay at historic properties when I travel. I spent two weeks El Convento; long enough to get a real feel for the place. Here's what I found. You can't beat the location if the ambiance of the old city is what you're looking for. I stayed in a room on the second floor overlooking the square in front of the hotel. The room was large and had a ceiling that must have been twenty feet high! I loved it. (rooms on the third and fourth floors were added to the top of the old convent and don't have quite the same antique feel as the second floor) The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the bath small, but more than adaquate. The maid service was good, twice a day, and I really appreciated the in-room internet connection for my laptop. I found the staff to be genuinely freindly and helpful. I would have no problem recommending the hotel for a stay of any length. However, my stay was not without a few problems. I read other reviews that mention faulty airconditioning. Mine worked but was very noisy. I suspected a bent fan blade hitting a shroud, the sort of thing that can be fixed with a screwdriver. I reported it, a repairman came promptly, agreed with the diagnosis, but claimed to be unqualified to fix it. He promised the regular maintenance crew would be in the next day and take care of it. They didn't come that day or any other. After a week of excuses I used a coin to remove the screws holding the grill, reached in and fixed it myself. Noise can be a problem. Most rooms are situated away from the busy street but noise echos around the small streets easily. My room was fitted with an extra window pane that cut down the noise but did not eliminate it. A bigger problem was the Hotel's practice of renting ground floor space for wedding receptions and other functions on the weekends. The noise from one party did not end until after one AM. I would recommend a set of ear plugs just in case. These annoyances aside, I enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff. Magnificent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: reich45
Reviews.Content: What a magnificent hotel. The staff are wonderful and really made us feel welcome. They smiled (not something that happens at all hotels!), were generally very helpful and stopped to pass the time of day with us. The staff are a real asset at this hotel and we cannot praise them enough. The hotel is situated in old San Juan and the building dates back several centuries. An excellent job has been done in converting the building to a hotel and the rooms were a pleasure to stay in. The hotel is conveniently situated for the shops and sites of old San Juan. The restaurants at the hotel were good. The breakfast area is particularly pleasant and the continental breakfast, with fresh fruit, is enjoyable. The wine and cheese evenings (free) offer good quality produce and the staff are very helpful in dealing with requests and questions. This is one of the few hotels that I would recommend without any hesitation. I would certainly love to visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly not luxury treatment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, where to start? The El Convento is a lovely hotel in historic Old San Juan, from a visual perspective. It is ideally located for walking around Old San Juan, close to many shops, restaurants, and historic sites. They also have a very nice daily wine and cheese tasting, as well as a nice complimentary continental breakfast in the morning. Unfortunately, for a hotel priding itself on being a member of the "small luxury hotels of the world" category, it fails to live up to those expectations of luxury when it comes to service. We arrived as a post-cruise package around noon, and were told that our rooms weren't quite ready yet and were told to check back in about an hour. That one hour turned into over 3 hours, as rooms were not ready until after 3 pm. The rooms themselves were large and roomy, with a nice-sized bathroom as well. The room my wife and I were given had a malfunctioning air conditioner, (there was also another member in our party whose air conditioning was not working) something we did not bring to the concierge's attention due to us just being so tired the first day, we took a long nap that night. When we did notify the front desk the following morning around 8 am as we were getting ready to go out for the day, we were told that they would get maintenance to check it out. When we returned to the hotel in mid-afternoon, the air conditioning was still not working. When I called again, the concierge said she would speak to her supervisor very quickly and then call me right back. Thirty minutes later after I called them again (and about 10 minutes after my wife had gone down to the desk to speak to them again about the air conditioning), we were told that they would assign us a different room. After 3 different calls to let the porter know we were ready to have our luggage taken to the new room, we were finally situated in a room with temperature control. It seems like a minor irritation, but they (a) either didn't check it out at all after we originally asked them to, or (b) knew it wasn't working and weren't going to do anything about it until we pestered the front desk staff enough. Our check out problems were the the biggest problems, though. Checking out itself wasn't a problem, but catching our taxis to the airport with all of our luggage was another situation. We checked out of the hotel at noon, and had arranged for our luggage to be held (with claim checks) until 1 pm for our transport to the airport. Taxis didn't arrive until closer to 1:30, and only when we got to the airport did we realize that we were missing 2 bags still, one my wife's, one belonging to my sister. My sister had to ride back to the hotel with the taxi driver to pick up the missing luggage, which the hotel staff told her was left on a chair by where we were sitting waiting for the taxis, as though we left them behind and forgot to grab them. I'm still trying to figure out how this could be since they were bags that had been checked in with the porter staff and once we gave the bags to them, they never left their custody. Its obvious that they forgot to pull them when they loaded the taxis, regardless of the excuse they offered of where they found the bags. My best advice for anyone looking to stay at El Convento? Visually pleasing, and ideally located if you want to stay in Old San Juan. However, the quality of service is severly lacking and very indifferent. I'm sure that for the price, you can find better accomodations elsewhere in San Juan, especially in the Isla Verde area. If and when my wife and I return to San Juan, our accomodations will definetly be elsewhere other than El Convento. *Note: This hotel was booked by our travel agent, who acknowledged beforehand she was not strongly familiar with San Juan and its accomodations*

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: marham
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Old San Juan -- close to everything -- staff was more than accommodating. Great views of the inner-courtyard; and higher rooms have ocean views. Free internet use; great continental breakfast in the morning; wonderful restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this unique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so wonderful to stay at! The staff was OVERLY helpful with our plans and in getting a higher floor room. This hotel is located in the perfect part of Old San Juan. It was absolutely beautiful! We would for sure stay here again on our next trip. Thanks to TripAdvisor we stayed here rather than some of our other options! So thanks to all who write reviews. This hotel is a MUST if your looking to stay in San Juan, Puerto Rico!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Spot”
Reviews.Author: sar_tor
Reviews.Content: On the way home from our honeymoon in Grenada we had a stop-over in San Juan and missed our connecting flight, so the airline put us up at El Convento for the evening. What a gem of a hotel! The rooms are clean, the staff friendly, and the location superb, and best of all the place has such character and charm. Plus, the tapas restaurant is terrific - such yummy sangria! We loved this hotel so much we are considering a return trip for our first anniversary this coming summer -- one night at El Convento was not nearly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed sophistication, great service”
Reviews.Author: EmilieV7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March when our flight to Guadeloupe was cancelled and we found ourselves stuck in San Juan for a night. Our stay could not have been nicer. From the moment we arrived we loved this place. Gorgeous hotel with soaring ceilings, Spanish arches and a stunning courtyard around which the rooms are built. This place manages to combine the best of old world elegance with contemporary style. And, the added bonus is that the service from all staff we encountered (including waiters in the restaurant) was efficient, warm and hospitable. We arrived about 10:30 PM starving and were delighted with the tapas restaurant. The rooms are a tad on the small side but the ambiance, service and sheer good taste more than compensate. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance ! ! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are big "Short Vacation" people and this was the best ! Our four days and three nights could not have been better. The room, pool, wine & cheese parties, food, furnishings, art work, statuary etc. were all outstanding but the best part of all were the people--------- they catered to our every need and made us feel relaxed and comfortable. Thank you all and we'll see you again. Mary Anne & Bill

Reviews.Title: “Best Small Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, This place was so pretty and charming, so much character. It's hard to find such places these days to stay in. The service was great - the conceirge (sp?) was so helpful in booking tours . . . we went with Rafeal to the rainforest - it was great ! We didn't eat at the restaurant but the courtyard and rooms were lovely. The free wine and cheese was awesome. If you want charm, history, great hotel - stay here ! If you are looking for huge pools with swim up bars and slides - stay away !!!!!!!!!!! One of the best i have stayed in - period.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: seattlebarb
Reviews.Content: The El Convento is a charming hotel in the heart of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. The hotel is a converted convent. The rooms are charming, but small. There is beautiful courtyard in the center for dining and drinks. There is also a tapas bar in the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of all the shops and the cruise ship port. We did not eat in the restaurants as we were with a convention, but the food catered by the hotel was great. Friends did tell us that the tapas bar was very good. The staff was very helpful and courteous. We enjoyed our visit very much.

Reviews.Title: “El Convento is delightful”
Reviews.Author: morningstar2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before our cruise and it was delightful. The rooms and baths are small but are lovely. You get the feeling you are staying in a Spanish parador. The evening wine reception was a hit and the breakfast was wonderful. If you want to be in old San Juan the location is perfect. Looking forward to my next visit. Only negative was checking in, if I did not read about the evening reception and breakfast before I arrived I would not have know about it from the front desk. Other than that I would have given it an excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs MAJOR work”
Reviews.Author: tcohn
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Overrun with cruise passengers and fully booked during our two nights there, the problems just never ended. An incomplete list: No vouchers provided for breakfast, even though we had "pre/post" cruise package [which stated breakfast included, but failed to disclose that gratuities on breakfast were extra]. Had to wait for table at breakfast -- a first anywhere. Incorrectly told we could charge Piscoteo restaurant bill to our room account--that proved embarrassing and inconvenient after dinner, since we relied on this info and brought nothing with us to dinner, and had to go to room and back in order to pay. Wake-up call scheduled both mornings, didn't receive wake-up call either morning, even when we were promised with "manual" wake up the second morning. No turn-down service second night, even when requested at front desk before going out for dinner. I could go on, but you get the idea. Nice-looking hotel, in charming Old San Juan, but these and countless other little problems arose [in just 48 hours!], at a four-star hotel where these things should never even happen. Old San Juan sorely needs a competitor to this place, in the same category. They've clearly sold out to the lucrative cruise ship add-on market, and the zoo-like atmosphere this creates, with resulting lapses in service, over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, luxurious....small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nancyandashesh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Convento from February 22-24, 2005. We got a good deal on hotels ($180 per night) and decided to splurge. Check-in was fast, concierge announced we'd gotten an upgrade (cool!) to a partial suite. Our room was 305, and wow was it gorgeous. Two full-length windows looking out on the cathedral plaza, an inlaid-marble dining table with six chairs, several cushy chairs, tv, fridge, sideboard, buffet table, two coffee tables, two chandeliers...it was a large, very medieval-atmosphered suite. There were even tapestries and real candles. The bathroom was small but all marble. But then we noticed the bed--the sofa had been pulled out into a full-size sofa bed. We tried to open the door we assumed went into the bedroom, but it was locked--and we realized what partial suite meant--the doors had been closed and someone else was being rented the bedroom part of the suite for the night. The sofa bed was rather lumpy and small, but we liked the rest of the room so much we decided to deal with it. (We slept terribly, since we both kept falling to the sunken-in middle of the bed). And the person in the room on the other side was laughing along with her tv, so my husband and I had a loud conversation about the weather so she'd realize we could hear her and she quieted down. So that was the only drawback, but we did choose to keep that room rather than switch to another, because we had seen several of those other rooms on the way in, and could tell from that and from the floor plan on our room door that the vast majority of the rooms are quite small, though nicely furnished. The complimentary breakfast included juice, fruit plate, hot or cold cereal, and basket of breads and danishes--much more than we could eat--served in the beautiful courtyard. The 6-8 pm wine and cheese reception is awesome: 8 wines, crackers, 4 cheeses, grapes--we didn't go out for dinner that night because we filled up on their delicious (and free) offerings, which we ate on the rooftop terrace by the pool, listening to the fountains and watching the stars. Even though the hotel is on a plaza, it's so very quiet! And the complimentary water bottles and tea and coffee available at all hours from the lounge area on the third floor was fantastic. Free internet access computer use there too. (Ask for a room on the third floor so you'll have easiest access to all this.) We ate in the hotel's Spanish tapas restaurant, the sangria was amazing, the tapas ok, but very convenient courtyard location after a full day of flying. The concierge was very helpful with suggesting other places to eat, as she had a large book full of restaurant menus. In all, highly recommend, but be prepared for small rooms. The complimentary extras here make all the difference--take advantage of the wine & cheese reception, and the breakfast, and the lounge area, and enjoy the decadent step back in time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, location, facilities&food!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my fianceÃ© have stayed at el convento several times and we LOVE this hotel. After reading the negative--and I can assure innacurate--review "Dissapointed!!" from a Seattle traveler in December 2004 I had to set the record straight. The facilities of this small boutique hotel (member of the prestigeuos Small Luxury Hotels of the World) are gorgeous and clean, including the bathrooms!! They are certianly not "bathsuites" but they are comfortable and VERY clean. The common areas of the hotels have lots of charm and you can even feel its age and history. The swimming pool is indeed small, but bigger than a jacuzzi. BTW, there is a jacuzzi next to it and the last time I was there, there were AT LEAST 14 chairs. Now, the hotel IS NOT big, after all it was not built to be a hotel but a Carmelite Convent 365 years ago...they were not thinking on sun bathing and big pools. Besides, you won't mind the pool size once you are enjoying of the sun with a roof top view of Old San Juan as your background. It is simply an experience on itself. There is indeed a lot of police around the hotel for a very good reason. The San Juan City Hall, Puerto Rico's Department of Justice and La Fortaleza (the Governor's Mansion) are within 5 blocks of the hotel. La Fortaleza is actually about 2 blocks away and you ought to visit it. It was originally the first Spanish defense fortification in the island until the 1600's when Governors started using it as their residence. Also, El Convento is within walking distace from the cruise pier. The hotel does not have security guards because it does not need them. It is a very safe area. As a matter of fact, we like El Convento so much that we are getting married there this summer. BTW, once there you have to try El Picoteo's sangria, shrimp cocktail, yucafongo (just order it!!), and Tres Leches cake. The world makes sense once you try them.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: gabriels
Reviews.Content: Just spent six nights at El Convento. Outstanding! This is a great restored 350 year old convent. Ideally located so you can easily take walking tours of Old San Juan. We had a great harbor view (4th or 5th floor). Hanging gardens, terraces, Palm trees and flowers gave it great ambience. Try their restaurant which serves Tapas. We also recommend the Amedeus (Puerto Rican) and La Chaumiere (French) resturants which are close by. If you like antiques go to El Alcazar on Calle San Jose. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambience, service needs work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at El Convento (Dec. 28 - Jan 2). For starters, the location is perfect, and we loved the atmosphere of the hotel. It was very peaceful, our 4th floor room had a lovely view, and we enjoyed twice daily maid service, lounging on the pool deck (never crowded) and the evening wine and cheese. However, customer service left a lot to be desired. We booked online through the hotel website and received an email confirmation. However, when I called El Convento to confirm, they had no record of our reservation. If you book online, definitely make sure you confirm with the hotel as well! We too found the concierge to be incompetent. We called multiple times before our trip to inquire about New Years Eve reservations and were told they would be taken care of, but this was never done. The concierge was unable to recommend restaurants to us, and many times told us reservations were made when in fact they weren't. We found the concierge to be the biggest disappointment at El Convento, expect to do research and make arrangements yourself. Despite this, the positives of the hotel outweight the negatives, and we would stay at El Convento again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at El Convento based upon other reviewers' comments and other recommendations for our honeymoon in October. We were very satisfied. From the beautiful building to the great neighborhood, the cheese and wine and El Picoteo, the great views from the roof and our well decorated, cozy room, the hotel was a perfect place to begin our journey in Puerto Rico. A great place to explore the Old City from, the hotel is close to some great restaurants, the fort, and shopping. We loved the hotel and if we ever come back to the island we will be sure to include El Convento in our plans.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Convento for 5 nights (December 6-11, 2004). We were pleasantly suprised upon our arrival and our experience only got better from there. We stayed on the 4th floor and had a nice view of the bay. The room was clean and very quiet, and well kept during our stay. We were amazed that we couldn't hear any noise from outside the room. Our room was nicely furnished and the bathroom was very nice as well. The hotel jacuzzi/pool area was convenient and not busy, offering a good view. The evening wine/cheese gathering was wonderful including outdoor seating and view of Old San Juan and the streets below. We got a good room rate on LuxRes. Our only disapointment was that the breakfast that had been advertised to be part of the room rate was no longer included, with no apologies from the staff. But, our in-room fridge came in handy for our own breakfasts overlooking the courtyard. We really enjoyed our stay here. A perfect base for exploring Old San Juan on foot, as we did each day and night. Would definitely stay here again, and hope to!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone who as ever stayed at a Small Luxury Hotels of The World property will know exactly what to expect from this unique hotel in Old San Juan. If you want to be surrounded by the old world charm and ambience of Viejo San Juan, in a very nicely run and very comfortable hotel, this is the place to stay. If you like more of a posh resort type atmoshpere stay in the Ritz Carlton in Isla Verde. If you do stay here, try to get a room on the 5th floor, from number 510 - 515 as these all have beautiful private views of old San Juan and the ocean as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at El Convento was excellent. We spent 5 nights here and have no complaints. The rooms are a bit small but it is all part of the charm. We cannot say enough good things about the service we received from the front desk. They had wonderful suggestions for dinner and arranged any tour we requested without a hitch. Would recommend this hotel to honeymooners especially.

Reviews.Title: “You'll feel pampered”
Reviews.Author: kkl
Reviews.Content: My family (with 3 children) spent a week exploring Vieques- wonderful snorkeling, wild ponies, the extraordinary bioluminescent bay, miles of deserted beaches, picturesque towns, surprisingly good restaurants. But we wanted to end our Puerto Rico adventure with some city life, so we chose El Convento in Old San Juan. We came in literally dripping sand and sea water and were treated royally. Our rooms were spacious and comfortable, great bathrooms with good water pressure in the showers. Lots of little amenities, chocolates on the turned-down beds. A superb breakfast buffet, excellent coffee always available, and a complimentary wine bar in the afternoon. The kids enjoyed the little pool on the roof, and we loved the view up there. The central courtyard is beautiful, with the lights twinkling at night in the huge neem tree, hundreds of fruit bats circling. We loved exploring old San Juan on foot, the architecture, parks and squares, El Morro, the jewelry shops on Calle San Francisco. Our favorite restaurant was Bili, a few blocks from El Convento, where the food is served tapas style. It was packed with diners, the meal itself was an adventure. We hope to return to El Convento someday.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING BUT NOT THE RITZ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you are looking for charm local color in the center of Old San Juan and lots of street noice on the weekends. It is not the place to stay if you are looking for luxurious and quiet surroundings. After reading the reviews of this hotel on this website, which I usually trust, I was disappointed. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The staff couldn't have been nicer --they were truly wonderful, turned themselves inside out. Our room, however left a lot to be desired. We stayed in the Casals suite, supposedly one of the nicest suites in the hotel and paid $635/night. While there were some beautiful antiques in the room, the room itself felt very old and tired, the tile on the floor must have been at least 25 years old and so dirty that the dirt was ground in. In areas around the doorways and walls, it was chipping, and looked more like a tenement. The staff at the front desk said the floor in this room was original to the hotel, which I find hard to believe, as that would make it upwards of 350 years old. There was no tile 350 years ago. The bathroom was very small, with no room to store anything, but the shower was great. Marble in the bathroom very old, with very old, dirty caulking around the tub and in between the tiles in the bath. The worst of it was Saturday night -- there was a wedding downstairs that went on to the wee hours of the morning, and it felt like the band was in our room. Impossible to sleep, then at about 5 a.m., some late-leaving drunken guests were screaming outside our window. In all fairness, I asked to see the VAnderbuilt suite. They were very nice about showing it to me and in fact, it looked much cleaner and more comfortable. It had a separate shower, and the floor was a castillo tile, so you could not see ground in dirt. Felt much more cozy and comfortable. Once of the nice things offered by the hotel is a complementary late afternoon cocktail hour -- they serve wine, cheese, crackers, coffee. They also have complementary high speed internet in the lounge. However, there is no room service at all. Bottom line is that I would not stay here again, but only because I prefer more updated, comfortable surroundings. I was expecting something akin to the Ritz, and I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: tropicaldan
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based largely on these tripadvisor guest reviews, and we were not disappointed. We stayed five nights from Nov 8th. The staff were very friendly and efficient, the hotel itself is simply beautiful, the courtyard and its magnificent tree stunning. The fifth floor room was just right, perhaps a little small but we expected that, and with a great view over the bay. No balcony, but this was compensated for by the wide and open balcony running right round the inner courtyard on each floor, and where we could sit in the evening and watch the bats in the tree or gaze over the rooftops of Old San Juan. Great stuff! The hotel organised two tours for us (we did not fancy the driving!) one to El Yunque Rain Forest and the other to the Camuy Caves, and both were very good - small personalised groups and not a huge tour bus. Saw all the hotels in the Condado, but living as we do in the Caribbean anyway, this was not our scene at all, and we are really glad we stayed at El Convento. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the El Convento exceeded all my expectations. The location in Old San Juan is excellent. The hotel has a wonderful historic atmosphere without being shabby. (its most recent renovation is supposed to have cost $275,000 per room) Our room was large with a view of the small park plaza and the Cathedral. In fact, we had balcony seats for a special music/dance performance after Mass on the steps of the Cathedral outside our window. Wine /cheese , breakfast very tasty and there is free internet access in the "library/lounge". We enjoyed the rooftop pool and hot tub. There is a harbor view and we watched the cruise ships glide past at night. So many nooks and crannies with a large inner courtyard which cant be captured in pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: scarlettk
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how beautiful this hotel was - because often old historic buildings converted to hotels don't really work out. There are several really pretty restaurants/bars in courtyard, and the small pool/jacuzzi on 4th floor has a nice view - it's like a roof pool. Some rooms have views of bay, but other than that, they were normal basic rooms. I noticed that room classifications listed on Expedia weren't accurate, and would recommend booking directly through hotel reservations if you want something different than basic room - which has 2 twin beds. Also, rooms have high-speed internet.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel El Convento
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Cristo St | Old San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
